materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 3 balls of 8884 Peacock A, 1 ball of 8704 Neon Pink B for cowl. 1 ball each of 8884 Peacock A, and 8704 Neon Pink B for Beanie.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** or as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 5” (12.5 cm) wide x 60” (152.5 cm) around. Beanie Measures 21-22” (53.3 x 55.9 cm) in circumference.
gauge: COWL GAUGE: 10 sts and 9 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern. First 3 rounds of Beanie = 4 3/4” (12 cm) in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COWL
With A, Ch 150, and without twisting ch; join with a slip st in first ch.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in each ch around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—150 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), (dc, ch 2, sc) in first st, *skip next 2 sts, (2 dc, ch 2, sc) in next hdc; repeat from * around, skip last 2 sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—50 shells.
Round 3: Slip st in next dc, ch 1, (sc, ch 2, 2 dc) in each ch-2 sp around; join with a slip st in first sc—50 shells.
Round 4: Slip st in next ch-2 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 2, sc) in same ch-2 space, (2 dc, ch 2, sc) in each ch-2 space around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3, change to B—50 shells. Fasten off A.
Rounds 5-10: Rep Rounds 3-4, working in the following color sequence: *1 round B, 2 rounds A; repeat from * once.
Round 11: Ch 2, *2 hdc in next ch-2 space**, hdc in space between next sc and next dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
BEANIE
With A, make an adjustable ring or ch 3; join with a slip st in first ch.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in first st, 2 dc in each st around—24 dc.
Round 7: Slip st in next ch-2 sp, ch 3, (dc, ch 2, sc) in same ch-2 space, (2 dc, ch 2, sc) in each ch-2 space around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—14 shells.
Rounds 8-13: Repeat Rounds 6-7 (3 times), working in the following color sequence: 1 more round A; 1 round B; 2 rounds A; 1 round B; 1 round A.
Round 14: Slip st in next dc, ch 1, *2 sc in next ch-2 space**, sc in space between next sc and next dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: 1 skein each 1801 Navy and 1502 Iced Aqua
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle, stitch marker, piece of felt, sewing needle and thread to match felt, straight pins
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 18 (20, 22)" [45.5 (51, 56) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 12 sts = 4" (10 cm); 9 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT (make 1 with each color)
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), 7 hdc in ring—8 hdc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 hdc in each st around—16 hdc.
Round 3: *Hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 7 times—24 hdc.
Round 4: *Hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 7 times—32 hdc.
Round 5: *Hdc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 7 times—40 hdc.
Round 6: *Hdc in next 4 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 7 times—48 hdc.
Round 7: *Hdc in next 5 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 7 times—56 hdc.
Sizes Medium and Large only:
Round 8: *Hdc in next 13 (6) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 3 (7) times—60 (64) hdc.
Size Large only:
Round 9: *Hdc in next 31 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * once—66 hdc.
All Sizes:
Rounds 8–16 (9–17, 10–18): Hdc in each st around.
Round 17 (18, 19): Sc in each st around; join with slip st in next st. Fasten off.
Monogram
Print desired letter. Pin to felt and cut out letter shape. Pin felt letter to front of hat and sew in place with matching thread.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Beehive Baby sport (100 g/3.5 oz; 328 m/359 yds)
Contrast A (09420 Precious Pink)  2 2 3 balls
Contrast B (09005 Angel White)  1 1 1 ball
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
4 buttons.
measurements: To fit chest measurement 6 mos 17” [43 cm], 12 mos 18” [45.5 cm], 18 mos 19”[48 cm] - Finished chest 6 mos 19” [48 cm], 12 mos 22” [56 cm], 18 mos 23½” [59.5 cm] - Hat: To fit baby’s head 6 (12-18) mos.
gauge: 5½ clusters and 10 rows = 4” [10 cm] in Basic Cluster Pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. 
 
Cardigan 
Body 
note: Body is worked in one piece to armholes. 
With A, ch 110 (126-134). 
Work in Basic Cluster Pat as follows: (see Diagram I on page 6). 
1st row: (RS). (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in 5th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook – cluster made. Ch 1. Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. *Ch 3. Cluster in next ch. Ch 1. Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Ch 2. Miss next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 26 (30-32) clusters. 

2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last turning ch sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. 

Rep last row for Basic Cluster Pat once more. 
 
size 6 mos only: next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 3 sc in next ch-2 sp. *1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next cluster. 2 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next cluster. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 11 times more. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next cluster. 2 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next cluster. 3 sc in turning ch sp. Join B. Turn. 123 sc. 

size 12 mos only: next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 3 sc in next ch-2 sp. *(1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next cluster. 2 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next cluster. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 8 times more. (1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next cluster. 2 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next cluster. 2 sc in turning ch sp. Join B. Turn. 134 sc. 

size 18 mos only: next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. *1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next cluster. 2 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next cluster. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 14 times more. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next cluster. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next cluster. 1 sc in turning ch sp. Join B. Turn. 145 sc. 

all sizes: **Proceed in Daisy Chain Pat as follows: (See Diagram II on page 6) 
1st row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. *(Ch 3. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 10 sc. (Ch 3. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 

2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in first ch-1 sp. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – dc2tog cluster made. (Ch 2. Dc2tog cluster) in same ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. *Ch 1. Miss next ch-3 sp. [(Dc2tog cluster. Ch 2) 3 times. Dc2tog cluster] all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Miss last ch-3 sp. (Dc2tog cluster. Ch 2. Dc2tog cluster) in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last sc. Join A. Turn. 

3rd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. (Dc2tog cluster in top of next dc2tog cluster) 4 times. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * across; ending with 1 sc in top of turning ch 3. Turn. 

4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. Ch 2. Miss next 2 dc2tog clusters. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. Ch 3. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 

5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Miss next ch-3 sp. [(Dc2tog cluster. Ch 2) 3 times. Dc2tog cluster] all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Join B. Turn. 

6th row: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). (Dc2tog cluster in top of next dc2tog cluster) twice. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. *Ch 3. (Dc2tog cluster in top of next dc2tog cluster) 4 times. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to last 2 ch-2 sps. Ch 3. (Dc2tog cluster in top of next dc2tog cluster) twice. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 

7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc2tog cluster. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. *Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. Ch 2. Miss next 2 dc2tog clusters. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. Rep from * across; ending with: Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. Ch 1. Miss next dc2tog cluster. 1 sc in top of turning ch 3. Join A. Turn.** 

size 6 mos only: next row: (WS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Miss next sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. *3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 8 times more. 2 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. 106 sc. Turn. 

size 12 mos only: next row: (WS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. *3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 9 times more. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. 122 sc. Turn. 

size 18 mos only: next row: (WS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. *3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 10 times more. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. 130 sc. Turn. 

all sizes: next row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first sc. *Ch 1. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Cluster in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. Ch 1. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Miss next sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 26 (30-32) clusters. 

next row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last turning ch 4. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. 

Rep last row for Basic Cluster Pat until work from beg measures 6½ (7½-8)” [16.5 (19-20.5) cm], ending with a WS row. 

Divide for armholes: next row: (RS). Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * 3 (4-5) times more. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-3 sp. turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 

Cont even in pat on 5 (6-7) clusters for Right Front until work from dividing row measures 2½ (3-3½)” [6 (7.5-9) cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off. 

shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Miss first ch-2 sp. Miss next ch-3 sp. Rejoin A with sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last turning ch 4. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. 

2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * 1 (2-3) time(s) more. Sl st in last ch-3 sp. Turn. 

3rd row: Sl st in next ch-1 sp, next cluster and next ch-3 sp. Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last turning ch sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. 

size 6 mos only: 4th row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. 

5th row: As 4th row. Fasten off. 

sizes 12 and 18 mos only: 4th row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * (1-2) time(s) more. Sl st in last ch-3 sp. Turn. 

5th row: Sl st in next ch-1 sp, next cluster and next ch-3 sp. Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * (0-1) time(s) more. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Fasten off. 

all sizes: Back: 1st row: (RS). Miss next 2 ch-3 sps after Right Front. Rejoin A with sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * 8 (10-10) times more. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch-3 sp. turn. leave rem sts unworked. 

Cont even in pat on 10 (12-12) clusters for Back until work from dividing row measures same length as Right Front. Fasten off. 

left Front: 1st row: (RS). Miss next 2 ch-3 sps after Back. Rejoin A with sl st to next ch-3 sp. Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last turning ch sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. 

Cont even in pat on 5 (6-7) clusters for Left Front until work from dividing row measures 2½ (3-3½)” [6 (7.5-9) cm] ending with a WS row. 

shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * 1 (2-3) time(s) more. Sl st in next ch-3 sp. turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 

2nd row: Sl st in next ch-1 sp, next cluster and next ch-3 sp. Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last turning ch sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. 

size 6 mos only: 3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. 

4th row: As 3rd row. 

sizes 12 and 18 mos only: 3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * (1-2) time(s) more. Sl st in last ch-3 sp. Turn. 

4th row: Sl st in next ch-1 sp, next cluster and next ch-3 sp. Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * (0-1) time(s) more. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. 

all sizes: 5th row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * 0 (0-1) time more. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Fasten off. 

sleeves 
With A, ch 42 (42-46). 
1st row: (RS). (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in 5th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook – cluster made. Ch 1. Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. *Ch 3. Cluster in next ch. Ch 1. Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Ch 2. Miss next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 9 (9-10) clusters. 

2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last turning ch sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. 

Rep last row for Basic Cluster Pat once more. 

sizes 6 and 12 mos only: next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. *1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next cluster. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 7 times more. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next cluster. 1 sc in turning ch sp. Join B. Turn. 46 sc. 

size 18 mos only: next row: (WS). Ch 1. 2 sc in first dc. 3 sc in next ch-2 sp. *1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next cluster. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 8 times more. 2 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next cluster. 3 sc in turning ch sp. Join B. Turn. 57 sc. 

all sizes: Work Daisy Chain Pat as given for Body from ** to **. 

FinishinG 
Sew shoulder seams. Sew sleeve seams to markers. Sew in sleeves, placing rows above markers along unworked sts at armholes to form square armholes. 
Buttonhole Band: 1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st in bottom corner of Right Front. Ch 1. Work 42 (48-51) sc up Right Front edge to neck edge. Turn. 

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 (12-13) sc. Rep from * twice more. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 2 sc in each ch-2 sp to end of row. Do not turn. 

4th row: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. 

Button Band: Work as for Buttonhole Band along Left Front edge, omitting all references to buttonholes. 

Collar: 1st row: (WS). Join B with sl st in side of 2nd row of Button Band at neck edge. Ch 1. Work 68 sc evenly along neck edge to side of 2nd row of Buttonhole Band. Turn. 

2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. *(Ch 3. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 10 sc. (Ch 3. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.

Dc2tog cluster] all in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Ch 1. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-3 sp. (Dc2tog cluster. Ch 2. Dc2tog cluster) in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last sc. Join A. Turn. 

4th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. (Dc2tog cluster in top of next dc2tog cluster) 4 times. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * across, ending with 1 sc in top of turning ch 3. Turn. 

5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. Ch 2. Miss next 2 dc2tog clusters. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. Ch 3. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 

6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Miss next ch-3 sp. [(Dc2tog cluster. Ch 2) 3 times. Dc2tog cluster] all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Join B. Turn. 

7th row: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). (Dc2tog cluster in top of next dc2tog cluster) twice. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. *Ch 3. (Dc2tog cluster in top of next dc2tog cluster) 4 times. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Ch 3. (Dc2tog cluster in top of next dc2tog cluster) twice. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 

8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc2tog cluster. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. *Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. Ch 2. Miss next 2 dc2tog clusters. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. Rep from * across, ending with: Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in top of next dc2tog cluster. Ch 1. Miss next dc2tog cluster. 1 sc in top of turning ch 3. Join A. Turn. 

9th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 2. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. (5 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc) twice. *Ch 3. Miss next ch-2 sp. (1 sc in next sc. 5 dc in next ch-3 sp) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 2. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Satin (100 g/3.5 oz; 182 m/200 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
04609 (Goldenrod) 1 ball
04705 (Crimson) 1 ball
04246 (Foliage) 1 ball
04200 (Emerald) 1 ball
04700 (Tangerine) 1 ball
measurements: One size to fit average lady’s head.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 12 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc. 
Cont in same manner, inc 6 sts in each rnd, as established to 120 sc.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc at end of 2nd rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 18 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - Sc2tog made. 
*1 sc in each of next 18 sc. Sc2tog. rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 114 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 17 sts. Sc2tog. rep from * 5 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 108 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog. rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 96 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog. rep from * 7 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. rep from * 7 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Sc2tog. rep from * 9 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 70 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog. rep from * 9 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. rep from * 5 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sts.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Medley™: 2 balls 954 Eclectic
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
Three ¾” (19mm) sew-through buttons
Fabric sealant (optional)
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 24” (61 cm) circumference at brim.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), 7 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—8 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, *hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around to last st, hdc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, *hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 6 times, hdc in last 2 sts, join with slip st in top of beginning ch—32 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, *hdc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 6 times, hdc in last 3 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—40 hdc.
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, *hdc next 4 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 6 times, hdc in last 4 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 hdc.
Round 7: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, *hdc next 5 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 6 times, hdc in last 6 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—56 hdc.
Round 8: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 6 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc next 6 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—64 hdc.
Round 9: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 7 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc next 7 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—72 hdc.
Rounds 10–12: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 13: Ch 2, hdc in next 5 sts, hdc2tog, *hdc in next 6 sts, hdc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—63 hdc.
Round 14: Ch 2, *skip next st, 3 hdc in next st, skip next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * 14 times, skip next st, 3 hdc in next st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—Sixteen 3-hdc groups.
Rounds 15–17: Ch 2, *skip next st, 3 hdc in next st (center st of 3-hdc group), skip next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around to last 3 sts, skip next st, 3 hdc in st, skip last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—Sixteen 3-hdc groups.
Ch 2, 2 hdc in same st as join, *skip next st, 3 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—Thirty-two 3-hdc groups.
Rounds 19–21: Slip st in next st (center st of first 3-hdc groups), ch 2, 2 hdc in same st *skip next 2 sts, 3 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Do not fasten off. Continue in rows.
Flap
Row 1: Slip st in next st (center st of first 3-hdc groups), ch 2, 2 hdc in same st, *skip next 2 sts, 3 hdc in next st; repeat from * 3 times, turn—Five 3-hdc groups.
Rows 2–6: Slip st in next st (center st of first 3-hdc groups), ch 2, 2 hdc in same st, *skip next 2 sts, 3 hdc in next st; repeat from * across to last st; leave last st unworked, turn.
FINISHING
Cut 3 strands each measuring 6” (15 cm). Using photograph as a guide, turn brim to right side and position flap with upper point towards crown and lower point aligned with folded edge of brim or as desired. Position button on flap. With strand on yarn needle, insert needle down in buttonhole through all thicknesses to wrong side and then up through other buttonhole so that ends of yarn are on right side. Tie ends in a knot and trim to desired length. Repeat to attach remaining buttons. Optional Apply a drop of fabric sealant to the knots to prevent unraveling.
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Alpaca Blend™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 155 yds/142 m)
Contrast A Onyx (01001) 1 ball
Contrast B Smoke (01002) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit average woman.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Ribbing
With smaller hook and A, ch 11. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece, when slightly stretched, measures 22" [56 cm]. Do not fasten off. Join last row and 1st row tog, working 1 row of sc through both thicknesses. Do not fasten off.
Change to larger hook and proceed as follows:
Foundation rnd: Ch 1. Work 64 sc evenly around edge of Ribbing. Join B with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
1st rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Skip next 3 sc. (Ch 1. 1 dc) 3 times in next sc - Shell made. *Ch 1. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Skip next 3 sc. Shell in next sc. Rep from * to around. Ch 1. Join A with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 7. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 7. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 4 (counts as dc. Ch 1). (1 dc. Ch 1) in same sp as last sl st. Working over chs of previous rnd, 1 sc in center dc of Shell 2 rows below. *Shell in next sc. Ch 1. Working over chs of previous rnd, 1 sc in center dc of Shell 2 rows below. Rep from * around. Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 1) in same sp as first dc. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 4. Sl st in next: (ch 1, dc, ch 1). Join A with sl st in next sc.
4th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 7. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 7. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first sc.
Rep last 2 rnds until Hat from beg (lower edge of Ribbing) measures approx 7½" [19 cm], ending on a 4th rnd.
Shape top: 1st rnd: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc in center dc of Shell 2 rows below. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in center dc of Shell 2 rows below. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Sl st in next: (2 dc, ch 1). Join A with sl st in next sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 5. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 5. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 4 (counts as dc. Ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc in center dc of Shell 2 rows below. *Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in center dc of Shell 2 rows below. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 4. Sl st in next: (ch 1, dc, ch 1). Join A with sl st in next sc.
4th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 3. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: With B, ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp 2 rows below. *Ch 1. 2 hdc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp 2 rows below. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join A with sl st to first hdc.
6th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. *Ch 1. Skip next: (ch 1, hdc). 1 sc in next hdc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join B with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Skip last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Baby Shower ™ (170yds/155m)
Contrast A Light Pink (1180) 1 ball
Contrast B Shrimp (1440) 1 ball
Contrast C Flamingo (1470) 1 ball
Faded Denim (4660) 1 ball
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet Hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Hdc-slip (half double crochet slip stitch) = Yoh and draw up a loop into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram) and through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit infant 0-3 mos. Circumference: Approx 15½" [39.5 cm].
gauge: 20 sts and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm] in sc/hdc pat
instructions:
Notes:
• Toboggan is worked in rnds from top downwards.
• The lower ribbing is worked separately in hdc-slip (half double crochet slip stitch). 
• Take care not to work the hdc-slip stitches too tightly.

Version 1 (3-Color Version)
With A, make an adjustable ring: Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work stitches of first round in the ring. After the first round of stitches is worked, pull gently on tail to tighten ring.

1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 hdc in ring. Join. 8 hdc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.

3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in next sc. *2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 hdc.

4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. *2 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.

5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. *2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.

6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 hdc. *2 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 4 hdc.  Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.

7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sc. *2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 hdc.

8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 hdc. *2 sc in next hdc.  1 sc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.

9th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sc. *2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 hdc.

10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 8 hdc. *2 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 8 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 sc.

11th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join.

12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join.

Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

Work Rounds 13-42 as follows:
Change yarn color to B at the beginning of Round 15.
Change yarn color to C at the beginning of Round 29.
Change yarn color as follows: Fasten off old yarn color and draw up a loop of new yarn color in same sp as sl st.

13th to 42nd rnds: Rep Rounds 11 and 12. Fasten off.

RIBBING
With C, ch 10.

1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 hdc.

2nd row: Ch 1. *1 hdc-slip in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures length to fit around Toboggan. Do not fasten off.

Edge Ribbing and Join Ribbing into a Ring: Do not turn, working along long edge of Ribbing, ch 1. 1 sc evenly spaced along edge. Bring short edges of ribbing tog, matching sts. Working through both thicknesses, sl st in each st across to join Ribbing into a ring. 

Attach Ribbing to Toboggan: Make sure that the ridges of Ribbing face outwards. Place Toboggan inside ring of Ribbing, matching sts of last round of Toboggan and ends of rows along unworked long edge of Ribbing. Working through both thicknesses, sl st loosely around to join Ribbing to lower edge of Toboggan. Fasten off.

TOP KNOT
Join A with sl st to top of Toboggan. Ch 22.

1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Sl st in top of Toboggan. Turn.

2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st across. Turn.

Slip st in top of Toboggan at end of last row. Fasten off and weave in ends. Tie into knot.

Version 2 (Solid Version)
Work as given for 3-Color Version, omitting all references of color changings.

materials: RED HEART® Roll With It Tweed™: 1 ball 9621 Modern Pastel
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
measurements: Hat measures 18 (20)" [45.5 (51) cm] circumference at brim x 16 (18)" [40.5 (45.5) cm] long including tassels and stretches to fit head measuring 20 (22)" [51 (56) cm].
gauge: 13 dc = 4" (10 cm); 7 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 54 (60).
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning skipped ch do not count as a st here and throughout) and in each ch across, turn—52 (58) dc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as st), dc in first 33 (39) sts, leave remaining sts unworked, turn—33 (39) dc.
Row 3: Ch 21, dc in 3rd ch from hook and in each remaining ch (tassel made), dc in next 33 (39) sts, turn—33 (39) dc and 1 tassel.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until piece measures 18 (20)" [45.5 (51) cm], ending with Row 2. Fasten off, leaving a 30" (76 cm) tail for seaming.
FINISHING
With end tail, seam first and last rows together through first 33 (39) sts; do not seam tassel. To close top of Hat, cut a long strand, with yarn needle, weave around base of fringes, pull tightly to close and secure.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1502 Iced Aqua A, 1401 Pewter B, and 1303 Aran C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures 18 (20, 22)” [45.5 (51, 56) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 6 sc = 2” (5 cm); 6 rows = 2” (5 cm) with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With larger hook and A, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, ch 12, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, ch 12, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc and 8 ch-12 loops.
Note Hold ch-12 loops in front of rounds and do not work into loops until instructed.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—32 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 4 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 4 sts, ch 12, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts, ch 12, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc and 8 ch-12 loops.
Rounds 8–10: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc changing to B at end of last round—56 sc.
Size Small only:
Round 11: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sts, ch 12, sc in next st, [sc in next 6 sts, ch 12, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc and 8 ch-12 loops.
Round 12: Repeat Round 8—56 sc.
Size Medium only
Round 11: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 5 sts, ch 12, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts, ch 12, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—64 sc and 8 ch-12 loops.
Round 12: Repeat Round 8—64 sc.
Size Large only
Round 11: Work same as Round 11 of size Medium.
Round 12: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 7 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc.
All sizes
Rounds 13 and 14: Repeat Round 8.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in first 6 (7, 8) sts, ch 12, sc in next st, [sc in next 6 (7, 8) sts, ch 12, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—56 (64, 72) sc and 8 ch-12 loops.
Rounds 16–18: Repeat Round 8; change to C at end of last round.
Round 19: Ch 1, sc in first 6 (7, 8) sts, ch 12, sc in next st, [sc in next 6 (7, 8) sts, ch 12, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—56 (64, 72) sc and 8 ch-12 loops.
Rounds 20–22: Repeat Round 8.
Rounds 23–26: Repeat Rounds 15–18; change to A at end of last round.
Round 27: Repeat Round 15.
Rounds 28–30: Repeat Round 8.
Round 31–34: Repeat Rounds 27–30.
Beginning at top of hat, draw 2nd ch-12 loop through first ch-12 loop, draw 3rd ch-12 loop through 2nd ch-12 loop; repeat in this manner down side of hat until all 8 ch-12 loops are worked (cable made), then repeat for each remaining set of 8 ch-12 loops around—8 cables.
Round 35: Ch 1, sc in first 6 (7, 8) sts, inserting hook in first ch-12 loop, sc in next st, [sc in next 6 (7, 8) sts, inserting hook in next ch-12 loop, sc in next st] 7 times; change to B; join with slip st in first sc—56 (64, 72) sc.
Rounds 36–39: With smaller hook, repeat Round 8.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Hopscotch™: 1 ball 7961 Somersault
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 16 (18, 20)” [40.5 (45.75, 50.8) cm] circumference and 5¾ (6½, 7¼)” [14.5 (16.5, 18.5) cm] long.
gauge: 13 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 10 rounds = 4” [10 cm] in half double crochet.
instructions:
Make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn around your finger with the yarn tail to the left and under the working yarn. Insert hook through the circle from front to back. Using the working yarn, yarn over and pull up a loop.

Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), work 9 hdc into adjustable ring; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 10 hdc. Pull beginning yarn tail to close adjustable ring.

Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st, work 2 hdc in each hdc around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join round – 20 hdc.

Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join.

Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st, hdc in next hdc, * 2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next hdc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 30 hdc.

Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join.

Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in same st, hdc in next 2 hdc, * 2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 40 hdc.

Round 7: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join.

Round 8: Ch 2, hdc in same st, hdc in next 3 hdc, * 2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 3 hdc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 50 hdc.

Round 9: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join.

Round 10: Ch 2, hdc in same st, hdc in next 24 (4, 4) hdc, * 2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 24 (4, 4) hdc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 52 (60, 60) hdc.

Size Child ONLY:
Round 11: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join.

Round 12: Ch 2, hdc in same st, hdc in next 11 hdc, * 2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 11 hdc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 65 hdc.

Body (All Sizes):
Round 1: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join, turn.

Repeat Round 1 four (six, six) times.

Last round: Ch 1, sc in same st and each st around, slip st to 1st sc to join.

Fasten off, leaving a 6” (15.25 cm) tail.

Ear (make 2)
Make adjustable ring; yarn over and pull up a loop.

Row 1: Ch 2, work 7 hdc into ring, turn. Pull beginning yarn tail to close adjustable ring.

Row 2: Ch 2, 2 hdc in 1st hdc, hdc in next 5 hdc, 2 hdc in last hdc, turn – 9 hdc.

Row 3: Ch 2, 2 hdc in 1st hdc, hdc in next 7 hdc, 2 hdc in last hdc – 11 hdc.

Fasten off, leaving a 6” (15.25 cm) tail.

FINISHING
With right side facing, flatten hat with the joining seam at the center back. Center one Ear on the 5th (6th, 6th) round of the flattened hat crown. Using the Ear yarn tail and yarn needle, sew the ear in place. Repeat on the opposite side with the second ear.

With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 2515 Turquoise A, 4600 White B, 9925 Really Red C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.0mm [US H-8], 5.5mm [US I-9]
Sharp craft scissors, yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished Hat Length: From edge of Band to tip of Hat, approximately 19.5” (49.5 cm) for smaller size and 21.5” (54.5 cm) for larger size.
gauge: 16 sc and 12 Rows of sc = 4” [10 cm] with larger size hook.
instructions:
HAT
Using smaller hook with A, ch 7.
Ribbed Band
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in back loops only of 2nd ch and each ch across; turn—6 sc.
Rows 2-55 (2-67): Working in back loops only, ch 1; sc in same sc and each sc across; turn—6 sc.
Row 56 (68): With Right side out, hold work with first and last Rows together at top, being careful not to twist piece. Ch 1; insert hook through opposite side of foundation ch and front loop of last Row of sts, sc together; continue to sc across in same manner to form Band—6 sc. Do not fasten off.
Crown
Round 1 (Right Side): Begin working in rounds using larger hook. Ch 1; working in Row ends of Ribbed Band, sc 56 (68) evenly spaced around; slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off A—56 (68) sc.
Round 2 (Right Side): Attach B to any sc; ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join—56 (68) sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; change to C in last sc; join.
Rounds 4-5: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 5, change to B; join.
Rounds 6-7: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 7, change to C; join.
Rounds 8-9: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 9, change to B; join.
Rounds 10-17: Repeat Rounds 6-9 twice. At end of Round 17, change to B; join.
Rounds 18-19: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 19, change to C; join.
Round 20: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 21: Ch 1, *sc in next 12 (15) sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times; change to B in last sc2tog; join—52 (64) sc.
Round 22: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 23: Ch 1, *sc in next 11 (14) sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times, change to C; join—48 (60) sc.
Round 24: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 25: Ch 1, *sc in next 10 (13) sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times; change to B; join—44 (56) sc.
Round 26: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 27: Ch 1, *sc in next 9 (12) sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times, change to C; join—40 (52) sc.
Round 28: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 29: Ch 1, *sc in next 8 (11) sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times; change to B; join—36 (48) sc.
Round 30: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 31: Ch 1, *sc in next 7 (10) sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times, change to C; join—32 (44) sc.
Rounds 32-33: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 33, change to B; join.
Round 34: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 35: Ch 1, *sc in next 6 (9) sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times, change to C; join—28 (40) sc.
Rounds 36-37: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 37, change to B; join.
Round 38: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 39: Ch 1, *sc in next 5 (8) sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times, change to C; join—24 (36) sc.
Rounds 40-41: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 41, change to B; join.
Round 42: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 43: Ch 1, *sc in next 4 (7) sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times, change to C; join—20 (32) sc.
Rounds 44-45: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 45, change to B; join.
Round 46: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 47: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 (6) sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times, change to C; join—16 (28) sc.
Round 48: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 49: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 (5) sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times, change to B; join—12 (24) sc.
Rounds 50-51: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 51, change to C; join.
Round 52: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. Do not fasten off.
For Size 18” (45.5 cm) Hat
Round 53: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around, change to B; join.
Rounds 54-55: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 55, change to C; join.
Rounds 56-57: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 57, change to B; join. 
Rounds 58-71: Repeat Rounds 54-57 three times, then Rounds 54-55 once. At end of Round 71, change to C; join.
Round 72: Ch 1, sc2tog around; fasten off—6 sc. Weave yarn end through sts and pull tightly to close hole in end.
For Size 20” (51 cm) Hat
Round 53: Ch 1, *sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times, change to B; join—20 sc.
Rounds 54-55: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 55, change to C; join.
Round 56: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 57: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times, change to B; join—16 sc.
Rounds 58-59: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 59, change to C; join.
Round 60: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join.
Round 61: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times, change to B; join—12 sc.
Rounds 62-63: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 63, change to C join.
Rounds 64-65: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 65, change to B join.
Rounds 66-67: Ch 1, sc in same sc and each sc around; join. At end of Round 67, change to C; join.
Rounds 68-79: Repeat Rounds 64-67 three times. At end of Round 79, change to C; join.
Round 80: Ch 1, sc2tog around; fasten off—6 sc. Weave yarn end through sts and pull tightly to close hole in end.
Pom Pom 
Make Pom pom using A and 3 or 4 fingers of hand as follows:
1. Cut 18” (45.5 cm) length of yarn and set aside. Hold hand as if to shake hands, with fingers together and extended.
2. Wrap yarn around extended fingers for 120 wraps.
3. While wraps are still on fingers, fold cut length of yarn in half and slip under the wraps. With folded yarn in place, slip the yarn off fingers. Tie yarn length tightly in a secure knot.
4. Hold yarn wraps tightly in fist with tie dangling from bottom of fist and the looped wraps extending over top of closed fist. Carefully trim loops to form Pom pom. Grasp by tie and shake to fluff out.
Finishing
Sew Pom pom securely to tip of Hat. Weave in and trim all yarn ends.

materials: YARN MEDIUM 4
• Patons® Classic Wool Worsted™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 194 yds/177 m)
COLORS Quantity
Version 1
• Contrast A Winter White (00201) 1 ball
• Contrast B Natural Mix (00229) 1 ball
• Contrast C Dark Grey Mix (00225) 1 ball
Version 2
• Contrast A Rich Teal (77768) 1 ball
• Contrast B Aran (00202) 1 ball
• Contrast C Pansy (77777) 1 ball
TOOLS
• Size H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
• Susan Bates® stitch marker.
• Susan Bates® yarn needle.
• Tape measure.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 14 single crochet (sc) and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools. With A, make slip knot. Make a loop with yarn and fold it to make a pretzel shape. Then draw through to make slip knot. Chain. Yarn over hook (Yoh), Draw through loop – 1 chain made. With A, chain (ch) 77. Join in round (rnd), being careful to not twist chain. Place marker for beginning (beg) of round (rnd).

Join in round (rnd) with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch, taking care not to twist chain.

2nd rnd: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 double crochet (dc) in each sc around. Join C with sl st to first sc.

1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in each ch around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 77 sc.

Double Crochet Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.

3rd rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Join A with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Join C with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: With C, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc around. Join A with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Join B with sl st to first sc.
Repeat (Rep) 2nd to 7th rnds until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm].

Fasten off. To permanently fasten off yarn, cut yarn leaving a long tail. Pull end of yarn through loop on hook and pull gently to tighten.

FINISHING
Lay Hat flat and sew top seam using whipstitch. Sew two pointy ends together (tog).

materials: RED HEART® Colorscape™: 1 ball 9938 Seattle
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: Fphdc (front post half double crochet): Yarn over, insert hook from front to back then to front, going around post of indicated st, draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through all loops on hook. Skip st behind Fphdc.
Fphdc2tog: [Yarn over, insert hook from front to back then to front, going around post of next st, draw up a loop] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all loops on hook.

Hdc in Third Loop: Skip top two loops of next hdc of previous row, yarn over, insert hook in third horizontal loop at back of work that corresponds to skipped st and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through all loops on hook.

hdc2tog in Third Loop: [Skip top two loops of next hdc of previous row, yarn over, insert hook in third horizontal loop at back of work that corresponds to skipped st and draw up a loop] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 20 (22) [51 (56) cm]
gauge: 11 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet working in back loops only. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Brim
Ch 9 (10).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd st from hook, sc in each ch to end of row – 8 (9) sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each stitch across – 8 (9) sts.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2 until 54 (58) rows have been completed. 
Joining Row: Ch 1, turn, fold piece in half, lining up sts of foundation ch and last row, working through both layers, slip st across to join first and last rows to form a loop. 
Body
Round 1: Ch 1, working along long edge of Brim, hdc 56 (60 sts) evenly spaced around, slip st in first hdc to join – 56 (60) sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, hdc in third loop in each st around, slip st in first st – 56 (60) sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, Fphdc around each of next 2 sts, hdc in third loop of next 2 sts, *Fphdc around each of next 2 sts, hdc in third loop of next 2 sts; repeat from * around, slip st in first Fphdc – 56 (60) sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, hdc in third loop in next 2 sts, Fphdc around each of next 2 sts, *hdc in third loop of next 2 sts, Fphdc around each of next 2 hdc; repeat from * around, slip st in first hdc. 
Rounds 5-20: Repeat Rounds 3 and 4.
Shape Crown
Round 21: Ch 1, Fphdc2tog, hdc2tog in third loop, *Fphdc2tog, hdc2tog in third loop; repeat from * around, slip st in first Fphdc2tog – 28 (30) sts.
Round 22: Ch 1, hdc in each st around, slip st in first hdc. 
Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. 
Weave tail in and out of every st around and pull tight to gather. Secure end.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Heads Up™: 1 ball each of 251 Citrus A and 852 Navy B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures about 22” (56 cm) circumference.
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = 4” (10 cm) diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Notes: Work first stitch of each round in same stitch as joining slip stitch unless otherwise instructed.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st first sc—24 sc. Fasten off A.
Round 4: With right side facing, join B with beg-dc in 13th sc of previous round, dc in same st, dc in next 2 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in beg-dc—32 dc. Fasten off B.
Round 5: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in 17th dc of previous round, ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc. Fasten off A.
Round 6: With right side facing, join B with beg-dc in 21st sc of previous round, dc in same st, dc in next 4 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 4 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in beg-dc—48 dc. Fasten off B.
Round 7: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in 25th dc of previous round, ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc. Fasten off A.
Round 8: With right side facing, join B with beg-dc in 29th sc of previous round, dc in each st around; join with slip st in beg-dc. Fasten off B.
Round 9: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in 29th dc of previous round, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.
Rounds 10 and 11: Repeat Rounds 8 and 9.
Round 12: Repeat Round 8.
Round 13: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A with beg-dc in same st as joining, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last st, ch 1, skip next st; join with slip st in first sc—28 ch-1 spaces and 28 sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, skipping the sc sts, work 2 sc in each ch-1 space around; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc. Fasten off A.
Special Stitch
beg-dc (beginning double crochet) = Beginning with empty hook and leaving a long beginning tail to weave n later, [yarn over] twice, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Note: If preferred, a traditional beginning double crochet can be worked as follows: Join yarn with slip st in indicated stitch, ch 3.
Notes
1. To make a smaller hat, use a hook one size smaller. To make a larger hat, use a hook one size larger.
2. Hat is worked in joined rounds, beginning at top of hat. Join but do not turn rounds.
3. Hat stripes are worked in the following color sequence: 3 rounds with A, 1 round with B, [1 round with A, 1 round with B] 4 times, 3 rounds with A.
4. To change color, fasten off old color and join new color in indicated stitch as instructed. The new color is joined in different stitches to help hide the joins.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet Thread”, Size 10: 1 ball each 001 White A, 450 Aqua B
Crochet Hook: 2.25mm [US B-1]
Thread needle
abbreviations: A and B = Color A, B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into indicated st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Small hat measures 8½” in circumference. Large hat measures 12½” in circumference.
gauge: 23 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in pattern st.
instructions:
LARGE HAT
With A, ch 4; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), work 11 
hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, change 
to B in last st—12 hdc.
Round 2: With B, ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1 here and 
throughout), *dc in next hdc, ch 1; repeat from * around; 
join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch; change to A in 
last st—12 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: With A, ch 4, dc in same st as join, (dc, ch 1, dc) 
in each dc around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning 
ch; change to B in last st—24 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: With B, slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 4, dc in 
space between next 2 dc, ch 1, *dc in next ch-1 space, 
ch 1, dc in space between next 2 dc, ch 1; repeat from * 
around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch, change 
to A in last st—24 dc and 24 ch-1 spaces.
Round 5: Repeat Round 3—48 dc and 24 ch-1 spaces.
Round 6: With B, slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 4, dc in 
space between next 2 dc, ch 1, *[dc in next ch-1 space, 
ch 1] twice, dc in space between next 2 dc, ch 1; repeat 
from * around to last ch-1 space, dc in last ch-1 space, ch 
1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch, change to A in 
last st—36 dc and 36 ch-1 spaces.
Round 7: Repeat Round 3—72 dc and 36 ch-1 spaces.
Round 8: With B, slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 4, *dc in 
next ch-1 space, ch 1; repeat from * around; join with slip 
st in 3rd ch of beginning ch, change to A in last st—36 dc 
and 36 ch-1 spaces.
Rounds 9–12: Repeat Rounds 7 and 8 twice.
Round 13: With A, ch 1, sc in each dc and ch-1 space 
around; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc.
Round 14: With A, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with 
slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
SMALL HAT
With A, ch 4; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rounds 1–5: Work Rounds 1–5 of large hat—48 dc and 
24 ch-1 spaces.
Rounds 6–8: Work Rounds 8–10 of large hat—24 dc and 
24 ch-1 spaces.
Rounds 9 and 10: Work Rounds 13 and 14 of large 
hat—48 sc. Fasten off.
Keep a little preemie’s head warm with these 
sweet caps in smooth 100% cotton thread. 
Choose from the many colors available 
including soft pastels and brights.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball each of 801 Bluebell A, 301 Teddy B and 112 Night-Night C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75 [US F-5]
Yarn needle
Stitch markers
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same stitch
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Size: 17½” (44.5 cm) in circumference.
gauge: 20 sts and 10 rows hdc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Round 4: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 2 sc; repeat from * around – 24 sc. 
Round 5: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * around – 30 sc.
Round 6: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 4 sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in next sc – 36 sc. Fasten off B. 
EYES (make 2)
With C, work same as Hat through Round 1; join with a slip in first hdc. Fasten off C.
NOSE
With C, work same as Eyepatch through Round 1.
Round 2: *2 sc in next sc, (hdc, dc, hdc) in next st; repeat from * twice; join with a slip in first sc. Fasten off C.
EAR (make 2, one with A and one with B) 
Make an adjustable ring
Round 1: Ch 1, 4 sc in ring; do not join; draw up end to tighten loop – 4 sc. Work in a spiral. 
Place a marker in first st of round and move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 8 sc. 
Round 3: *2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 12 sc.
Round 4: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 2 sc; repeat from * around – 16 sc. 
Round 5: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * around – 20 sc.
Round 6: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 4 sc; repeat from * around – 24 sc.
Round 7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 5 sc; repeat from * around – 28 sc. 
Rounds 9-10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 6 sc; repeat from * around – 32 sc.
HAT
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 hdc in ring; do not join; draw up end to tighten loop – 8 hdc. Work in a spiral. Place a marker in first st of round and move marker up as work progresses. 
Round 2: 2 hdc in each st around – 16 hdc. 
Round 3: *2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next hdc; repeat from * around – 24 hdc.
Round 4: *2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in each of next 2 hdc; repeat from * around – 32 hdc. 
Round 5: *2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in each of next 3 hdc; repeat from * around – 40 hdc.
Round 6: *2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in each of next 4 hdc; repeat from * around – 48 hdc.
Round 7: *2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in each of next 5 hdc; repeat from * around – 56 hdc. 
Round 8: *2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in each of next 6 hdc; repeat from * around – 64 hdc.
Round 9: *2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in each of next 7 hdc; repeat from * around – 72 hdc.
Round 10: *2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in each of next 8 hdc; repeat from * around – 80 hdc.
Round 11: Hdc in each hdc around.
Round 12: *2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in each of next 9 hdc; repeat from * around – 88 hdc.
Rounds 13-20: Hdc in each hdc around.
Round 21: Slip st in each hdc around; join with a slip st in first slip st. Fasten off A. 
Weave in ends. 
EYEPATCH
With B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; do not join; draw up end to tighten loop – 6 sc. Work in a spiral. 
Place a marker in first st of round and move marker up as work progresses. 
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc. 
Round 3: *2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 18 sc.
Rounds 12-28: Sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in next sc. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
FINISHING
Using photo as a guide, sew one eye to eyepatch. Sew eyepatch, remaining eye, and Nose to hat. Flatten each ear and sew last round of each ear closed. Fold tops of ears and sew last round of ears to hat. Weave in ends.

materials: Red HeaRt® With Love™: 1 skein 1942 Plum Jam.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hat fits most women.
gauge: 12 sc = 4”; 16 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Hat
Beginning at side, ch 28. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 27 sc. 
Row 2 (right side): Ch 1, sc through both loops of each of the first four sc, sc in back loop of each of the next 22 sc; turn – 26 sc. 
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in back loop in each of the next 21 sc, sc through both loops of the last 4 sc; turn – 25 sc. 
Row 4: Ch 1, sc through both loops of each of the first four sc, sc in back loop of each of the next 20 sc; turn – 24 sc. 
Row 5: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in back loop in each of the next 19 sc, sc through both loops of the last 4 sc; turn – 23 sc. 
Row 6: Ch 1, sc through both loops of each of the first four sc, sc in back loop of each of the next 18 sc; turn – 22 sc. 
Row 7: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in back loop in each of the next 17 sc, sc through both loops of the last 4 sc; turn – 21 sc. 
Row 8: Ch 1, sc through both loops of each of the first four sc, sc in back loop of each of the next 16 sc; turn – 20 sc. 
Row 9: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in back loop in each of the next 15 sc, sc through both loops of the last 4 sc; turn – 19 sc. 
Row 10: Ch 1, sc through both loops of each of the first four sc, sc in back loop of each of the next 14 sc; turn – 18 sc. 
Row 11: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in back loop in each of the next 13 sc, sc through both loops of the last 4 sc; turn – 17 sc. 
Row 12: Ch 1, sc through both loops of each of the first four sc, sc in back loop of each of the next 12 sc, sc in the end of each previous 11 rows; turn – 27 sc. 
Row 13: Ch 1, sc in back loop in each of the next 23 sc, sc through both loops of the last 4 sc; turn – 27 sc. 
Rows 14-61: Repeat Rows 2-13 four more times. 
Row 62-72: Repeat Rows 2-12 once more, ch 1 at the end of Row 72; turn. 
Joining: With right sides facing together, hold Row 1 edge on Row 72 edge, join edges with a slip st through front loops of Row 73 and unused loops of foundation ch, to last 4 sts. End with slip st through both loops of last 4 sts and unused loops of foundation ch; fasten off. With yarn needle and long strand of yarn, weave yarn through stitches at top of hat. Cinch together to close space, and fasten securely. Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 400 Grey Heather A, and 316 Soft White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch markers, two ¾–1” (19–25 mm) buttons, yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated

gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 9 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in half double crochet (hdc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com

RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
Little Lindy’s Aviator Hat 
Keep your cuddly baby protected from the cold with this clever aviator-style hat. Choose neutral shades as shown for a dashing look with any outfit. 
Size Toddler Only: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 9 sts] 5 times; join with slip st in first hdc—55 hdc.
Size Child Only: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts] 10 times; join with slip st in first hdc—60 hdc.
All Sizes:
Next 8 (9, 11) Rounds: Ch 1, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc. Do not fasten off.
First Earflap
Row 1 (right side): Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), hdc in next 6 (8, 10) sts; leave remaining sts unworked—6 (8, 10) hdc.
Rows 2–3 (4, 4): Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across.
Fasten off.
Forehead Flap
With right side facing, skip 3 unworked sts following last st of Row 1 of first earflap, draw up a loop of B in the next unworked st.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in same st as joining, sc in next 15 (16, 17) sts; leave remaining sts unworked—16 (17, 18) sc.
Rows 2–8 (9, 10): Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Fasten off.
Second Earflap
With right side facing, skip 3 unworked sts following last st of Row 1 of forehead flap, draw up a loop of A in the next unworked sts.
Rows 1–3 (4, 4): Work same as Rows 1–3 (4, 4) of first earflap.
Fasten off.
Directions are for size Baby. Changes for sizes Toddler and Child are in parentheses.
HAT
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1 (does not count as a st here and throughout), 10 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first hdc—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—20 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st] 10 times; join with slip st in first hdc—30 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts] 10 times; join with slip st in first hdc—40 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts] 10 times; join with slip st in first hdc—50 hdc.
FINISHING
Border: With wrong side (inside) of hat facing, join A with sc in st at center back of hat (between the two earflaps), work sc all the way around the edges of hat, earflaps, and forehead flap, working 1 sc in each st, 2 sc in end of each hdc row (on sides of earflaps), and 1 sc in end of each sc row (on sides of forehead flap); join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Fold forehead flap up. Sewing through flap and hat, sew one button to each upper corner of flap to hold in place.
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Shocking Pink (0718) 1 ball or 165 yds/151 m
Contrast B Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Contrast C Black (0312) 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Size U.S I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Tape measure
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 12 half double crochet (hdc) and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.
NOTES
• Join all rounds (rnds) with slip stitch (sl st) to first stitch (st).

HAT
With A, chain (ch) 3.
1st round (rnd): 10 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first hdc in this rnd and all subsequent rnds. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
7th to 14th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
15th rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 hdc.
16th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 hdc.
17th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 90 hdc.
18th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 100 hdc.
19th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 110 hdc.
20th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 120 hdc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. Slip stitch (sl st) in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.

EARS (make 2 alike)
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.

INNER EARS (make 2 alike)
With B, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc. Fasten off.
Sew Inner Ears to Ears as shown in photo. Sew Ears to top of Hat as shown in photo.

EYES (make 2 alike)
With C, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc. Fasten off.
With B, embroider glints in Eyes as shown in photo. Sew Eyes to Hat as shown in photo.

NOSE
With B, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 double crochet (dc) in 4th ch from hook (beg ch 3 counts as dc). 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 24 dc.
Fasten off.
With C, embroider Nose with satin stitch and straight stitch as shown in photo. Sew Nose to Hat as shown in photo.

materials: Caron® Cupcakes™ (3 oz/85 g; 244 yds/223 m) Tutti Frutti (16001) 1 ball for all sizes
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® stitch markers.
measurements: To fit child sizes 2 (4-6-8-10)
gauge: 16 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for the smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s), the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. Note: Chain (ch) 2 at beginning (beg) of rounds (rnds) does not count as half double crochet (hdc).
Beg at crown, ch 3.
1st rnd: 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Repeat (rep) from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 64 hdc.
Size 4 only: 9th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 15 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 68 hdc.
Sizes 6, 8 and 10 only: 9th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 72 hdc.
Size 8 only: 10th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 17 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 76 hdc.
Size 10 only: 10th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 78 hdc.
All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 64 (68-72-76-78) hdc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 7 ( 7½-8-8-8½) [18 (19-20.5-20.5-20.5) cm]. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 3 times more. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew pompom to top of Hat.

materials: Bernat® Bundle Up™ (4.9 oz/140 g; 267 yds/244 m)
Main Color (MC) Violet Gray (74027) 1 1 ball
Contrast A Duckling (74019) 1 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch markers.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Tr3tog = [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in indicated space. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook twice] 3 times. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
measurements: To fit head circumference: 6/12 mos  16" [40.5 cm], 18/24 mos  18" [45.5 cm]
gauge: 15 hdc and 12 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes. 
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnds and rows does not count as hdc. 
• Hat is worked from top down.
• Earflaps worked separately and sewn to Hat.
• Join all rnds when noted with sl st to top of first st. 
HAT
Beg at top, with MC, ch 3.
1st rnd: 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 8 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 hdc.
Size 18/24 mos only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc. 
Both sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 5¾ (6½)" [14.5 (16.5) cm]. Fasten off.
Star Earflaps (make 2)
Center: With A, ch 4. 
1st rnd: 14 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). Join to top of ch-3. 15 dc.
Points: 2nd rnd: *Ch 7. Working into horizontal 'bump' at back of each ch, 1 sc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 tr in next ch. Skip next 2 dc. Sl st in next dc. (1 Point made). Rep from * around. Join. 5 Points total. Fasten off.
Flap: 1st row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to sc at end of any Point. Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Tr3tog, inserting hook into next tr, center sl st and base of next tr on next point. Cont working across rem loops of ch-7: 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st.* Working across opposite side of same point, 1 sc in ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to * once more. Turn.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st.* 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. PM on last st for Tie placement. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Place markers 1 (1¼)" [2.5 (3) cm] at either side of join (center back) of last rnd of Hat.
Sew Earlaps to Hat beg at marker, allowing Star to overlap Hat as seen in picture.
Edging and Ties: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to center back of Hat. Ch 1. *Work sc evenly around outer edge of Hat to next Tie marker. Ch 23. Working into horizontal 'bump' at back of each ch, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Rep from * once more. Cont working sc evenly around outer edge of Hat to first sc. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool WorstedTM (3.5 oz/100 g; 210 yds/192 m) Blue Heather (77118) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 buttons.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and insert hook from front to back around post of next stitch. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.)
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head.
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Beg at crown, ch 3. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 15 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 16 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 24 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in sp between last dcfp and next dcfp. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 32 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 40 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 48 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 56 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 64 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 2. *3 dcfp around dcfp 2 rows below. Miss next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * 15 times more. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
10th rnd: As 8th rnd.
11th rnd: Sl st in next st. Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss next sc. 3 dcfp around dc 2 rows below. Miss next sc. *1 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. 3 dcfp around dc 2 rows below. Miss next sc. Rep from * 14 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
12th rnd: As 8th rnd.
