13th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sts. Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss next sc. 3 dcfp around dc 2 rows below. Miss next sc. *1 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. 3 dcfp around dc 2 rows below. Miss next sc. Rep from * 14 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep 12th and 13th rnds until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a 13th rnd. Do not fasten off.
Band: 1st and 2nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc. Do not fasten off.
Brim: Beg working in rows: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 46 sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of last row.
FINISHING
Fold Brim of Hat at corners and sew into place with button on each side as shown in photo.

materials: Patons® Canadiana™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 205 yds/187 m)
Main Color (MC) Dark Grey Mix (10042) 1 ball (4/6) 1 ball (8/10)
Contrast A Black (10040) 1 ball (4/6) 1 ball (8/10)
Contrast B Lime Juice (10712) 1 ball (4/6) 1 ball (8/10)
Contrast C Pale Grey Mix (10046) 1 ball (4/6) 1 ball (8/10)
Main Color (MC) Medium Teal (10744) 1 ball (4/6) 1 ball (8/10)
Contrast A Medium Amethyst (10344) 1 ball (4/6) 1 ball (8/10)
Contrast B Winter White (10006) 1 ball (4/6) 1 ball (8/10)
Contrast C Lime Juice (10712) 1 ball (4/6) 1 ball (8/10)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Sc3tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook
measurements: To fit child 4/6 (8/10)
gauge: 16 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Fair Isle Pat.
instructions: Notes: • To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed with new color. • Carry color when not in use loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to avoid stranding (see photo below of WS of work). Ribbing With MC, ch 18. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 17 sts. 2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. GAuGE 16 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Fair Isle Pat. Proceed in pat as follows: Rep last row until work from beg measures 17½ (18½)" [44.5 (47) cm], when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off. Join last row and 1st row tog with 1 row of sc to form tube. Beg working in rnds: Foundation rnd: ch 1. Working along side edge of ribbing, work 72 (80) sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. 1st to 8th rnds: Ch 1. Work Chart to end of chart, noting 8-st rep will be worked 9 (10) times. Join with sl st to first sc at end of each rnd. Rep last 8 rnds of Chart once more. Shape top: 1st rnd: With MC, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. *With B, 1 sc in next sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 63 (70) sts. 2nd rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in next st. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 6 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Join B with sl st to first sc. 3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. *With MC, sc2tog. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. With MC, sc2tog. Join A with sl st to first sc. 54 (60) sts. 4th rnd: With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 45 (50) sts. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 (40) sts. 6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc3tog. Rep from * around to last 0 (1) st. (1 sc in last st) 0 (1) time. Join with sl st to first sc leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem 12 (14) sts.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast B Light Country Peach (9737) 1 ball
Contrast D Oﬀ   White (9702) 1 ball
Contrast E Light Country Blue (9709) 1 ball
Contrast F Country Blue (9710) 1 ball
Contrast G Dark Country Blue (9711) 1 ball
Caron® Simply Soft® Heathers™ (5 oz/141 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Contrast A Gray Heather (H9509) 1 ball
Contrast C Woodland Heather (H9503) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: V-st = (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in indicated stitch.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Stripe Pat
Work 1 rnd of each color: B, C, D, E, F, B, G, A
These 8 rnds form Stripe Pat.
HAT
Ribbing: With A, ch 12.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 11 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg, when slightly stretched, measures 19½" [49.5 cm].** Do not fasten off.
1st rnd: Work 64 sc across longer side of ribbing. Join with sl st to first sc.
Proceed in Stripe Pat as follows:
1st rnd: With B, ch 4. 1 dc in same sp as sl st – beg V-st made. *Skip next sc. V-st in next sc. Rep from * around. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Fasten off. 32 V-sts.
2nd rnd: Join C with sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as sl st. *V-st in next V-st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
First 2 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last rnd until work from beg measures 7½" [19 cm].
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows:
Shape crown: 1st rnd: Join appropriate color with sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as sl st. V-st in each of next 6 V-sts. Skip next V-st. * V-st in each of next 7 V-sts. Skip next V-st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 28 V-sts.
2nd rnd: Join appropriate color with sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as sl st. V-st in each of next 5 V-sts. Skip next V-st. * V-st in each of next 6 V-sts. Skip next V-st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 24 V-sts.
3rd rnd: Join appropriate color with sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as sl st. V-st in each of next 4 V-sts. Skip next V-st. * V-st in each of next 5 V-sts. Skip next V-st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 20 V-sts.
4th rnd: Join appropriate color with sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as sl st. V-st in each of next 3 V-sts. Skip next V-st. * V-st in each of next 4 V-sts. Skip next V-st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 16 V-sts.
5th rnd: Join appropriate color with sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as sl st. V-st in each of next 2 V-sts. Skip next V-st. * V-st in each of next 3 V-sts. Skip next V-st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 12 V-sts.
6th rnd: Join appropriate color with sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as sl st. Skip next V-st. *V-st in next V-sts. Skip next V-st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Fasten off. 6 V-sts.
Thread yarn through rem V-sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. Sew ends of ribbing.
Pompom: Wind A around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Anchor® Embroidery Floss™ (9 yds/8 m)
Contrast A Pink (00054) 1 skein or 5.5 yds/5 m
Contrast B Yellow (00289) 1 skein or 5.5 yds/5 m
Contrast C Green (00240) 1 skein or 5.5 yds/5 m
Contrast D Blue (928) 1 skein or 5.5 yds/5 m
Contrast E Purple (00111) 2 skeins or 17 yds/15 m
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit 12" [30.5 cm] fashion doll.
gauge: 28 sc and 28 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.

MOTIFS  
Make 1 each in the following color combinations:
Motif 1: E as Color 1, A as Color 2, C as Color 3.
Motif 2: A as Color 1, B as Color 2, E as Color 3.
Motif 3: C as Color 1, D as Color 2, A as Color 3.
Motif 4: D as Color 1, E as Color 2, C as Color 3
Motif 5: E as Color 1, C as Color 2, B as Color 3.
With Color 1, ch 2. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: [(2 sc. Ch 2) 3 times. 2 sc] all in ring. Ch 2. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in same sp as sl st. [(2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in sp between next 2-sc groups. [(2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 2 sc in in sp between next 2-sc groups] 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Ring of Motifs: Sew sides of 5 Motifs tog to form Ring in the following order: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.
Shape crown: With RS facing, join E with sl st to any ch-2 sp at top edge of Ring of Motifs.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each sc around, working 1 sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Join. 40 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts. Fasten off. Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely.

Brim
With RS facing, join E with sl st to any ch-2 sp at bottom edge of Ring of Motifs.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch-2 sps) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd, working 1 sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Join. 42 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Real Teal (0656) 1 ball or 85 yds/78 m
Red Heart® Super Glow™ (1.8 oz/50 g; 50 yds/46 m)
Contrast B Lunar White (2000) 2 balls or 91 yds/83 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
measurements: One size to fit Adult - approx 20" [51 cm] circumference.
gauge: 12 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• When changing colors, work hdc to last 3 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 3 loops on hook and proceed in new color, keeping color change to WS of work. 
• Carry color not in use along top of last row and work new sts around carried color. 
• Ch 1 at beg of rnds does not count as hdc. 
• Join all rnds with sl st to first hdc at end of rnd. 
CROWN 
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to make ring. See diagram on page 3. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. *With B, 2 hdc in next hdc. With A, 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. With B, 2 hdc in last hdc. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc. 
3rd rnd:  With A, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 2 hdc in next hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc.** With A, 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc. 
4th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc.** With A, 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc. 
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc.** With A, 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then * to ** once more. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc. 
6th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc.** With A, 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
Proceed in Check Pat as follows: 
7th to 10th rnds:  With B, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc.** Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join B with sl st to first hdc at end of 7th to 9th rnds. 
Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 10th rnd. 
11th to 14th rnds:  With A, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc.** With A, 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 11th to 13th rnds. Join B with sl st to first hdc at end of 14th rnd.
BRIM 
15th rnd: With B, working in back loops only, ch 1. 1 hdcbl in same sp as sl st. 1 hdcbl in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdcbl in next hdc. 1 hdcbl in each of next 2 hdc. *With A, 1 hdcbl in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdcbl in next hdc. 1 hdcbl in each of next 2 hdc.** With B, 1 hdcbl in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdcbl in next hdc. 1 hdcbl in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 70 hdc. 
16th rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc.** With B, 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 80 hdc. 
17th rnd:  With B, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc.** With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 90 hdc. 
18th rnd:  With B, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc.** With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 100 hdc. 
19th rnd:  With B, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc.** With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 110 hdc. 
20th rnd: With B only, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Break B. 
21st rnd: With A, sl st in each hdc around. Join with sl st in first sl st. Fasten off. 
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver”: 1 skein each 356 Amethyst A, 316 Soft White B, 672 Spring Green C and 312 Black D.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Yarn needle
polyester fiberfill.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = color A, B, C, D
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures 20” around at widest; 10½” flattened and measured across top of teeth.
gauge: Rounds 1–6 = 3½” across at widest. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Round 1 (Right Side): With A ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join and do not turn—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—54 sc.
Round 12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—60 sc.
Round 14: [Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—66 sc.
Rounds 15–25: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off A.
Teeth
Round 26: Join B with slip st in first sc, ch 1, sc in each sc around.
Round 27: Slip st in next sc, *ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, tr in last ch (tooth made), skip next 3 sc of Round 26, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around, slip st in last sc. Fasten off B.
Horn
Round 1 (Right Side): With C ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join—6 sc.
Round 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice—8 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice—10 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice—12 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—15 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—18 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Rounds 14–16: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off C, leaving a long tail for sewing horn to hat.
Eye
Rounds 1–3: With B, work Rounds 1–3 of Hat—18 sc.
Rounds 4–6: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off B, leaving a long tail for sewing eye to hat.
Pupil
Round 1: With D, work Round 1 of Hat; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Fasten off D, leaving a long tail for sewing pupil to eye.
Eyelid
Row 1: With A, ch 2, 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—12 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off A, leaving a long tail for sewing eyelid to hat.
Eyelashes
Cut twelve 6” strands of D. Fold one strand in half. Using crochet hook, draw the folded end of strand through first sc of Row 3 of eyelid. Draw ends of strand through fold and pull gently but firmly to tighten. Repeat this process to attach an eyelash to each sc of Row 3. Brush and trim eyelashes as desired.
ASSEMBLY
Stuff horn and sew to top of hat, slightly to one side. Sew pupil to center of eye. Sew eye to front of hat. Sew eyelid above eye, slightly overlapping top of eye. Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red A and 316 Soft White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
Susan Bates® Easy Pom Pon Maker, 2" (5 cm) diameter
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22, 24)" (51 (56, 61) cm) in circumference.
gauge: 13 dc and 7 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HAT
With A, create a magic ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 dc in ring; join with slip st in first dc – 12 dc
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 dc in each dc around; join with slip st in first dc – 24 dc 
Round 3: Ch 1, [dc in next st, 2 hdc in next st] 12 times; join with slip st in first dc – 36 dc 
Round 4: Ch 1, [dc in 2 each of next sts, 2 dc in next st] 12 times; join with slip st in first dc – 48 dc
Note: Change to yarn color B at end of Round 4 (5, 5).
Round 5: Ch 1, [dc in each of next 3 sts, 2 dc in next st] 12 times, join with slip st in first dc – 60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [dc in each of next 9 (4, 4) sts, 2 dc in next st] 6 (10, 10) times, join with slip st in first dc – 66 (72, 72) sts.
For largest size only
Next round: Ch 1, [dc in 8 sts, 2 dc in next st] 8 times, join with slip st in first dc – 80 dc.
Next 6 (7, 7) rounds: Ch 1, dc in each st around; slip st to join – 66 (72, 80) dc.
Earflaps (optional)
Row 1: Ch 2 (counts as 1 dc here and throughout), dc2tog over next 2 sts, dc in each of next 6 (8, 8) sts, dc2tog over next 2 sts, dc in next st, turn – 10 (12, 12) dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn – 10 (12, 12) sc.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc2tog over next 2 sts, dc in each st to last 3 sts, dc2tog over next 2 sts, dc in last st, turn – 8 (10, 10) dc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn – 8 (10, 10) sc.
Repeat the last 2 rows 0 (1, 1) more times – 8 sc.
Next 2 rows:
Row 1: Ch 2, [dc2tog over next 2 sts] twice, dc in last st, turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across – 4 sc. 
Fasten off.
With earflap facing up, skip 28 (30, 32) sts to the left of last earflap st on brim, and join B with slip st in next st.
Work other Earflap the same way.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Border for Cap Version
Next 2 rounds: Ch 1, sc in each st around.
Fasten off.
Border for Earflap Version
Join B with slip st in center back of hat. 
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each st and 4 sc in each sc-row edge around, join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
Pom Poms
With A and B held together, make a pom pom and sew to top of hat.
Maple Leaf
With A, form an adjustable loop
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as 1 dc), 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in first st – 12 dc. 
Round 2: Ch 2, (picot, hdc) in same st as joining slip st, (hdc, picot, hdc) in next st, (hdc, picot, ch 2, slip st) in next st, (slip st, ch 2, picot, dc) in next st, (dc, picot, dc) in next st, (dc, picot, ch 2, slip st) in next st, (slip st, ch 2, picot, hdc) in next st, (hdc, picot, hdc) in next st, (hdc, picot, ch 2, slip st) in next st, slip st in next st, ch 5, skip 1 ch, sc in each of next 4 ch (stem), slip st in Round 1 to join stem, slip st in beginning ch-2 to join round.
Fasten off.
Position Maple Leaf as desired onto hat and use markers to hold in place.
Assuring picots are defined, use yarn needle to sew in place.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Medium, Art E404, Oeko-Tex Certified 100% Acrylic baby yarn available in solid 4.5 oz (127 g) 247 yds (225 m), and prints 4 oz (113 g) 208 yds (190 m) balls
Susan Bates® crochet hook: 5mm [H-8]
Yarn needle
4" (10 cm) piece of cardboard
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat fits head circumference 16 (18, 20)” [41 (46, 51) cm]
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 10 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HAT
Round 1: Leaving a 24” (61 cm) tail for seaming later, ch 44 (48, 52). Join to first ch with slip st.
Round 2: Ch 1, 1 sc in each ch around; join to first sc with slip st.
Round 3: Ch 2, dc in first st, 3-dc cl in next st, *1 dc in next st, 3-dc cl in next st; repeat from * around; join to first dc with slip st.
Round 4: Ch 1, 1 sc in each st around; join to first sc with slip st.
Repeat Rounds 3 and 4 five (six, seven) more times.
Edging
Ch 1, FPsc around each sc around; join to first FPSC with slip st.
FINISHING
With yarn needle and long tail, whip stitch the top of the hat closed.
Pom Poms (make 2)
Wrap yarn 90 times around 4" (10 cm) cardboard. Tie a 24” (61 cm) length of yarn around the wrapped yarn tightly. Slide yarn off cardboard.
Cut loop edges of yarn and shape with scissors until round without cutting the 24” (61 cm) length of yarn.
With the 24” (61 cm) length of yarn and your yarn needle, attach the pom poms to the top corners of the hat. Weave tail through both the pom pom and the hat 10 times.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Royal Blue (9767) 1 1 ball
Contrast B Blue Mint (B9608) 1 1 ball
Contrast C Green (9779) 1 1 ball
Contrast D Sunshine (9755) 1 1 ball
Contrast E Orange (9778) 1 1 ball
Contrast F Harvest Red (9763) 1 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 stitch markers.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: To fit child 2 (4) years.
gauge: 13 hdc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Stripe Pat
Work 3 rnds with A.
Work 3 (4) rnds of each color in the following sequence: B, C, D, E and F.
HAT
Beg at crown, with A, ch 4. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
First 3 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete.
Beg with B, cont in Stripe Pat as follows:
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 4 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 5 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 hdc.
Size 2 yrs only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. *1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 13 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 13 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
Size 4 yrs only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 6 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 6 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 64 hdc.
Both sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. PM at end of rnd. Rep last rnd, keeping cont of Stripe Pat, until work from marked rnd measures 3¾ (4½)" [9.5 (11.5) cm].
Note: Last rnds of Stripe Pat should be worked with F.
Earflaps: Place markers on 5th hdc on each side of center back (joining hdc), leaving 8 hdc unworked at center back.
First Earflap: 1st row: (RS). Join F with sl st in marked hdc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 15 (17) hdc. Turn.
16 (18) sc.
**Next 2 (4) rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
14 (16) sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more.
8 (10) sts at end of last row.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
4 (6) sts at end of last row. Fasten off.**
Second Earflap: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 20 hdc of Hat. Join F with sl st in next hdc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 15 (17) sts to marker. Turn.
16 (18) sc.
Work from ** to ** as given for First Earflap.
Edging: With RS facing, join F with sl st at center back. Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 rnd of reverse sc evenly around all outer edges. Join with sl st to first reverse sc. Fasten off.
Ties: (make 2). Cut 4 lengths each of E and F 11" [24 cm] long. With someone holding opposite end, twist strands to the right until they begin to curl tightly. Fold strands in half. Wrap F around cord approx 10 times 1" [2.5 cm] from end to secure ends. Trim ends. Attach tie to each Earflap.
Top Twisted cord: Cut 10 lengths each of A and B 15" [38 cm] long. With someone holding opposite end, twist strands to the right until they begin to curl tightly. Fold strands in half. Wrap A around cord approx 20 times 1" [2.5 cm] from end to secure ends. Trim ends. Attach to top of Hat.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m; Paints: 4 oz/113.4 g; 204 yds/186 m)
Dark Country Blue (39711) 1 ball or Passion (P0019) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Hat from beg measures 6 (7-9-10)" [15 (18-23-25.5) cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Note: Chain (chain) 2 at beginning (beg) of round (rnd) does not count as half double crochet (hdc).
Ch 4. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. Repeat (rep) from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc. 
6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 4 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 5 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 hdc.
Size 6/8 yrs only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. (1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 3 times. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
Sizes Woman and Man only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 6 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 6 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 64 hdc.
Size Man only: 9th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 7 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 7 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 72 hdc.
All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Rep last rnd until Hat from beg measures 6 (7-9-10)" [15 (18-23-25.5) cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Main Color (MC) Off White (9702) 1 ball
Contrast A Orchid (9717) 1 ball
Contrast B Chartreuse (9771) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit baby sizes 6-12 (18-24) months.
gauge: 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
HAT
With MC, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
Size 6-12 mos only: 6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 23 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 24 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 52 hdc.
7th to 15th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
16th and 17th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdcfp around first hdc. *1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdcbp around last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Fasten off.
Size 18-24 mos only: 6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
7th to 17th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
18th and 19th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdcfp around first hdc. *1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdcbp around last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Fasten off.
Ears (make 2)
With MC, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Ear edging: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to bottom right corner of Ear. Work sc evenly along 2 sides, having 3 sc in top corner. Fasten off.
Large Flower (make 1)
With A, ch 21.
1st row: 7 dc in 4th ch from hook. *Sl st in next ch. 8 dc in next ch. Rep from * to last ch. Sl st in last ch. Fasten off.
Sew Flower tog into coil as shown in picture.
Small Flower (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same st as last sl st. *Sl st in next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Sl st in last sc. Fasten off.
Leaves (make 2)
With B, ch 11.
1st rnd: 3 tr in 5th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into rem loops along opposite side of ch, 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 4 tr in last ch. Join with sl st to top of ch-4. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Ears, Flowers, and Leaves to Hat as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (5 oz/141 g; 260 yds/238 m)
Sizes Child 6/8 Adult
Aran Fleck (4313) 1 1 ball
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Tunisian Afghan crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® Steel Yarn Needle.
measurements: To fit Child 6/8 (Adult) head.
gauge: 13 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus (  ).
Note: Work all rows with RS of work facing. Hat is worked side to side.
Ch 72 (76). Note: Work into horizontal bumps at back of foundation ch for 1st row.
1st row: Forward pass: (Right to left). Insert hook into 2nd ch from hook. Yoh, draw loop through and leave on hook. *Insert hook in next ch. Yoh, draw loop through and leave on hook. Rep from * to end of chain. Do not turn. 72 (76) loops on hook.
1st row: Return pass: (Left to right). Yoh and draw through first loop on hook for selvedge st. *Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Rep from * until 1 loop rem on hook. Do not turn. Loop rem on hook becomes first st of next row.
2nd row: Forward pass: (Right to left). *1Tss in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts before marker. PM on last st. Leave rem sts unworked. Return pass.
Rep last row, working 2 sts less on every Forward pass row until there are 2 sts rem. Join B.
Next row: Forward pass: (Right to left). With B, *1Tss in next st. Rep from * to end of row. 24 sts. Return pass.
Second Wedge: With B, work from ** to ** as given for First Wedge, joining C at end of last row.
Third Wedge: With C, work from ** to ** as given for First Wedge, joining A at end of last row.
Changing colors in the following sequence: A, B, C, work 9 more Wedges. Fasten off.
Joining row: With RS tog and crochet hook, join C with sl st to first st at outer edge. Working through both thicknesses, work in sc across foundation row and last row of Bottom. Fasten off.
To close center of Bottom: Thread C through side edges of each row. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Side of Purse: With A and Tunisian hook, ch 60.
1st row: Forward pass: (Right to left). Draw up a loop in 2nd ch from hook. Draw up a loop in each rem ch to end of chain, leaving all loops on hook. 60 sts on hook. Do not turn.
Return pass: (Left to right after working Forward pass of each row). Yoh and draw through last loop only (for edge st). *Yoh and draw through 2 loops. Rep from * until 1 loop rem on hook. Do not turn.
2nd row: Forward pass: (Right to left). *1Tss in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Return pass.
Rep last row 8 times more.
Next row: Forward pass: (Drawstring hole row). 1Tss in each of first 5 sts. Sl st in each of next 3 sts. *1Tss in each st to end of row. Return pass, working ch 3 over 3 sl sts.
Next row: Forward pass: 1Tss in each of first 5 sts. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 ch. *1Tss in each st to end of row. Return pass.
Join B.
With B, rep 2nd row 10 times more.
Work from *** to ***. Join C.
With C, rep 2nd row 10 times more.
Work from *** to ***. Join A.
Changing colors in the following sequence: A, B, C, work 9 more stripes, noting position of Drawstring holes. Fasten off.
Join Side to Bottom: With WS tog and U.S. G/6 (4 mm) hook, matching colors of Side and Bottom, join C with sl st to any st. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc around Side and Bottom. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Final Return pass: (Left to right). Yoh and draw through first loop on hook for selvedge st. *Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Rep from * until 1 loop remains on hook. Break yarn, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. Sew back seam.
Pompom: Holding 2 strands of yarn together wind around 4 fingers approx 60 times. Tie tightly in center. Cut through both sides of loops. Shape to a smooth round shape. Attach to top of Hat.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Ombres™ (4 oz/113 g; 204 yds/186 m) Contrast A Stormy Weather (08243) 1 1 1 ball
Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast B Black (39727) 1 1 1 ball
Contrast C White (39701) 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. 1 Susan Bates® stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit 2/4 yrs (8/10 yrs – Adult)
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written 2/4 yrs (8/10 yrs - Adult). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Beg at crown, with A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
Cont as established, inc 8 sc evenly spaced every alt rnd until there are 56 (64-72) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 7 (8-9)" [18 (20.5-23) cm].
Beg working in rows: First Earflap:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 (16-18) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Earflap measures 2 (2½-3)" [5 (6-7.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 4 (5-6) sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * once more. Turn. 11 (13-15) sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 (3-4) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 (4-5) sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 8 (10-12) sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 0 (1-2) st(s). Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 1 (2-3) st(s). Sc2tog. Turn. 4 (6-8) sts.
Size 2/4 yrs only: Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sts.
Size 8/10 yrs only: Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 3 sts.
Size Adult only: Next row: Ch 1. (Sc3tog) twice. Sc2tog. 3 sts.
All sizes: Fasten off.
With RS facing, skip next 8 (8-11) unworked sc. Join A with sl st to next st. Work from ** to ** as given for First Earflap.
Nose
With B, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 2 hdc in first sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 2 hdc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Nose and Eyes to front of Hat as shown in picture. With C, embroider a little glint in each Eye using straight stitch.
Pompom Ears (make 2)
Wind 1 strand each of B and C around 4 fingers 60 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew 1 pompom to each side of Hat at top as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart ™ Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Main Color (MC) Seaweed (0660) 1 ball
Contrast A Swim Shorts (0880) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not
count as st.
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new
color, draw through loops and
proceed with new color.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch
to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc
around. Join. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc
in next hdc) 8 times. Join. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 8 times.
Join. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc) 8 times.
Join. 40 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 8 times.
Join. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc
around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc) 8 times.
Join. 56 hdc. Break A. Join MC.
9th rnd: With MC, as 7th rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc) 8 times.
Join. 64 hdc.
11th to 20th rnds: As 7th rnd.
21st to 23rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Chunky Cupcakes™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 138 yds/126 m) Blackberry Sorbet (23003) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc3tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch-1 sp. Skip next sc. Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch-1 sp. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc3tog made.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions: With smaller hook, ch 8. 1st row:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 7 sc. 2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 19½" [49.5 cm], when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off. Join last row and 1st row tog with 1 row of sc to form tube. Change to larger hook. Beg working in rnds: Foundation rnd: Ch 1. Working along side edge of ribbing, work 70 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd. Beg working in Moss St Pat. Note: For striping effect shown, alternate between using a strand from outside of cake and a strand from inside of cake every other rnd. Set up rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 1st rnd:  Ch 2. Skip first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of ch 2. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last st. Ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last 2 rnds for Moss St Pat until work from lower edge of ribbing measures 6½" [16.5 cm], ending on a 2nd rnd. Shape top: 1st rnd:  Ch 2. Skip first sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 3 times. Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch-1 sp. Skip next sc. Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch-1 sp. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc3tog made. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. Sc3tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of ch 2. 2nd and alt rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last st. Ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 2. Skip first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of ch 2. 5th rnd: Ch 2. Skip first sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) twice. Sc3tog. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Sc3tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of ch 2. 7th rnd: As 3rd rnd. 9th rnd: Ch 2. Skip first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sc3tog. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Sc3tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of ch 2. 10th rnd:  As 2nd rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and secure tightly. Sew pompom to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® With Love® Metallic: 1 ball 8922 Fuchsia
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Split lock stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Finished Circumference: 22" (56 cm)
gauge: 11 sts = 4” (10 cm); 8 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in hdc with A.
instructions:
CLOCHE
Brim
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 7; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does NOT count as a st), working in back loops, hdc in first sc and in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, working in back loops, hdc in first hdc and in each hdc across; turn.
Repeat Row 3 until brim is 22” (56 cm) long.
Crown
Ch 1, work 60 sc across one long edge; join with a slip st to first sc to form a circle. Place marker in first st of round. Do not join but work in continuous rounds, moving marker up each round.
Round 1: Hdc in first sc and in each sc around – 60 hdc.
Round 2: Hdc in first hdc and in each hdc around.
Repeat Round 2 until piece measures 5½” (14 cm) from lower edge.
Shape Crown
Next Round: [Hdc in 3 hdc, dec] 12 times – 48 hdc.
Work 1 round even.
Next Round: [Hdc in 2 hdc, dec] 12 times – 36 hdc.
Work 1 round even.
Next Round: [Hdc in hdc, dec] 12 times – 24 hdc.
Work 1 round even.
Next Round: [Dec] 12 times – 12 hdc.
Next Round: [Dec] 6 times; join with a slip st in next st – 6 hdc. Fasten off.
Weave yarn end through last 6 sts and draw top closed. Sew brim seam. Weave in loose ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Sizes 2/4 6/10 yrs Aruba Sea (0505) or Dusty Gray (0300)1 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop of next stitch
measurements: To fit head sizes: Child 2/4 years 18½" [47 cm] circumference, Child 6/10 years 19" [48 cm] circumference
gauge: 14 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Rib Pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to both sizes.
Note: Balaclava is worked from side to side.
Ch 39 (49) loosely.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 38 (48) sc.
**2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (sc and sl st).
Rep last 2 rows 4 times more.
Next row: As 2nd row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 scbl in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 5 times. Turn. 38 (48) sc.**
Rep from ** to ** once more.
Shape face opening: Upper Section: 1st row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each of next 18 (23) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
***2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (sc and sl st).
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 2 (3) time(s) more.***
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 scbl in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 4 (5) times. Turn. 19 (24) sc.
Next row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep from *** to *** once more. Fasten off.
Lower Section: With WS facing, working across rem sts of Main Body, join yarn with sl st to back loop of next sc.
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Working through back loops only, Sc2tog. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last 2 sts. Working through back loops only, Sc2tog.
3rd row: As 1st row.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 7 (11) times more.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. 2 scbl in last sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 scbl in first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Joining row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. 2 scbl in last sc of Lower Section. Working across Upper Section: 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 scbl in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 4 (5) times. Turn. 38 (48) sc.
Rep from ** to ** as given above twice more. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew back seam. Weave yarn through last sl st of each row along top edge. Gather tightly and fasten securely.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Worsted™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 194 yds/177 m) Contrast A Desert (77752) 1 ball
Patons® Alpaca Blend™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 155 yds/142 m) Contrast B Yam (01021) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Large eye embroidery needle.
Optional: Sticky-back water soluble fabric stabilizer to transfer embroidery motif.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] with Contrast A.
instructions:
Notes:
Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.

With A, ch 72. Join with sl st to first ch making sure not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join. 72 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. Rep 2nd rnd for 2" [5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 6½" [16.5 cm].
Shape top:
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sc. Fasten off leaving long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

Using B and template, embroider floral motif onto side of Hat (see page 3).
Optional: Using a sticky-back water soluble stabilizer, draw embroidery design on stabilizer, attach onto Hat and embroider.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m) Cherry (77709) 2 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit average woman.
gauge: 9 hdc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 a t beg of each rnd counts as 1 hdc.
Ch 3.
1st rnd: (RS). 9 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 2 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in next hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
Rep last rnd until work measures 8" [20.5 cm] from beg.
Ribbing: 1st rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. 1 hdcbp around next hdcbp. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdcfp around next hdcfp. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
Rep last rnd until work measures 11" [28 cm] from beg.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers appro x 150 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein 235 Lemon A.
RED HEART® “Kids”: 1 Skein 2945 Bikini Multi B.
Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9], 5mm [US H-8] and 6.5mm [US10.5-K] hook.
Pink round beads, matching thread and needle, stitch marker, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 18”.
gauge: 12 dc = 4” using 5.5mm [I-9] hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A and 5.5mm [I-9] hook, ch 54, slip st in first ch to form ring. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in each ch around, slip st in beginning ch to join – 54 hdc.
Rounds 2-3: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around, slip st in beginning ch.
Round 4: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 5-6: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 7: Ch 2, hdc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 8: Ch 2, hdc in next 4 hdc, [skip next hdc, hdc in next 5 hdc] to last st, skip last st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 45 hdc. 
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 10-11: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st in beginning ch.
Round 12: Ch 2, hdc in next 3 dc, [skip next dc, hdc in next 4 dc] around to last st, slip last st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 36 sts. 
Round 13: Ch 2, hdc in next 2 hdc, [skip next hdc, hdc in next 3 hdc] around to last st, skip last st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 27 sts. 
Round 14: Ch 2, hdc in next hdc, [skip next hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc] around to last st, slip last st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 18 sts. 
Round 15: Ch 2, skip next hdc, [hdc in next hdc, skip next hdc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 9 sts.
Round 16: Ch 1, [sc in next hdc, skip next hdc] around, slip st in first st – 4 sts. 
Round 17: [Slip st in next sc, skip next sc] around, slip st to first st – 2 sts.
Fasten off.

Right Ear Flap 
Mark center of front of Hat. 
Row 1: With wrong side facing and 5.5mm [I-9] hook, join A in st 3” to left of marked center front, ch 3, dc in next 9 sts. 
Row 2-6: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 9 dc.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, skip first dc, hdc in next 6 dc, skip next st, slip st in last dc. 
Fasten off.

Left Ear Flap 
Row 1: With right side facing and 5.5mm [I-9] hook, join A in st 3” to left of marked center front, ch 3, dc in next 9 sts. 
Row 2-6: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 9 dc.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, skip first dc, hdc in next 6 dc, skip next st, slip st in last dc. 
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Edging and Ties
Row 1: With right side facing and 5.5mm [I-9] hook, join B in any st along edge in back of Hat, ch 2, hdc in each st around, working 3 hdc in each skipped st on Row 7 of Ear Flaps, to center of Ear Flap, ch 60 for Tie, slip st in same space along edge of Hat, hdc in each st along edge of Hat to center of opposite Ear Flap, ch 60 for Tie, slip st in same st along edge of Hat, hdc in each st around to first st, slip st in top of beginning ch. 

Whipper Braids (Make 9)
With 1 strand of A and B held together and 6.5mm [K-10.5] hook, join yarn in any st at Row 15 at top of Hat, ch 50. 
Fasten off. 
Make 8 more Whipper Braids in each st around Row 15.

SWIRLY FLOWER (Make 2)
Petals (Make 6 with A and 6 with B for each Flower)
With 5mm [H-8] hook, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form a loop.
Round 1: Ch 2, work 7 hdc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch 2, to join.
Round 2: Ch 1 (counts as sc), sc in same st, [2 sc in each hdc] around, slip st in beginning ch – 16 sc. 
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Swirly Flower
Arrange Petals counterclockwise in a spiral flower, alternating colors. Sew together in center with A. 
Sew Flower to center of Right Earflap.
Sew 6 to 10 pink beads in center of Flower.
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® With Love®(7 oz/198 g; 370 yds/338 m)
Contrast A Pewter (1401) 1 ball
Contrast B Iced Aqua (1502) 1 ball
Contrast C Aran (1303) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) and U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: S (M-L): Approx 18 (20, 22)" [45.5 (51, 56) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 12 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• Hat is made in joined rounds with RS facing at all times.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
HAT
With larger hook and A, ch 4. Join with sl st to make a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, ch 12, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, ch 12, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc and 8 ch-12 loops.
Note: Hold ch-12 loops in front of rounds and do not work into loops until instructed.
4th rnd: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 4 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 4 sts, ch 12, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts, ch 12, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc and 8 ch-12 loops.
8th to 10th rnds: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc.
Size Small only:
11th rnd: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sts, ch 12, sc in next st, [sc in next 6 sts, ch 12, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc and 8 ch-12 loops.
12th rnd: Repeat 8th rnd—56 sc.
Size Medium only:
11th rnd: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 5 sts, ch 12, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts, ch 12, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—64 sc and 8 ch-12 loops.
12th rnd: Repeat 8th rnd—64 sc.
Size Large only:
11th rnd: Work same as 11th rnd of size Medium.
12th rnd: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 7 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc.
All sizes:
13th and 14th rnds: Repeat 8th rnd.
15th rnd: Ch 1, sc in first 6 (7, 8) sts, ch 12, sc in next st, [sc in next 6 (7, 8) sts, ch 12, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—56 (64, 72) sc and 8 ch-12 loops.
16th to 18th rnds: Repeat 8th rnd.
19th to 34th rnds: Repeat 15th to 18th rnds four times.
Fasten off.
Beginning at top of hat, draw 2nd ch-12 loop through first ch-12 loop, draw 3rd ch-12 loop through 2nd ch-12 loop; repeat in this manner down side of hat until all 8 ch-12 loops are worked (cable made), then repeat for each remaining set of 8 ch-12 loops around—8 cables.
35th rnd: With right side facing, join B with sc in first sc, sc in next 5 (6, 7) sts, inserting hook in first ch-12 loop, sc in next st, [sc in next 6 (7, 8) sts, inserting hook in next ch-12 loop, sc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc—56 (64, 72) sc.
36th and 37th rnds: With smaller hook, repeat 8th rnd; change to C at end of 37th rnd.
38th and 39th rnds: Repeat 8th rnd. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pompom: Wind B around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hood. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Bernat® Fabwoolous™ (6 oz/170 g; 306 yds/280 m)
Contrast A Navy (25015) 2 balls
Contrast B Lime (25003) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Hat: One size to fit Adult. Scarf: Approx 9" x 90" [23 x 228.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
HAT
Beg at crown, with A, ch 3.
1st rnd:  10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc.
6th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
7th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
9th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Break A. Join with B.
10th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 3. Skip next sc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) all in next sc. *Skip next 2 sc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Skip next sc. 1 dc in last sc. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 3. *(1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) all in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join.
Rep 12th rnd until work from marked rnd measures approx 4½" [11.5 cm].
Next rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Break B. Join with A. 70 sc.
Ribbing: 1st rnd:  With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. *1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Rep from * around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until Ribbing measures 2½" [6.5 cm].
Fasten off.
SCARF
Stripe Pat
With A, work 12 rows.
With B, work 12 rows.
These 24 rows form Stripe Pat.
With A, ch 33. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 31 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next hdc. Skip next hdc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) all in next hdc. *Skip next 2 hdc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) all in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Skip next hdc. 1 dc in each of last 2 hdc. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) all in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
First 3 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Cont in Stripe Pat, rep last row until work from beg measures approx 89½" [227.5 cm], ending with an 11th row of A stripe.
Next row:  With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. 31 hdc. 
Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut lengths of A 14" [35.5 cm] long. Taking 4 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe evenly spaced across each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Patons® Canadiana (3.5 oz/100 g; 205 yds/187 m) Deep Orchid (10332) 1 ball
Bernat® Faux Fur Pompom™ Aubergine (01323)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and insert hook from back to front around post of next stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and insert hook from front to back around post of next stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: One size to fit average woman.
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Ribbing: Ch 13.
1st row: (RS). Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch across. Turn. 12 sts.
2nd row: Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each of next 12 sl st. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Do not fasten off.
Join back seam: Working in back loops only, sl st last row and rem loops of foundation ch tog. Do not fasten off. Turn work and proceed as follows:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Beg working in rnds: 1st rnd: Ch 3. Work 70 dc evenly around. Join with sl st to first dc. 70 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around next dc. 1 dcbp around each of next 9 dc) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 8 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
4rd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 7 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
5th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
6th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around first st. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
11th rnd: As 6th rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around next dc. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 8 dc) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 63 sts.
13th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 56 sts.
14th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 49 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 42 sts.
16th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 7 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 35 sts.
17th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around first st. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Skip next st. Join with sl st to first dcbp. 28 sts.
18th rnd: Ch 3. Skip first st. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. Join with sl st to first dcbp. 21 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.
Sew Pompom to top of Hat.

pattern_name: Bernat Softee Baby Warrior Baby Helmets
materials: Bernat Softee Baby (140 g/5 oz; 361 m/395 yds)
Main Color (MC) Aqua (30201) 1 ball
Contrast A Antique White (30008) 1 ball
Crochet hooks sizes 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) and 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) or size needed to obtain gauge.
Horned Version: Stuffing.
abbreviations: MB (Make Bobble) = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in next st. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook – Bobble made.
measurements: To fit Preemie 1/3 lbs (Preemie 4/6 lbs - Newborn - 3/6 mos - 12 mos)
gauge: 18.5 sc and 24 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for largest size, the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black it applies for both sizes.

Helmet

Note: Helmet is worked back and forth in rnds. At end of each rnd, join with sl st to first st. Turn before beg next rnd.
With larger hook and MC, ch 36 (42-48-60-72). Join in rnd with sl st to first ch, taking care do not twist ch.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 18 (21-24-30-36) sc. MB in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
8th to 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
11th rnd: As 7th rnd. Turn.
Repeat last 4 rnds 2 (2-3-3-4) times more.
Shape top:
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 (5-6-8-10) sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2 tog made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 30 (36-42-54-66) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 (4-5-7-9) sc. Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 24 (30-36-48-60) sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 (3-4-6-8) sc. Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 18 (24-30-42-54) sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 (12-15-21-27) sc. MB in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 1 (2-3-5-7) sc. Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 12 (18-24-36-48) sc.
Sizes Preemie 4/6 lbs, Newborn, 3/6 mos and 12 mos only:
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 1 (2-4-6) sc. Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 12 (18-30-42) sc.
Sizes Newborn, 3/6 mos and 12 mos only:
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 1 (3-5) sc. Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 12 (24-36) sc.
Sizes 3/6 mos and 12 mos only:
Next rnd: Ch 1.  1 sc in each of next 12 (18) sc. MB in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 (4) sc. Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 18 (30) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 1 (3) sc. Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 12 (24) sc.
Size 12 mos only:
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 18 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. MB in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 12 sc.
All sizes:
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2 tog) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Thread tail through rem 6 sts and fasten securely.

Horns (make 2).
With smaller hook and MC, ch 14 (14-16-16-18). Join in rnd with sl st to first ch, taking care do not twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 0 (0-1-1-2) time(s) more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 1 (1-2-2-3) sc. Sc2 tog. Rep from * once more. Join A with sl st to first sc. 10 (10-12-12-14) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until A section measures approx 2 (2-2½ -2½ -3) ins [5 (5-6-6-7.5) cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 (3-4-4-5) sc. Sc2 tog. Rep from * once more. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 (8-10-10-12) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Thread yarn through rem sts. Pull tightly. Stuff horns. Thread yarn down side of Horn. Pull slightly to create bend. Secure yarn.

Wings (make 2).
With smaller hook and A, ch 13 (13-15-17-19).
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 12 (12-14-16-18) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2 tog. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 (1-1-2-2) time(s) more.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sctog. Turn.
Rep last row 3 (3-3-4-5) times more. 4 (4-6-6-6) sc.
Fasten off.
Right Wing edging: With RS facing, join A to rem loop of last ch of foundation ch.
** 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 row of sc evenly around entire edge of Wing. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next row: *Ch 3. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * across bottom 12 (12-14-16-18) sc. Fasten off. **

Left Wing edging: With WS facing, join A to rem loop of first ch of foundation ch.
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Wing edging.

Finishing
Sew Horns or Wings to sides of Helmet as shown in picture.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool DK Superwash™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 125 yds/114 m) Claret (12532) or Mallard Teal (12203) or Gold (12609) 2 balls
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 19 sts and 22 rnds = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Beg at top of crown, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
4th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch1.1sc)innextch-1sp.Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sts.
5th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sts.
7th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sts.
8th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sts.
10th rnd: As 8th rnd.
11th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 96 sts.
12th rnd: As 8th rnd.
13th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 15 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 102 sts.
14th rnd: As 8th rnd.
Rep last rnd for pat until work from beg measures 7" [18 cm].
