Next rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. *Ch 1. Skip next 3sts:(sc,ch-1spandsc).1scin next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Rep from * to last 9 sts. Ch 1. Skip next 3 sts: (sc, ch-1 sp and sc). (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 86 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Ribbing
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). Dcfp around first sc. *Dcbp around next sc. Dcfp around next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Dcbp around next sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). Dcfp around first dcfp. *Dcbp around next dcbp. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last st. Dcbp around last dcbp. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
Rep last rnd until Ribbing measures approx 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Heart & Sole™ with Aloe”: 1 Ball 3955 Mellow Stripe.
Crochet Hook: 3.5mm [US E-4].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: V-st: (dc, ch 1, dc) all in same st.
Fan: (5 dc) all in same st.
SmFan: (3 dc) all in same st.
Reverse sc: Insert hook in next st to the right and pull up a loop, yo and pull through both loops.
Fphdc: Yo, insert hook from front to back around post of next st, yo and pull up a loop, yo and pull through all 3 loops.
Bphdc: Yo, insert hook from back to front to back around post of next st, yo and pull up a loop, yo and pull through all 3 loops.
measurements: Hat circumference is 18”.
gauge: Rounds 1-7 = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3, 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; join with a slip st to first hdc – 8 sts.
Round 2: Ch 2, 2 hdc in each st around; join – 16 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 24 sts.
Round 4: Ch 4, dc in same st (counts as 1st V-st), * skip next st, SmFan in next st, skip next st, ** V-st in next st; repeat from * around, ending at **; join to 3rd ch of ch-4.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in same st, * 2 hdc in next ch-1 space, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, ** hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around, ending at **; hdc in last st; join – 48 sts.
Round 6: Ch 2, * hdc in next 5 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 56 sts.
Round 7: Ch 4, dc in same st (counts as 1st V-st), * skip next st, SmFan in next st, skip next st, ** V-st in next st; repeat from * around, ending at **; join; TURN.
Round 8: Slip st in 1st st, (slip st, ch 4, dc) all in next st, * SmFan in next ch-1 space, ** V-st in 2nd dc of next SmFan; repeat from * around, ending at **; join; turn.
Round 9: Slip st in 1st st, (slip st, ch 4, dc) all in next st, * Fan in next ch-1 space, ** V-st in 2nd dc of next SmFan; repeat from * around, ending at **; join; turn.
Rounds 10-20: Slip st in 1st 2 sts, (slip st, ch 4, dc) all in next st, * Fan in next ch-1 space, ** V-st in 3rd dc of next Fan; repeat from * around, ending at **; join; turn.
Round 21: Repeat Round 10; DO NOT TURN at end of round.
Begin Band-Round 22: Ch 1, hdc in same st, * 2 hdc in next ch-1 space, hdc in next st, skip next st, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st, skip next st, ** hdc in next st; repeat from * around, ending at **; join – 112 sts.
Rounds 23-27: Ch 2, fphdc around 1st st, * bphdc around next st, ** fphdc around next st; repeat from * around, ending at **; join.
Lace Edging-Round 28: Ch 4, dc in same st, * skip next 2 sts, Fan in next st, ** skip next 2 sts, V-st in next st; repeat from * around, ending at **; skip last st; join.
Round 29: Ch 1, work 5 Reverse sc in each Fan and 2 Reverse sc in each V-st around; join.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Mega Bulky™(10.5 oz/300 g; 64 yds/58 m)
Claret (88532)    1 ball
Size U.S. Q (16 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit average woman.
gauge: 5½ sts and 5 rnds = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Beg at top of Hat, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 
Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. 1 sc in 
next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 24 sts.
4th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc in next 
sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 
Skip next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * once more. Ch 1. Skip last sc. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.
5th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 
1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 8½" [21.5 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Main Color (MC) Country Blue (9710) 1 ball
Contrast A Dark Country Blue (9711) 1 ball
Contrast B Off White (9702) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With MC, ch 37 loosely. 
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 
1 hdc in each ch to last 10 ch. 1 sc in each of last 10 ch. Turn. 35 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Work in horizontal bar only at front of work, created by hdc (see diagram), 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, at front of work, created by hdc, 1 hdc in each st to last 9 sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
4th row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Work in horizontal bar only at front of work, created by hdc, 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to last 7 sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
6th row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
7th row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to last 5 sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
8th row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
9th row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to last 3 sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
10th row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in next sc. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
11th row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 5 times. Turn. 35 sts. 
Rep 2nd to 11th rows 6 times more. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
FINISHING
Sew back seam. Weave MC through last sl st of each row along top edge. Gather tightly and fasten securely.
Pompom: (Make 2). Wind 1 strand each of A and B around 2 fingers 40 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat. 
Cord: With B, make chain 35" [89 cm] long. 
1st row: Sl st in back bump of 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. 
Thread cord through sts as shown in picture 2" [5 cm] above bottom edge, beg and ending at one side of Hat. Try Hat on. Tie ends in a bow, so Hat fits snugly. Sew pompom to each end of cord.

materials: Bernat® Satin™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 200 yds/182 m) Grey Mist Heather (04045) 1 ball
Small amounts of Soft Fern (04221), Fern (04222), Maitai (04732), Sea Shell (04420), Flamingo (04423) and Sultana (04307) for embroidery.
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: One size to fit average woman's head.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
Cont as established, inc 6 sts on every rnd to 60 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 66 sts.
Cont in same manner, inc 6 sts on every following alt rnd to 72 sts. Place marker at end of last rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 5½” [14 cm].
Next rnd: Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off
FINISHING
Measure approx ½" [1 cm] up from Hat edge to mark beg of Chart as shown in picture. Work cross stitch embroidery following Chart (see page 2).

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”: 1 Ball 4422 Tangerine.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 5mm [US H-8].
Stitch markers, yarn needle, one 15/8” diameter button by JHB #80139 Zebra Flower.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 18 (20, 22)”
gauge: 12 hdc = 4”; 10 rows = 4” using smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With the smaller hook, ch 54 (60, 66), slip st in first ch to form ring. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in each ch around, slip st in top of beginning ch to join.
Rounds 2-4: Ch 2, hdc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 5-8: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 9: Ch 2, hdc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 10: Ch 2, hdc in next 4 sts, skip next st, [hdc in next 5 sts, skip next st] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 45 (50, 55) sts.
Rounds 11-13: Ch 3, dc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 14: Ch 2, hdc in next 3 sts, skip next st, [hdc in next 4 sts, skip next st] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 36 (40, 44) sts.
Round 15: Ch 2, hdc in next 2 sts, skip next st, [hdc in next 3 sts, skip next st] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 27 (30, 33) sts.
Round 16: Ch 2, hdc in next st, skip next st, [hdc in next 2 sts, skip next st] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 18 (20, 22) sts.
Round 17: Ch 2, skip next st, [hdc in next hdc, skip next hdc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 9 (10, 11) sts.
Round 18: Sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, [sc in next 2 sts, skip next st] around, sc in next 0 (1, 2) sts, slip st in first st to join – 6 (7, 8) sts.
Round 19: Working in a spiral manner, [sc in next sc, skip next sc] around until no sts remain.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Asymmetric Brim
Row 1: With right side facing and larger hook, count 11 sts to left of first st on Round 1, sc in next 29 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, skip 2 sc, sc in next sc and each sc across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across to last st, skip last st.
Rows 4-17: Repeat Rows 2-3.
Row 18: Repeat Row 2.
Do not fasten off.
Hat Edging
With wrong side facing, work sc evenly spaced along edge of Brim, hdc in each st along opposite edge of foundation ch to opposite edge of Brim, sc evenly spaced along opposite edge of Brim, sc in each st across Row 18, ch 10 for buttonhole, slip st in first st to join.
Fasten off. 
It won’t take long to make this flapper-inspired hat…in fact, you’ll have time to make it in many colors.

materials: Bernat® Spark™ (8 oz/225 g; 191 yds/175 m) Quarry (12004) 2 balls or 221 yds/202 m
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from left to right. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Ribbing: Ch 7.
1st row: (RS). Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch across. Turn. 6 sts.
2nd row: Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each of next 6 sl sts. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 21" [53.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Join back seam: Working in back loops only, sl st last row and rem loops of foundation ch tog. Do not fasten off. Turn work and proceed as follows:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd does not count as st. (See diagram on page 2).

1st rnd: Ch 3. Work 40 dc evenly around. Join with sl st to first dc. 40 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 dc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around next st) 8 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
4rd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts) 8 times. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
5th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts) 8 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
6th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st) 8 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
Rep last 5 rnds until work from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], ending on 6th rnd.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 8 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 32 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Skip next st) 8 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 24 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next st) 8 times. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 16 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

Pompom
Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

pattern_name: Buffalo Plaid Crochet Hat for Him
materials: Red Heart® Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Contrast A Luggage (0959) 1 ball
Contrast B Red Hot (0419) 1 ball
Contrast C Summer Night (0212) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
With A, ch 72. Join with sl st to first ch making sure not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each ch around. Join. 72 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdcfp around next st. 1 hdcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join. Rep 2nd rnd 5 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Beg working Chart (see page 2), noting that each square is equal to 1 sc and reading rnds from right to left. Carry color not being used along top of work. Change colors by drawing contrast color through last 2 loops on hook.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Rep last rnd and cont working Chart until rows 1-6 are worked 4 times.
Fasten off leaving long tail. Finishing: Using running st, gather top edge of Hat with long tail of yarn. Pull tight and secure.
Pompom: With A, B and C held tog wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 60 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: 1 ball each 7625 Minty A
7305 Biscuit B
Susan Bates® crochet hook: 6.5mm [US K-10½]
Yarn needle and extra-large 3” (7.5 cm) pompom maker (optional)
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: To Fit Head Circumference: 17-18 (18-19, 20-22)” [6.5 (7, 8) cm]. Finished Head Circumference: 17 (18½, 20)” [6.5 (7, 8) cm]
gauge: 11 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 8 rows = 4” [10 cm] in Double Crochet with smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Round 1: Using B and smaller hook, ch 2, 8 sc in the 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in the first sc of the round (slip sts are used to join every round and are not counted as a st) – 8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc here and throughout), dc in the first st, 2 dc in each st to the end; join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 16 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in the first st, *1 dc in the next st, 2 dc in the next st; repeat from * until 1 st remains, dc 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 24 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in the first st. *1 dc in each of the next 2 sts, 2 dc in the next st; repeat from * until 2 sts remain, dc to the end; join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 32 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in the first st, *1 dc in each of the next 3 sts, 2 dc in the next st; repeat from * until 3 sts remain, dc to the end; join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 40 dc.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in the first st, *1 dc in each of the next 4 sts, 2 dc in the next st; repeat from * until 4 sts remain, dc to the end; join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 dc.
Toddler size only: Skip Rounds 7 and 8. Resume work on Round 9.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in the first st, *1 dc in each of the next 5 sts, 2 dc in the next st; repeat from * until 5 sts remain, dc to the end; join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 56 dc.
Rounds 8-9: Ch 3, dc to the end; join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 (56, 56) dc.
Fasten off B. Join A in the top of the beginning ch.
Round 10: Ch 3, *2 dc, 1 tr into the base of the next st, dc; repeat from * until 3 sts remain, 2 dc, 1 tr in the base of the next st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 33 (39, 39) dc, 12 (14, 14) tr.
Round 11: Ch 3, dc to the end; join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 (56, 56) dc.
Row 12: Ch 3, dc until 1 st remains; turn, leaving last st unworked – 47 (55, 55) dc.
Toddler Size Only: Skip rows 13-14. Resume work on row 15.
Child Size Only: Skip row 13. Resume work on row 14.
Adult Size Only: Proceed with Row 13.
Rows 13-16: Ch 3, dc to the end; turn – 47 (55, 55) dc.
Round 17: Ch 5, skip the first 3 sts of the row, dc in the next st; dc until 3 sts remain, ch 5, skip 2 sts, sc in the last st.
Sizes Toddler and Adult Only:
Row 18 (right side): Turn, ch 1, 8 sc in the ch-5 space, sc to the next ch-5 space, 8 sc in the next ch-5 space, turn work; working in ends of rows, 2 sc in each dc to the base of the split, 2 sc in the base of the split; 2 sc in each dc in ends of rows; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Size Child Only:
Row 18 (wrong side): Do not turn. Ch 1; working in ends of rows, 2 sc in each dc to the base of the split, 2 sc in the base of the split, 2 sc in each dc in ends of rows, 8 sc in the ch-5 space, sc to the next ch-5 space, 8 sc in the next ch-5 space; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Ties (make 2)
Measure and cut two lengths of yarn at 100 (110, 120)” [250 (275, 300) cm] each. Holding the two yarn strands together, fold in half and put through one of the 8-sc loops at the bottom edge of the work. With the yarn still folded over, use the larger hook to work a ch to the end of the yarn. When about 4” (10 cm) remain, fasten off. If you are making tassels, leave yarn tails and do not weave them in. If you are not making tassels, weave in the ends of the ties.
Tassels (make 2; optional)
Make and attach tassels to the end of the ties if desired.
Pompom (optional)
Make and attach one extra-large pompom to the crown of the hat if desired. Secure it tightly and weave in any ends.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Worsted™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 210 yds/192 m)
Contrast A Cherry (77710) 1 ball
Contrast B Heath Heather (77215) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head.
gauge: 18 sts and 17 rows = 4” [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
Stripe Pat
With A, work 4 rnds.
With B, work 4 rnds.
These 8 rnds form Stripe Pat.
With B, ch 96. Join with sl st to first ch to 
form ring, being careful not to twist ch. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first ch. Ch 1. * Skip 
next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 1. Rep from * 
to last ch. Skip last ch. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 96 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next 
ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to 
last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl 
st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. * Ch 1. Skip 
next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from *  
around. Ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to 
first sc.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds for pat.
With B, work a further 6 rnds in pat. 
Join A at end of last rnd. Do not break B.
Keeping cont of pat, work 20 rnds in Stripe 
Pat. Break B.
With A only, proceed as follows:
Next rnd: As 2nd rnd.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 
*(Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 10 times. Ch 
1. **Skip next (sc. Ch-1 sp. sc). 1 sc in next
ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from
* to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sts.
2nd and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch
1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around.
Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(Ch 1. Skip
next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 9 times. Ch
1. **Skip next (sc. Ch-1 sp. sc). 1 sc in next
ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from
* to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(Ch 1. Skip
next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 8 times. Ch 1.** 
Skip next (sc, ch-1 sp, sc). 1 sc in next ch-1
sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to
** once. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(Ch 1. Skip
next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 7 times. Ch 1.** 
Skip next (sc, ch-1 sp, sc). 1 sc in next ch-1
sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to
** once. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(Ch 1. Skip
next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1.** 
Skip next (sc, ch-1 sp, sc). 1 sc in next ch-1
sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to
** once. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(Ch 1. Skip 
next sc.1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1.** 
Skip next (sc, ch-1 sp, sc). 1 sc in next ch-1 
sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to 
** once. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(Ch 1. Skip 
next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1.** 
Skip next (sc, ch-1 sp, sc). 1 sc in next ch-1 
sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to 
** once. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(Ch 1. Skip 
next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1.** 
Skip next (sc, ch-1 sp, sc). 1 sc in next ch-1 
sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to 
** once. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(Ch 1. Skip 
next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1.** 
Skip next (sc, ch-1 sp, sc). 1 sc in next ch-1 
sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to 
** once. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
19th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. 1 sc in 
next ch-1 sp. Ch 1.** Skip next (sc, ch-1 sp, 
sc). 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice 
more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 16 sts. Fasten off leaving a long 
end. Thread end through rem sts and draw 
up tightly. Fasten securely.

materials: 1 (2) ball(s) 9937 Deep Water
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 10mm [US N-15]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22)" [51 (56) cm] in circumference
gauge: Rounds 1 and 2 = 4" (10 cm) in diameter; 7 dc = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3, 9 dc in ring, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 10 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining slip st, 2 dc in each dc around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 20 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining slip st, dc in next dc, * 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 30 dc.
For smaller size only:
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining slip st, dc in each of next 4 dc, * 2 dc in next dc, dc in each of next 4 dc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 36 dc.
For larger size only:
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st, dc in each of next 2 dc, * 2 dc in next dc, dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 40 dc.
For both sizes:
Rounds 5-10: Ch 3, skip first st, dc in next dc and in each dc around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch 3.
Round 11: Ch 2 (counts as first bpdc), fpdc around next dc, * bpdc around next dc, fpdc around next dc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top ch of beginning ch-2 – 36 (40) sts.
Round 12: Ch 2 (counts as first bpdc), fpdc around next fpdc, * bpdc around next bpdc, fpdc around next fpdc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver™”: 1 skein 971 Camouflage
Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm (US I-9)
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Circumference 21”. To fit 22-23” head
gauge: 11 double crochet = 4”; 7 rows = 4” in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Chain 4, join with slip stitch to form ring.
Round 1: Chain 3 (counts as double crochet throughout), work, 11 double crochet into ring, slip stitch to first double crochet to join – 12 double crochet.
Round 2: Chain 3, double crochet in same st, 2 double crochet in each double crochet around, slip stitch to first double crochet to join – 24 double crochet.
Round 3: Chain 3, 2 double crochet in next double crochet, *double crochet in next double crochet, 2 double crochet in next double crochet; repeat from *, slip stitch to first double crochet to join – 36 double crochet.
Round 4: Chain 3, double crochet in next dc, 2 double crochet in next double crochet, *double crochet in next 2 double crochet, 2 double crochet in next double crochet; repeat from *, slip stitch to first double crochet to join – 48 double crochet.
Round 5: Chain 3, double crochet in next 4 double crochet, 2 double crochet in next double crochet, *double crochet in next 5 double crochet, 2 double crochet in next double crochet; repeat from *, slip stitch to first double crochet to join – 56 double crochet.
Rnds 6-14: Chain 3, double crochet in each double crochet around, slip stitch to first double crochet to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
RED HEART ® “Super Saver®”, Art. E300 available in solid color – 7oz (198g), 364yd (333m) or multi or fleck color – 5oz (141g), 244yd (223m) skeins.

materials: 1 ball 4410 Dolphin A
1 ball 4001 Frosting B
1 ball 4258 Peachie C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.5 mm [US K-10½], 5.5 mm [US I-9]
Stitch markers, large eye needle, pompom maker
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C
() = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Child's size Small (fits 17"-19" head); changes for Teen-Adult size Large (fits 19"-20" head) are in parentheses.
gauge: 12 dc = 4” [10 cm]; 6 rows dc = 4” [10 cm] using larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Using larger hook and A, ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to form ring. Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc now and throughout), 11 dc in ring, join in top of ch-3 (see Notes); turn—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same first st, 2 dc in each dc around, join; turn—24 dc. 
Round 3: Ch 1 (does not count as a st now and throughout), (slip st, dc) in each dc around (see Notes), join in first slip st; turn—48 sts.
Rounds 4-5: Ch 1, *slip st in next dc, dc in next slip st; repeat from * around, join; turn—48 sts.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in each st around, join; turn—48 dc.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in next 6 (2) dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 7 (3) dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, join; turn—54 (60) dc.
Round 8: Ch 1, *slip st in next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, join; turn—54 (60) sts. 
Rounds 9-10: Ch 1, *slip st in next dc, dc in next slip st: repeat from * around, join; turn—54 (60) sts. 
Rounds 11-12: Ch 3, dc in each st around, join; turn—54 (60) dc.
Round 13: Ch 1, *slip st in next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, join; turn—54 (60) sts.
Round 14: Ch 1, *slip st in next dc, dc in next slip st; repeat from * around, join; turn—54 (60) sts.
Round 15: Ch 1, *slip st in next dc, dc in next slip st; repeat from * around, join; do not turn—54 (60) sts.
Round 16 (Large size only): Ch 3, dc in each st around, join—60 dc.
Round 16 (17): Ch 1, *sc in next 7 (8) sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around; join in first sc—48 (54) sts. Fasten off A.
Round 17 (18): Join B in first st, ch 1, sc in each st around; join—48 (54) sc. 
Round 18 (19): Skip first sc (join was worked in this st), slip st in next 5 sc, ch 1 (does not count as a st), sc in next sc; place stitch marker in sc just made; sc in next 34 (40) sc, slip st in last 7 sc; join—48 (54) sts. Fasten off B.
With smaller hook and Right Side facing, join C in marked sc of previous round. From here forward work in rows.
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 3, dc in same first sc, fpdc around post of next sc two rounds below, *dc in next sc, fpdc around post of next sc two rounds below; repeat from * 15 (18) times, 2 dc in last sc (skip remaining slip sts); turn—37 (43) sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in same first dc, *dc, bpdc; repeat from * 16 (19) times, dc in next dc, 2 dc in top of ch-3; turn—39 (45) sts.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in same first dc, fpdc,*dc, fpdc; repeat from * 17 (20) times, 2 dc in top of ch-3—41 (47) sts. To make first Tie: ch 25 (27); turn, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 23 (25) chs—24 (26) slip sts.
Row 4 (Small size only): Continuing to work across top of Row 3, hdc in first 2 dc, bphdc, *hdc, bphdc; repeat from * 17 times, hdc in last 2 sts—41 sts. To make second Tie: ch 25; turn, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 23 chs—24 slip sts. Continuing to work across top of Row 4, slip st in each st across—41 slip sts. Fasten off.
Row 4 (Large size only): Continuing to work across top of Row 3, dc in first 2 dc, bpdc, *dc, bpdc: repeat from * 20 times, dc in last 2 sts—47 sts. To make second Tie: ch 27; turn, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 25 chs—26 slip sts. Continuing to work across top of Row 4, slip st each st across—47 slip sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING Referring to photo for placement, make a large pompom and sew to crown of Hat; make 2 small pompoms and sew one to each Tie end. Weave in all ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m)
Version 1: Contrast A Refresh (69001) 1 ball
Contrast B Cotton (69001) 1 ball
Version 2: Contrast A Feather Gray (69002) 1 ball
Contrast B Cotton (69001) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Bean Stitch = Insert hook in next st. Yoh and pull up a loop (2 loops on hook). (Yoh in the same stitch pull up a loop) twice. (6 loops on hook.) Yoh and pull through 5 loops on hook. Yoh and pull a loop through remaining loops.
measurements: One size to fit average Adult.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes
• Double strand by using the interior and exterior strand of the same ball at the same time for each colour used.
• Ch 3 counts as dc at beg of rnd.
Rnd 1: (RS) 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
Rnd 2: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 10 sc.
Rnd 3: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
Rnd 4: Ch 3. 1 dc in next st, 1 sc around last post. *1 dc in next 2 sts. 1 sc around last post. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 30 sts.
Rnd 5: Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. Ch 2. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. *1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sc and 10 ch-2 sps.
Rnd 6: Sl st to next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 4 dc in same ch-2 sp. *5 dc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sc to top of ch 3. 50 sts.
Rnd 7: Ch 1. *1 sc around sp between next two 5-dc groups. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip to next sp between two 5-dc groups. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sc and 20 ch-2 sps.
Rnd 8: Sl st to next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same ch-2 sp. *3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 sts.
Rnd 9: Ch 1. *1 sc around sp between next two 3-dc groups. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 1. Skip to next sp between two 3 dc groups. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc and 40 ch-1 sps.
Note: In next rnd, treat each ch-1 sp and sc as individual sts as you skip sts.
Rnd 10: Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Skip next st. *1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Skip next st. Rep from * around. Join with 70 sts.
Rnd 11: Ch 3. 1 dc in same st as sl st. Skip next st. *2 dc in next st. Skip next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of beg ch 3. 70 sts.
Rnd 12: Ch 1. Working into sp between next two 2-dc groups, Bean St. Ch 1.*Bean st in next sp between 2-dc groups. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join to first bean with sl st. 35 bean sts, 35 ch 1 sps.
Rnd 13: Sl st to next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp. *2 dc in each ch 1 sp around. Join to top of beg ch 3. 70 dc.
Rnd 14 to 17: Rep 12th and 13th rnds twice more.
Rnd 18: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Break A. 70 sc.
Rnd 19: Working in front loops only, join B (held double) with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Rnd 20: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 3 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 90 sc.
Rnd 21: As 18th rnd. 90 sc.
Rnd 22: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 3 sc in the next st. *1 sc in each of next 8 sts. 3 sts in next st. Rep from * around. 1 sc in each of last 5 sts. Join. 110 sc.
Rnd 23 and 24: As 18th rnd. 110 sc. Turn at the end of 24th rnd.
Brim Thickness Section
Rnd 25: (WS) Working in front loops only, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 110 sc.
Rnd 26 and 27: (WS) Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Break B. 110 sc.
Note: If you have an insufficient quantity left in A to complete final rnd, use 1 strand B held with 1 strand A.
Rnd 28: Join A (held double) with sl st to first st. Roll brim back to catch the unworked back loop from the 25th rnd closest to the st. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around, catching corresponding back loop at the same time as you work into the st. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m)
Contrast A Navy (07711) 1 ball
Contrast B Grass (53223) 1 ball
Contrast C Burgundy (07636) 1 ball
Contrast D Clay (53041) 1 ball
Contrast E Pumpkin (53630) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from left to right. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left.  (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: One size to fit average woman.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Note: Do not break yarn. Carry colors not in use loosely up WS of work.
With A and larger hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 1) in ring. (2 dc. ch 1) 5 times. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: With B, sl st in next dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join C with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 ch-1 sps.
3rd rnd: With C, sl st in next dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join D with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: With D, sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join E with sl st to top of ch 3. 18 ch-1 sps.
5th rnd: With E, sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join A with sl st to top of ch 3.
6th rnd: With A, sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) five times.** (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * once, then from * to ** once more. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 21 ch-1 sps.
7th rnd: With B, as 5th rnd, join C at end of rnd. 
8th rnd: With C, as 5th rnd, join D at end of rnd.
Cont as established, working 1 rnd each in D, E, A, B, C, D, E until Hat from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], ending with 1 rnd of E.
Join A with sl st to top of ch 3.
Ribbing
Change to smaller hook and proceed as follows:
1st rnd: With A, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around next sc. Dcbp around next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
Rep last rnd until ribbing measures 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic Crochet Thread size 10™: 2 balls of 275 Coral
Susan Bates® Steel Crochet Hook: 2.55mm [US 0]
Yarn needle
measurements: Hat Measures 18” (45.5 cm) in circumference
gauge: 23 sts and 10 rows dc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With 2 strands of thread held together as one throughout, ch 6; join with a slip st in first ch. 
Round 1: Ch 1, 16 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc—16 sc.  
Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), skip next sc, *dc in next sc, ch 3, skip next sc; repeat from *around, join with a slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-6—8 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, 5 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-3 space around, join with a slip st in first sc—8 shells.
Round 4: Ch 1, BPsc in first sc, *ch 8, skip next shell, skip next sc**, BPsc of next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—8 ch-8 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, 6 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-8 space around, join with a slip st in first sc—8 shells.
Round 6: Repeat Round 4.
Round 7: Slip st in each of next 3 ch, ch 1, (sc, ch 4, sc, ch 4) in each ch-8 loop around; join with a slip st in first sc—16 ch-4 spaces.
Round 8: Slip st in next ch-4 space, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 5 dc in same ch-4 space, *ch 2, 2 dc in next ch-4 space, ch 2**, 6 dc in next ch-4 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—16 ch-2 spaces.
Round 9: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, dc in each of next 4 dc, *ch 3, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc**, dcin each of next 5 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—16 ch-3 spaces.
Round 10: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, dc in each of next 3 dc, *ch 4, skip next ch-3 space, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, ch 4, skip next dc**, dc in each of next 4 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—16 ch-4 spaces.
Round 11: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, dc in each of next 2 dc, *ch 4, skip next ch-4 space, dc in each of next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, ch 4, skip next dc**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—16 ch-4 spaces.
Round 12: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, dc in next dc, *ch 5, skip next ch-4 space, dc in each of next 5 dc, ch 4, skip next dc**, dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—16 ch-5 spaces.
Round 13: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *5 dc in next ch-5 space, dc in each of next 5 dc, 5 dc in next ch-5 space**, dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—136 dc.
Rounds 14-30: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Round 31: Ch 3, dc in next dc (counts as dc2tog), *dc in each of next 2 dc, dc2tog over next 2 sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—102 sts.
Round 32: Ch 3 (counts as FPdc), dc in each of next 2 dc, *FPdc around the post of next dc2tog, dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Round 33: Ch 3 (counts as FPdc), dc in each of next 2 dc, *FPdc around the post of next FPdc, dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 288 m/315 yds)
Contrast A Ocean (39759) 1 ball
Contrast B Robin’s Egg (39780) 1 ball
Contrast C Pumpkin (39765) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit average woman.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook, yoh with new color through rem loops and proceed.
Ribbing: With A, ch 12.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram) in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing measures approx 21" [53.5 cm] long when slightly stretched, ending on a WS row. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew foundation row and last row tog to form ribbing.
Hat: With RS facing, join A with sl st to center back seam. Ch 1. Work 72 sc evenly around side edge of Ribbing. Join B with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Note: Chart section of Hat is worked in rnds, but turning work at end of each rnd to alternate RS and WS. Carry color when not in use across top of rnd and work sts around it.
Beg working Chart:
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 1st row of Chart, reading chart from right to left, noting 12 st rep will be worked 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Work 2nd row of Chart, reading chart from left to right, noting 12 st rep will be worked 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
First 2 rows of Chart are complete. Cont working in Chart pat, turning work at end of each rnd until 33 rows of Chart are complete. Break C.
With B only, proceed as follows:
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sts.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and pull up tightly. Fasten securely.
Pompom:
Wind C around 4 fingers 150 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in the middle and leave long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to a smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: 3-Light (4-Medium) Yarn: 1 Ounce for each cap
Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6] (5mm [US H-8])
Double Point Knitting Needles: 3.5 and 4mm [US 4 & 6] (4 and 5mm [US 6 & 8])
3 Stitch markers
yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hat circumference = 11¼ (11)”.
gauge: 17 sts = 4”; 10 rows = 3” (13 sts = 4”; 6 rows = 2½”) in pat. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauges.
instructions:
Rnd 1: Ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a sl st in first sc.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, 3 (2) dc in first sc, [4 (3) dc in next sc] 5 times; join with a sl st in top of ch-3 – 24 (18) sts.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join – 48 (36) sts.
Rnd 4: Ch 3, skip first sc, dc in each sc around; join in top of ch-3.
Rnd 5: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Rnds 6-17 (6-11): Rep Rnds 4 and 5 six (three) more times.
Rnd 18 (12): Rep Rnd 4.
Rnds 19 and 20 (13): Ch 2, dc around the post of the next st from the front, * dc around the post of the next st from the back, dc around the post of the next st from the front; rep from * around; join with a sl st to top of ch-2. Fasten off at end of last rnd. Weave in ends.

KNIT CAP
GAUGES: 22 sts = 4”; 30 rows = 4” (17 sts = 4”; 23 rows = 4”) in St st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauges.
With smaller needles, cast on 60 (48) sts – 20 (16) sts on each of 3 needles. Join, being careful that sts are not twisted.
Ribbing Rnd: * K2, P2; rep from * around. Rep Ribbing Rnd until 2½” from beg. Change to larger needles and work in St st (K every rnd) until 5” from beg.
Shape Top: Place a marker between the 10th and 11th (8th and 9th) sts on each needle.
Next Rnd: [K2tog, K to marker, K2tog, K to end of needle] 3 times – 18 (14) sts on each needle.
Next Rnd: [K2tog, K to marker, K2tog, K to end of needle] 3 times – 16 (12) sts on each needle.
Next Rnd: Knit.
Rep last 3 rnds 2 (1) more times, then rep the first 2 rnds again – 4 sts on each needle. Cut yarn leaving an 8” end. With yarn needle, weave end through remaining sts, draw up tightly and fasten securely. Fold ribbing in half to the right side.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1101 Eggshell A, 1252 Mango B, 1012 Black C, and 1546 Iris D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
2 ¼” (6.5mm) googly eyes
hot glue gun
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cap measures 18 (20)” [45.5 (51) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 10 dc = 3” (7.5 cm); 4 rows = 2½” (6.5 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CAP
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 11 dc into ring; change to B; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 2, 2 dc in each st around; change to C; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 2, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; change to B; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 2, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; change to A; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 2, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 3 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; change to B; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 2, dc in each st around; change to C; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Size Small only:
Round 7: Ch 2, dc in each st around; change to B; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 8: Ch 2, dc in each st around; change to A; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 9: Repeat Round 7.
Rounds 10 and 11: Repeat Rounds 6 and 7.
Rounds 12 and 13: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
Size Large only:
Round 7: Ch 2, dc in next 8 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 9 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; change to B; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—66 dc.
Rounds 8–11: Work same as Rounds 8–11 of size Small.
SPIDER
Head
With D, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, 11 dc into ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc. Fasten off. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Body
With D, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, 11 dc into ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 2, 2 dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Row 3: *Ch 6, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, slip st in st at base of ch-6 (leg made), slip st in next st; repeat from * 3 times, slip st in next 3 sts; repeat from * 3 times; leave remaining sts unworked. Fasten off. (If you would like your spider to have 8 legs, repeat from * 4 times on each side of Body.)
FINISHING
Hold cap with seam at back. Using photograph as a guide, arrange spider body and head on front of cap. With D, sew in place. You may prefer to bend the legs and tack the ends.
With glue gun, adhere googly eyes to head.
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Main Color (MC) Pumpkin (0254) 1 ball or 295 yds/268.5 m
Contrast A Café Latte (0360) 1 ball or 5.5 yds/5 m
Contrast B Tea Leaf (0624) 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.

Dcfp2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Hdcbl = Half double crochet through back loop only
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 15 sc and 17 rows = 4” [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. With larger hook and MC, ch 5. Join with sl st in first ch to make a ring. See diagram on page 4.

1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 2 dcbp around last st. Join with sl st to top of first st. 18 sts. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 24 sts. 
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 30 sts. 
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 36 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 42 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Rep from around. Join with sl st to first st. 48 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. 2 dcbp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from around. Join with sl st to first st. 54 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 60 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 66 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 72 sts.
12th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 78 sts.
13th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 8 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
14th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 7 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 84 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 9 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
16th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 8 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 90 sts.
17th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 10 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
18th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 9 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 96 sts.
19th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 11 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
20th rnd:  Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 10 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 102 sts.
21st rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 12 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
22nd rnd:  Ch 2. *2 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 11 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 108 sts.
23rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 13 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
24th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp2tog around next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 9 sts. Dcfp2tog around next 2 sts.  1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 96 sts.
25th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp2tog around next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 7 sts. Dcfp2tog around next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 84 sts.
26th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp2tog around next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. Dcfp2tog around next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 72 sts.
Brim: 28th rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdcbl in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
See diagram on page 5.
29th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 hdc.
30th rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join. 80 hdc.   
31st rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 90 hdc.
32nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
Fold Brim half way through to RS to form Peak. Sew in place.
Stem: With smaller hook and A, ch 2. 1st rnd: 9 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 3rd to 8th rnds:  Working in both loops, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Stuff lightly with length of A.
Leaves (make 2). With smaller hook and B, ch 10. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch.* 
[(1 sc. Ch 1) twice. 1 sc] in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, rep from * to * to last ch. 1 sc in last ch. Fasten off, leaving a long end.  Sew Leaves and Stem to top of Hat as shown in picture.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m; Heathers: 5 oz/141 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Contrast A Charcoal Heather (9508) 1 ball
Contrast B Watermelon (9604) 1 ball
Caron® Simply Soft® Tweeds™ (5 oz/141 g; 240 yds/219 m)
Contrast C Oﬀ White Tweeds (23001) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as a st.
With A, ch 70.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 68 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 6 times more.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Break A. Join B. Turn.
Work Chart (see page 2), noting each square of chart is equal to 1 sc and reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right. Do not carry color not in use across top of previous row.
1st row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 47 hdc. With C, 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 22 sc. With B, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 45 sc. With C, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Cont working chart in sc until 22nd row of chart is complete. Break B and C. Join A.
Shape crown: 1st row: With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 64 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 56 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 48 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 40 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 32 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 24 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 16 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. 8 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely. Sew center back seam.

materials: RED HEART® Heads Up™: 2 balls 872 Royale
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures about 22” (56 cm) circumference.
gauge: Rounds 1–5 = 4¼” (11 cm) diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in front loop of first sc—8 sc.
Note: Work first stitch of each round in same stitch as joining slip stitch unless otherwise instructed.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st first sc—24 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—32 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each st around.
Round 7: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Round 8: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next 2 sts, skip next 2 sts, shell in next st, *skip next 2 sts, dc in next 3 sts, skip next 2 sts, shell in next st; repeat from * around to last 2 sts, skip last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—6 shells and 18 dc.
Round 9: Ch 1 (elongate this first loop slightly here and throughout), Fpdc around beginning ch-3, FPdc around each of next 2 dc, shell in center dc of next shell, *Fpdc around each of next 3 dc, shell in center dc of next shell; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first Fpdc—6 shells and 18 Fpdc.
Rounds 10 and 11: Ch 1, Fpdc around each of first 3 Fpdc, shell in center dc of next shell, *Fpdc around each of next 3 Fpdc, shell in center dc of next shell; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first Fpdc.
Round 12: Ch 1, Fpdc around each of first 3 Fpdc, ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next dc, slip st in next 3 dc, sc in next dc, *ch 1, skip next dc, Fpdc around each of next 3 Fpdc, ch 1, skip next dc, sc in next dc, slip st in next 3 dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * around to last dc, ch 1, skip last dc; join with slip st in first Fpdc—18 slip sts, 12 sc, 12 ch-1 spaces, and 18 Fpdc.
Round 13: Ch 1, Fpdc around each of first 3 Fpdc, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next 5 sts, *ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, Fpdc around each of next 3 Fpdc, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around to last ch-1 space, ch 1, skip last ch-1 space; join with slip st in first Fpdc—30 sc, 12 ch-1 spaces, and 18 Fpdc.
Round 14: Ch 3, dc in each st and ch-1 space around—60 sts.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in each dc around; join with slip st in first sc, TURN.
Folded Brim
Round 16 (wrong side): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around; join with slip st in back loop of first sc.
Round 17: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around; join with slip st in both loops of first sc.
Round 18: Ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in first sc, *skip next sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next sc; repeat from * around to last sc, skip last sc; join with slip st in first sc—30 (sc, ch 2, sc) scallops.
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Fold brim up.
Special Stitches
Fpdc (Front post double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from front side of work to back and to front again around post of indicated stitch; yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice.
shell = Work 7 dc in indicated stitch.
Notes
1. To make a smaller hat, use a hook one size smaller. To make a larger hat, use a hook one size larger.
2. Hat is worked in joined rounds, beginning at top of hat. Join but do not turn rounds unless otherwise instructed. The join serves as back seam of hat.

materials: Red Heart® With Love™ (7 oz/198 g; 370 yds/338 m)
Sizes S M
Cameo (1711) 1 1 ball
Tan (1308) 1 1 ball
Iced Aqua (1502) 1 1 ball
Size U.S. K/101/2 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: To fit head circumference: 20 (22)" [51 (56) cm]
gauge: 10 hdc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: This project is worked top-down in the round. The right side of the work is always facing.

SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
Inc (Increase): Work 2 half-double crochet in stitch or sp indicated.
FPhdc (Front-post half double crochet): Work a half-double crochet around the front of the post of the stitch indicated.
BPhdc (Back-post half double crochet): Work a half-double crochet around the back of the post of the stitch indicated.

HAT
Crown
Make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn around your finger with the yarn tail to the left and under the working yarn. Insert hook through the circle from front to back. Yarn over using the working yarn and pull through loop; ch 1, release circle around finger gently.

1st rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), 9 hdc into adjustable ring, sl st to first hdc to join rnd; tighten yarn tail to close the ring – 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2, hdc in first sp (counts as inc), inc in each sp between each hdc around; sl st to first hdc to join rnd – 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2, hdc in sp between each st around; sl st to first hdc to join rnd.
4th rnd: Ch 2, hdc in first sp (counts as inc), hdc in next sp, *inc in next sp, hdc in next sp; repeat from * around; sl st to first hdc to join rnd – 30 hdc.
5th rnd: Rep 3rd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 2, hdc in first sp (counts as inc), hdc in next 2 sps, *inc in next sp, hdc in next 2 sps; repeat from * around; sl st to first hdc to join rnd–40 hdc.
7th rnd: Rep 3rd rnd.

Size S only: 
8th rnd: Ch 2, hdc in first sp (counts as inc), hdc in next 7 sps, *inc in next sp, hdc in next 7 sps; repeat from * around; sl st to first hdc to join rnd–45 hdc.
9th rnd: Ch 2, hdc in first sp (counts as inc), hdc in each sp around; sl st to first hdc to join rnd – 46 hdc.

Size M Only: 
8th rnd: Ch 2, hdc in first sp (counts as inc), hdc in next 3 sps, *inc in next sp, hdc in next 3 sps; repeat from * around; sl st to first hdc to join rnd–50 sts.
9th rnd: Rep 3rd rnd.

All Sizes: Rep 3rd rnd 8 (11) times more.

Brim
1st rnd: Ch 2 (counts as BPhdc), FPhdc in next st, *BPhdc in next st, FPhdc in next st; repeat from * around; sl st to first st to join rnd.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as BPhdc), FPhdc in next FPhdc, *BPhdc in next BPhdc, FPhdc in next FPhdc; repeat from * around; sl st to first st to join rnd.
3rd rnd: Rep 2nd rnd. Fasten off. Break yarn, leaving a 6" (15 cm) tail.

FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in yarn ends. Block as desired.

materials: Bernat® Softee®Baby™ (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m)
Baby Blue (35451) 1 1 balls
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4 Susan Bates® locking stitch markers.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: HBdc = Yoh and insert hook in next stitch. Yoh and draw through stitch and first loop on hook. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook – herringbone double crochet made.

HB2dctog = (Yoh and insert hook in next stitch. Yoh and draw through stitch and first loop on hook. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – herringbone double crochet 2 together made.
measurements: To fit head circumference 6/12 mos 17" [43 cm] 18/24 mos 18" [45.5 cm]
gauge: 18 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written 6/12 mos ( 18/24 mos ). When only one number is given, it applies to both sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.
Ch 62 ( 66).
1st row: (RS). 1 HBdc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). 1 HBdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 60 ( 64) sts.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 HBdc in each HBdc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 4½ ( 5)" [ 11.5 ( 12.5) cm], ending on a WS row. PM at each end of last row. Fasten off.

Shape Back Head
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to 21st ( 23rd) st of last row.
1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 HBdc in each of next 17 ( 19) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 18 ( 20) sts.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 HBdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. HBdc2tog. 1 HBdc in each st to last 3 sts. HBdc2tog. 1 HBdc in last HBdc. Turn.
Rep last row 5 times more. 6 ( 8) sts.
Next row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 HBdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row for Back Head Gusset until Back measures 4½ ( 5)" [ 11.5 ( 12.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. PM at each end of last row.

FINISHING
Align final marked row of Bonnet to final marked row of Back Head Gusset and Seam on both sides of Back Head Gusset.
Edging and ties: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to center back edge of Bonnet.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly along bottom edge to first corner. Ch 29 for Tie. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Work sc evenly across face opening to next corner. Ch 29 for Tie. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Work sc evenly along rem bottom edge. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around, working around both sides of Ties and having 3 sc at each end of tie. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool DK Superwash™ (1.75 oz /50 g; 125 yds /114 m)
Contrast A Dark Grey Heather (12042) 1 1 1 ball
Contrast B Gold (12609) 1 1 1 ball
Contrast C Medium Grey Heather (12044) 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit child 4 (6-8) years.
gauge: 17 sc and 20 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed. Carry color when not in use loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to avoid stranding.
With A, ch 64 (72-80). Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 (72-80) sc.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Join B at end of 5th rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 2. (With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. With C, 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc) 8 (9-10) times. Join B with sl st to first hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. (With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. With C, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 8 (9-10) times. Join C with sl st to first hdc.
8th and 9th rnds: Ch 2. (With C, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 8 (9-10) times. Join B at end of 9th rnd with sl st to first hdc.
10th rnd: As 7th rnd.
Rep 7th to 10th rnds 2 (3-4) time(s) more, then 7th to 9th rnds once.
Crown shaping: 1st rnd: Ch 2. *With B, 1 hdc in next hdc. Hd2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. With C, 1 hdc in next hdc. Hd2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 7 (8-9) times more. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 48 (54-60) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. (With B, 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. With C, 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts) 8 (9-10) times. Join C with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *With C, 1 hdc in next hdc. Hd2tog. With A, 1 hdc in next hdc. Hd2tog. Rep from * 7 (8-9) times more. Join C with sl st to first hdc. 32 (36-40) sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. (With C, 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts) 8 (9-10) times. Join B with sl st to first hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *With B, hd2tog. With C, hd2tog. Rep from * 7 (8-9) times more. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 16 (18-20) sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. (With B, 1 hdc next st. With C, 1 hdc in next st) 8 (9-10) times. Join A with sl st to first hdc.
7th rnd: With A, ch 2. (Hdc2tog) 8 (9-10) times. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
FINISHING: Working in rem loops of foundation ch, join MC with sl st to any loop. Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each loop around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Reverse Sc Diagram

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein in each of following colors: Boy’s version: 1601 Lettuce A, 1012 Black B, 1101 Eggshell C, 1252 Mango D. Girl’s version: 1502 Iced Aqua A, 1012 Black B, 1101 Eggshell C, 1704 Bubble Gum D.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6].
Yarn needle, small amount of stuffing for nose.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat circumference measures 19” (48 cm).
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet.
instructions:
Row 29: *Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across, ch 1, turn—18 sc.
Row 30: Sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn.
Row 31: *Sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across, ch 1, turn—12 sc.
Row 32: *Sc2tog; repeat from * across—6 sc.
Fasten off. Draw yarn through remaining sts and secure. Sew back seam.
Boy’s Eye (make 1)
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Fasten off. Embroider pupil with B and sew in place.
Boy’s Nose
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Rounds 3 – 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc2tog] 3 times, sc to end, join and fasten off. Stuff lightly and sew in place.
Boy’s Ear (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Rounds 4 and 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc2tog] 6 times, sc to end, fasten off. Do not stuff. Sew in place.
Boy’s Mouth
With B, ch 13.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, fasten off. Sew a smile under nose.
Directions are for size Child/Small Adult.
HAT (both versions)
Brim
With A, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, ch 1, turn.
Rows 2 – 64: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn. Do not fasten off.
Body
Row 1: Work 64 sc evenly across, ch 1, turn—64 sc.
Rows 2 – 14: Sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn.
Row 15: *Sc in next 14 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across, ch 1, turn—60 sc.
Row 16: Sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn.
Row 17: *Sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across, ch 1, turn—54 sc.
Row 18: Sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn.
Row 19: *Sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across, ch 1, turn—48 sc.
Row 20: Sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn.
Row 21: *Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across, ch 1, turn—42 sc.
Row 22: Sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn.
Row 23: *Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across, ch 1, turn—36 sc.
Row 24: Sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn.
Row 25: *Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across, ch 1, turn—30 sc.
Row 26: Sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn.
Row 27: *Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across, ch 1, turn—24 sc.
Row 28: Sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn. crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. 
Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

Boy’s Tooth (make 1)
With C, ch 3.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, ch 1, turn.
Rows 2 and 3: Sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn. Fasten off. Sew in place.
Eye Patch Band
With B, ch 55.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, fasten off.
Eye Patch
With B, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, 3 sc in last ch, working on opposite side of ch work 2 sc, ch 1, turn—7 sc.
Row 2: Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in next 2 sc, ch 1, turn—10 sc.
Row 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across—15 sc.
Row 4: Sc in each sc across, fasten off. Sew band in place and then sew patch in place. Embroider a long st with little sts crossing it under eye patch.
Feelers (make 2)
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—9 sc.
Rounds 3 – 6: Sc in each sc around. At end of Round 6, change to A.
Rounds 7 – 13: With A, sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Sew in place.
Braids for Boy’s Hat (make 2)
With A, [ch 35, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across] 3 times. Sew attached edge to side of hat securely. Braid the 3 strands together, keeping strands flat and smooth. Tie a piece of yarn tightly at bottom to secure.
Weave in ends.
Girl’s Nose
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around, fasten off. Stuff lightly and sew in place.
Girl’s Ear (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Rounds 4 – 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: *Sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc. Fasten off. Do not stuff. Sew in place.
Girl’s Eye (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join and fasten off. With B, embroider a French knot in center of each eye. Sew eyes in place. Embroider 3 straight sts above eye for lashes.
Girl’s Tooth (make 3)
With C, ch 3.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, ch 1, turn.
Row 2: Sc in each sc, fasten off.
Girl’s Mouth
With D, ch 16.
Row 1: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, fasten off. Sew in place. Sew teeth in place.
Girl’s Cheek (make 2)
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc. Fasten off and sew in place on each side of mouth.
Top Curls
With D, [ch 15, work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across] 3 times. Sew to top of head.
Side Curl (make 2)
With D, ch 55.
Row 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, fasten off. Sew in place securely. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m) First Blush (68009) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 10 hdc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting!
• All rounds (rnds) are joined with slip stitch (sl st) to first stitch (st).
• Chain (ch) 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Ribbing: Ch 11.
1st row:  1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 single crochet in back loop only (scbl) of each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 22" [56 cm], when slightly stretched.
Join last row and first row together (tog) with 1 row of sl st to form tube.
Begin working in rnds:
1st rnd:  [Right side (RS)]. Ch 1. Working along side edge of ribbing, work 54 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 half double crochet (hdc) in each st around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from lower edge measures 7" [18 cm].
Beg shaping crown:
1st rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Half double crochet next 2 sts tog (hdc2tog). Repeat (Rep) from * around. Join. 45 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sts.
3rd rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 27 sts.
