4th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in next st. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Draw end through remaining (rem) sts and secure tightly.
Pompom:  With strands of any unused shades held together, wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 100 times in total. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew pompom to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® Grande™: 1 ball 402 Foggy
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 11.5mm [US P-16]
Yarn needle
Elastic ponytail holder
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22½)" [51 (57) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 6 dc = 4½" (11.5 cm); 4 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Round 1: Join yarn with a slip knot around ponytail holder. Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 17 (19) dc around holder. Join with a slip st in top of beginning ch—18 (20) dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—27 (30) dc.
Size Small only
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, skip next dc, *2 dc in next dc, skip next dc; repeat from * around to last dc, dc in last dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—13 two-dc groups and 1 dc.
Rounds 4 and 5: Slip st in next dc, slip st in space before next 2-dc group, ch 3, dc in same space, *2 dc in next space between 2-dc groups; repeat from * 11 times, 2 dc in space before last dc, dc in space between last dc and beginning ch; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 6: Slip st in next dc; slip st in space before next 2-dc group, ch 3, dc in same space, *2 dc in next space between 2-dc groups; repeat from * 11 times, 2 dc in space before last dc, dc in space between last dc and beginning ch; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
Size Large only
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, skip next dc, *2 dc in next dc, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—15 two-2 dc groups.
Rounds 4–6: Slip st in next dc, slip st in space before next 2-dc group, ch 3, dc in same space, 2 dc in each space between 2-dc groups around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 7: Slip st in next dc; slip st in space before next 2-dc group, ch 3, dc in same space, 2 dc in each space between 2-dc groups around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™ Set includes 12 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (85 m/93 yds each; 1020 m/1116 yds total)
Contrast A Cherry Red 1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
Contrast B Pumpkin 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Contrast C Saffron 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast D Spring Green 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast E Royal 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Contrast F Jade 1 ball or 42 yds/38 m
Contrast G Lavender 1 ball or 46 yds/42 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: Each rnd of Motif will be worked with a different color. MOTIFS Make 1 each in the following color combinations: Motif 1: E as Color 1, C as Color 2, A as Color 3. Motif 2: D as Color 1, E as Color 2, C as Color 3. Motif 3: A as Color 1, B as Color 2, E as Color 3. Motif 4: C as Color 1, D as Color 2, A as Color 3. Motif 5: E as Color 1, C as Color 2, B as Color 3. Motif 6: B as Color 1, A as Color 2, D as Color 3. With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 2. 1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc) 3 times in ring. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off. 2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off. 3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. [(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1] 3 times. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off. Sew sides of 6 Motifs tog to form Ring in this order: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6. HAT CROWN Note: Join all rnds with sl st in first sc. With RS facing, join F with sl st to any ch-2 sp at top edge of Ring of Motifs. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around, working 1 sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Join. 78 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 66 sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc. 6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc. 7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc. 8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc. 9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc. 10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. 11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc. 12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 1 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc. 13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sc. Fasten off. Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely. BRIM Note: Join all rnds with sl st in first sc. With RS facing, join G with sl st to any ch-2 sp at bottom edge of Ring of Motifs. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around, working 1 sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Join. 78 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 84 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 90 sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 96 sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 102 sc. 6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 108 sc. 7th to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Main Color (MC) Passport (0410) 2 3 balls
Contrast A Beach Ball (0200) 1 1 ball
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
5 yds (4.5 m) of white worsted weight yarn.
abbreviations: Split sc = Insert hook between 2 strands of vertical V in the middle of sc instead of usual way. Draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.
measurements: Hat: To fit child 2/4 yrs (6/8 yrs) old. Cowl: 24 (26) [61 (66) cm] around x 10 (12) [25.5 (30.5) cm] deep.
gauge: 13 split sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] on larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to both sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.

HAT
With smaller hook and MC, ch 9 (11).
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 (10) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 18 (20)" [45.5 (51) cm]. With larger hook, join last row and 1st row tog with 1 row of sc to form tube.
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first split sc.

Foundation rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working along side edge of ribbing, work 59 (65) sc evenly around. Join. Place marker on last st at end of each rnd and move marker at end of each rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 split sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 8 (8½)" [20.5 (21.5) cm]. Fasten oﬀ.

FINISHING
Inner Ears (make 2).
With A and smaller hook, ch 4.
1st row: 5 dc in 4th ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Fasten oﬀ. Sew Inner Ears to Hat as shown in photo.

COWL
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc/split sc. With larger hook and MC, ch 78 (86). Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. Place marker on last st at end of each rnd and move marker up on subsequent rnds.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 split sc in each st around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 10 (12)" [25.5 (30.5) cm]. Fasten oﬀ.

FINISHING
Whiskers (make 6).
With white yarn and smaller hook, ch 15.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of ch. Fasten oﬀ.

Nose
With A and smaller hook, ch 4.
1st row: 5 dc in 4th ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Fasten oﬀ. Sew Whiskers and Nose to Hat as shown in photo.

materials: Bernat® Softee Baby™ (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m) Prettiest Pink (30205) OR Little Mouse (30010)
Bernat® Softee Baby Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Feather Gray (62010) OR Cotton (62009)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook
1 button ½" [1.25 cm] diameter
measurements: To fit baby 6/12 (18/24) months (mos).
gauge: 16 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written 6/12  (18/24 ) mos. Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Notes:
• Hat is worked from top, worked in rounds (rnds), then the sides are worked in rows.
• Chain (ch) 3 at beginning (beg) of rnds or rows counts as double crochet (dc).
• Join all rnds with slip stitch (sl st) to first dc.
Back of Bonnet
Chain (ch) 4.
1st rnd: 8 double crochet (dc) in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to first dc (top of ch-3). 9 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same space (sp) as sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 18 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Repeat (rep) from * to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Join. 27 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Join. 36 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Join. 45 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Join. 54 dc.
Size 18/24 mos only: 7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Join. 63 dc.
Both Sizes: Sides:
1st row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 49 (59) dc. Turn. Leave remaining (rem) 4 (3) dc unworked. 50 (60) dc.
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 50 (60) dc.
11th row: (buttonhole row). Ch 12. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). Ch 1. Skip next ch (buttonhole made). 1 dc in each of next 7 ch. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off. 59 (69) dc and 1 ch-1 sp.
FINISHING
Sew button at front bottom corner of Bonnet to correspond to buttonhole strap.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m)
Sizes 2/4 yrs 8/10 yrs Adult
Dark Pink (10621) 1 1 1 ball
Note: 1 ball will make approx 7 (5-4) Hats.
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: To fit 2/4 yrs (8/10 yrs – Adult)
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Beg at top of crown, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 3 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 18 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. *2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 2 dc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 33 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. *Skip next dc. Dcfp around post of next dc, then dcfp around post of skipped dc – Cr Dcfp made. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 49 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Size 2/4 yrs only: 7th rnd: Ch 3. *(Cr Dcfp) 3 times. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 57 sts.
8th rnd: As 6th rnd.
Sizes 8/10 yrs and Adult only: 7th rnd: Ch 3. *(Cr Dcfp) twice. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * to last 8 dc. [Cr Dcfp. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made)] 4 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 63 sts.
8th rnd: As 6th rnd.
Size Adult only: 9th rnd: Ch 3. *(Cr Dcfp) 5 times. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * to last 2 dc. Cr Dcfp. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 69 sts.
10th rnd: As 6th rnd.
All Sizes: 1st rnd: Ch 3. *Cr Dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep last 2 rnds for pat until work from beg measures approx 5 (6½-7)" [12.5 (16.5-18) cm], ending on a 2nd rnd.
Edging: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 12 (13-15) sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each of last 0 (2-0) sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 53 (59-65) sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
3rd rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.
Optional - Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers 150 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Patons® Canadiana™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 205 yds/187 m) Main Color (MC) Navy (10110) 1 ball
Contrast A Winter White (10006) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 14 sc x 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.

With MC, ch 72. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.

1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first 72 hdc.

2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 2. *1 hdcfp around next st. 1 hdcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdcfp.

Beg working Chart, noting each square is equal to 1 sc and reading rnds from right to left, Carry color not in use loosely across top of row and work sts around it. Change colors by drawing new color through last 2 loops on hook of previous color.

Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

Rep last rnd until all 15 rnds of chart have been worked. Break A.

Next rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 6 ½" [16.5 cm].

Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.

4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc. 

5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.

6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.

7th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.

8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sc.

Fasten off leaving long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.

materials: RED HEART® Shimmer®: 1 ball 1403 Pewter A
RED HEART® Boutique Ribbons®: 1½ yd (1.4 m) 1938 City B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Split lock stitch marker
yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
dec (decrease) = [yarn over and draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 5 loop on hook.
measurements: Cloche fits most women. Finished Circumference: 22” (56 cm)
gauge: 11 sts = 4” (10 cm); 8 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in hdc
instructions:
Brim
Row 1 (Right Side): With A, ch 7; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does NOT count as a st), working in back loops, hdc in first sc and in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, working in back loops, hdc in first hdc and in each hdc across; turn.
Repeat Row 3 until brim is 22” (56 cm) long.
Crown
Ch 1, work 60 sc across one long edge; join with a slip st to first sc to form a circle. Place marker in first st of round. Do not join but work in continuous rounds, moving marker up each round.
Round 1: Hdc in first sc and in each sc around – 60 hdc.
Round 2: Hdc in first hdc and in each hdc around.
Repeat Round 2 until piece measures 4½” (11.4 cm) from lower edge.
Shape Crown
Next Round: [Hdc in 3 hdc, dec] 12 times – 48 hdc.
Work 2 rounds even.
Next Round: [Hdc in 2 hdc, dec] 12 times – 36 hdc.
Work 2 rounds even.
Next Round: [Hdc in hdc, dec] 12 times – 24 hdc.
Work 2 rounds even.
Next Round: [Dec] 12 times – 12 hdc.
Next Round: [Dec] 6 times; join with a slip st in next st – 6 hdc. Fasten off.
Weave yarn end through last 6 sts and draw top closed. Sew brim seam. Weave in loose ends.
Flower
Cut a 1½ yd (1.4 m) length of B. Thread a 12” (30.4 cm) piece of A on a yarn needle. Weave A through top holes of B, gathering gently and forming into layered circular ruffles. Knot to secure. Tack to hat.

materials: TLC® 'Baby': 1 skein each 5737 Powder Pink A and 5011 White C.
RED HEART® 'Buttercup™': 1 skein 4276 Light Blue Multi B.
Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm [US K-10½]
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Bpdc (Back post double crochet) = Yo, insert hook from the back side of the work to front and to back again around the post of the indicated stitch on a previous row; yo and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), yo and draw through two loops (2 loops on hook), yo and draw through two loops (1 loop on hook)

Fpdc (Front post double crochet) = Yo, insert hook from the front side of the work to back and to front again around the post of the indicated stitch on a previous row; yo and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), yo and draw through two loops (2 loops on hook), yo and draw through two loops (1 loop on hook)
sc2tog =  [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Hat measures 14 (16)” in circumference.
gauge: With 2 strands of A, 14 sts = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Band
With 2 strands of A held together as one, ch 48 (56), and without twisting ch, join into a ring with slip st in first ch. Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (count as dc here and throughout), dc in each ch around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 (56) dc. Rounds 2-4: Ch 3, Fpdc around the post of next st, *Bpdc around the post of next 2 sts**, Fpdc around the post of next 2 sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with slip st around the post of beginning ch-3.
Ruffle
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in tfl ONLY of each dc around, join with slip st in first sc. Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next sc, 5 dc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, omitting last sc, join with sl st in first sc – 12 (14) shells. Fasten off.
Crown
Round 1: With right side facing, join one strand of B in remaining back loop of any st in round 4 of band, ch 1, working tbl ONLY, sc in each dc around, join with slip st in first sc. Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each of first 6 sc, *sc2tog in next 2 sts**, sc in each of next 6 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with slip st in first sc – 42 (49) sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each of first 5 sc, *sc2tog in next 2 sts**, sc in each of next 5 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with slip st in first sc – 36 (42) sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each of first 4 sc, *sc2tog in next 2 sts**, sc in each of next 4 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with slip st in first sc – 30 (35) sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in each of first 3 sc, *sc2tog in next 2 sts**, sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with slip st in first sc – 24 (28) sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sc, *sc2tog in next 2 sts**, sc in each of next 2 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with slip st in first sc – 18 (21) sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, *sc2tog in next 2 sts; repeat from * around, sc in last 0 (1) st, join with slip st in first sc – 9 (11) sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, *sc2tog in next 2 sts; repeat from * around, sc in last st, join with slip st in first sc – 5 (6) sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, *sc2tog in next 2 sts; repeat from * around, sc in last 1 (0) st, join with slip st in first sc – 3 (3) sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. With C, make a pompom and attach it to the top of the hat.

materials: Bernat® Baby Sport™ (12.3 oz/350 g; 1256 yds/1148 m)
Baby Taupe (21011)  1 ball for all sizes
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop around each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Ch 36 (42-54-60-66). Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st here and throughout). 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 2. *1 hdcfp around next st. 1 hdcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdcfp.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Skip next 2 sts. *(3 dc in next st) twice. Skip next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 4 sts. (3 dc in next st) twice. Skip last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first dc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Rep 7th rnd until work from beg measures 3 (3½-4½-5½-6½)"[7.5 (9-11.5-14-16.5) cm].
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 (5-7-8-9) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 (36-48-54-60) hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 (4-6-7-8) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 (30-42-48-54) hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 (3-5-6-7) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 18 (24-36-42-48) hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 1 (2-4-5-6) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 12 (18-30-36-42) hdc.
Sizes Newborn, 3/6 mos, 6/12 mos and 18/24 mos only:
Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next (1-3-4-5) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. (12-24-30-36) hdc.
Sizes 3/6 mos, 6/12 mos and 18/24 mos only: Next rnd:
Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next (2-3-4) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. (18-24-30) hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next (1-2-3) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. (12-18-24) hdc.
Sizes 6/12 mos and 18/24 mos only: Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next (1-2) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. (12-18) hdc.
Size 18/24 mos only: Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 12 hdc.
All sizes: Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Magical™: 1 ball 1012 Top Hat.
Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5].
Split lock stitch markers
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat fits most women. Hat Circumference measures 21”.
gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 4” in pattern; Rounds 1-11 = 14” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge. NOTE: Gauge may vary depending on which section of the yarn is being used; the yarn varies in thickness.
instructions:
BERET
Ch 4; join with slip st to form ring. 
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc plus ch-1), [dc in next dc, ch 1] 11 times; join with slip st in 3rd ch of ch-4 – 12 dc, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next space, ch 1, [dc in next dc, dc in next space, ch 1] 11 times; join in top of ch-3 – 24 dc, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, dc in next space, ch 1, [dc in next 2 dc, dc in next space, ch 1] 11 times; join – 36 dc, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, dc in next space, ch 1, [dc in next 3 dc, dc in next space, ch 1] 11 times; join – 48 dc, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, dc in next space, ch 1, [dc in next 4 dc, dc in next space, ch 1] 11 times; join – 60 dc, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, dc in next space, ch 1, [dc in next 5 dc, dc in next space, ch 1] 11 times; join – 72 dc, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in next 5 dc, dc in next space, ch 1, [dc in next 6 dc, dc in next space, ch 1] 11 times; join – 84 dc, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in next 6 dc, dc in next space, ch 1, [dc in next 7 dc, dc in next space, ch 1] 11 times; join – 96 dc, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 10: Ch 3, dc in next 7 dc, dc in next space, ch 1, [dc in next 8 dc, dc in next space, ch 1] 11 times; join – 108 dc, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 11: Ch 3, dc in next 8 dc, dc in next space, ch 1, [dc in next 9 dc, dc in next space, ch 1] 11 times; join – 120 dc, 12 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off.
Band
Row 1: Ch 5; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch; turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across; turn.
Rows 3-52: Repeat Row 2 until Band reaches 21” when gently stretched. Fasten off leaving 24” tail for sewing.
FiNiSHiNG
With split lock stitch markers, pin band in place to Round 11 of hat. Using yarn needle and tail from band sew Band to hat. Sew short ends of Band together. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
RED HEART® Boutique™ Magical™, Art E787 available in 3.5 oz (100 g), 190 yd (174 m) balls.

materials: RED HEART® "Soft Yarn": 2 1/2 Ounces No. 4608 Wine
OR No. 9518 Teal.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Optional: 3/4 Yard of 1/2" elastic.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Beret fits most women.
gauge: GAUGE: Rnds 1-2 = 3" across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Ch 5; join with a sl st to form a ring.

Rnd 1: Ch 3, 2 dc in ring, ch 1, [3 dc in ring, ch 1] 4 times; join with a sl st to top of ch-3.

Rnd 2: (Sl st, ch 3, 2 dc) all in next dc, * ch 1, 3 dc in next sp **, ch 1, skip next dc, 3 dc in next dc; rep from * around, end at **; sc in top of ch-3 to join and form last ch-1 sp – ten 3-dc groups.

Rnd 3: Ch 3, 2 dc over sc; [ch 1, 3 dc] twice all in next ch-1 sp – inc made; * ch 1, 3 dc in next sp, inc in next sp; rep from * around; sc in top of ch-3 to join – 15 3-dc groups.

Rnd 4: Ch 3, 2 dc over sc, * ch 1, 3 dc in next sp; rep from * around; sc in top of ch-3 to join.

Rnd 5: Ch 3, 2 dc over sc, * ch 1, 3 dc in next sp, inc in next sp **, ch 1, 3 dc in next sp; rep from * around, end at **; sc in top of ch-3 to join – twenty 3-dc groups.

Rnd 6: Rep Rnd 3 – thirty 3-dc groups.

Rnds 7-10: Rep Rnd 4.

Rnd 11: Rep Rnd 4 EXCEPT end with "ch 1, sl st in top of ch-3" instead of "sc in top of ch-3" to join.

Rnd 12: Ch 3, dc in next dc and in each dc around skipping all ch-1 sps; join with a sl st in top of ch-3 – 90 sts.

Rnd 13: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in next 6 dc; draw up a lp in next 2 dc, yo and through all 3 lps on hook – dec made; * sc in next 7 dc, dec over next 2 dc; rep from * around; join to first sc – 80 sc.

Rnds 14-21: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join to first sc. Fasten off after Rnd 21 leaving a long (30") end.

Fold sc band in half to wrong side and sl st in place to wrong side of Rnd 13. Weave in ends.

Optional: Cut elastic to head measurement plus 1/2". Overlap ends of elastic by 1/2" and sew together. Fold sc band in half over circle of elastic and sl st in place.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Peacock (7155) 1 O’Go
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4” [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with O’Go, locate the end of the yarn.
• Carefully cut plastic tie where ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull to remove tie. 
• Colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. 
• Each color is ready to use.
• Change colors each round as desired, noting color placement may effect ability to create single color bottom band (as shown).
With desired color and larger hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 1) in ring. (2 dc. ch 1) 5 times. Join next color with sl st to top of ch 3. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in next dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join next color with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 ch-1 sps. 
3rd rnd: Sl st in next dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join next color with sl st to top of ch 3. 
4th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join next color with sl st to top of ch 3. 18 ch-1 sps. 
5th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join next color with sl st to top of ch 3. 
Rep last rnd, working each rnd in desired shade until Hat from beg measures 8” [20.5 cm]. Join desired shade for bottom band with sl st to top of ch 3. 
Bottom band: With smaller hook and desired color, proceed as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc. 
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (Solids: 6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m; Heathers: 5 oz/141.7 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Contrast A  Dk Country Blue (9711) 1 ball
Contrast B  Country Blue (9710) 1 ball
Contrast C  Lt Country Blue (9709) 1 ball
Contrast D  Lt Country Peach (9737) 1 ball
Contrast E  Off White (9702) 1 ball
Contrast F  Gray Heather (H9509) 1 ball
Contrast G  Woodland Heather (H9503) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker
abbreviations: Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
Sc2togspl = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc between ‘legs’ of stitch. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook in pat.
instructions:
Notes: When working from chart, carry yarn not in use loosely across top of work. Work next row over strand of yarn which is not in use. Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.

Ribbing: With A and smaller hook, ch 12. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 11 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg, when slightly stretched, measures 19½" [49.5 cm]. Do not fasten off. Change to larger hook and proceed as follows: 
Set-up rnd: Ch 1. Work 72 sc across longer side of ribbing. Join with sl st to first sc. PM for beg of rnd.

Beg working Chart (shown right), noting 8-st rep will be worked 9 times, reading rnds from right to left. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 splsc in each sc around. 
Rep last rnd, and cont working Chart until 28th rnd of Chart is complete.
Break all colors but E.

Shape crown: 
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 splsc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 64 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 splsc in each of next 6 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sts. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 splsc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sts. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 splsc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 splsc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join.32 sts. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts. 
Break yarn, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. Sew ends of ribbing tog.

Pompom: Wind 2 strands of A, 1 strand each D and G around 3 fingers 40 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® “Designer Sport™”: 1 skein 3825 Pool.
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: fphdc (front post half double crochet): yarn over, insert hook from front to back to front around the post of indicated stitch and draw yarn through, yarn over and draw through all three loops on hook.
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat circumference measures 18”.
gauge: 13 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in Pattern st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
CUFF
Ch 15.
Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn – 14 sc.
Row 1: Ch 1, working in back loop only, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat Row 1 until piece measures 18” from beginning, slightly stretched.
HAT
Turn cuff to work along long edge, sc 54 sts evenly spaced across, turn.
Row 1: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2, *hdc in next 2 hdc, Fphdc in next st, hdc in 3 hdc; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4-7: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Row 8:  (RS) Ch 2, *hdc in next 2 sts, Fphdc in next st, hdc in next hdc, hdc2tog; repeat from * across, turn – 45 sts.
Row 9: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 10: Ch 2, *hdc in next 2 sts, Fphdc in next st, hdc2tog; repeat from * across, turn – 36 sts.
Row 11: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 12: Ch 2, *hdc2tog, Fphdc in next st, hdc in next hdc; repeat from * across, turn – 27 sts.
Row 13: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 14: Ch 2, hdc in next hdc, *Fphdc in next st, hdc2tog; repeat from * to last 2 sts, Fphdc in next st, hdc in last st, turn – 19 sts.
Rows 15 and 17: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Rows 16 and 18: Ch 2, *hdc in next st, Fphdc in next st, hdc in next hdc; repeat from * across, turn.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew back seam, reversing sewing at Cuff so seam doesn’t show when Cuff is folded up to right side.
Weave in ends.

Tie: Holding 2 strands of yarn together, ch 30. Fasten off. Weave Tie under each Fphdc st 3 rows from last row. Pull tightly and knot to secure to make small gathering at top of Hat. Fold Cuff to right side.

materials: 1 (1, 1, 2) skein(s) 7259 Flamenco of RED HEART® Super Saver Fair Isle™
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
Susan Bates Easy Wrap Pompom Maker or 3½" (9 cm) piece of heavy cardboard
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 18 (20, 22, 24)" [45.5 (51, 56, 61) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 16 sts = 4½" (11.5 cm); 10 rows = 3½" (9 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Brim
Ch 6.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Rows 2–64 (70, 78, 84): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 65 (71, 79, 85): With first and last rows held together, ch 1, working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across. Do not turn.
Body
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing and working in ends of rows, ch 1, 2 sc in first row, *skip next row, 2 sc in next row; repeat from * around to last row, skip last row; join with slip st in first sc—64 (70, 78, 84) sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—64 (70, 78, 84) hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first hdc, *skip next hdc, 2 sc in next hdc; repeat from * around to last hdc, skip last hdc; join with slip st in first sc—64 (70, 78, 84) sc.
Rounds 4-16 (18, 20, 22): Repeat last 2 rounds 16 (18, 20, 22) times.
Round 17 (19, 21, 23): Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last st, skip last st; join with slip st in first sc—32 (35, 39, 42) sc.
Round 18 (20, 22, 24): Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last 1 (2, 2, 1) st(s), skip last 1 (2, 2, 1) st(s); join with slip st in first sc—16 (17, 19, 21) sc.
Round 19 (21, 23, 25): Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last 1 (2, 2, 2) st(s), skip last 1 (2, 2, 2) st(s); join with slip st in first sc—8 (8, 9, 10) sc. Fasten off, leaving a 12" (30.5 cm) tail.
FINISHING
Weave tail through every other st of last round, working through last st as needed. Pull gently to close and secure tail.
Pompom
Following pompom maker directions, make 3½" (9 cm) pompom or make pompom as follows: Wrap yarn around 3½" (9 cm) piece of heavy cardboard (the more wraps, the fuller the pompom). Gently remove wraps from cardboard. Cut a 12" (30.5 cm) length of yarn and tie it tightly around center of wraps. Do not cut the ends of this center tie. Cut ends of wraps. Fluff and trim pompom. Use ends of center tie to attach pompom to top of hat.
Weave in ends.

materials: 1 ball each 6768 Pink A and 4600 White B
RED HEART® Soft
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch markers
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hat circumference at lower edge: 23”.
gauge: 12 hdc = 4”; 10 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 70, slip st in first ch to join. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in each ch around, slip st in top of beginning ch to join.
Rounds 2-3: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 4: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in each dc, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 6: Ch 4, (counts as tr here and throughout), tr in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch. 
Round 7: Ch 4, tr in each tr around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Fasten off.
Round 8: Join B in beginning ch, ch 4, tr in each tr around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 9: Ch 2, hdc in each tr around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Fasten off.
Round 10: Join A in beginning ch, ch 4, tr in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 11-12: Repeat Round 7.
Fasten off.
Round 13: Join B in beginning ch, repeat Round 9.
Round 14: Repeat Round 10.
Shape Crown
Round 15: *Skip 6 tr, slip st in next tr; repeat from * around 9 more times, slip st in every other slip st to close.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Edging
Working opposite foundation ch, join A in first ch, ch 1, sc in each ch around, slip st in beginning ch.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Off White (39702) 1 ball
Contrast B Bone (39703) 1 ball
Contrast C Soft Green (39739) 1 ball
Contrast D Sunshine (39755) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit average Adult.
gauge: 13 hdc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Stripe Pat
With A: 1 rnd.
With B: 1 rnd.
With A: 1 rnd.
With C: 1 rnd.
With D: 1 rnd.
With C: 1 rnd.
With A: 1 rnd.
With B: 1 rnd.
With A: 1 rnd.
These 9 rnds form Stripe Pat.
Notes: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st throughout.
Do not break yarn when changing colors. Carry color not in use up loosely up back of work.
To change color, work to last loops on hook of first color, yoh with new color and proceed. Carry color not in use loosely up WS of work.
Ribbing: With A and smaller hook, ch 8
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 19½" [49.5 cm], when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off.
Join last row and first row tog with 1 row of sc to form tube.
Beg working in rnds: 
Foundation rnd: Ch 2. Working along side edge of ribbing, work 84 hdc evenly around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Change to larger hook.
Beg Stripe Pat and proceed as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Skip next hdc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 2. Working in back loops only, *1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Skip next hdc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first hdc.
Rep last rnd for Zig Zag pat and cont in Stripe Pat until work from beg measures approx 7½" [19 cm].
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows:
Shape crown: 1st rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, *1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Skip next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 70 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, *1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Skip next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, *1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Skip next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 42 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, *1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Skip next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 28 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 14 sts. Break yarn, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®, Art. E400, available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 390 yd (357 m) and multi-color 5 oz (141 g), 230 yd (211 m) skeins
1 (1, 2) skeins. Child (18¼”) 1805 Bluebell or 1303 Aran, Women (19½”) 1909 Holly Berry, Men (21”) 1937 Deep Blues
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [US H-8] and 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle; optional pompom maker
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: For child size (6 year-old); changes for women and men are in parentheses.
gauge: 14 sts = 4" (10 cm); 16 rounds = 4" (10 cm) in sc with smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Next Round: Ch 1, [dec, sc in next 1 (2, 3) sc, dec, sc in next sc] 4 times; join – 16 (20, 24) sc.
Women’s and Men’s Size Only-Next Round: Ch 1, [dec, sc in next (0, 1) sc, dec, sc in next sc] 4 times; join – (12, 16) sc.
All Sizes: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Weave end through remaining sts and draw up tightly; fasten securely.
Optional: Make a pompom and fasten to top of hat.
Special Abbreviation: dec (decrease) = [draw up a loop in next sc] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
HAT
Cuff
With larger hook ch 64 (68, 74); join with a slip st to first ch, being sure ch is not twisted.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in same ch as joining and in each ch around; join in the back loop of first sc; turn – 64 (68, 74) sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc around; join in the back loop of first sc; turn.
Repeat Round 2 until 5 (5½, 5½)” [12.7 (14, 14) cm] from beginning slightly stretched. Do not turn at the end of last round.
Crown
Change to smaller hook.
Next Round (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in both loops of each sc around; join. Do not turn.
Repeat last round until 9 (10, 10)” [22.8 (25, 25) cm] from beginning decreasing 0 (0, 2) sc on last round – 64 (68, 72) sc.
Shape Top
Ch 1, [dec, sc in next 11 (12, 13) sc, dec, sc in next sc] 4 times; join – 56 (60, 64) sc.
Next Round: Ch 1, [dec, sc in next 9 (10, 11) sc, dec, sc in next sc] 4 times; join – 48 (52, 56) sc.
Next Round: Ch 1, [dec, sc in next 7 (8, 9) sc, dec, sc in next sc] 4 times; join – 40 (44, 48) sc.
Next Round: Ch 1, [dec, sc in next 5 (6, 7) sc, dec, sc in next sc] 4 times; join – 32 (36, 40) sc.
Next Round: Ch 1, [dec, sc in next 3 (4, 5) sc, dec, sc in next sc] 4 times; join – 24 (28, 32) sc.

materials: Bernat® Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Low Tide (00098)  1 ball
Contrast B Flint (00033)   1 ball
Size U.S. K/101/2 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit average Woman’s head.
gauge: 9 hdc and 6 rows = 4” [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as hdc.
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of row and work sts over it.
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: 9 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 9 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 18 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 27 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 45 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Yoh. Draw loop through next hdc. With B, draw yarn through all loops on hook. Yoh. Draw loop through next hdc. With A, draw yarn through all loops on hook. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
7th and 8th rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl to to first hdc.
Rep 6th to 8th rnds until work from 5th rnd measures approx 8” [20.5 cm], ending on an 8th rnd. Break A.
Ribbing: 1st rnd: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcfp around first st. *1 hdcbp around next st. 1 hdcfp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. Rep 2nd rnd 3 times more. Fasten off.
Pompom: Wind B around 4 fingers approx 150 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 1 ball each 8884 Peacock A and 8532 Purple B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 9mm [M-13 US] and 6.5mm [K-10.5 US]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
measurements: Headband measures 4” wide x 22” circumference (10 x 55.9 cm)
gauge: 10 dc = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; 5 rows = 4” (10 cm) with 1 strand of A and B held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
EAR WARMER
With larger hook and 1 strand of A and B held together, ch 12.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch across, turn—10 dc.
Rows 2–26: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each dc across, turn.
Joining Row: With wrong sides of Rows 1 and 26 held together and working through both thicknesses, ch 1, sc in each dc—10 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With right side facing and smaller hook, join 1 strand of B with sc to end of any row on upper edge, working across ends of rows, sc evenly spaced around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Repeat for lower edge. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Essentials Baby™: 1 ball each 6001 Cotton A and 6724 Rosewater B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.0mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat directions are for size 16" (40.5 cm) head with changes for size 18" (45.5 cm) and 20" (51 cm) in parentheses.
gauge: 16 sc and 16 rows of sc = 4" [10 cm], 5 bobbles in pattern = 4" [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HAT
Band
With A, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook (beginning ch-1 does not count as a st, now and throughout) and each ch across; turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 16" [40.5 cm] long. (18" [45.5 cm], 20 [51 cm]).
Body
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, work 54 (63, 72) sc evenly spaced along long edge of Band; turn—54, 63, 72 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sc, bobble in next sc; repeat from * across; turn—18 (21, 24) bobbles, 36 (42, 48) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, *sc in top of bobble, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across; turn—54 (63, 72) sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, *bobble in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across; turn—18 (21, 24) bobbles, 36 (42, 48) sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sc, sc in top of bobble; repeat from * across; turn—54 (63, 72) sc.
Rows 6-14 (6-18, 6-18): Repeat Rows 2-5 another 2 (3, 3) times, then work Row 2 once.
Shape Crown
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, *sc in next 4 (5, 6) sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn—45 (54, 63) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, *bobble in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across; turn—15 (18, 21) bobbles, 30 (36, 42) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 (4, 5) sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn—36 (45, 54) sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sc, bobble in next sc; repeat from * across; turn—12 (15, 18) bobbles, 24 (30, 36) sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 (3, 4) sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn—27 (36, 45) sts.
Row 6: Ch 1, *bobble in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across; turn—9 (12, 15) bobbles, 18 (24, 30) sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, *sc in next 1 (2, 3) st(s), sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn—18 (27, 36) sts.
Row 8: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sc, bobble in next sc; repeat from * across; turn—6 (9, 12) bobbles, 12 (18, 24) sc.
For Size 16" (40.5 cm)
Row 9: Ch 1, sc2tog 9 times; turn—9 sts.
Row 10: Ch 1, *bobble in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across—3 bobbles, 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving an 18" (45.5 cm) tail.
For Size 18" (45.5 cm)
Row 9: Ch 1, *sc in next st, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn—18 sts.
Row 10: Ch 1, *bobble in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across; turn—6 bobbles, 12 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc2tog 9 times; turn—9 sts.
Row 12: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sc, bobble in next sc; repeat from * across—3 bobbles, 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving an 18" (45.5 cm) tail.
For Size 20" (51 cm)
Row 9: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn—27 sts.
Row 10: Ch 1, *bobble in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across; turn—9 bobbles, 18 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, *sc in next st, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn—18 sts.
Row 12: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sc, bobble in next sc; repeat from * across; turn—6 bobbles, 12 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc2tog 9 times; turn—9 sts.
Row 14: Ch 1, *bobble in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across—3 bobbles, 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving an 18" (45.5 cm) tail.
All Sizes
Use tail to sew seam down back of Hat, weave in ends.
EARS (Make 2)
Inner Ear
With B, ch 11.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 8 chs, 3 sc in last ch; working up other side of foundation ch, sc in next 9 chs; turn—21 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc—23 sc. Fasten off and set aside.
Outer Ear
With A, ch 11.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 8 chs, 3 sc in last ch; working up other side of foundation ch, sc in next 9 chs; turn—21 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc; turn—23 sc. Place Inner Ear on top of Outer Ear.
Row 3: Continuing with A and working through both Inner Ear and Outer Ear held together; ch 1, sc in next 11 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 11 sc; turn—25 sc. Rows 4 and 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around. At end of Row 5, do not turn; fasten off and weave in ends.
FINISHING
Referring to photo for placement, position Ears at sides of Hat and sew in place.

materials: HEART® Grande™: 1 ball 275 Nectar
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 11.5mm [US P-16]
Yarn needle
Elastic ponytail holder
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 18” (45.7 cm) circumference at brim.
gauge: 6 dc = 4½" (11.5 cm); 4 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Notes 1. Hat is worked in joined rounds with right side facing. 2. You will be working stitches around the ponytail holder.
HAT
Round 1: Join yarn with a slip knot around ponytail holder. Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 15 (19) dc around holder. Join with a slip st in top of beginning ch—16 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, skip next dc, *2 dc in next dc, skip next dc; repeat from * around to last dc, dc in last dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 two-dc groups and 1 dc.
Rounds 4 and 5: Slip st in next dc, slip st in space before next 2-dc group, ch 3, dc in same space, *2 dc in next space between 2-dc groups; repeat from * 10 times, 2 dc in space before last dc, dc in space between last dc and beginning ch; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 6: Slip st in next dc; slip st in space before next 2-dc group, ch 3, dc in same space, *2 dc in next space between 2-dc groups; repeat from * 11 times, 2 dc in space before last dc, dc in space between last dc and beginning ch; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all ends.

pattern_name: VERTICAL RIDGES CROCHET HAT FOR HIM
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Aran Fleck (4313) 1 ball or 124 yds/112 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet through back loop
measurements: One size to fit Adult. Approx 21-22" [51-56 cm] head circumference.
gauge: 14 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Hat is worked from side to side. 
• Short-turn rows are worked to create top shaping.
Ch 38 loosely. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 37 sc.
**2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (sc and sl st). 
Rep last 2 rows 5 times more, then 2nd row once. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Work across ends of unworked sts from previous 13 rows: (1 scbl in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 6 times. Turn. 37 sc.**  

Rep from ** to ** 5 times more. 
Fasten off. 
Sew back seam, reversing 3" [7.5 cm] for turn back.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Pretty ‘n Pink (0722)
Turqua (0512)
Macaw (3944)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop
measurements: To fit head circumference: Child 2/4 years 18½" [47 cm], Child 6/10 years 19" [48 cm], Adult Small 19½" - 20½" [49.5 - 52 cm], Adult Large 21" - 22" [53.5 - 56 cm]
gauge: 14 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Rib Pat.
instructions:
Ch 39 (49-57-59) loosely. (See Diagram on page 3).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 38 (48-56-58) sc.
**2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (sc and sl st). 36 (46-54-56) sc rem. 
Rep last 2 rows 4 (4-5-5) times more, then 2nd row once. 28 (38-44-46) sc rem.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 scbl in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 6 (6-7-7) times. Turn. 38 (48-56-58) sc.** 

Rep from ** to ** once more. 
Shape face opening: Upper Section: 1st row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each of next 18 (23-26-28) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
***2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (sc and sl st). 17 (22-25-27) sc rem.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows 2 (3-3-4) times more. 12 (15-18-18) sc rem.*** 
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 scbl in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 4 (5-5-6) times. Turn. 19 (24-27-29) sc. 
Next row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep from *** to *** once more. 
Fasten off. 
Lower Section:  With WS facing, working across rem sts of Main Section, join yarn with sl st to back loop of next sc. 
1st row:  (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only,  Sc2tog. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last 2 sts. Working in back loops only, Sc2tog.
3rd row: As 1st row. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 7 (11-11-13) times more. 
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. 2 scbl in last sc. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. 2 scbl in first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Joining row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. 2 scbl in last sc of Lower Section. Working across Upper Section: 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 scbl in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 4 (5-5-6) times. Turn. 38 (48-56-58) sc. 
Rep from ** to ** as given above twice more. Fasten off. 
FINISHING 
Sew back seam. Weave yarn through last sl st of each row along top edge. Gather tightly and fasten securely.

materials: RED HEART® "Light & Lofty®": 4 Ounces 9330 Cape Cod.
Crochet Hook: 10mm [US N-15].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 7 sts = 4"; 8 rows = 4" in pat. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 4; join with a sl st to form a ring. 
Rnd 1: Ch 3, 11 (13) dc into ring; join with a sl st in top of ch-3 – 12 (14) sts. 
 
Rnd 2: Ch 3, FPdc around joining st, [dc in next dc, FPdc around same dc] 11 (13) times; join with a sl st in top of ch-3 – 24 (28) sts. 
 
Rnd 3: Ch 3, dc in joining st, FPdc around FPdc, [2 dc in next dc, Fpdc around Fpdc] 11 (13) times; join – 36 (40) sts. 
 
Rnd 4: Ch 3, skip joining st, dc in dc, FPdc around Fpdc, [dc in next 2 dc, FPdc around FPdc] 11 (13) times; join. 
 
Rnds 5-10: Rep Rnd 4. TURN at end of Rnd 10. 
 
Rnds 11-15: Ch 3, working on Wrong Side, skip joining st, FPdc around each st around; join. Fasten off at end of Rnd 15. 
 
Weave in ends. Turn up brim.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 390 Hot Red A and 312 Black B.
Crochet Hooks: 5mm (US H-8) and 6mm (US J-10).
Yarn needle, small amount of polyester fiberfill, two 5mm wiggle eyes and glue to secure eyes.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: To fit 14 (16, 18)” head circumference.
gauge: 13 sts and 14 rounds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With larger hook and B, ch 44 (52, 56); join with a slip st to first ch, making sure ch is not twisted.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with a slip st to first sc – 44 (52, 56) sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc around; join.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc around, changing to A in last sc; join.
Rounds 4-5: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc around; join.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc around, changing to B in last sc; join.
Rounds 7-8: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc around, join.
Repeat Rounds 3-9 until hat measures 6 (7, 8)” from beginning.
Fasten off leaving a 12” tail. Sew a seam straight across the top of the hat. Fold the corners formed by the top seam into the center of the hat and tack in place. Weave in ends.
LADYBUG
Body
With smaller hook and A, ch 4.
Row 1 (Right Side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc; turn – 12 sc.
Rows 3-7: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, changing to B in last sc; turn.
Rows 9-10: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 11: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 6 times; turn – 6 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, draw up a loop in each of next 6 sc, yo and draw through all 7 loops on hook.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Wings (Make 2)
With smaller hook and A, ch 4.
Row 1 (Right Side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across; turn – 12 sc.
Rows 3-7: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 6 times; turn – 6 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, draw up a loop in each of next 3 sc, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Legs (Make 3)
With smaller hook and B, ch 24.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
FINISHING
Sew body seam, filling body with fiberfill. With yarn needle and B, embroider a line of chain stitches down back of body and French knot spots on wings. Sew legs across bottom of body so that they evenly extend on each side. Sew wings to back of body. Glue wiggle eyes. Sew Ladybug to center top of hat. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron International's One Pound (100% Acrylic; 16oz/454g, 812yds/742m): Hers shown in: #0516 Scarlet (MC): 1 skein; #0510 Kelly Green (B): 1 skein; His shown in: #0562 Claret (MC): 1 skein; #0566 Leaf Green (B): 1 skein
One size US J-10 (6mm) crochet hook and one size I-9 (5.5mm) crochet hook for ribbing or sizes to obtain gauge
Yarn needle
Pompom maker for 3”/7.5cm pompons
measurements: Hat measures 18 (21)"/45.5(53.5)cm in circumference; 45 1/2(46 1/2)"/115.5 (118)cm long.
gauge: With larger hook, 12 sts & 12 rows = 4"/10cm. With smaller hook in ribbing pattern, 16 sts and 12 rows in back loop only = 4"/10cm.
instructions: Ribbing (worked sideways) With smaller hook and MC, ch 8 (9). Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—7 (8) sc. Row 2 (RS): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn. Rep Row 2 until piece measures 17 (19 1/2)” from beginning, ending with a RS row. Fasten off leaving a sewing length. With yarn needle and sewing length, sew ends together to form a tube. First Section (sc) Rnd 1 (RS): With smaller hook, join CC in any st on either side edge of tube, ch 1, work 56 (62) sc evenly spaced around; change to larger hook and join with sl st in first sc—56 (62) sc. Rnd 2: With larger hook, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with sl st in first sc. Rep Rnd 2 until piece measures 4 1/2 (5)”/11.5 (12.5)cm from beginning of first section. Fasten off CC, join MC with sl st in first st. Second Section (seed st) Rnd 1: With MC, ch 1, sc in first sc, dc in next sc, *sc in next sc, dc in next sc; rep from * around; join with sl st in first sc—28 sc; 28 dc. Rnd 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc),*sc in dc, dc in sc*; rep from * around, ending with sc in last dc; join with sl st in top of beginning ch-3—28 sc; 28 dc. Rnd 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, dc in next sc, *sc in next dc, dc in next sc; rep from * around; join with sl st in first sc—28 sc; 28 dc. Rep Rnds 2-3 until section measures 3”/7.5cm from beginning. Fasten off MC, join CC with sl st in first st. SHAPE CROWN Third Section (sc) Rnd 1: With CC, ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 12 sts; rep from* 3 times, sc in last 0 (6) sc; join with sl st in first sc—52 (58) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2”/5cm from beginning. Next Rnd: Ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 11 sts; rep from * 3 times, sc in last 0 (6) sc; join with sl st in first sc—48 (54) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2 1/2”/6.5cm from beginning. Fasten off CC, join MC with sl st in first st. Fourth Section (seed st) Rep Second Section, working on 48 (54) sts. Fasten off MC, join CC with sl st in first st. Fifth Section (sc) Rnd 1: With CC, ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 10 sts; rep from* 3 times, sc in last 0 (6) sc; join with sl st in first sc—44 (50) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2”/5cm from beginning. Next Rnd: Ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 9 sts; rep from * 3 times, sc in last 0 (6) sc; join with sl st in first sc—40 (46) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2 1/2”/6.5cm from beginning. Fasten off CC, join MC with sl st in first st. Sixth Section (seed st) Rep Second Section, working on 40 (46) sts. Fasten off MC, join CC with sl st in first st. Seventh Section (sc) Rnd 1: With CC, ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 8 sts; rep from * 3 times, sc in last 0 (6) sc; join with sl st in first sc—36 (42) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2”/5cm from beginning. Next Rnd: Ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 16 (7) sts; rep from * 1 (3) times, sc in last 0 (6) sc; join with sl st in first sc—34 (38) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2 1/2”/6.5cm from beginning. Fasten off CC, join MC with sl st in first st. Eighth Section (seed st) Rep Second Section, working on 34 (38) sts. Fasten off MC, join CC with sl st in first st. Ninth Section (sc) Rnd 1: With CC, ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 15 (6) sts; rep from * 1 (3) times, sc in last 0 (6) sc; join with sl st in first sc—32 (34) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2”/5cm from beginning. Next Rnd: Ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 6 sts; rep from * 3 times, sc in last 0 (2) sc; join with sl st in first sc—28 (30) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2 1/2”/6.5cm from beginning. Fasten off CC, join MC with sl st in first st. Tenth Section (seed st) Rep Second Section, working on 28 (30) sts. Fasten off MC, join CC with sl st in first st. Eleventh Section (sc) Rnd 1: With CC, ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 12 (5) sts; rep from * 1 (3) times, sc in last 0 (2) sc; join with sl st in first sc—26 (26) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2”/5cm from beginning. Next Rnd: Ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 4 sts; rep from * 3 times, sc in last 2 (2) sc; join with sl st in first sc—22 (22) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2 1/2”/6.5cm from beginning. Fasten off CC, join MC with sl st in first st. Twelfth Section (seed st) Rep Second Section, working on 22 (22) sts. Fasten off MC, join CC with sl st in first st. Thirteenth Section (sc) Rnd 1: With CC, ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 3 sts; rep from * 1 (3) times, sc in last 2 (2) sc; join with sl st in first sc—18 (18) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2”/5cm from beginning. Next Rnd: Ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 7 sts; rep from * 3 times; join with sl st in first sc—16 (16) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2 1/2”/6.5cm from beginning. Fasten off CC, join MC with sl st in first st. Fourteenth Section (seed st) Rep Second Section, working on 16 (16) sts. Fasten off MC, join CC with sl st in first st. Fifteenth Section (sc) Rnd 1: With CC, ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts; rep from * 1 (3) times join with sl st in first sc—12 (12) sc. With CC, work even in sc rnds until section measures 2”/5cm from beginning. Next Rnd: Ch 1,*sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next 4 sts; rep from * 3 times; join with sl st in first sc—10 (10) sc. Last Rnd: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with sl st in first sc—10 (10) sc. Fasten off CC leaving a sewing length. FINISHING: With yarn needle, and sewing length, weave yarn through sts of last rnd, gather tightly and secure. With A, make a 3”/7.5cm pompom and attach to tip of hat. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® With Love Chunky™: 2 balls 1939 Papaya
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8mm [US L-11] and 10mm [US N/P-15]
3⅜" (85mm) diameter pompom maker (optional)
yarn needle
abbreviations: blo = work in back loop only of indicated stitch
sc2tog (single crochet decrease): [Insert hook into next stitch and pull up a loop] twice; yarn over and draw through all three loops on hook – 1 stitch decreased.
measurements: To fit head circumference: 20 (22)" [51 (56) cm]; Finished circumference: 19¼ (20)" [49 (51) cm]
gauge: 10 sts = 4" (10 cm); 8 rows = 4" (10 cm) in crossed sc with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Brim
With smaller hook, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in blo in each st across, turn. Repeat Row 2 forty-six (forty-eight) more times. Bring short ends of Brim together. Sc across short ends, stitching through both ends at the same time to seam. Do not fasten off.
Body
Change to larger hook.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each Brim row end around; join with a slip st to first sc, turn – 48 (50) sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, *skip next sc, sc in next sc, sc in previous skipped sc; repeat from * around, join with a slip st to 1st sc, turn.
Repeat Round 2 until hat measures 7" (17.75 cm) long.
Crown Decreases
Round 1: Ch 1, *sc2tog, [skip next sc, sc in next sc, sc in previous skipped sc] two (three) times, sc2tog; repeat from * around, join with a slip st to 1st sc, turn – 12 (10) sts dec, 36 (40) sts total.
Repeat Round 1 two (three) more times – 12 (10) sts.
Fasten off, leaving a 6" (15 cm) yarn tail.
FINISHING
Thread yarn through yarn needle and draw through remaining sts twice; draw up firmly and fasten securely. Optional: Using pompom maker, make pompom and attach securely. With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends. Wash and lay flat to block.

materials: Red Heart ® Super Saver ® Super Craft Kit™ Brights Kit includes: 12 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (93 yds/85 m each; 1116 yds/1020 m total)
Colors: White, Day Glow Yellow, Minty, Turqua, Hot Red, Pretty N’ Pink, Day Glow Orange, Light Jasmine, Amethyst, Flamingo, Blue
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates ® yarn needle
Tape measure
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
measurements: One size to fit Adult - approx 20" [51 cm] circumference.
gauge: 12 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.
NOTES
• When changing colors, work hdc to last 3 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 3 loops on hook and proceed in new color, keeping color change to WS of work.
• Carry color not in use along top of last row and work new sts around carried color.
• Ch 1 at beg of rnds does not count as hdc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first hdc at end of rnd.

CROWN
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to make ring. See diagram on page 6.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. *With Color 2, 2 hdc in next hdc. With Color 1, 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. With Color 2, 2 hdc in last hdc. Join Color 1 with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: With Color 1, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 2 hdc in next hdc. *With Color 2, 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc.** With Color 1, 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join Color 1 with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: With Color 1, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. *With Color 2, 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc.** With Color 1, 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join Color 1 with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: With Color 1, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. *With Color 2, 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc.** With Color 1, 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then * to ** once more. Join Color 1 with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: With Color 1, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. *With Color 2, 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc.** With Color 1, 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join Color 2 with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.

Proceed in Check Pat as follows:
7th to 10th rnds: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *With Color 1, 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. With Color 2, 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc.** Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join Color 2 with sl st to first hdc at end of 7th to 9th rnds. Join Color 1 with sl st to first hdc at end of 10th rnd.
11th to 14th rnds: With Color 1, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *With Color 2, 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc.** With Color 1, 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join Color 1 with sl st to first hdc at end of 11th to 13th rnds. Join Color 2 with sl st to first hdc at end of 14th rnd.

BRIM
15th rnd: With Color 2, working in back loops only, ch 1. 1 hdcbl in same sp as sl st. 1 hdcbl in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdcbl in next hdc. 1 hdcbl in each of next 2 hdc. *With Color 1, 1 hdcbl in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdcbl in next hdc. 1 hdcbl in each of next 2 hdc.** With Color 2, 1 hdcbl in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdcbl in next hdc. 1 hdcbl in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join Color 2 with sl st to first hdc. 70 hdc.
16th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. *With Color 1, 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc.** With Color 2, 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join Color 2 with sl st to first hdc. 80 hdc.
17th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. *With Color 1, 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc.** With Color 2, 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join Color 2 with sl st to first hdc. 90 hdc.
18th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. *With Color 1, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc.** With Color 2, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join Color 2 with sl st to first hdc. 100 hdc.
19th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *With Color 1, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc.** With Color 2, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * 3 times, then from * to ** once more. Join Color 2 with sl st to first hdc. 110 hdc.
20th rnd: With Color 2 only, ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
Break Color 2.
21st rnd: With Color 1, sl st in each hdc around. Join with sl st in first sl st.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft®(6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Taupe (9783) 1 ball
Bernat® Faux Fur Pompom Grey Lynx (01042) 1 Pompom
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit average woman.
gauge:
12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
7 star clusters and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Ribbing: With smaller hook ch 13.
1st row: (RS). Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sl sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each of next 12 sl sts. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Do not fasten off.
Join back seam: Working in back loops only, sl st last row and rem loops of foundation ch tog. Do not fasten off. Turn work, change to larger hook and beg working in rnds as follows: See Diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 71 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. 71 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. Draw up a loop in each of the following sps: 2nd and 3rd loops from hook, same sc as last sl st and each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook – beg Star Cluster made. Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of the following sps: Top of previous Star Cluster, under 2 vertical strands of last st of previous Star Cluster, in same sp as last loop drawn up of previous Star Cluster and each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook –Star Cluster made. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch-3. 35 Star Clusters.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in first ch-1 sp. 1 sc in top of next Star Cluster. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 71 sc.
