Rep last 2 rnds until work from beg (including ribbing) measures approx 6½" [16.5 cm], ending on a 2nd rnd. 
Dec for crown as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 61 sts.
2nd and alt rnds: Ch 3. Beg Star Cluster. Ch 1. *Star Cluster. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch-3.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 51 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 41 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 31 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc3tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 7 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely.
Sew Faux Fur Pompom to top of Hat.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Black (0312) 1 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Susan Bates® stitch markers.
measurements: Hat to fit 16 (18-20-22)" [40.5 (45.5-51-56) cm] head circumference.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions: The instructions are written for S. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written S (M-L-XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Note: Hat is worked flat and then seamed. HAT Ch 2. See diagrams on page 3. 1st row: (RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 12 sc. 5th to 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 8th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 18 sc. 9th to 11th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 12th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 24 sc. 13th to 15th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 16th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 30 sc. 17th to 19th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 20th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 36 sc. 21st to 23rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 24th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 42 sc. 25th to 27th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 28th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 48 sc. 29th to 31st rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Sizes M, L and XL only: 32nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 54 sc. 33rd to 35th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 36th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 60 sc. 37th to 39th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Sizes L and XL only: 40th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 66 sc. 41st to 43rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 44th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 72 sc. 45th to 47th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Size XL only: 48th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 78 sc. 49th to 51st rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Sizes S, M and L only: Next 1 (2–2) row(s): Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. All Sizes: Cont for Brim as follows: See diagram on page 3. 1st row: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). Working in back loops only, 1 dc in first sc. 2 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 96 (120-144-156) dc. 2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 112 (140-168-182) dc. 3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 13 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 120 (150-180-195) dc. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving long yarn tail for sewing. With long yarn tail, sew back Hat seam. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein of 726 Coral
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5 mm [US H-8] and 6 mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses as indicated
measurements: Finished Hat Size: 20 (22)” (51 (56) cm) head circumference
gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 3.5” (9 cm)
instructions:
HAT
Round 1 (Right side): With smaller size hook, ch 4; 11 dc in fourth ch from hook (skipped chs count as first dc), join with slip st to first dc: 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc, now and throughout), dc in same dc, 2 dc in each dc around; join with slip st to first dc: 24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same dc, dc in next dc, (2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc) around; join with slip st to first dc: 36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same dc, dc in next 2 dc, (2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc) around; join with slip st to first dc: 48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same dc, dc in next 3 dc, (2 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc) around; join with slip st to first dc: 60 dc.
Size Medium Only
Rounds 6-11: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join with slip st to first dc.
Round 12: With larger size hook, ch 6 (counts as first dc plus ch-3 sp), dc in next dc, (ch 3, dc in next dc) around, ch 3; join with slip st to first dc: 60 dc and 60 ch-3 sps.
Round 13: Ch 3, (skip next ch-3 sp, dc in next dc) around; join with slip st to first dc.
Rounds 14 and 15: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join with slip st to first dc; fasten off.
Size Large Only
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in same dc, dc in next 4 dc, (2 dc in next dc, dc in next 4 dc) around; join with slip st to first dc: 72 dc.
Rounds 7-12: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join with slip st to first dc.
FLOWER
Round 1 (Right side): With smaller size hook, ch 4; 11 dc in fourth ch from hook (skipped chs count as first dc), join with slip st to first dc: 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next dc, (ch 7, sc in next dc) around, ch 7; join with slip st to first sc; fasten off.
FINISHING
Thread yarn needle with a length of yarn. Using photo as a guide, sew wrong side of Flower to right side of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 1 ball each of 8429 Grey A, and 8671 Neon Green B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10½]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Finished Circumference: 19½ (22½)” (49.5 (57) cm), will stretch to fit a range of sizes. Finished Height: 9 (10)” (23 (25.5) cm)
gauge: 10 sts = 4” (10cm); 9 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in half double
instructions:
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 7 (8) sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—7 (8) sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in same sc as joining slip st, 2 hdc in next 6 (7) sc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—14 (16) hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next st, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st] 6 (7) times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—21 (24) hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 2 sts, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts] 6 (7) times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—28 (32) hdc.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 3 sts, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts] 6 (7) times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—35 (40) hdc.
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 4 sts, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts] 6 (7) times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—42 (48) hdc.
Round 7: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 5 sts, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 5 sts] 6 (7) times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—49 (56) hdc.
Next 1 (2) Rounds: Ch 2, skip same st as joining, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 and change to B.
Next 2 Rounds: With B, ch 2, skip same st as joining, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 and change to A at end of 2nd round.
Next 4 Rounds: With A, ch 2, skip same st as joining, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 and change to B at end of 4th round.
Next 2 Rounds: With B, ch 2, skip same st as joining, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 and change to A at end of 2nd round.
Repeat last 6 rounds to work one more stripe with A and one more stripe with B.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Cotton-ish™ by Vickie Howell (2.4 oz/70 g; 282 yds/258 m)
Sizes 6/12 mos 18/24 mos 4 yrs
Crimson Twine (85434) or Cotton Harvest (85628) or Lemon Twill (85620) or Jade Jersey (85700) or Royal Denim (85134) 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit head circumference: 6/12 mos 17” [43 cm], 18/24 mos 18” [45.5 cm], 4 yrs 19” [48 cm]
gauge: 16 half double crochet (hdc) and 10½ rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Note: Chain (ch) 2 at beginning (beg) of rounds (rnds) does not count as half double crochet (hdc).
Ch 3.
1st round (rnd): 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Repeat (rep) from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 hdc.
Size 6/12 mos only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
Sizes 18/24 mos and 4 yrs only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 64 hdc.
Size 4 yrs only: 9th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 15 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 68 hdc.
All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 7½ (8-8½)” [19 (20.5-21.5) cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd 3 times more.
Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Kroy Socks™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 166 yds/152 m) Flax (55011)    2 balls
Size U.S. C/2 [2.75 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in the back loop only
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 24 sc and 26 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Hat is worked sideways. Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc.
Ch 68.
Foundation row:  1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to last 8 sts. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Turn.
1st row:  Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of next 8 sts. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS-see diagram) in each of next 58 hdc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 58 hdc. 1 scbl in each of next 8 sts. Turn.
Rep these 2 rows until work from beg measures approx 20" [51 cm], when slightly stretched. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Weave end through last scbl of each row along top edge and gather tightly. Sew back seam.
WS of work shown

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™ Blend”: 2 skeins 1870 Denim
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: sc2tog (sc dec) = Insert hook into st and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next st and draw up a loop. Yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
tr2tog = (Yo twice and insert the hook into the next st, yarn over, draw up a loop, yarn over, and draw through 2 of the loops on hook) twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Head Circumference: 20 (22)”
gauge: 13 sc = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 65 (73). 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 64 (72) sc.
Rows 2-5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 4 (counts as tr), *2 tr in next 3 (2) sc, tr in next sc; repeat from * to last 0 (3) sc, tr in last 0 (3) sc, turn – 112 (118) sts.
Rows 7-9: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 10: Ch 4 (counts as tr), tr in each sc across, turn.
Rows 11-12: Repeat Row 7.
Row 13: Sc2tog, *sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * to last 2 sts, sc2tog (sc in last 2 sts), turn – 92 (98) sts.
Row 14: Repeat Row 10.
Rows 15-16: Repeat Row 7.
Row 17: Ch 1, sc in next 4 (2) sc, *sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across, turn – 70 (74) sts.
Row 18: Repeat Row 10.
Rows 19-20: Repeat Row 7.
Row 21: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * to last 1 (2) sts, sc in last 1 (2) sts, turn – 47 (50) sts.
Row 22: Ch 4 (counts as tr), *tr2tog, tr in next st; repeat from * to last st, tr in last st, turn – 32 (34) sts.
Row 23: Repeat Row 7.
Row 24: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * to last 2 (1) sts, sc2tog (sc in last st), turn – 21 (23) sts.
Row 25: Repeat Row 7.
Row 26: Ch 1, [sc2tog] across to last st, sc in last st, turn – 11 (12) sts.
Row 27: Ch 1, sc in next 1 (0) st, [sc2tog] across, turn – 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
FINISHING
Weave tail through last sts and pull tight. Sew back seam closed. 
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 1 ball each 8884 Peacock A, 8532 Purple B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures about 21 (24)” (53.5 (61) cm) circumference.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm) in double crochet (dc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Size Large Only—Round 7: Ch 2, dc in same st as joining, dc in next 5 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—84 dc.
Body of Hat
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Repeat Round 1 until piece measures 8” (20.5 cm) from beginning. Fasten off.
Brim
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join B with sc in any st, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Directions are for size Small/Medium. Round 7 is added for Large size hat.
Special Technique
Adjustable-ring = Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work stitches of first round in the ring. After the first round of stitches is worked, pull gently on tail to tighten ring.
HAT
Shape Crown
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 2, dc in same st as joining, 2 dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 2, dc in same st as joining, dc in next st, *2 dc in next st, dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 2, dc in same st as joining, dc in next 2 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 2, dc in same st as joining, dc in next 3 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 2, dc in same st as joining, dc in next 4 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—72 dc.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool (100 g / 3.5 oz) 77707 (That's Red) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension
6 ins [15 cm] ribbon 3 mm wide for hatband
Glue
Pin backing for lapel pin
Key chain hardware for key chain
Stick pin and backing for hat pin
Small clip for purse decoration
measurements: Approx 2 ins ½ [6 cm] in diameter after felting.
gauge: 12 sc and 12 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 3.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to form a ring.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
4th and 5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 25 sc.
8th rnd: As 4th rnd. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Felt Hat following How to Felt instructions. Shape Hat while wet and allow to dry away from heat and direct sunlight.
Wrap ribbon around Hat for hatband as shown in picture and glue in position. Glue or sew pin backing to back of Hat brim for Lapel Pin. Sew key chain to edge of Hat brim for Key Chain. Attach stick pin to back of Hat brim for Hat Pin. Sew clip to back of Hat brim for Purse Clip.

materials: Red Heart® With Love™: 1 skein 1909 Holly Berry for Child or 1530 Violet for adult.
Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: To fit head circumference: 18-20 (20-22)”.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 7 rounds = 4” in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Round 1: Begin at top, ch 3 (does not count as a st); 10 (12) dc in 3rd ch from hook; join with a slip st in top of first dc – 10 (12) dc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), 2 dc in first dc and in each dc around; join in first dc – 20 (24) dc.
Round 3: Ch 2, 2 dc in first dc, dc in next dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] 9 (11) times; join – 30 (36) dc.
Round 4: Ch 2, 2 dc in first dc, dc in next 2 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc] 9 (11) times; join – 40 (48) dc.
Adult Size Only-Round 5: Ch 2, 2 dc in first dc, dc in next 3 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc] 11 times; join – 60 dc.
Both Sizes-Rounds 5-11 (6-12): Ch 2, dc in first dc and in each dc around; join.
Round 12 (13): Ch 1, sc in first 10 (12) dc, hdc in next dc, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next 12 (16) dc, dc in next dc, hdc in next dc, sc in last 14 (28) dc; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 13 (14): Ch 1, sc in first 10 (12) sc, hdc in next hdc, dc in next dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] 12 (16) times, dc in next dc, hdc in next hdc, sc in last 14 (28) sc; join.
Child Size Only-Round 14: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sc, hdc in next hdc, dc in next 38 dc, hdc in next hdc, sc in last 14 sc; join.
Both Sizes-Round 15: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join. Fasten off.
Strap
Ch 34 (36).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, ch 29 (31), skip next 29 (31) ch, sc in last 2 ch; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, ch 31 (33), sc in last 2 sc. Fasten off.
Buttons (Make 2)
Ch 2; 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc.
FINISHING
Attach strap above brim. Sew a button over sc at each end of strap.

materials: Bernat® Beyond™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 80 yds/73 m)
Contrast A Hot Pink (23007) or Red (23008) - 2 balls for each 4/6, 8/10, and Adult
Contrast B Pumpkin (23009) or Gray Scale Varg (23024) - 1 ball for each 4/6, 8/10, and Adult
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Stitch marker
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not counts as hdc.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 12 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 18 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
Size 4-6 only: 7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
Sizes 8-10 and Adult only: 7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 42 hdc.
Size Adult only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 45 hdc.
All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Rep last rnd until Hat from beg measures 7½ (8½-9)" [19 (21.5-23) cm]. Join B at end of last rnd. Break A.
With B, rep last rnd 3 times more.
Last rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m)
Contrast A Topaz (53514)
Contrast B Natural (07414)
Contrast C Clay (53041)
Contrast D Black (07421)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle
measurements: To fit 3 mos (6 mos-12 mos-4/6 yrs-8/10 yrs-Teen).
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
• Rnds are joined with a sl st to first st.
With A, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 10 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in each st around. Join. 20 sts.

3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.

Size 0-3 mos only:
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 44 sts.
6th to 11th rnds: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. Do not fasten off.

Size 6-12 mos only:
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
6th to 12th rnds: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. Do not fasten off.

Size 12-24 mos only:
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 55 sts.
7th to 13th rnds: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. Do not fasten off.

Size 4/6 yrs only:
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sts.
7th to 14th rnds: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. Do not fasten off.

Size 8/10 yrs only:
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 14 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sts.
8th to 15th rnds: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. Do not fasten off.

Size Teen only:
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 14 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sts.
8th to 16th rnds: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. Do not fasten off.

All sizes: First Earflap
1st row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 10 (10-12-12-14-14) sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each st to last 2 sts. Dc2tog. Turn. 8 (8-10-10-12-12) sts.
Rep last row 2 (2-3-3-4-4) times more. 4 sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 14 (16-16-18-18-20) times. Fasten off.

Second Earflap
On opposite edge of Hat from First Earflap, join A with sl st. Work as given for First Earflap.

Sloth Claws (work at end of both Earflaps)
Join B with sl st to bottom of Earflap.
1st row: *Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Sl st in next st along bottom of Earflap. Rep from * twice more. Fasten off.

Eye Patches (make 2)
With C, ch 7.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of chain, 1 sc in each stitch until end of chain. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 2 sc in each of next 3 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

Eyes (make 2)
With D, begin using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join. Fasten off.
Stitch Eyes to corners of Eye Patches as shown in photo.

Face
With B, ch 12.
1st rnd: 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to last ch. 3 dc in last ch. Working into opposite side of chain, 1 dc in each st to last st. 3 dc in last st. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in next st) 5 times. 2 dc in each of next 3 sts. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in next st) 4 times. 2 dc in each of last 3 sts. Join.

Sizes 4/6 yrs, 8/10 yrs, and Teen only:
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in first st. 1 dc in each st to last st. 2 dc in last st. Join. Fasten off.

Nose
With D, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Stitch Nose to middle of Face as shown in photo. Backstitch on a smile. Stitch Face to middle front of Hat. Stitch Eye Patches to sides of Face.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Stripes™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m) Polo Stripe (4960) 2 balls or 299 yds/273.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet through back loop
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Ribbing: Ch 21.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 20 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures 19½" [49.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Join ribbing: With WS facing, working through both thicknesses of foundation ch and last row of ribbing, work 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not fasten off.
Turn Ribbing sideways and work 72 sc evenly around long edge of Ribbing. Join with sl st to first sc.
Proceed in Shell Pat as follows: (see diagram on page 2)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 sc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 2 dc in first sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc and 2 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 dc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds for Shell St Pat until work from first rnd of sc after Ribbing measures approx 6½" [16.5 cm], ending on 2nd rnd.
Shape top: 1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc and 2 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 dc. Join with sl st to first sc. 50 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next dc. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next dc. 1 dc in first sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next dc. 1 hdc in next sc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc and dc. Skip next dc. 1 hdc in next sc. Skip next dc. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sts.
4th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Thread end through front loops of rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Fold Ribbing in half to RS.
Pompom:  Wind yarn around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Witch hat
main color (mc) Black (00002) 2 balls (195 m/210 yds)
contrast a Grape (00071) 1 ball (37 m/40 yds)
contrast B Hot Purple (01317) 1 ball (28 m/30 yds)
Wizard hat
main color (mc) Black (00002) 1 ball (100 m/108 yds)
contrast a Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball (82 m/85 yds)
contrast B Yellow (00010) 1 ball (22 m/24 yds)
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit 21" [53.5 cm] head circumference. Approx 13" [33 cm] tall.
gauge: 15 hdc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
note: Ch 2 does not count as st at beg of rnd.
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 12 hdc.
4th and 5th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 18 hdc.
7th and 8th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
9th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
10th and 11th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
12th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
13th and 14th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. Break B.
15th rnd: With A, ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
16th and 17th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
18th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 42 hdc.
19th and 20th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
21st rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
22nd and 23rd rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
24th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc) 6 times. Join MC with sl st to first hdc. Break A. 54 hdc.
25th and 26th rnds: With MC, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
27th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
28th and 29th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
30th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 66 hdc.
31st and 32nd rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
33rd rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 72 hdc.
34th and 35th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
36th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc) 6 times. Join B with sl st to first hdc. Break MC. 78 hdc.
37th and 38th rnds: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
39th rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 38 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) twice. Join with sl st to first hdc. Join MC at end of last rnd. Break B. 80 hdc.
Witch Version only:
Brim: 40th rnd: With MC, ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sc.
41st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 5 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
42nd and 43rd rnds: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Join B at end of 43rd rnd.
44th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Wizard Version only:
Brim: 40th rnd: With MC, ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sc.
41st rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 96 sc.
42nd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 104 sc.
43rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc) 8 times. Join A with sl st to first sc. Break MC. 112 sc.
44th rnd: With A, ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 120 sc.
45th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Buckle: With B, ch 12. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in each ch around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
Sew Buckle to front of hat as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart ™ Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Contrast A Summer Night (0212) 1 ball
Contrast B Sandy Shores (0110) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from left to right. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Note: Do not break yarn. Carry colors not in use loosely up WS of work.
With A and larger hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 1) in ring. (2 dc. ch 1) 5 times. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: With B, sl st in next dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 ch-1 sps.
3rd rnd: With A, sl st in next dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: With B, sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join A with sl st to top of ch 3. 18 ch-1 sps.
5th rnd: With A, sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3.
6th rnd: With B, sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) five times. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * once, then from * to ** once more. Join A with sl st to top of ch 3. 21 ch-1 sps.
7th rnd: With A, as 5th rnd, join B at end of rnd.
8th rnd: With B, as 5th rnd, join A at end of rnd. Rep last 2 rnds until Hat from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], ending with a B rnd. Join A with sl st to top of ch 3.
Ribbing: Change to smaller hook and proceed as follows:
1st rnd: With A, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around next sc. Dcbp around next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
Rep last rnd until ribbing measures 2" [5 cm].
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Light & Lofty®”: 1 Skein 9930 Paprika Multi.
Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5] and 5.5mm [US I-9].
Red seed beads
bead weaving thread
beading needle
15” of thin flat black elastic
stitch markers
yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures 8” in diameter and is made to wear tilted slightly to left.
gauge: 8 dc = 4”; 4 rows = 4” using larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With larger hook, ch 6, slip st in first st to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 13 dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch to join. Place marker for beginning of round – 14 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, 2 dc in same space, 3 dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 42 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch. 
Round 4: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch. 
Fasten off.
Loopy Flower
With smaller hook, ch 16, slip st in first ch to form a loop, [ch 15, slip st into same ch] 9 more times – 10 petals. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Thread 5 beads onto beading thread and secure in center of Flower. Continue to add clusters of 5 beads in center of Flower. Knot to secure.
Sew Flower at edge of Hat so petals drape over edge. Cut a length of elastic to fit from edges of Hat around chin. Sew ends of elastic on either side of Hat on wrong side along inside edge. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Premium™ (7 oz / 198 g;360 yds/329 m)

Contrast B Soft Gray Heather (58001) 1 ball
Contrast C Evergreen (58515)               1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit average Adult’s head.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Stripe Pat
With A – 8 rnds. 
With B – 7 rnds. 
With C – 7 rnds. 
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. 
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc. 
4th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc. 
5th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc. 
6th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc. 
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
8th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc) 8 times. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 56 hdc. 
9th rnd: With B, as 7th rnd. 
10th rnd:  Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 64 hdc.
