materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Main Color (MC) Clay (28041), Redwood (28522), Soft Taupe (28011), Ultra Blue (28742) or Glowing Gold (28607) 1 1 ball
Contrast A Grass (28223), Soft Taupe (28011), Pumpkin (28630), Glowing Gold (28607) or Clay (28041) 1 1 ball
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit child 4/6 (8/12) yrs
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size, the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to both sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.

With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
Size 8/12 only: 5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 15 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 34 sc.
Both sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Skip first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to beg ch-2.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last 2 rnds until Hat from beg measures 7½ (8) [19 (20.5) cm]. Fasten off.
Next rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Pompom: Wind 2 strands of A around 4 fingers approx 40 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew pompom to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® "Fiesta®": 1 Skein 6013 Wheat.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat Circumference: 20".
gauge: Square = 5" x 5". CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Squares can be sewn together OR joined together on the last round. If joining, work the first square through Rnd 5, then join subsequent squares while working Joining Rnd 5.

SQUARE: Ch 8; join with a sl st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, 16 sc in ring; join with a sl st in first sc.
Rnd 2: Ch 4, [dc in next sc, ch 1] 15 times; join with a sl st in 3rd ch of ch-4.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, * 2 sc in next sp, ch 3, skip next dc, 2 sc in next sp **, sc in next dc; rep from * around, end at **; join in first sc.
Rnd 4: Ch 1, * 9 dc in next ch-3 sp, skip next 2 sc, sl st in next sc, (4 dc, ch 3, 4 dc) all in next ch-3 sp, skip next 2 sc **, sl st in next sc; rep from * around, end at **; join in first ch-1.
Rnd 5: Sl st in first 4 dc, [sl st in 5th dc of 9-dc group, ch 5, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in next ch-3 sp, ch 5, skip next 9 sts] 4 times, join in 5th sl st. Fasten off.

Joining Rnd 5: Sl st in first 4 dc, sl st in 5th dc of 9-dc group, ch 5, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in next ch-3 sp; ch 1, hold squares with wrong sides together and sl st in any corner ch-3 sp of adjoining square, ch 1, 2 dc in same corner sp on working square, ch 1, sl st in next ch-2 sp of adjoining square, ch 1, 2 dc in same corner sp on working square, ch 5, sl st in 5th dc of 9-dc group on working square, sl st in corresponding sl st of adjoining square, ch 5, 2 dc in next ch-3 sp on working square, ch 1, sl st in next ch-2 sp in adjoining square, ch 1, 2 dc in same corner sp on working square, ch 1, sl st in next ch-3 sp in adjoining square, ch 1, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in same corner sp on working square – one side joined; complete square as written. Join on 2 or 4 sides as required, noting that to join 4 sides for top of hat, begin joining at first sl st in 5th dc of 9-dc group and at the next ch-2 sp before the first corner.

HAT: Make 4 squares and join or sew together to form a circle. Make a 5th square and join or sew on top of circle.
Hat Brim-Rnd 1: With right side facing, join yarn in corner of any square; ch 1, work 16 sc evenly spaced across each square; join to first sc – 64 sc.
Rnd 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 316 Black A and 3620 Glowworm B
Susan Bates ® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22)” [51 (56) cm] circumference.
gauge: 12 sts and 12 rows
instructions:
Ribbing
With A, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across – 5 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in back loops of each st across.
Rows 3-59 (65): Repeat Row 2.
Do not fasten off.

Body
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, rotate to work into row ends, work 60 (66) sc evenly along row ends of ribbing – 60 (66) sts. Fasten off A.
Row 2: With Right Side facing, join B with sc in first st of Row 1, sc in each remaining st across. ribbing = 4” (10cm).
CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, changing to A in last st.
Row 4: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), turn, skip first st, dc in each remaining st across.
Row 5: Ch 3, turn, skip first st, dc in each remaining st across, changing to B in last st.
Rows 6-7: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, changing to A in last st of Row 7.
Rows 8-9: Repeat Rows 4-5.
Rows 10-11: Repeat Rows 6-7.
Row 12: With A, ch 3, turn, skip first st, dc in next 3 sts, dc2tog, [dc in next 4 dc, dc2tog] 9 (10) times – 50 (55) sts.
Row 13: Ch 3, turn, skip first st, dc in next 2 dc, dc2tog, [dc in next 3 dc, dc2tog] 9 (10) times, changing to B in last st – 40 (44) sts.
Row 14: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 10 (11) times – 30 (33) sts.
Row 15: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] 10 (11) times, changing to A in last st – 20 (22) sts.
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] 10 (11) times – 10 (11) sts.
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] 5 times, (sc in last st) – 5 (6) sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

Finishing
Weave yarn tail through sts of Row 17 and pull to close tightly. Fasten securely.
With Right Sides facing, align row ends and sew back seam. Weave in ends.

Notes
1. Ribbing is worked first. Hat is worked in turned rows then back seam is sewn.
2. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Carry old color loosely up side of piece until next needed.

Special Stitches
dc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc2tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Soft Ecru (00004) 1 ball
Contrast B Meadow (01135) 1 ball
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: One size to fit head circumference: 21" [53.5 cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
• Hat is worked from Top down, ending at the brim.
TOP
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
8th rnd: As 6th rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
10th rnd: As 6th rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
12th rnd: As 6th rnd.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join 72 sc.

14th rnd: As 6th rnd.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 78 sc. Join B.
16th to 19th rnds: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join A at end of last rnd.
20th and 21st rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join B at end of last rnd.
22nd to 25th rnds: As 16th to 19th rnds. Join A at end of last rnd.

BRIM
1st rnd: With A, ch 1. *2 scbl in first sc. 1 scbl in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 104 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st at end of rnd.
3rd to 6th rnds: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join A at end of last rnd.
7th rnd: With A, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 130 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join B at end of last rnd. Break A.
9th to 12th rnds: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off at end of 12th rnd.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Ways™”: 2 balls 3520 Aquarium.
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US I-9].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Head Circumference: 18 (20)”
gauge: 14 sc = 4”; 13 rows = 4” in Sc Rib pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 17. 
Foundation Row: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch 
across – 16 sc. 
Begin Sc Rib Pattern
Row 1 (WS): Ch 1, sc in front loop only of each sc across.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each sc across.
Repeat Rows 1 and 2 until piece measures 18 (20)” from 
beginning. 
Turn to work along long edge of piece. 
Next Row: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc 54 (60) sts evenly 
across long edge of ribbing – 55 (61) dc. 
Row 1 (WS): Ch 3 (counts as dc), *Bptr in next st, dc in 
next st; repeat from * across.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), *Fptr in next st, dc in next st; 
repeat from * across.
Repeat Rows 1 and 2 until piece measures 12 (12 1/2)” 
from beginning.
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Fold in half crosswise and sew sts of last row together for 
top of Hat. Sew side seam. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m)
Royalty (10530) 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit 2/4 yrs (8/10 yrs – Adult)
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. With MC, ch 54 (60-64). Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 (60-64) sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. Working into back loops only, 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds 2 (3-4) times more, then rep 2nd rnd once.
Shape crown: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 (8-6) hdc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 (54-56) stitches (sts). 2nd and alt rnds: Ch 2. Working into back loops only, 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 (7-5) hdc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 (48-48) sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 hdc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 35 (40-40) sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 hdc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 (32-32) sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 (24-24) sts.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *Working into back loops only, 1 hdc in next st. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 14 (16-16) sts.
11th rnd With MC, ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 7 (8-8) sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

materials: Red Heart® Baby TLC™: 1 ball each 7624 Lime A, 5881 Powder Blue B, and 5777 Lilac C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hat Circumference: 14 (16)” [36 (41) cm].
gauge: 22 sts = 4” (10 cm); 11 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern.
instructions:
With A, ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 4, [dc in ring, ch 1] 10 (12) times; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-4, slip st in next ch-1 space; change to B – 11 (13) ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: With B, ch 4, dc in same ch-1 space, ch 1, [(dc, ch 1, dc) all in next ch-1 space, ch 1] 10 (12) times; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-4, slip st in next ch-1 space; change to C – 22 (26) ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: With C, ch 1, sc in same ch-1 space, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, * ch 3, sc in next ch-1 space, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; TURN; do NOT join; change to A.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, sc in first dc, 3 dc in next sc, * ch 3, sc in next dc, 3 dc in next sc; repeat from * across changing to B in last st; turn.
Row 2: Repeat Row 1 except change to C in last st.
Row 3: Repeat Row 1 except change to A in last st.
Rows 4-9: Repeat Rows 1-3 twice.
Rows 10 and 11: Repeat Rows 1 and 2 once.
Toddler Size Only-Rows 12-14: Repeat Row 3, then Rows 1 and 2 once more.
Brim-Both Sizes
Row 12 (15): With C, sc in first 3 dc, sc in next sc, * sc in ch-3 space, sc in next 3 dc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across and at same time increase (decrease) 1 sc at middle of row; turn – 55 (63) sc.
Row 13 (16): Ch 1, sc in first sc, * ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across; turn – 27 (31) ch-3 spaces.
Row 14 (17): Ch 3, dc in first sc, sc in next ch-3 space, * 5 dc in next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * to last st; sc in last sc. Fasten off.
Edging
Sew back seam. With right side facing, join A at seam; ch 1, sc in first st, ch 1, * sc in next st, ch 1; repeat from * around; join in first sc. Fasten off.
To Change Color in Sc: Work last sc before color change until 2 loops remain on hook, drop color in use, with next color yo and draw through 2 loops; continue with new color.
To Change Color in Dc: Work last dc before color change until 2 loops remain on hook, drop color in use, with next color yo and draw through 2 loops on hook; continue with new color.
Special Abbreviations
dc2tog = [yo and draw up a loop in next st, yo and draw through 2 loops] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
dc3tog  = [yo and draw up a loop in next st, yo and draw through 2 loops] 3 times, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Hat directions are for Infant; changes for Toddler are in parentheses.
FLOWER
With C, ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 10 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, 5 dc in next sc, * sc in next sc, 5 dc in next sc; repeat from * around changing to A in last st; join.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, ch 1, * sc in next st, ch 1; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off.
Sew Flower to front of hat. With double strand of A embroider a French knot in center of Flower.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m; Heathers: 5 oz/141.7 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Contrast A Charcoal Heather (H9508) 1 ball
Contrast B Cool Green (39770) 1 ball
Contrast C Chartreuse (39771) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit average Man.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4"[10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Hat is worked sideways.
Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc.
To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook, yoh with new color through rem loops and proceed.
With A, ch 40.
Foundation row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 38 hdc.
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS-see diagram) in each of next 36 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 36 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 34 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked 34 hdc.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 32 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 32 hdc.
6th row: As 2nd row.
7th row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 32 hdc. Do not turn. *(Yoh and draw up a loop in side of last st of previous row. Yoh and draw up a loop in horizontal bar created below first unworked hdc 2 rows below. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Side hdc2tog made). 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below next unworked hdc 2 rows below. Rep from * twice more. 38 sts. Turn.
8th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each st to end of row. Turn. 38 hdc.

Section 2
**1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 36 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 36 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 34 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 34 hdc.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 32 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 32 hdc.
6th row: As 2nd row.
7th row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 32 hdc. Do not turn. *Side hdc2tog. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below next unworked hdc 2 rows below. Rep from * twice more. 38 sts. Turn.
8th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each st to end of row. Turn. 38 hdc.**

Section 3
Break A, join B.
1st row: (RS). With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 36 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 36 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row to end of row. Join C. Turn.
3rd row: With C, ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 34 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 34 hdc.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row to end of row. Join B. Turn.
5th row: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 32 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 32 hdc.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row to end of row. Join A. Turn.
7th row: (RS). With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each of next 32 hdc. Do not turn. *Side hdc2tog. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below next unworked hdc 2 rows below. Rep from * twice more. 38 sts. Turn.
8th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row in each st to end of row. Turn. 38 hdc.

Rep Section 2 from ** to ** 5 times more. Do not turn at end of last row.

materials: Caron® Latte Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m) Sunset Strip (97006) 1 ball or 218 yds/200 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® steel yarn needle
Susan Bates® Split-Lock Stitch Count Markers
measurements: One size to fit Adult – approx 21" [53.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Hat is worked from top down.
• Crown of Hat is worked in a continuous spiral. Do not join rnds of top unless otherwise stated. Move marker up each rnd to maintain rnd count.
• Join rnds of Side and Brim with sl st to first st.
Beg using magic loop method.
Crown:  1st rnd: Ch 1. 7 sc in ring. 7 sc. PM on last st. See diagram on page 2.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 21 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 28 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 35 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
7th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 49 sc.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc.
9th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 63 sc.
10 rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 70 sc.
11th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 77 sc.
12th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 84 sc.
Working in front loop only, join with sl st to first st. Do not continue to move marker. Leave marker in place.
Side: 1st rnd:  Ch 1. Working in front loops only,  1 sc in each sc around. Join.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marker measures 3¼" [8.5 cm].
Brim: 1st rnd:  Ch 1. Working in front loops only,  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 91 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Join. 98 sc.
4th and alt rndsRnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Join. 105 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Join. 112 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Join. 119 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Join. 126 sc.
12th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Working in back loop only, join with sl st to first sc.
13th rnd:  Working in back loops only, sl st in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
REPEAT UNTIL SIDES MEASURE 3¼”

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m) Lippy (68004) 1 O’Go
Sizes U.S. J/10 (6 mm) and U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 12 sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.

Stripe Pat
With D, work 4 rnds.
With A, work 2 rnds.
With C, work 4 rnds.
With A, work 2 rnds.
These 12 rnds form Stripe Pat.

HAT 
Ribbing: With E, ch 11.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 21" [53.5 cm] when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off. Join last row and first row tog with 1 row of sc. Break E.

Change to larger hook and proceed as follows:
1st rnd: Join D with sl st to side edge at join. Ch 1. Working along side edge, work 64 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with ‘Ch 1. Skip next sc.’ Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in last ch-1 sp just worked at end of last rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ‘Ch 1. Skip next sc.’ Join with sl st to first sc.

First 3 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last rnd until 12 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete. Break A. Join B at end of last rnd.

Shape Crown: 1st rnd: With B, sl st in last ch-1 sp just worked at end of last rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next [sc. Ch-1 sp. sc]. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Ch 1. Skip next [sc. Ch-1 sp. sc]. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ‘Skip next: sc, ch-1 sp and sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
2nd rnd: Sl st in last ch-1 sp just worked at end of last rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ‘Ch 1. Skip next sc.’ Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in last ch-1 sp just worked at end of last rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next [sc. Ch-1. Sc]. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ‘1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc.’ Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and pull up tightly. Fasten securely.

Pompom: Holding strands of A, B and C, wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 60 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to smooth round shape. Attach Pompom to top of Hat.

materials: Stitch Nation by Debbie Stoller™ “Washable Ewe™”: 1 ball 3540 Currant.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
() = work directions in parentheses into same st.
measurements: Hat measures 21” circumference x 11” tall (unfolded). Flower measures 4” across (at widest).
gauge: Round 1 of Hat = 1½” across; Rounds 1 and 2 of Hat = 2½” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 3; slip st in first ch from hook to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 10 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—11 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—22 dc.
Round 3: Ch 2, Beg-Cl working first leg in same st as join, ch 3, Cl in back bar of 3rd ch from hook (horizontal Cl made – 2 loops remain on hook), Cl in same st as 2nd leg of previous Beg-Cl (3 loops remain on hook), Cl in next dc, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook, *ch 3; 3Cltog working first leg in back bar of 3rd ch from hook, 2nd leg in same dc as last leg of previous Cl, and 3rd leg in next dc; repeat from * 18 more times, ch 3; 3Cltog working first leg in back bar of 3rd ch from hook, 2nd leg in same dc as last leg of previous Cl, and 3rd leg in slip st join of previous round; ch 3, Beg-Cl in back bar of 3rd ch from hook; join with slip st in base of first horizontal Cl—22 horizontal Cl.
Rounds 4–12: Ch 2, 2Cltog working first leg in same st as join and 2nd leg at base of next horizontal Cl, *ch 3; 3Cltog working first leg in back bar of 3rd ch from hook, 2nd leg in same st as last leg of previous Cl, and 3rd leg in base of next horizontal Cl; repeat from * 18 more times, ch 3; 3Cltog working first leg in back bar of 3rd ch from hook, 2nd leg in same st as last leg of previous Cl, and 3rd leg in slip st join of previous round, ch 3, Beg-Cl in back bar of 3rd ch from hook; join with slip st in base of first horizontal Cl—22 horizontal Cl.
Fasten off.

FLOWER
Ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: [Sc in ring, ch 3] 6 times; join with slip st in first ch-3 space—6 sc and 6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 1, 5 sc in each ch-3 space around; join with slip st in first sc—6 petals.
Round 3: Working behind the petals of Round 2, [slip st around post of next sc of Round 1, ch 3] 6 times; join with slip st in first ch-3 space.
Round 4: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, 3 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-3 space around; join with slip st in first sc—6 petals.
Round 5: Working behind petals of Round 4, ch 5, [skip next sc of Round 4, slip st around post of next sc of Round 4, ch 5] 5 times; join with slip st in first ch-5 space.
Round 6: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, 5 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-5 space around; join with slip st in first sc—6 petals.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Fold back brim. Using photograph as a guide, sew flower to hat. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 312 Black A, 324 Bright Yellow B; small amount 316 Soft White C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [US H-8] and 6mm [US J-10].
Yarn needle
small amount of polyester fiberfill
two 5mm wiggle eyes
glue to secure eyes.
abbreviations: sc2tog = draw up a loop in next 2 sc, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
A, B, C = color A, B, C
measurements: To fit 14 (16, 18)” [36 (41, 46) cm] head circumference.
gauge: 13 sts = 4” (10 cm); 14 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in sc with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Beginning at lower edge, with larger hook and A, ch 44 (52, 56); join with a slip st to first ch, making sure ch is not twisted.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with a slip st in back loop of first sc – 44 (52, 56) sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in back loop of first sc.
Maintain Stripe Pattern and repeat Round 2 until piece measures 6 (7, 8)” [15 (18, 20) cm] from beginning. Fasten off.
Sew a seam straight across the top of the hat. Fold the corners formed by the top seam into the center of the hat and tack in place.
Bumblebee Body
Row 1: Beginning at rear end, with smaller hook and A, ch 4; 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across changing to B in last st; turn – 12 sc.
Row 3: With B, ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 4: Repeat Row 3 changing to A at end of row.
Bumblebee Wings (Make 2)
Row 1: With smaller hook and C, ch 3; 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in next sc; turn – 4 sc.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, draw up a loop in next 4 sc, yo and draw through all 5 loops on hook. Fasten off.
Bumblebee Antenna (Make 2)
With A and smaller hook, ch 4. Fasten off.
Assembly
Sew seam of bumblebee, stuffing with fiber fill before closing seam. Sew wings and antennae to bumblebee in place as shown. Glue wiggle eyes in place. Sew completed bumblebee to center top of hat.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes™: 1 ball each 591 Posey A, 203 Daffodil B and 623 Spearmint C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H/8] and 5.5mm [US I/9]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished circumference 17 (18)” [43 (46) cm]
gauge: Rounds 1-4 = 4.5” (11.4cm) with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Your little boy (or girl) will look adorable in this stylish hat. It is crocheted in a trio of colors to coordinate with the blanket, but you can make it in any color to go with other outfits.
Round 1: Beg Cl in ring, ch 2, [Cl, ch 2] 5 times in ring; join with slip st in beg 3-dc Cl – 6 petals. Fasten off A.
Round 2: Join B with a slip st in any ch-2 space (beg Cl, ch 2, Cl) in same space, ch 2, [(Cl, ch 2, Cl) in next ch-2 space, ch 2] 5 times; join with slip st in beg Cl – 12 Cls. Fasten off B.
Round 3: Join C with slip st in any ch-2 space, ch 1, 3 sc in same space, ch 1, *skip next cl, 3 sc in next ch-2 space, ch 1; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc – 36 sc, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in each sc and ch-1 sp around; join with slip st in first dc – 48 sts. Fasten off C.
Round 5: Join A with sc in next st, ch 1, *skip next st, sc in next st, ch 1, sc in next st, ch 1; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st – 32 sc, 32 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off A.
Round 6: Join B with dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next st, *dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off B.
Round 7 (Wrong Side): With Wrong Side facing, join C with slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 1, sc in same space, ch 1, skip next st, *sc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st.
Round 8: Ch 3, turn; dc in each ch-1 space and st around; join with slip st in first st – 64 sts. Fasten off C.
Round 9: Join A with sc in any st, ch 1, skip next st, *sc in next st, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st – 32 sts. Fasten off A.
Round 10-13: Repeat Rounds 6-9.
Brim
Row 14: Join B with sc in any ch-1 space, [skip next st, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, skip next st, sc in next ch-1 space] 6 times; turn, slip st in next 2 dc, ch 1 – 25 sts.
Row 15: Sc in next st, [4 dc in next sc, skip next st, sc in next st, skip next st] 5 times; turn, slip st in next 2 sts, ch 1 – 21 sts.
Row 16: Sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, [hdc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, hdc in next st, dc in next st] 3 times, hdc in next st, sc in next st, slip st in next st. Fasten off.
Edging
With Right Side facing, join A with slip st in first unworked st of Round 12; slip st in each st around to Brim, leaving sts of Brim unworked.
FINISHING
Weave in all ends.
Directions are for size Small. Size Medium is made by using larger hook.
Notes
Hat is worked in joined rounds. Do not turn unless otherwise indicated.
Brim is worked in turned rows after Round 12 of Hat.
Size of Hat is determined by size of crochet hook used.
Special Stitches
beg Cl = Ch 3, holding back last loops, work 2 dc in indicated st, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Cl = Holding back last loops, work 3 dc in indicated st, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.

materials: Caron® Colorama Halo™ (17.6 oz/500 g; 1059 yds/968 m) Teal Royal (94019) 1 ball or 205 yds/188 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® steel yarn needle.
Susan Bates® Split-Lock Stitch Count Markers.
measurements: One size to fit Adult – approx 21" [53.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Hat is worked from top down.
CROWN
Note: Crown of Hat is worked in a continuous spiral. Do not join rnds of top unless otherwise stated. Move marker up each rnd to maintain rnd count.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 7 sc in ring. 7 sc. PM on last st. See diagram on page 2.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 21 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 28 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 35 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 49 sc.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc.
9th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 63 sc.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 70 sc.
11th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 77 sc.
12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 84 sc. Working in front loop only, join with sl st to first st. Do not continue to move marker. Leave marker in place.
SIDE
Note: Join rnds of Side and Brim with sl st to first st.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marker measures 3¼" [8.5 cm].
BRIM
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 91 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Join. 98 sc.
4th and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Join. 105 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Join. 112 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Join. 119 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Join. 126 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Working in back loop only, join with sl st to first sc.
13th rnd: Working in back loops only, sl st in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein 319 Cherry Red.
Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 5mm [US H-8].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat Circumference = 19¾ (21)”.
gauge: 13 sts = 4”; 10 rounds = 4” in hdc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With larger hook, ch 64 (68); join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring taking care that ch is not twisted.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with a slip st in first sc – 64 (68) sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Ponytail Opening-Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, ch 10, skip next 9 sc, sc in each sc around; join.
Round 4: Ch 1, hdc in first sc, 9 hdc in ch-10 space, hdc in each sc around; join with a slip st in first hdc.
Rounds 5 and 6: Ch 1, hdc in each hdc around; join.
Round 7: Ch 1, [2 hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 3 hdc] 16 (17) times; join – 80 (85) hdc.
Rounds 8 and 9: Repeat Round 5.
Round 10: Ch 1, [hdc in next 4 hdc, skip next hdc] 16 (17) times; join – 64 (68) hdc.
Round 11: Ch 1, [hdc in next 3 hdc, skip next hdc] 16 (17) times; join – 48 (51) hdc.
Rounds 12-14: Repeat Round 5.
Round 15: Ch 1, [hdc in first hdc, skip next hdc] 24 (25) times, hdc in next 0 (1) hdc; join – 24 (26) hdc.
Round 16: Ch 1, sc in each hdc around; join.
For large only: 
Round 17: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Both Sizes-Round 17 (18): Ch 1, [sc in sc, skip next sc] 12 (13) times; join – 12 (13) sc.
Round 18 (19): Ch 1, [sc in sc, skip next sc] 6 times, sc in next 0 (1) sc; join – 6 (7) sc. Fasten off leaving a 6” yarn end. Weave yarn end through remaining sts; draw up firmly, fasten securely. Weave in ends.
Brim
Row 1: Skip 9 sts under Ponytail Opening and next 19 (20) sts of Round 1; with smaller hook, join yarn around the post of next sc; ch 1, sc around next 17 (19) sc; turn.
Rows 2-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 6. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m)
Contrast A Natural (07414) or Aqua (53201) 1 1 ball
Contrast B Aqua (53201) or Natural (07414) 1 1 ball
Size U.S.H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster V-St = *(Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through rem 3 loops on hook.* Ch 1. Rep from * to * once more in same stitch.
measurements: To fit Child 4-6 yrs (Adult).
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. Carry colors when not in use loosely up WS of work. Both Sizes: Beg at top of Hat, with A, ch 20. Join with sl st to first ch to make a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 24 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. Cluster V-St in same sc as last sl st. *Skip next sc. Cluster V-St in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to beg of first Cluster V-St. 12 Cluster V-Sts. 3rd rnd: Sl st across top of first Cluster V-St to ch-1 sp. Join B. Ch 2. Cluster V-St in same ch-1 sp as last sl st. Cluster V-St in each ch-1 sp of each Cluster V-St around. Join with sl st to beg of first Cluster V-St. 12 Cluster V-Sts. 4th rnd: Sl st across top of first Cluster V-St to ch-1 sp. Join A. Ch 2. Cluster V-St in same ch-1 sp as last sl st. *Cluster V-St in sp between 2 Cluster V-Sts from previous rnd. Cluster V-St in ch-1 sp of next Cluster V-St (skip in-between sp). Cluster V-St in ch-1 sp of next Cluster V-St. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to beg of first Cluster V-St. 18 Cluster V-Sts. 5th rnd: Sl st across top of first Cluster V-St to ch-1 sp. Join B. Ch 2. Cluster V-St in same ch-1 sp as last sl st. Cluster V-St in ch-1 sp of each Cluster V-St around. Join with sl st to beg of first Cluster V-St. 18 Cluster V-Sts. Child Size only: 6th rnd: Sl st across top of first Cluster V-St to ch-1 sp. Join A. Ch 2. Cluster V-St in same ch-1 sp as last sl st. Cluster V-St in ch-1 sp of each Cluster V-St around. Join with sl st to beg of first Cluster V-St. 18 Cluster V-Sts. 7th and 8th rnds: As 5th and 6th rnds. 9th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in ch-1 sp of next Cluster V-St. 1 sc between 2 Cluster V-Sts from previous rnd. 2 sc in ch-1 sp of next Cluster V-St. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sc. 10th to 13th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off and weave in ends. Adult Size only: 6th rnd: Sl st across top of first Cluster V-St to ch-1 sp. Join A. Ch 2. *(Cluster V-St in ch-1 sp of next Cluster V-St) 3 times. Cluster V-St in between 2 Cluster V-Sts from previous rnd. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to beg of first Cluster V-St. 24 Cluster V-Sts. 7th rnd: Sl st across top of first Cluster V-St to ch-1 sp. Join B. Ch 2. Cluster V-St in same ch-1 sp as last sl st. Cluster V-St in ch-1 sp of each Cluster V-St around. Join with sl st to beg of first Cluster V-St. 24 Cluster V-Sts. 8th rnd: Sl st across top of first Cluster V-St to ch-1 sp. Join A. Ch 2. Cluster V-St in same ch-1 sp as last sl st. Cluster V-St in ch-1 sp of each Cluster V-St around. Join with sl st to beg of first Cluster V-St. 24 Cluster V-Sts. 9th and 10th rnds: As 7th and 8th rnds. 11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in ch-1 sp of next Cluster V-St. 1 sc between 2 Cluster V-Sts from previous rnd. 2 sc in ch-1 sp of next Cluster V-St. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc. 12th to 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off and weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Pink Punch (2001) - Size S: 1 (165 yds/151 m), Size M: 1 (196 yds/179 m), Size L: 1 (242 yds/221 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Tape measure
measurements: Sizes S M L - Finished Hat Circumference: 18" [45.58 cm] - 20" [51 cm] - 22" [56 cm]
gauge: 14 half double crochet (hdc) and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions: Note: Yarn is worked as ‘self-striping’ yarn, allowing colors to change as they appear. Brim: Ch 10. 1st row: (RS). 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 63 (69 - 77) times more. Joining row: Ch 1. With first and last rows together, working through both thicknesses, slip stitch (sl st) in each st to end of row. Do not turn. 1st rnd: Working across long side of Brim, ch 1. Work 64 (70 - 78) sc evenly around. Join. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 half double crochet (hdc) in each sc around. Join. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first hdc. *Skip next hdc. 2 sc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. Skip last hdc. Join. 64 (70 - 78) sc. Rep last 2 rnds 7 (8 - 9) times more. [16 (18 - 20) rnds total]. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Skip last sc. Join. 32 (35 - 39) sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 1 (2 - 2) sc. Skip last 1 (2 - 2) sc. Join. 16 (17 - 19) sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 1 (2 - 2) sc. Skip last 1 (2 - 2) sc. Join. 8 (8 - 9) sc. Fasten off, leaving long end. Weave end through remaining stitches. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. PomPom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat. Notes: Ch 2 at beginning of rnd does not count as a st. Join all rnds with sl st to first st.

materials: Red Heart® Soft® (5 oz/141 g; 256 yds/234 m)
Contrast A Light Grey Heather (9440): S/M 1 ball, L/XL 1 ball
Contrast B Berry (9779): S/M 1 ball, L/XL 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Tape measure.
measurements: Small/Medium Approx 20" [51 cm] circumference and 9" [23 cm] tall. Large/Extra-Large Approx 24" [61 cm] circumference and 10.5" [26.5 cm] tall, excluding pompom.
gauge: 16 half double crochet (hdc) and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: The instructions are written for S/M size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus S/M (L/XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. USING THIS GUIDE Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools. NOTES • To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color. Carry color not in use carefully up wrong side of hat when next needed. • Chain (Ch) 2 at beginning (beg) of round (rnd) does not count as stitch (st). HAT With A, make a slip knot and place it on hook. Slip knot Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then draw through to make slip knot. Chain 2 (Ch 2). *Yarn over hook (Yoh), draw through loop – 1 chain made. Repeat (rep) from * once more – 2 chains made. 1st rnd: 7 (8) single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) in first sc. You will have 7 sc in this rnd if you are making S/M size Hat and 8 sc in this rnd if you are making L/XL size Hat. Note: Model on the photo wearing L/XL size Hat without pompom. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 half double crochet (hdc) in same space (sp) as sl st. 2 hdc in each of next 6 (7) sc. Join with sl st in first hdc. 14 (16) hdc. 3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in next hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 6 (7) times. Join with sl st in first hdc. 21 (24) hdc. 4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 6 (7) times. Join with sl st in first hdc. 28 (32) hdc. 5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc) 6 (7) times. Join with sl st in first hdc. 35 (40) hdc. 6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 6 (7) times. Join with sl st in first hdc. 42 (48) hdc. 7th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc) 6 (7) times. Join with sl st in first hdc. 49 (56) hdc. 8th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc) 6 (7) times. Join with sl st in first hdc. 56 (64) hdc. Next 1 (2) rnd(s): Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in first hdc. Join B at end of last rnd. Next 2 rnds: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in top of first hdc. Join A at end of last rnd. Next 3 rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in first hdc. Next rnd [increase (inc) rnd]: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc) 13 (15) times. Join with sl st in first hdc. Join B. 70 (80) hdc. Next 2 rnds: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in top of first hdc. Join A at end of last rnd. Next 4 rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in top of first hdc. Join B at end of last rnd. Next 2 rnds: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in top of first hdc. Join A at end of last rnd. Next 4 rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in top of first hdc. Join B at end of last rnd. Size S/M only: Next 4 rnds: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in first hdc. Size L/XL only: Next 2 rnds: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in first hdc. Next 2 rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in top of first hdc. Join B at end of last rnd. Next 2 rnds: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st in first hdc. Both sizes: Fasten off. To fasten off yarn, cut yarn leaving a long tail. Pull end through loop on hook and pull gently to tighten. FINISHING Using yarn needle, Weave in all yarn tails. We love seeing your makes! Share your photos using #YARNSPO and tag us @yarnspirations on Instagram or find us on Facebook.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn™”: 1 ball each of A, 9523 Dark Leaf B and 3729 Grape C
Crochet hook: I-9 (5.5mm)
Small pom-pom maker, 2”/5cm diameter
Yarn needle
measurements: Approximately 24”/61cm circumference at lower edge
gauge: 13 stitches and 8 rows = 4”/10cm in double crochet using size I/9 (5.5mm) crochet hook.
instructions:
Notes: Change color in the join of a round. Insert hook in first stitch of the round, yarn over with the new color and draw through all loops on hook. Cut and weave in the old color, or carry loosely up the inside of the hat. This pattern is written with no abbreviations so it is perfect for beginners.
Special Stitch
Front Post double crochet: Yarn over, insert hook from front to back to front around post of indicated stitch; yarn over and draw up loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice.
HAT
With A, make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn around index finger, forming a ring, remove ring from finger and hold working yarn behind ring. Insert hook into ring, yarn over and draw a loop through the ring. Work Round 1 in ring, then pull tail to cinch ring closed.
Round 1: Chain 3 (counts as first double crochet here and throughout), work 9 more double crochet in ring; join with slip stitch in top of beginning ch – 10 double crochet.
Round 2: Chain 3, double crochet in same stitch as join (increase made), 2 double crochet in each stitch around; join with slip stitch in top of beginning chain – 20 double crochet.
Round 3: Chain 3, double crochet in same stitch as join, double crochet in next stitch, [2 double crochet in next stitch, double crochet in next stitch] 9 times; join and change to C with slip stitch in top of beginning chain – 30 double crochet.
Round 4: With C, chain 3, double crochet in same stitch as join, double crochet in next 2 stitches, [2 double crochet in next stitch, double crochet in next 2 stitches] 9 times; join and change to B with slip stitch in top of beginning chain – 40 double crochet.
Round 5: With B, chain 1 (counts as first single crochet here and throughout), single crochet in same stitch as join, single crochet in next 3 stitches, [2 single crochet in next stitch, single crochet in next 3 stitches] 9 times; join and change to A with slip stitch in beginning chain – 50 single crochet.
Round 6: With A, chain 2 (counts as first half double crochet here and throughout), half double crochet in same stitch as join, half double crochet in next 4 stitches, [2 half double crochet in next stitch, half double crochet in next 4 stitches] 9 times; join and change to B with slip stitch in top of beginning chain – 60 half double crochet.
Round 7: With B, chain 3, double crochet in same stitch as join, double crochet in next 5 stitches, [2 double crochet in next stitch, double crochet in next 5 stitches] 9 times; join with slip stitch in top of beginning chain – 70 double crochet.
Round 8: Chain 3, double crochet in each stitch around; join with slip stitch in top of beginning chain.
Round 9: Chain 2, half double crochet in each stitch around; join and change to C with slip stitch in top of beginning ch.
Round 10: With C, chain 2, half double crochet in each stitch around; join and change to A with slip stitch in top of beginning chain.
Round 11: With A, chain 3, double crochet in each stitch around; join and change to B with slip stitch in top of beginning chain.
Round 12: With B, chain 1, single crochet in each stitch around; join and change to C with slip stitch in beginning chain.
Round 13: With C, chain 1, single crochet in each stitch around; join and change to A with slip stitch in beginning chain.
Round 14: With A, chain 3, double crochet in each stitch around; join with slip stitch in top of beginning chain.
Round 15: Chain 3, double crochet in each stitch around; join and change to B with slip stitch in top of beginning chain.
Round 16 (front post stitch round): With B, chain 3, Front Post double crochet around beginning chain of previous round, *double crochet in next stitch, Front Post double crochet around same stitch; repeat from * around; join with slip stitch in top of beginning chain – 140 stitches.
Round 17: Chain 3, skipping all Front Post double crochets of Round 16, double crochet in each double crochet around; join with slip stitch in top of beginning chain – 70 double crochet.
Round 18 (front post stitch round): Ch 3, Front Post double crochet around first Front Post double crochet 2 rows below, *double crochet in next stitch, Front Post double crochet around next Front Post double crochet 2 rows below; repeat from * around; join with slip stitch in top of beginning chain – 140 stitches.
Round 19: Ch 3, skipping all Front Post double crochet of Round 18, double crochet in each double crochet around; join with slip stitch in top of beginning chain – 70 double crochet.
Round 20: Repeat Round 18.
Round 21: Chain 1, skipping all Front Post double crochet of previous round, slip stitch in each double crochet around; join with slip stitch in beginning chain. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all ends. With C and pompom maker, make a 2”/5cm pom-pom. Sew pom-pom to top of hat.

materials: RED HEART® Grande™: 1 ball each 3927 Chianti A and 941 Barley B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 11.5mm [US P-16]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22½)" [51 (57) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 6 dc = 4½" (11.5 cm); 4 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With A, make an adjustable ring. Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 8 (9) dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—9 (10) dc. Pull gently on tail to close ring. Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—18 (20) dc. Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch; change to B—27 (30) dc.
Size Small only:
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, skip next dc, *2 dc in next dc, skip next dc; repeat from * around to last dc, dc in last dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—13 two-dc groups and 1 dc.
Rounds 5 and 6: Slip st in next dc, slip st in space before next 2-dc group, ch 3, dc in same space, *2 dc in next space between 2-dc groups; repeat from * 11 times, 2 dc in space before last dc, dc in space between last dc and beginning ch; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Round 7: Slip st in next dc; change to A, slip st in space before next 2-dc group, ch 3, dc in same space, *2 dc in next space between 2-dc groups; repeat from * 11 times, 2 dc in space before last dc, dc in space between last dc and beginning ch; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
Size Large only:
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, skip next dc, *2 dc in next dc, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—15 two-2 dc groups.
Rounds 5–7: Slip st in next dc, slip st in space before next 2-dc group, ch 3, dc in same space, 2 dc in each space between 2-dc groups around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 8: Slip st in next dc; change to A, slip st in space before next 2-dc group, ch 3, dc in same space, 2 dc in each space between 2-dc groups around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
Finish: Weave in all ends.

materials: Patons® Canadiana™ (100 g/3.5 oz; 187 m/205 yds)
Main Color (MC) Pale Teal (10743) 1 ball
Contrast A Crantini (10522) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: To fit child 2/4 (6/8-10/12) years.
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
Hat is worked from the top down.
HAT
With MC and leaving a long tail, ch 33 (42-48). Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist ch. (See Diagram 1 on page 2).
1st rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Miss next 2 ch. *(1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. Miss next 2 ch. Rep from * 9 (12-14) times more. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 11 (14-16) V-sts.
2nd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Miss next 2 dc. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 dc. Rep from * 9 (12-14) times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Sizes 6/8 and 10/12 only: 3rd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Miss next 4 dc. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 4 dc. Rep from * (12-14) times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep last rnd once more.
All sizes: Next rnd (A): Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. Miss next 4 dc. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Miss next 4 dc. Rep from * 9 (12-14) times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Next rnd (B): Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Miss next 2 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 dc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in ch-2 sp. Miss next 2 dc. Rep from * 8 (11-13) times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 22 (28-32) V-sts.
Next rnd (C): Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Miss next 2 dc. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 20 (26-30) times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Next rnd (D): Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Miss next 4 dc. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Miss next 4 dc. Rep from * 20 (26-30) times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Size 10/12 only: Next rnd: Rep last rnd once more.
All sizes: Beg decreasing for Hat Band:
1st rnd: Sl st to first ch-2 sp. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Miss next 4 dc. *(1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Miss next 4 dc. Rep from * 20 (26-30) times more. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
2nd rnd: Sl st to first ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Miss next 2 dc. *2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 dc. Rep from * 20 (26-30) times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 44 (56-64) sc.
4th to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Join A at end of last rnd.
8th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
With beg tail, draw yarn through foundation chain tightly and fasten securely.
FLOWER (See Diagram 2 on page 2)
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Rep from * once more. Do not join with sl st. 3 petals.
3rd rnd: Do not ch 1. Working in rem back loops of 1st rnd, 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Do not join with sl st. 6 petals.
5th rnd: Do not ch 1. Working in rem back loops of 3rd rnd, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Rep from * 7 times more. Do not join with sl st. 9 petals.
7th rnd: Do not ch 1. Working in rem back loops of 5th rnd, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Rep from * 10 times more. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off. 12 petals.
FINISHING
Sew Flower to Hat as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Unforgettable™: 2 balls 3935 Dragonfly.
Crochet Hook: 4 mm (US G-6)
Yarn Needle
Stitch Markers
abbreviations: dc2tog: *Yo, insert hook in st and draw up loop, yo, draw yarn through 2 loops, yo, insert hook in next st, yo, draw yarn through 2 loops, yo, draw through 3 loops.
Fpdc (front post double crochet): Yo, insert hook from front to back to front around the post of next st, (yo, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Bpdc (back post double crochet): Yo, insert hook from back to front to back around the post of next st, (yo, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook) twice.

Larks Head Knot: Fold 4 strands of yarn in half and using your crochet hook, pull the folded end through the stitch from front to back, hook the strands and pull them through the loop. Tighten knot by pulling the strands away from your design.
measurements: Finished size: 19½ (21½, 23”) in circumference. Directions are given for Adult Size Small. Changes for Medium and Large are in parentheses.
gauge: 9 sts = 2”, 12 rows = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Start at the top center, ch 4; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 12 sts. 
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in first st, 2 dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 24 sts.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next st, 2 Fpdc in next st, *dc in next 2 sts, 2 Fpdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 32 sts
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sts, 2 Fpdc in next st, *dc in next 3 sts, 2 Fpdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 40 sts
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next st, Fpdc in next st, dc in next st, 2 Fpdc in next st, *dc in next 2 sts, Fpdc in next st, dc in next st, 2 Fpdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 48 sts
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 4 sts, 2 Fpdc in next st, *dc in next 5 sts, 2 Fpdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 56 sts
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in next st, Fpdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 2 sts, 2 Fpdc in next st, *dc in next 2 sts, Fpdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 2 sts, 2 Fpdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 64 sts
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in next 6 sts, 2 Fpdc in next st, *dc in next 7 sts, 2 Fpdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 72 sts
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in next st, Fpdc in next 4 sts, dc in next 2 sts, 2 Fpdc in next st, *dc in next 2 sts, Fpdc in next 4 sts, dc in next 2 sts, 2 Fpdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 80 sts
Round 10: Ch 3, dc in next 8 sts, 1 (2, 2) Fpdc in next st, *dc in next 9 sts, 1 (2, 2) Fpdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 
80 (88, 88) sts.
Round 11: Ch 3, dc in next st, Fpdc in next 5 (6, 6) sts, dc in next 2 sts, 1 (1, 2) Fpdc in next st, * dc in next 2 sts, Fpdc in next 5 (6, 6) sts, dc in next 2 sts, 1 (1, 2) Fpdc in next st, * repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 80 (88, 96) sts.
Round 12: Ch 3, dc in next 8 (9, 10) sts, Fpdc in next st, *dc in next 9 (10, 11) sts, Fpdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3. 
Round 13: Ch 3, Fpdc in next 7 (8, 9) sts, dc in next st, Fpdc in next st, *dc in next st, Fpdc in next 7 (8, 9) sts, dc in next st, Fpdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3.
Round 14-19: Repeat Rounds 12-13 three times.
Round 20: Ch 3, Fpdc in next 8 (9, 10) sts, 2 Fpdc in next st, *Fpdc in next 9 (10, 11) sts, 2 Fpdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 
88 (96, 104) sts.
Rounds 21-24 (21-25, 21-25): Ch 3 (does not count as a st), Fpdc around first ch-3 post in previous round, Fpdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of first Fpdc – 88 (96, 104) FPdc. Fasten off.
Ear Flaps
Left Flap
Row 1: With RS facing, join yarn with slip st in 20th (22nd, 24th) sts to the left of center front FPdc, ch 3 (does not count as a st for remainder of pattern), Fpdc in same st, Fpdc in each of next 14 sts – 15 Fpdc.
Row 2: Ch 3, Bpdc around first st, Bpdc in each st across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, Fpdc around first st, Fpdc in next 6 sts, skip next st, Fpdc in each st across; turn – 14 sts
Row 4: Repeat Row 2.
Row 5: Ch 3, Fpdc around first st, Fpdc in each st across; turn. 
Row 6: Repeat Row 2
Row 7: Ch 3, Fpdc around first st, Fpdc in next 2 sts, skip next st, Fpdc in next 6 sts, skip next st, Fpdc in last 3 sts; turn – 12 sts
Row 8: Repeat Row 2
Row 9: Ch 3, Fpdc around first st, Fpdc in next 2 sts, skip next st, Fpdc in next 4 sts, skip next st, Fpdc in last 3 sts – 10 sts. Fasten off
Right Flap
Fold hat in half. 
Row 1: With RS facing, join yarn with slip st in 34th (36th, 38th) sts to the right of center front FPdc, ch 3 (does not count as a st for remainder of pattern), Fpdc in same st, Fpdc in each of next 14 sts – 15 Fpdc.
Rows 2-9: Repeat Rows 2-9 of Left Ear Flap. Fasten off.
Border
Round 1: With RS facing, join yarn in center back slip st, ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each st across to ear flap, *work 15 dc evenly spaced across right side of ear flap, working across last row of ear flap, **dc2tog in next 2 sts; repeat from ** 4 more times, work 15 dc evenly spaced across left side of earflap*, dc in each st across front of hat to next ear flap; repeat from * to * once, dc in each st across back of hat to beginning; join with slip st in top of ch-3. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Braided Ear Flap Ties
Cut four 24” lengths of yarn for each fringe. Join 6 fringes with a lark’s head knot in 6 sts across bottom edge of each flap. Using 2 adjacent fringes for each section, separate fringes into 3 sections. Braid 3 sections for desired length. Cut an 8” length of yarn, tie at the bottom of the braid, wrap several times around and weave into the bottom of the braid. Trim the yarn evenly at the end of the braid.
PomPom
Make a 3” pompom and attach to the top of the hat.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Vivid™: 1 ball each 6761 Powerful Pink A, 6631 Glowing Green B, 6224 Laser Yellow C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 16mm [US Q] or size needed to obtain gauge
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Size: 20” (50.8 cm) in circumference; 10” (25 cm) tall
gauge: 1 shell and 1 sc in pattern and 3 rounds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

Have fun crocheting this hat in bright bulky yarn in simple shell stitches. Cool hat to make and wear or give to your friends!

Special Stitch
Shell: 3 dc in indicated st.

Notes
Ch-3 at beginning of rounds counts as dc unless otherwise stated.
Do not turn at end of rounds unless otherwise stated.
Join rounds with slip st in indicated st or space unless otherwise stated.

BEANIE
With A, ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 3, 9 dc in ring, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3, fasten off—10 dc.
Round 2: With right side facing, join B with sc in any st, shell in next st, *sc in next st, shell in next st; repeat from * 3 more times, join with slip st in beginning sc, fasten off—5 sc, 5 shells.
Round 3: With right side facing, join C with sc in center st of any shell, shell in next sc, *sc in center st of next shell, shell in next sc; repeat from * 3 more times, fasten off—5 sc, 5 shells.
Round 4: With right side facing, using A, repeat round 3.
Round 5: With right side facing, using B, repeat round 3.
Rounds 6–7: Repeat rounds 3–4. Do not fasten off at end of last round.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with slip st in beginning sc, fasten off—20 sc.

FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Ombre™: 1 skein 3967 Sea Coral
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
Susan Bates Easy Wrap Pompom Maker or 3½" (9 cm) piece of heavy cardboard
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 18 (20, 22, 24)" [45.5 (51, 56, 61) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 16 sts = 4½" (11.5 cm); 10 rows = 3½" (9 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Brim
Ch 6.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc. 
Rows 2–64 (70, 78, 84): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 65 (71, 79, 85): With first and last rows held together, ch 1, working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across. Do not turn.

Body
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing and working in ends of rows, ch 1, 2 sc in first row, *skip next row, 2 sc in next row; repeat from * around to last row, skip last row; join with slip st in first sc—64 (70, 78, 84) sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—64 (70, 78, 84) hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first hdc, *skip next hdc, 2 sc in next hdc; repeat from * around to last hdc, skip last hdc; join with slip st in first sc—64 (70, 78, 84) sc.
Rounds 4-16 (18, 20, 22): Repeat last 2 rounds 16 (18, 20, 22) times.
Round 17 (19, 21, 23): Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last st, skip last st; join with slip st in first sc—32 (35, 39, 42) sc.
Round 18 (20, 22, 24): Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last 1 (2, 2, 1) st(s), skip last 1 (2, 2, 1) st(s); join with slip st in first sc—16 (17, 19, 21) sc.
Round 19 (21, 23, 25): Ch 1, sc in first st,*skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last 1 (2, 2, 2) st(s), skip last 1 (2, 2, 2) st(s); join with slip st in first sc—8 (8, 9, 10) sc. Fasten off, leaving a 12" (30.5 cm) tail.

FINISHING
Weave tail through every other st of last round, working through last st as needed. Pull gently to close and secure tail.

Pompom
Following pompom maker directions, make 3½" (9 cm) pompom or make pompom as follows: Wrap yarn around 3½" (9 cm) piece of heavy cardboard (the more wraps, the fuller the pompom). Gently remove wraps from cardboard. Cut a 12" (30.5 cm) length of yarn and tie it tightly around center of wraps. Do not cut the ends of this center tie. Cut ends of wraps. Fluff and trim pompom. Use ends of center tie to attach pompom to top of hat.
Weave in ends.

gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 13 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

This chenille yarn is so soft and wonderful to touch that baby will enjoy wearing this hat! The easy crochet pattern will work up quickly for last minute gifts for boy or girl babies.

Special Stitches
sc2tog (single crochet 2 stitches together) = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog (single crochet 3 stitches together) = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop in next st] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.

Notes: Hat is worked in joined rounds, with right side always facing, beginning at top of Hat. Earflaps are worked back and forth in rows beginning over a portion of the stitches in the last round of Hat.

HAT
Ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, [sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, [sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—54 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Repeat last round until piece measures about 6 in. (15 cm) from beginning. Do not fasten off.

First Earflap
Row 1 (right side): (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in next sc, sc in next 8 sc, turn; leave remaining sts unworked—9 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in next 9 sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc, turn—7 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [sc2tog, sc in next sc] twice, turn—5 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc3tog, sc in last sc, turn—3 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off.

Second Earflap
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, skip next 20 unworked sc of last round of Hat (for front of Hat), join yarn with sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc, turn; leave remaining sts unworked (for back of Hat)—9 sc.
Rows 2–8: Work same as Rows 2–8 of First Earflap. Do not turn at the end of Row 8. Do not fasten off.

Edging and Ties
Sc in end of each row across side edge of Second Earflap, sc in each unworked sc across back of Hat, sc in end of each row across side edge of First Earflap; working across last row of Earflap, sc in first sc, ch 41 (for first Tie), slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, skip next sc, sc in last sc; sc in end of each row across next side edge of First Earflap, sc in each unworked sc across front of Hat, sc in end of each row across edge of Second Earflap; working across last row of Earflap, sc in first sc, ch 41 (for 2nd Tie), slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, skip next sc, sc in last sc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.
