instructions:
CLOCHE
Ch 6; join with a slip st to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as 1st dc), 15 dc in ring; join – 16 sts.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1), * dc in next dc, ch 1; repeat from * around; join in 3rd ch of ch-4.
Round 3: Slip st in 1st ch-1 space, ch 1, sc in same space; (dc [ch 1, dc] 3 times) all in next space – shell made; * sc in next space, shell in next space; repeat from * around; join – 8 shells.
Round 4: Ch 6, * sc in center space of next shell, ch 2, d... (remaining instructions truncated for clarity purposes).

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Soft Pink (39719) 1 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker.
measurements: Preemie 3-4 lbs (Preemie 5-6 lbs – Newborn 7-9 lbs -3 months 10-12 lbs). To fit head circumference: 81/2 (11-121/2 -14) [21.5 (28-32-35.5) cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.
Beginning (Beg) at crown, chain (ch) 3.
1st round (rnd): 8 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 [counts as double crochet (dc)]. 1 dc in same space (sp) as last sl st. *Ch 1. 2 dc in next hdc. Repeat (Rep) from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 8 groups of 2 dc.
Size 3-4 lbs only: 3rd rnd: Sl st in next sp between 2 dc. [Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc] in same sp. *(2 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 2 dc in sp between next 2 dc. Rep from * once more. (2 dc in next ch-1 sp. 2 dc in sp between next 2 dc) 3 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 13 groups of 2 dc.
Size 5-6 lbs only: 3rd rnd: Sl st in next sp between 2 dc. [Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc] in same sp. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. *2 dc in next sp between 2 dc. (2 dc in next sp) twice. Rep from * twice more. 2 dc in next sp between 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 groups of 2 dc.
4th rnd: Sl st in next sp between 2 dc. [Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc] in same sp. (2 dc in next sp between 2 groups of 2 dc) twice. *2 dc in next sp between 2 dc. (2 dc in next sp between 2 groups of 2 dc) 3 times. Rep from * twice more. 2 dc in next sp between 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 16 groups of 2 dc.
Sizes 7-9 and 10-12 lbs only: 3rd rnd: Sl st in next sp between 2 dc. [Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc] in same sp. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. *2 dc in next sp between 2 dc. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 16 groups of 2 dc.
Size 7-9 lbs only: 4th rnd: Sl st in next sp between 2 dc. [Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc] in same sp. 2 dc in next sp between 2 groups of 2 dc. *2 dc in next sp between 2 dc. (2 dc in next sp between 2 groups of 2 dc) 5 times. Rep from * once more. 2 dc in next sp between 2 dc. (2 dc in next sp between 2 groups of 2 dc) 4 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 19 groups of 2 dc.
Size 10-12 lbs only: 4th rnd: Sl st in next sp between 2 dc. [Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc] in same sp. *(2 dc in next sp between 2 groups of 2 dc.) 3 times. 2 dc in next sp between 2 dc. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 21 groups of 2 dc.
All sizes: Next rnd: Sl st in next sp between 2 groups of 2 dc. [Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc] in same sp. *2 dc in next sp between 2 groups of 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep last rnd until Hat measures approx 31/2 (4-41/2-5)" [9 (10-11.5-12.5) cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Tweeds™ (5 oz / 141 g; 250 yds / 228 m) Gray Heather (23002) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: One size to fit average Adult.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Rnds are worked in a spiral. Do not join at end of rnds. Place marker on first stitch of each rnd and move each rnd. Beg at top of Hat, ch 3.
1st rnd: 6 hdc in 3rd ch from hook.
2nd rnd: *Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar created below stitch in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS - see diagram). Rep from * around. 12 hdc.
3rd rnd: *Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Rep from * around. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: *Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Rep from * around. 36 hdc.
5th rnd: *Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each next 5 sts. Rep from * around. 42 hdc.
6th rnd: *Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: *Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. 54 hdc.
8th rnd: *Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * around. 60 hdc.
9th rnd: *Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * around. 66 hdc.
Next rnd: *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each st around. 60 hdc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 8½" [21.5 cm]. Sl st in horizontal bar in each of next 2 sts of previous rnd. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Sport®: 1 skein each 971 Camouflage A and 254 Pumpkin B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [G-6 US]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22)” [51 (56) cm] circumference at brim
gauge: 14 dc = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; 8 rounds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 4.
Round 1 (right side): Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch-3 counts as first dc here and throughout); join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in next st, *2 dc in next st, dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in next 2 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in next 3 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in next 4 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—72 dc.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in next 11 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 11 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—78 dc.
Both sizes Rounds 7 (8)–15 (20): Ch 3, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3; change to B at end of Round 15 (20)—72 (78) dc.
Round 16 (21): Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st to first sc.
Round 17 (22): Working through front loops only, ch 1, slip st in each st around; join with slip st in first slip st.
Round 18 (23): Working through back loops only, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 19 (24) and 20 (25): Repeat Rounds 17 (22) and 18 (23); change to A at end of Round 20 (25).
Rounds 21 (26)–23 (28): Ch 3, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off at end of Round 23 (28).
FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee®Baby™ (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331m) Pale Blue (02002) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: FPhdc = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next hdc from front to back to front. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Hdctbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
Hdctbl2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in back loop of next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit baby 12-18 months.
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc. Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Ch 64. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each ch around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 64 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdctbl in each dc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdctbl in each of next 3 sts. FPhdc around next st. Rep from * around. Join.
Rep 3rd rnd until Hat from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm].
Shape Crown: 1st rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdctbl in each of next 3 sts. FPhdc around next st. 1 hdctbl in next st. Hdctbl2tog. FPhdc around next st) 8 times around. Join. 56 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdctbl in each of next 3 sts. FPhdc around next st. 1 hdctbl in each of next 2 sts. FPhdc around next st) 8 times. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdctbl in next st. Hdctbl2tog. FPhdc around next st. 1 hdctbl in each of next 2 sts. FPhdc around next st) 8 times. 48 sts. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdctbl in each of next 2 sts. FPhdc around next st. 1 hdctbl in each of next 2 sts. FPhdc around next st) 8 times around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdctbl in each of next 2 sts. FPhdc around next st. Hdctbl2tog. FPhdc around next st) 8 times. 40 sts. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 2. (Hdctbl2tog. FPhdc around next st. 1 hdctbl around next st. FPhdc around next st) 8 times. 32 sts. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 2. (Skip next hdc. FPhdc around next st) 16 times. 16 sts. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 2. (Hdctbl2tog) 8 times. 8 sts. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.
Ears (make 2)
Ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts at end of 4th row.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off. Sew Ears to top of Hat as shown in photo.

materials: Red Heart® Roll With It Tweed™ (5.29 oz/150 g; 296 yds/271 m) Seagrass (9685) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Slst2tog = Insert hook through indicated stitches. Draw up a loop through all stitches and loop on your hook.
measurements: Size One size to fit adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Hat is worked sideways with short rows.
• Take care to not work sl sts too tightly.
• Follow modified slst2tog instructions above to prevent holes from forming at crown.
Ch 64.
1st row: (RS). Working into horizontal “bump” at back of each ch, sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 63 sts.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop only of each st to end of chain. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop only of each st to last 2 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 61 sts.
5th row: As 3rd row. 59 sts.
7th row: As 3rd row. 57 sts.
9th row: As 3rd row. 55 sts.
11th row: As 3rd row. 53 sts.
13th row: As 3rd row. 51 sts.
15th row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop only of each st to end of row. Sl st in back loop only of next 2 sts of row 2 rows below. Turn. 53 sts.
17th row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop only of each st to end of row. Slst2tog, working into side of last st 4 rows below and back loop only of next st 6 rows below. Sl st in back loop only of next st. Turn. 55 sts.
19th row: As 17th row. 57 sts.
21st row: As 17th row. 59 sts.
23rd row: As 17th row. 61 sts.
25th row: As 17th row. 63 sts.
26th row: As 2nd row.
First wedge complete. Rep 3rd to 26th rows 4 times more.
Rep 3rd to 25th rows once more.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Weave end through last st of each row along top edge and gather tightly. Sew back seam, reversing seam approx 3½" [9 cm] for cuff.

materials: Red Heart® Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Sizes Small Large
Blue Skies (0810)  1  1  ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
First fdc (foundation double crochet) = Ch 3. Yoh and draw up a loop in 3rd ch from hook. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook – chain made. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Fdc = Yoh and draw up a loop in “chain" of previous stitch. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook – chain made. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements:
Fits lady’s head circumference
Small 20" [51 cm]
Large  22" [56 cm]
gauge: 12 dc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
HAT
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
1st rnd: First fdc. Work 53 (59) fdc. Join. 54 (60) sts.
With beg length of yarn, sew side edge of 1st rnd.

2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 2. Dcfp around first st. Dcbp around next st. *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join.

4th rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each st around. Join.

5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join.

6th and 7th rnds: Ch 2. Working in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each st around. Join.

8th rnd: Ch 2, Working in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 dc in each st around. Join.

9th to 16th rnds: As 5th to 8th rnds twice.

17th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 7 (3) sts. Dc2tog. *1 dc in each of next 7 (3) sts. Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sts.

18th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 2 sts. Dc2tog. *1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sts.

19th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. Ddc2tog. *1 dc in next st. Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.

20th rnd: Ch 2. *Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end.

FINISHING
Weave end through last rnd. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Pompom: Wind yarn around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hood. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Bernat® Softee® chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m) Teal (28203) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit average lady's head.
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
Hat (See Diagram I on page 2).
With larger hook, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 54 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in last st from previous rnd keeping ch 3 at back of work. *Miss next st. 1 dc in next st. Working in front of dc just worked, 1 dc in missed st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Working in both loops, as 5th rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
9th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *(Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – dc2tog made. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Dc2tog. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 45 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Y oh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc2tog made. Rep from * around. 36 sts. Fasten off.
Brim (See Diagram II on page 2).
With smaller hook, join yarn with sl st to 8th st of 10th rnd of Hat.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 28 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th to 7th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog . Turn. 20 sc at end of 7th row.
8th row: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc across. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton (Solids: 50 g/1.75 oz or Ombres and Prints 42.5 g/1.5 oz)
TODDLER VERSION 23743 (Summer Splash) 1 ball
KIDS VERSION Contrast A (00056 Yellow) 1 ball
Contrast B (13628 Hot Orange) 1 ball
Contrast C (13712 Hot Green) 1 ball
Contrast D (13740 Hot Pink) 1 ball
ADULT VERSION 23741 (Playtime) 2 balls
Size 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit Toddler 1-3 yrs (Child 5-8 yrs-Adult)
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions:
STRIPE VERSION
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join B with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join C with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: With C, ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join D with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: With D, ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. Join A with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. Join B with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
Last 4 rnds form Stripe Pat.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, inc 6 sts on every row, as before to 48 (54-60) sts, then every following alt row to 60 (66-72) sts.
Cont in Stripe Pat, work 9 (10-12) rows even.
Next rnd: With appropriate color, working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
PLAIN VERSION
Work as given for Stripe Version, omitting reference to color changing.

materials: RED HEART® Medley™: 1 (1, 2) ball(s) 930 Garden, 940 Volcano or 952 Stained Glass A and 1 (1, 1) ball 920 Sandy B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
two ¾” (19 mm) or 1” (25 mm) buttons
pompom maker or 3” (7.5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 18 (20, 22)” [45.5 (51, 56) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 10 sts = 4” (10 cm); 8 rows = 4” (10 cm) in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, form an adjustable ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 10 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first hdc—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—20 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, *2 hdc in first st, hdc in next st; repeat from * 9 times; join with slip st in first hdc—30 hdc. 
Round 4: Ch 1, *2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from * 9 times; join with slip st in first hdc—40 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 1, *2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 7 (3, 3) sts; repeat from * 4 (9, 9) times; join with slip st in first hdc—45 (50, 50) hdc.
Size Large only:
Round 6: Ch 1, *2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 9 sts; repeat from * 4 times; join with slip st in first hdc—55 hdc.
All sizes:
Rounds 6–13 (6–15, 7–15): Ch 1, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc. Do not fasten off. 
Right Earflap 
Row 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), skip next st, hdc in next 5 sts, skip next st, hdc in next st, turn—7 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 3 sts, skip next st, hdc in last st, turn—5 hdc.
Row 3: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next st, skip next st, hdc in last st—3 hdc. Fasten off.
Forehead Flap
Row 1 (right side): With right side and front edge of earflap facing, skip next 2 sts of last round, join B with sc in next st, sc in the next 15 (17, 19) sts, turn—16 (18, 20) sc.
Rows 2–6 (6, 8): Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. 
Fasten off.
Left Earflap
Row 1 (right side): With right side of forehead flap facing, skip next 2 sts of last round, join A with slip st in next st, ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 5 sts, skip next st, hdc in next st, turn—7 hdc.
Rows 2 and 3: Work same as Rows 2 and 3 of right earflap.
FINISHING
Edging Round: With right side facing, join A with sc in center st at back of hat, sc in each st to first earflap, *2 sc in end of each row of first side, ch 11, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across (earflap tie made), 2 sc in end of each row of 2nd side*, sc in each st to forehead flap, sc in end of each row of first side, sc in each st across, sc in end of each row of 2nd side, sc in each st to next earflap; repeat from * to * once, sc in each remaining st; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Using photograph as a guide, turn up forehead flap and sew a button in each upper corner, working through both thicknesses of flap and hat to secure. 
Pompom
With B, following pompom maker directions, make one pompom or make pompom as follows: Wrap yarn around 3” (7.5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard (the more wraps, the fuller the pompom). 
Gently remove wraps from cardboard. Cut a 12” (30.5 cm) length of B and tie it tightly around center of wraps. Do not cut the ends of this center tie. Cut ends of wraps. Fluff and trim pompom. Use ends of center tie to attach pompoms through Round 1.
Fringe
Cut 6 strands of B, each 5 (6, 7)” [12.5 (15, 18) cm] long. Hold 3 strands together and thread through bottom end of earflap tie.
Knot in place and trim ends evenly. Repeat to attach remaining 3 strands to other earflap tie.
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1g; 315 yds/288 m)
Main Color (MC) Pumpkin (9765) 1 1 1 1 ball
Contrast A Off White (9702) 1 1 1 1 ball
Contrast B Black (9727) 1 1 1 1 ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit head circumference: 6/12 mos 17" [43 cm], 18/24 mos 18" [45.5 cm], 4 yrs 19" [48 cm], 6/8 yrs 19.5" [49.5 cm]
gauge: 13 hdc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as hdc. With larger hook and MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc. 3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc. 4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc. 5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc. 6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 4 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc. Size 6/12 mos only: 7th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 11 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 11 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 52 hdc. Sizes 18/24 mos, 4 yrs and 6/8 yrs only: 7th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 5 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 hdc. Sizes 4 yrs and 6/8 yrs only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. [1 hdc in each of next 27 (13) hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc] 1 (3) time(s). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 58 (60) hdc. All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep last rnd until Hat from beg measures 5 (5.5-5.5-6)" [12.5 (14-14-15) cm], joining A at end of last rnd. Break MC. With A, rep last rnd until Hat from beg measures 7 (7.5-8-8.5)" [18 (19-20.5-21.5) cm]. Fasten off. Ears Inner Ear With smaller hook and A, ch 2. 1st row: (RS). 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 7 sc. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. (1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. (1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. 5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. (1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn. 6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. (1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Fasten off. Outer Ear With smaller hook and MC, make as given for Inner Ear. Join Ears: With WS of Inner Ear and Outer Ear facing each other, and RS of Inner Ear facing, using smaller hook join B with sl st to first sc. 1st row: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 2 sc in last sc. Nose With smaller hook and B, ch 2. 1st rnd: (3 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 tr. 1 dc. 3 hdc. 1 dc. 1 tr. 1 dc. 1 hdc) all in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Eyes (make 2) With smaller hook and B, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join A with sl st to first sc. Break B. 2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Finishing Sew Eyes, Ears and Nose to Hat as shown in picture. With 2 strands of B, embroider mouth with straight stitch as shown in picture.

pattern_name: Preemie to Toddler Crochet Baby Set
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Ombre™ (10 oz/283 g; 482 yds/440 m)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) for Booties and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) for Hat
Susan Bates® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
2 small buttons for Booties.
abbreviations: Dc2(3-5)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2 (3-5) times. Yoh and draw through all 3 (4-6) loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Twisted sc = Insert hook in next stitch. Bring hook over yarn instead of yarn over hook and pull up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.
measurements: Hat: To fit head circumference: Preemie ( Newborn- 6/12 mos- 18/24 mos) 9½" ( 12-16-17½)" [24 (30.5-40.5-44.5 cm]. Booties: To fit baby’s foot: 3/6 (12/18) mos.
gauge: 17 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size Preemie for Hats and 3/6 mos for Booties. If changes are necessary for sizes Newborn, 6/12 or 18/24 mos for Hats and 12/18 mos for Booties, the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes.
HAT
With larger hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 twisted sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 twisted sc in next sc. 1 twisted sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 twisted sc in next sc. 1 twisted sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
Sizes Newborn, 6/12 and 18/24 mos only: 5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 twisted sc in next sc. 1 twisted sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 twisted sc in next sc. 1 twisted sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
Sizes 6/12 and 18/24 mos only: 7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 twisted sc in next sc. 1 twisted sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 twisted sc in next sc. 1 twisted sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
Sizes Preemie and 18/24 mos only: Next rnd: Ch 1. *2 twisted sc in next sc. 1 twisted sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 27 (54) sc.
All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 twisted sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. PM on last rnd. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 3 ( 3½-4-4½)" [7.5 (9-10-11.5) cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each st around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Rep last rnd 2 (3-4-5) times more. Fasten off.
BOOTIES
With smaller hook, ch 16 (22).
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 (7) ch. 2 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 (7) ch. 2 sc in last ch. 21 (27) sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 ( 10) sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 ( 10) sc. 2 sc in last sc. 27 (33) sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 ( 13) sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 ( 13) sc. 2 sc in last sc. 33 (39) sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 ( 16) sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 ( 16) sc. 2 sc in last sc. 39 (45) sts. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 5 times more.
Shape Instep
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of next 13 (16) sc. (Dc3tog) twice. 1 dc in next sc. (Dc3tog over next 3 sts) twice. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of next 13 ( 16) sc. (Dc5tog) 5 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Strap (make 2).
Ch 33 (40).
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 32 (39) sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 2 sc in ch-2 sps to end of row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew back and sole seam. Sew Strap to Bootie as shown in picture. Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m) Main Color (MC) Pave The Way (68022) 1 O’Go
Contrast A, B, C, D and E Concord Crush (68019) 1 O’Go
Sizes U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Yarn needle
Locking stitch marker
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section (Contrast A, B, C, D and E).
• You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A, B, C, D and E.
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of rnd and work sts around it.
• Change colors by drawing new color through last 2 loops on hook and proceed with new color, keeping color change to WS of work.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
• Ch 1 at beg of each rnd.
• Ch 2 at beg of each row does not count as st.
HAT 
Ribbing:  With MC and smaller hook, ch 12.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdcbl in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg measures 19" [48 cm] when unstretched, ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Join last row and first row tog with 1 row of sl st to form tube. Do not fasten off.
Beg working in rnds: 
Set-up rnd: (RS). With larger hook, ch 1. Working across side edge of ribbing, work 52 sc evenly around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd.
Work chart as follows:
1st to 12th rnds:  Ch 1. Working in sc, work Chart to end of chart, reading rnds from right to left and noting 4-st rep will be worked 13 times. Join.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. With MC, 1 sc in first st. *With E, sc2tog. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. With E, sc2tog. With MC, 1 sc in last st. Join. 39 sts.
2nd rnd: With E, ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *With MC, sc2tog. With E, 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. With MC, sc2tog. Join. Break MC. 26 sts.
3rd rnd: With E, ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 13 sts.
4th rnd:  Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in next st. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 7 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and secure tightly.
Pompom:  With 1 strand each of MC, A, B, C, D, and E held tog, wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 25 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew pompom to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® Head’s Up™: 1 ball each 689 Bright Green A, 852 Navy B, 229 Sunshine C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8mm [US L-11]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, Color B, and Color C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22)” (51 (56) cm) circumference
gauge: 10 sts = 4” (10 cm); 3 rounds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 1 (right side): With A ch 3, work 11 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first hdc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in same st as joining (increase made), 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next st, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in each of next 2 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 hdc.
20” Circumference Only
Rounds 5–7: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off A.
Round 8: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off B.
Round 9: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off A.
Round 10: With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off C.
Round 11: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off A.
Round 12: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off B.
Round 13: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Do not fasten off A.
Round 14: Ch 1, TURN, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: 1 skein each 3520 Peacock Feather A and 3620 Fern B
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
6 Stitch markers
two ¾” buttons
yarn needle
matching sewing thread and needle
abbreviations: dec (decrease) = [draw up a loop in next sc] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Hat Circumference = 14 (16)”
gauge: 15 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in sc. Rounds 1-5 = 3” across
instructions:
Hat
With A, ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc – 8 sc.
Round 2: With B, ch 1, inc in each sc around; join – 16 sc.
Round 3: With A, ch 1, [sc in sc, inc] 8 times; join – 24 sc.
Round 4: With B, ch 1, [sc in 2 sc, inc] 8 times; join – 32 sc.
Round 5: With A, ch 1, [sc in 3 sc, inc] 8 times; join – 40 sc.
Round 6: With B, ch 1, [sc in 4 sc, inc] 8 times; join – 48 sc.
Round 7: With A, ch 1, [sc in 5 sc, inc] 8 times; join – 56 sc.
12 Months Size Only-Round 8: With B, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join – 56 sc.
Toddler Size Only-Round 8: With B, ch 1, [sc in 6 sc, inc] 8 times; join – 64 sc.
Both Sizes-Rounds 9-25 (9-29): Continue to alternate color every round, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Fasten off after Round 25 (29).
Earflaps & Front Flap
Beginning at center back joining, place markers for Earflaps at st 8, 21, 36, and 49 (9, 24, 41, and 56). Earflaps are worked between markers 8 and 21 (9 and 24) and between markers 36 and 49 (41 and 56).
Place different color markers for Front Flap at st 22 and 35 (25 and 40).
Left Earflap
Row 1: With right side facing, join A with sc in marked st 8 (9), sc to marked st 21 (24); turn – 14 (16) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across.
Row 3: Ch 1, dec, sc to last two sc; dec – 12 (14) sts.
Rows 4-11 (4-13): Repeat Rows 2 and 3 4 (5) times – 4 sc.
Row 12 (14): Ch 1, [dec] twice; turn – 2 sc.
Row 13 (15): Ch 1, dec – 1 sc.
Tie-Row 14 (16): Ch 14, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off.
Right Earflap
Row 1: Join A with sc in marked st 36 (41), sc to marked st 49 (56); turn – 14 (16) sc.
Rows 2-14 (2-16): Work same as for Left Earflap.
Front Flap
Row 1: With right side facing, join A with sc in marked st 22 (25), sc to marked st 35 (40); turn – 14 (16) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3-Buttonhole: Ch 1, sc in first sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 8 (10) sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in last sc; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch across; turn – 14 (16) sc. Fasten off.
FiniSHinG
Fold Front Flap up. Sew buttons to hat under buttonholes of flap.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool DK Superwash™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 125 yds/114 m)
Contrast A Dark Gray Heather (12042) 1 ball
Contrast B Gold (12609) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit average Woman’s head.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Colorwork Pat.
instructions:
Note: When working from chart and joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
Carry color when not in use loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to avoid stranding.
Ribbing: With A, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 19" [48.5 cm] when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off.
Join last row and 1st row tog with 1 row of sc to form tube.
Beg working in rnds:
Foundation rnd:  Ch 1. Working along side edge of ribbing, work 88 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd.
1st to 15th rnds: Ch 1. Work Chart to end of chart, noting 8-st rep will be worked 11 times. Join with sl st to first sc at end of each rnd. When chart is complete break A and cont with B.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 7" [18 cm].
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 77 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around Join with sl st to first sc. 66 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 55 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 44 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around Join with sl st to first sc. 33 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 22 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and secure tightly.
Pompom: Wind A around 4 fingers approx 100 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Attach to top of Hat.

materials: Caron International's Simply Soft (100% acrylic; 6 oz/170 g, 315 yds/288 m skein): 4 oz
One size US G-6 (4 mm) crochet hook, or size to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker (or small piece of contrasting yarn)
Yarn needle
measurements: Hat measures approximately 21"/53.5 cm circumference (at band)
gauge: In single crochet worked in the round, 15 sts and 14 rows = 4"/10 cm
instructions:
HAT
Ch 2.
Round 1 (RS): Work 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join and do not turn—4 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—8 sc.
Round 3: Work 2 sc in each sc around—16 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times—32 sc.
Round 6: Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 6 sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 4 sc—40 sc.
Round 8: Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times, sc in last 3 sc—48 sc.
Round 9: Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 6 sc—52 sc.
Round 10: Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 10 sc—56 sc.
Round 11: Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times, sc in next 2 sc—64 sc.
Round 12: Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times, sc in next 6 sc—72 sc.
Round 13: Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times, sc in next 3 sc—80 sc.
Rounds 14–25: Sc in each sc around.
Sl st in next st.
Band Base
Note: The band base rounds are joined with sl st at the end of each round.
Rounds 26–28: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; join with sl st in first sc.
Round 29: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with sl st in first sc.
Brim
Note: Resume working in continuous rounds. Do not join at the end of rounds.
Round 30: Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times, sc in next 7 sc—88 sc.
Round 31: Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times, sc in next 5 sc—96 sc.
Rounds 32 and 33: Sc in each sc around.
Sl st in next st. Fasten off.
BAND
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st in free front loop of any sc in Round 25, ch 1, rev sc in each free front loop around; join with sl st in first sc. Repeat this process, working rev sc in free front loops of Rounds 26 and 27.

BOW
Ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next 2 sc, sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [sk next sc, sc in next sc] twice, sc in last sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sk next sc, sc in next 2 sc, turn—3 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, insert hook in first sc and draw up a loop (2 loops on hook), sk next sc, insert hook in last sc and draw up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through all loops on hook.
Fasten off.
With RS facing, and working across opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn with sl st in first ch, ch 1, sc in each ch across—3 sc.
Repeat Rows 2–7 for other end of bow. Fasten off.
Bow Center
Ch 6; join with sl st in first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist ch.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with sl st in first sc, do not turn—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Insert bow into bow center. Sew bow to side of band, as shown in photograph. Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.

materials: Caron® Cupcakes™ (3 oz/85 g; 244 yds/233 m)
Sizes 6-12 mos: 1 ball Strawberry Kiwi Pop (16012)
Sizes 18-24 mos: 1 ball Strawberry Kiwi Pop (16012)
Sizes U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) and U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc3tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit head circumference: 6-12 mos 17" [43 cm], 18-24 mos 18" [45.5 cm]
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.

Notes:
• Wind separate balls of each shade in Caron® Cupcakes®. Assign shades contrast A, B, C, D and E:
A: Dark Pink
B: Light Pink
C: White
D: Green
E: Yellow
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.

FROSTING
Note: Frosting is worked sideways.

Stripe Pat
With A: 2 rows.
With B: 2 rows.
With C: 2 rows.
These 6 rows form Stripe Pat.

With larger hook and A, ch 36 (40).
1st row: (RS). 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 3 hdc). 1 hdc in each ch to last 3 ch. Hdc3tog. Turn. 34 (38) sts.
2nd row: [(Ch 2. Skip first hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) counts as Hdc2tog]. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 3 hdc in last hdc. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B and working in back loops only, [(Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc – counts as 3 hdc)]. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 hdc. Hdc3tog. Turn.
4th row: With B, as 2nd row. Join C.
5th row: With C, as 3rd row.
6th row: With C, as 2nd row. Join A.

First 6 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.

Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 4 rows until work from beg, when slightly stretched, measures approx 16 (19)" [40.5 (48) cm], ending on a 6th row of Stripe Pat. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew foundation ch and last row tog to form tube. Thread end through edge st of every 2nd row, cinching top.

RIBBING
With smaller hook and D, ch 64 (68). Join with sl st to form ring, taking care not to twist ch.
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st throughout.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcfp around first st. *1 hdcbp around next st. 1 hdcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdcbp around last st. Join with sl st to first st.
Rep 2nd rnd until ribbing measures 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off.

With larger hook, join E with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Working in front loops only, *Skip next st. 5 dc in next st. Skip next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * around. Fasten off.

Sew bottom of Frosting to rem back loops of Ribbing, easing in fullness as needed.
Sew pompom in position.

Sprinkles: Embroider sprinkles using bullion st, varying colors.

materials: Patons® Lace Sequin™ (2.5 oz/70 g; 344 yds/314 m) Moonstone (37044) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. (See Diagram on page 2). 
1st rnd: Ch 3. 12 dc in ring. Join with sl st to first dc. 12 dc. Push beg ch 3 to WS of work. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcfp around each dc. Join with sl st around post of first dcfp. Push beg ch 3 to WS of work. 12 dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in sp between each dcfp. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st around first dcfp. Push beg ch 3 to WS of work. 24 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 3. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 2 dc in sp between dcfp and next dc. Miss next dc. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st around first dcfp. Push beg ch 3 to WS of work. 36 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 3. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 3 dc in sp between dcfp and next dc. Miss next 2 dc. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st around first dcfp. Push beg ch 3 to WS of work. 48 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 3. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 4 dc in sp between dcfp and next dc. Miss next 3 dc. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st around first dcfp. Push beg ch 3 to WS of work. 60 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 4. *1 trfp around next dcfp. (2 tr. 3 dc) in sp between dcfp and next dc. Miss next 4 dc. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st around first trfp. Push beg ch 4 to WS of work. 72 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 4. *1 trfp around next trfp. (2 tr. 3 dc) in sp between trfp and next tr. Miss next 5 sts. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st around first trfp. Push beg ch 4 to WS of work.
9th rnd: Ch 4. *1 trfp around next trfp. (2 tr. 4 dc) in sp between trfp and next tr. Miss next 5 sts. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st around first trfp. Push beg ch 4 to WS of work. 84 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 4. *1 trfp around next trfp. (2 tr. 4 dc) in sp between trfp and next tr. Miss next 6 sts. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st around first trfp. Push beg ch 4 to WS of work.
11th rnd: Ch 4. *1 trfp around next trfp. (3 tr. 4 dc) in sp between trfp and next tr. Miss next 6 sts. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st around first trfp. Push beg ch 4 to WS of work. 96 sts.
12th to 15th rnds: Ch 4. *1 trfp around next trfp. (3 tr. 4 dc) in sp between trfp and next tr. Miss next 7 sts. Rep from * 11 times more. Join with sl st around first trfp. Push beg ch 4 to WS of work.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 96 sc. 17th to 19th rnds: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Push beg ch 2 to WS of work. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 672 Spring Green A, 254 Pumpkin B and 324 Bright Yellow C.
Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6].
Polyfill Stuffing, Yarn Needle.
abbreviations: sc2tog: [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

A, B, C = color A, B, C; ch = chain; dc = double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified; * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 18” in circumference. Fits Child’s size 2-4 years.
gauge: 5 dc = 1½”; 3 Rounds dc = 1½”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Beginning at top of hat with A, ch 4; join into a ring with slip st in first ch.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch 3 – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in first st, 2 dc in each dc around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch 3 – 24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch 3 – 36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch 3 – 48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch 3 – 60 dc.
Rounds 6-13: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch 3.
Round 14: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, *skip 2 dc, 5 sc in next dc, skip 2 dc, sc in next dc, repeat from * around, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch 3. Fasten off.
Hat Scales (make 2)
With B, ch 43.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn – 42 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in next 6 sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog over next 2 sc, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, [sc2tog over next 2 sc] twice, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc2tog over next 2 sc, work 4 sc evenly spaced down side of scale.
Row 7: Sc in next 6 sc in Row 1.
Repeat Rows 3-7 (5 times); then repeat Rows 3-6 once, turn.
Joining Row: With wrong sides of hat scales together, ch 1, working through double thickness, sc evenly across top of scales, working 3 sc in top of each scale, leaving bottom open. Stuff each scale very lightly then sew scales in place on top of hat.
Tail
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join. Work in a spiral, marking beginning of each round, moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 8 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 10 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 12 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 15 sc.
Rounds 8-9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 18 sc.
Rounds 11-12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: *Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 21 sc.
Rounds 14-27: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Tail Scales
With B, ch 26.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, ch 1, *3 dc in next ch, skip next ch, slip st in next ch**, ch 1; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **. Fasten off. Sew to top center of tail. Stuff tail and sew in place.
Large Spot (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join, work in a spiral as before.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 24 sc. Fasten off, leaving long sewing length.
Medium Spot (make 4)
Work same as Large Spot through Round 3. Fasten off, leaving long sewing length.
Small Spot (make 2)
Work same as Large Spot through Round 2. Fasten off, leaving long sewing length. Randomly arrange spots on each side of hat and sew in place.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool DK superwash™ (50 g/1.75 oz; 114 m/125 yds)
main Color (mC) First Bud (12236) 2 balls
Contrast a Apple Green (12223) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
abbreviations: sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
scfp = Draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook
scbp = Draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head.
gauge: 17 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
note: Band is worked sideways. 
Band: With MC, ch 29.
1st row: (RS). Yoh and draw up a loop in 4th ch 
from hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on 
hook. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch. Yoh 
and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh 
and draw through all loops on hook – counts as 
dc and dc3tog. *1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 5 dc 
in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch.* (Yoh and 
draw up a loop in next ch. Yoh and draw through 
2 loops on hook) twice. Miss next ch. (Yoh and 
draw up a loop in next ch. Yoh and draw through 
2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through 
all loops on hook – counts as dc4tog over 5 sts.
Rep from * to * once more. (Yoh and draw up 
a loop in next ch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops 
on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all 
loops on hook – counts as dc3tog. 1 dc in last 
ch. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Scfp around 
each st to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 3. Dc3tog. *1 dc in each of next 
3 sc. 5 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc.* 
Dc4tog over 5 sc. Rep from * to * once more. 
Dc3tog. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows of Zig-Zag pat until work from 
beg across side edge measures approx 22" 
[56 cm], ending with 2nd row. Fasten off. Sew 
foundation chain and last row tog. 
top of hat: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join A with 
sl st at back seam. Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 
Work 88 hdc evenly around edge of Band. Join 
with sl st to first hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Scbp in each hdc around. Join 
with sl st to first st. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 
Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 80 sts. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sts. 
Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 72 sts. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 
Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 64 sts. 
Cont in same manner, dec 8 sts on every rnd, 
until there are 16 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long 
end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. 
Fasten securely. 
Bottom edging: With RS facing, join A with 
sl st at back seam. Ch 1. Work 90 sc evenly 
around bottom edge of Band. Join with sl st to 
first sc. Fasten off. 
looped Cord: *With MC, ch 36. Join with sl st 
to first ch, sl st in each ch around. Rep from * 
7 times more. Fasten off. Attach Looped Cord 
to top of Hat.

materials: Patons® Metallic™ (3 oz/85 g; 252 yds/230 m) Blue Steel (95134) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc3(5)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3(5) times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scbp = Draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head
gauge: 18 dc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions: Notes: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3 at end of rnd. Ch 4. Join with sl st to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3. 15 dc in ring. Join. 16 dc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 scbp around first dc. *1 scbp around next dc. 2 scbp around next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 scbp around last dc. Join, inserting hook from back to front, work sl st around post of first sc. 24 sts. 3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 2 dc in next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last st. Join. 36 dc. 4th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as sl st. *Dc3tog. 5 dc in next dc. Rep from * 7 times more. Dc3tog. 2 dc in first dc. Join. 54 sts. 5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbp around each st around. Join, inserting hook from back to front, work sl st around post of first sc. 6th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in next st. Dc3tog. 1 dc in next st.** 5 dc in next st. Rep from * 7 times more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first st. Join. 72 sts. 7th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Dc3tog. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc.** 5 dc in next dc. Rep from * 7 times more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first st. Join. 90 sts. 8th rnd: As 5th rnd. 9th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Dc3tog. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts.** 5 dc in next st. Rep from * 7 times more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first st. Join. 108 sts. 10th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Dc3tog. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc.** 5 dc in next dc. Rep from * 7 times more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first dc. Join. 126 sts. 11th rnd: As 5th rnd. 12th and 13th rnds: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 5 sts. Dc3tog. 1 dc in each of next 5 sts.** 3 dc in next st. Rep from * 7 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in first st. Join. Rep 11th to 13th rnds twice more, then 11th rnd once. Next rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Dc5tog. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts.** 3 dc in next st. Rep from * 7 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in first st. Join. 108 sts. Next rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Dc5tog. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts.** 3 dc in next st. Rep from * 7 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in first st. Join. 90 sts. Next rnd: As 5th rnd. Next 5 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Aran (0313) 1 ball
Contrast B Gray Heather (0400) 1 ball
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit head circumference 18 (20-22)" [45.5 (51-56) cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Join rnds with sl st to top of first dcfp. 
With A, ch 56 (64-72). Join in rnd, taking care to not twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 (64-72) hdc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first hdc. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 dcfp around next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 dcbp around each of last 3 hdc. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of last 3 sts. Join.
Rep 3rd and 4th rnds for Waffle Pat until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm], ending on a 4th rnd. Join B. Break A.
With B, rep 3rd and 4th rnds for Waffle Pat until work from beg measures approx 5 (6-6 1/2)" [12.5 (15-16.5) cm], ending on a 4th rnd.
Shape top 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 hdc in next st. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in next st. Hdc2tog. Join. 42 (48-54) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of last 2 sts. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join. 28 (32-36) sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcbp around last st. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last st. Skip last st. Join. 14 (16-18) sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st and in each st around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) 7 (8-9) times. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. 
Pompom: Wind A around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc. 3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc. 4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc. 5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. materials: 1 ball 7710 Misty Rose
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number
measurements: Hat directions are written for head sizes 18" [45.5 cm], 20" [51 cm], and 22" [56 cm].
gauge: 11 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 7 rows of dc = 4.5" [11.5 cm] and 8 rows of sc = 3" [7.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
ALL SIZES
Form Adjustable Ring, Ch 2.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 12 dc into Ring; join with slip st in top of first dc—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 2, 2 dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of first dc—24 dc. 
Round 3: Ch 2, *2 dc in next st, dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of first dc—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 2, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of first dc—48 dc. 
Do not fasten off, continue with instructions for intended size.

For Size 18" [45.5 cm]
Round 5: Ch 2, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 23 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of first dc—50 dc.
Rounds 6-8: Ch 2, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of first dc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in top of first sc—50 sc.
Rounds 10-12: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each st around; join with slip st in top of first sc. At end of Row 12, fasten off.

For Size 20" [51 cm]
Round 5: Ch 2, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of first dc—56 dc.
Rounds 6-9: Ch 2, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of first dc.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in top of first sc—56 sc.
Rounds 11-14: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each st around; join with slip st in top of first sc. At end of Row 14, fasten off.

For Size 22" [56 cm]
Round 5: Ch 2, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of first dc—60 dc.
Rounds 6-10: Ch 2, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of first dc.
Round 11: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in top of first sc—60 sc.
Rounds 12-16: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each st around; join with slip st in top of first sc. At end of Row 16, fasten off.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in all ends.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m)
Sizes               6/12  18/24 mos
Main Color (MC) Bunny Brown (86028)  1    1  ball
Contrast A Ever After Pink (86020)     1    1  ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker.
1 button ½" [1.25 cm] diameter.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit baby 6/12 (18/24) mos.
gauge: 13 hdc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Note: Hat is worked from face opening to back of head.
Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc throughout.
HAT
With smaller hook and MC, ch 8. 
Ribbing: 1st row:  (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc. 
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row (buttonhole row): Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.
4th row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn.
5th row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 17 (18)" [43 (45.5) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. 
Place marker on side edge of Ribbing 5 (5½)" [12.5 (14) cm] up from foundation ch. 
1st row:  (RS). Working across side edge of Ribbing, ch 1. Work 42 (48) sc to marker. Turn. 
Change to larger hook. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (including ribbing) measures 4 (5)" [11.5 (12.5) cm], ending on a WS row. PM at end of last row.
Dec as follows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 (6) hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 36 (42) hdc. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 (5) hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 30 (36) hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 3 (4) hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 24 (30) hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 (3) hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 18 (24) hdc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 1 (2) hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 12 (18) hdc. Turn.
Size 18/24 mos only: 6th row:  Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 12 hdc. Turn.
Both sizes: Next row:  Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. 6 hdc.
Fasten off leaving a long end.  
Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely. Sew back seam to marked row.
Outer Ear (make 2)
With larger hook and MC, ch 3. 
1st row: (RS). 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 4½ (5½)" [11.5 (14) cm], ending on a WS row. 
Fasten off.
Inner Ear (make 2)
With larger hook and A, make as given for Outer Ear.
Join Ears:  With WS of Inner and Outer Ear facing each other, Outer Ear facing you and larger hook, join MC with sl st to top left corner of Ears through both thicknesses.
1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly down left side of Ear, 3 sc in bottom tip, work sc evenly up right side of Ear. Fasten off.
Rep for second Ear.
Finishing
Sew Ears to Hat as shown in picture. Sew button to left side of Hat at ribbing to correspond with buttonhole.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Unforgettable Waves™, 2 balls 3990 Menagerie
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat circumference: 20” [51 cm]
gauge: 16 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 20 rows = 4” [10 cm] in slip stitch.
instructions:
NOTES
Brim is worked in rows and then joined to make a loop to fit around head. Stitches are picked up along one long edge and are worked in joined rounds to top of crown.
SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
dc2tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next ch-1 space of V-st, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all loops on hook
V-Stitch: (Dc, ch 1, dc) all in the same st.
HAT
Brim
Ch 9.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 8 sts.
Rows 2-100: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, slip st in each st across.
Joining Row: Ch 1, turn, with wrong sides facing and right sides rows together, fold band in half to line up sts of first and last rows, working through both layers, sc in each st across to join ends. Turn Brim right side out.
Body
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1 here and throughout), dc in same st, [skip 3 rows, V-st in next row] around, slip st in 3rd ch of beg ch-4 – 25 V-sts.
Rounds 2-14: Ch 4, dc in ch-1 space, [V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st] around, slip st in 3rd ch of beg ch-4.
Shape Crown
Round 15: Ch 3, [dc2tog in ch-1 space of next 2 V-sts] 12 times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Weave long tail through sts of last row and pull to close top of crown. Secure end. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz /100 g; 127 yds/116 m)
Contrast A Raven (01005) 1 braid
Contrast B, C, D, E and F Purple Pops (01017) 1 braid
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Before working with Caron® x Pantone™ multi-shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls. 
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone # (see ball band)
• Designate each different shade of the 5 separate yarn balls as Contrast A, B, C, D, E and F as noted in Materials section (or as desired).
• Due to finite amount of yarn in each shade, pattern gauge must be matched to ensure successful results
• When working from chart and joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color not in use across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to prevent stranding.

Ribbing: 
With A, ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 hdc.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 2. Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram) in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing measures approx 21" [53.5 cm] long when slightly stretched, ending on a WS row. Turn.
Join Ribbing seam by working 1 sl st through both thicknesses in each back loop and each rem loop of foundation ch. Do not fasten off.

Beg working in rnds: Foundation rnd: Ch 1. Working along side edge of ribbing, work 72 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
1st to 18th rnds: Ch 1. Work 1st to 18th rows of Chart, noting 8-st rep will be worked 9 times. Join with sl st to first sc at end of each rnd.

19th rnd (Dec rnd): Ch 1. *With E, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With A, sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. With E, 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 63 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *With E, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.

Proceed as follows with A only:
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 45 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 27 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.

Pompom
Wind F around 4 fingers approx 100 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™
Kit includes 12 balls (1.7 oz/50 g; 21 oz/600 g total), yardage (93 yds/85 m; 1116 yds/1020 m total).
Contrast A Pumpkin 1 ball or 24 yds/22 m
Contrast B Saffron 1 ball or 65 yds/59 m
Contrast C Royal 1 ball or 24 yds/22 m
Contrast D Jade 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Contrast E Soft White 1 ball or 24 yds/22 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of ends counts as dc. To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
Beg at Crown, with B, ch 4. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 7 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join A with sl st to top of beg ch 3. 8 dc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break A.
3rd rnd: Join E with sl st in sp between any 2 groups of 2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. *3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break E. 8 groups of 3 dc.
4th rnd:  Join D with sl st in sp between any 2 groups of 3 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. *3 dc in center dc of next 3 dc group. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3 dc. Rep from * around ending with 3 dc in center dc of last 3 dc group. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break D. 16 groups of 3 dc.
5th rnd:  Join A with sl st in sp between any 2 groups of 3 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. *3 dc in center dc of next 3 dc group. (3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3 dc) 4 times. Rep from * around ending with (3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3 dc) 3 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break A. 20 groups of 3 dc.
6th rnd:  Join C with sl st in sp between any 2 groups of 3 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. *3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3 dc. Rep from * around to last group of 3 dc. 3 dc in center dc of next 3 dc group. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break C. 21 groups of 3 dc.
7th rnd: Join B with sl st in sp between any 2 groups of 3 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. *3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break B.
8th rnd: With A, as 7th rnd.
9th rnd: With E, as 7th rnd.
10th rnd: With D, as 7th rnd. 
11th rnd: With A, as 7th rnd. 
12th rnd: With C, as 7th rnd. 
13th rnd: With B, as 7th rnd. 
14th rnd: With A, as 7th rnd. 
15th rnd: With E, as 7th rnd.
Brim: Note: Brim rnds alternate RS and WS.
1st rnd:  (RS). Join D with sl st in any dc (center back of Hat). Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each dc around. 63 sc. Join with A with sl st to first sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join C with sl st to first sc. Turn. 84 sc.
3rd rnd: (RS). With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc. Turn.
4th rnd: (WS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. Turn. 126 sc.
5th rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat ® Super Value (197 g/7 oz; 389 m/426 yds)
Main Color (MC) (53022 Dark Heather) 1 ball
Contrast A (53015 Taupe Heather) 1 ball
Main Color (MC) (00607 Berry) 1 ball
Contrast A (07421 Black) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
White felt for eyes
Stuffing for Devil Hat horns
measurements: To fit child sizes 2/4 (6/8) yrs.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions: The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Both Versions: Note: Ch 2 does not count as st at beg of rnd. With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc. 3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next sc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc. 4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc. 5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc. 6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc. 7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 hdc.
