Size 6/8 yrs only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 64 hdc. Both sizes: Place marker at end of last rnd. Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 4½ (5) ins [11 (12.5) cm]. Join A at end of last rnd. With A, rep last rnd for 3 ins [7.5 cm]. Fasten off. Bear Version EARS (make 2). Inner Ear: **With A, ch 2. 1st row: (RS). 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of first 3 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc. 3rd row: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 11 sc. 4th row: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 15 sc. 5th row: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 19 sc.** Fasten off. Outer Ear: With MC, work from ** to ** as given for Inner Ear. Do not break MC. With WS of Inner and Outer Ears tog, with MC work through both thicknesses as follows: Next row: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Do not turn. 23 sc. Next row: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc across. Fasten off. FINISHING Fold A section to RS for cuff. Sew Ears to Hat. With white felt, cut out eye circles 1 ¼ ins [3 cm] diameter. With A, embroider eyes over felt, using satin stitch. Embroider nose and snout as shown in photo. Devil Version Horns (make 2) **With MC, ch 12. Join with sl st to first sc to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.** Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 3 ins [7.5 cm]. Shape points: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2 tog made. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 9 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2 tog. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sc. 4th rnd: As 2nd rnd. 5th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2 tog) 3 times. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread yarn through rem sts. Pull tightly. Stuff Horns. Thread yarn down side of Horn. Pull slightly to form bend. Secure yarn. Sew horns in position. Tail Work from ** to ** as given for Horns. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 12 ins [30.5 cm]. Fasten off. Fringe: Cut 12 strands of MC 3 ins [7.5 cm] long. Taking 1 strand, knot into fringe around end of Tail. Trim fringe evenly. Tie end of Tail into knot, leaving fringe free. Sew Tail to back of Hat. With white felt cut out eyes 1 ¼ ins [3 cm] diameter. With MC, sew in position using Satin stitch.

materials: Bernat® Satin™ (100 g/3.5 oz; 182 m/200 yds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit child 2/4 (6/8) yrs.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Do not break colors. Carry color not in use loosely up WS of work. To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color and draw through rem 2 loops and proceed.
Beg at top of crown, with A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 3 dc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 18 dc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. *2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 2 dc in each of last 2 sc. Join A with sl st to top of ch 3. 33 dc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 3. *Miss next dc. Dcfp around post of next dc, then dcfp around post of missed dc – Cr Dcfp made. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 49 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3.
Size 2/4 only: 7th rnd: With B, ch 3. *(Cr Dcfp) 3 times. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). (Cr Dcfp) twice. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * to last 8 dc. [(Cr Dcfp) twice. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made)] twice, omitting last dc in rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 59 sts.
Size 6/8 only: 7th rnd: With B, ch 3. *(Cr Dcfp) twice. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * to last 8 dc. [Cr Dcfp. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made)] 4 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 63 sts.
Both sizes: 8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join A with sl st to top of ch 3.
9th rnd: With A, ch 3. *Cr Dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3.
11th and 12th rnds: With B, as 9th and 10th rnds, joining A at end of 12th rnd.
Rep 8th to 12th rnds for pat until work from beg measures approx 7" [18 cm], ending with 2 rnds of B and joining A at end of last rnd. Break B.
next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (1 sc in each of next 19 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 57 (61) sc.
next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Pompom: Wind A around 4 fingers 80 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to form pompom. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Speckle™ (5 oz/141 g; 235 yd/215 m)
Galaxy (61014) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcbp2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dcfp2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dcfp3tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop around each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook 3 times.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as a st.
With smaller hook, ch 68 loosely. Join with sl st to first ch making sure not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 68 sts.
2nd to 8th rnds: Ch 2. *1 hdcfp around first st. 1 hdcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdcfp. Change to larger hook.
9th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
10th and 11th rnds: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
12th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Skip next 3 sts. 1 trfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 trfp around each of 3 skipped sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
13th and 14th rnds: As 10th and 11th rnds.
Rep 10th to 14th rnds once more.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Dcfp2tog. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Dcfp2tog. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 60 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. (Dcfp2tog) twice. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 52 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Dcbp2tog. 1 dcbp around next st. Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcfp around skipped st. 1 dcbp around next st. Dcbp2tog. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 44 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. Skip next st. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Dcfp3tog. Rep from * to last 10 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Dcfp2tog. Join with sl st to first dcbp. 36 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcbp around next st. Dcbp2tog. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. Dcbp2tog. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcbp. 28 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcbp2tog. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Dcbp2tog. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcbp. 20 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.
Pompom
Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 120 times. Remove from fingers. Tie tightly in the middle with 1 strand of yarn and leave 2 long ends for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Attach to hat as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 2 skeins 356 Amethyst A
1 skein 312 Black B
1 skein 256 Carrot C
Crochet Hooks: 6.5mm [US K-10.5] (for hat) and 5mm [US H-8] (for hat band and attaching hair)
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, B, and C
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Finished Circumference: 18 (19, 21)”
gauge: 10 sts = 4”; 11 rows = 4” in single crochet with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Beginning at top of hat, with larger hook and 2 strands of A held together, ch 4; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times, sc in next 2 sc—36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 9: Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times, sc in next 4 sc—54 sc.
Round 10: [Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—60 sc.
Round 11: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc] 6 times—66 sc.
Round 12: Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times, sc in next 5 sc—72 sc.
Round 13: [Sc in next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—78 sc. Fasten off.
Round 14 (Wrong Side): With Wrong Side facing, join A with sc in last st of Round 13, sc in each remaining sc around. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Round 15 (Right Side): With Right Side facing, join A with sc in last st of Round 14, sc in each remaining sc around.
Rounds 16 and 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: [Sc in next 11 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—72 sts.
Rounds 19–21: Sc in each sc around.
Round 22: [Sc in next 10 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—66 sts.
Round 23: Sc in each sc around.
Round 24: [Sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—60 sts.
Recreate your own version of Willy Wonka or the Mad Hatter or perhaps make this outlandish crocheted hat in green and be a leprechaun.

Instructions include how to attach and style tangled yarn hair.

MAD WILLY HAT | CROCHET
CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: EASY
Round 25: Sc in each sc around.
Round 26: [Sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—54 sts.
Round 27: Sc in each sc around.
Round 28: [Sc in next 4 (7, 25) sc, sc2tog] 9 (6, 2) times—45 (48, 52) sts.
Rounds 29–33 (35, 35): Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off.
Brim
Round 1: With Wrong Side facing and larger hook, join A with sc in last st of Round 33 (35, 35), sc in each remaining sc around—45 (48, 52) sc. Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [Sc in next 6 (7, 7) sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times, sc in last 3 (0, 4) sc—51 (54, 58) sts.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 (8, 8) sc] 6 times, sc in last 3 (0, 4) sc—57 (60, 64) sts.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc in next 8 (9, 9) sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times, sc in last 3 (0, 4) sc—63 (66, 70) sts.
Round 7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 12 times, sc in last 3 (6, 10) sc—75 (78, 82) sts.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] 12 times, sc in last 3 (6, 10) sc—87 (90, 94) sts.
Fasten off.
HAT BAND
With smaller hook and B, ch 10.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—9 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), dc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, turn.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until band measures 18 (19, 21)”. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. With Right Side facing, wrap band around hat just above brim. Sew short ends of band together. Sew band to hat, sewing across top and lower edges of band.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Hair
Decide which part of the hat you want to be the back (select the part that you want to be seen the least). Place markers on Round 1 of brim, inside hat, placing one on each side of 26 (28, 30) sts centered at back of hat. 
Attach Hair: Attach a fringe to each of the 26 (28, 30) sts, as follows:
Cut four 12” lengths of C. Hold the lengths together and fold in half. Insert hook, from inside of hat, into one of the stitches, insert hook into the fold of C and draw the fold through forming a loop (only draw the fold through, do not draw the strands all the way through). Insert the ends of the strands into the loop and pull to tighten.
Tangle Hair: Separate the plies of the strands. A comb or brush may help. Pull the plies apart beginning at the bottom of each strand. Use the hair ratting technique to tangle the yarn.

materials: Patons® Uplands™ (3.2 oz/90 g; 99 yds/90 m) Chocolate Cherry Mix (98007) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 buttons.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 11 single crochet (sc) and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Chain (ch) 2 at beginning (beg) of rounds (rnds) does not count as stitch (st). Join each rnd with a slip stitch (sl st) to first st of rnd.
Ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. 20 hdc. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Repeat (rep) from * around. 30 hdc. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 40 hdc. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 50 hdc. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 60 hdc. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 7" [18 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 single crochet (sc) in each of next 8 hdc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yarn over hook (yoh) and draw through all loops on hook - Single crochet 2 together (sc2tog) made. Rep from * around. 54 sc. Join.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
Brim: Join yarn with sl st to 13th sc of last rnd.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next 3 rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Continuing (cont) along side of Brim and around edge of Hat, work sc evenly around. Join. Fasten off.
Band
Ch 40.
1st row: 1 double crochet (dc) in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Band to Hat at top of Brim. Sew one button to each end of Brim.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 ball 1505 Peacock
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] (for single crochet sections) and 6.5mm [US K-10.5] (for texture pattern sections)
Stitch marker, pompom maker, Yarn needle.
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Finished Circumference: 20 (22)” (51 (56) cm), Finished Height: 11” (28 cm)
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 13 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet with smaller hook. 10 sts = 4” (10 cm); 10 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in texture pattern with larger hook.
instructions:
HAT
With smaller hook, make an adjustable ring. 
Note: If preferred, a beginning ring can be 
made as follows: With smaller hook, ch 4; join 
with slip st in first ch.
First Single Crochet Section
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join 
with slip st in first sc—8 sc. Place a marker 
in the last sc made. Move marker up as each 
round is completed.
Note: Work first stitch of every round in the 
same stitch as joining.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join 
with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in first 
hsc—24 sc.
Size Small Only
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with 
slip st in first sc, TURN.
Size Large Only
Round 4: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next 
st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in 
first sc, TURN—32 sts.
Both Sizes
First Texture Pattern Section
Change to larger hook. 
Round 5 (wrong side): Ch 1, *hdc in next st, 
slip st in next st; repeat from * around; do not 
join—24 (32) sts.
Directions are for size Small. Changes for 
size Large are in parentheses
Finished Circumference: 20 (22)” (51 (56) cm)
Finished Height: 11” (28 cm)
Special Technique
Adjustable-ring = Wrap yarn into a ring, 
ensuring that the tail falls behind the working 
yarn. Grip ring and tail between middle finger 
and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, 
yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a 
loop. Work stitches of first round in the ring. 
After the first round of stitches is worked, pull 
gently on tail to tighten ring.
Notes
1. Hat is worked in rounds beginning at 
top of hat. Sections of single crochet are 
alternated with sections of a texture pattern 
created with half double crochet and slip 
stitches. In single crochet sections, the last 
stitch of each round is joined to the first 
stitch with a slip stitch. In texture pattern 
sections, only the first and last rounds are 
joined. Pay careful attention to instructions 
to know when to join and when not.
2. The texture pattern is created by working 
half double crochet stitches into the slip 
stitches and slip stitches into the half 
double crochet stitches of the previous 
round. When working increase rounds not 
all half double crochet stitches are worked 
into slip stitches and not all slip stitches are 
worked into half double crochet stitches, 
but half double crochet stitches are always 
alternated with slip stitches.
3. Only turn rounds when instructed to do 
so. Single crochet sections are worked 
with right side facing, and texture pattern 
sections are worked with wrong side facing.
Size Small Only
Round 6: *Slip st in next st, hdc in next st, 
(slip st, hdc) in next st; repeat from * around; 
do not join—32 sts.
Size Large Only
Round 6: *Slip st in next st, hdc in next st, slip 
st in next st, (hdc, slip st) in next st, hdc in 
next st, slip st in next st, hdc in next st, (slip st, 
hdc) in next st; repeat from * around; do not 
join—40 sts.
Both Sizes
Round 7: *Hdc in next st, slip st in next st; 
repeat from * around; do not join—32 (40) sts.
Round 8: *Slip st in next st, hdc in next st; 
repeat from * around; do not join.
Round 9: *Hdc in next st, slip st in next st; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in first 
hdc, TURN.
Second Single Crochet Section
Change to smaller hook.
Round 10 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each st 
around; join with slip st in first sc—32 (40) sts.
Round 11: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 (4) sts, 2 sc in 
next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st 
in first sc—40 (48) sts.
Round 12: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join 
with slip st in first sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, *sc in next 4 (5) sts, 2 sc in 
next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st 
in first sc—48 (56) sts.
Rounds 14 and 15: Ch 1, sc in each st around; 
join with slip st in first sc, TURN.
Second Texture Pattern Section
Change to larger hook.
Round 16 (wrong side): Ch 1, *hdc in next st, 
slip st in next st; repeat from * around; do not 
join.
Round 17: *Slip st in next st, hdc in next st; 
repeat from * around; do not join.
Size Small Only
Round 18: *Hdc in next st, [slip st in next st, 
hdc in next st] twice, (slip st, hdc) in next st, 
slip st in next st, [hdc in next st, slip st in next 
st] twice, (hdc, slip st) in next st; repeat from * 
around; do not join—56 sts.
Size Large Only
Round 18: *[Hdc in next st, slip st in next st] 
3 times, (hdc, slip st) in next st; repeat from * 
around; do not join—64 sts.
Both Sizes
Round 19: *Slip st in next st, hdc in next st; 
repeat from * around; do not join—56 (64) sts.
Round 20: *Hdc in next st, slip st in next st; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in first 
hdc, TURN.
Third Single Crochet Section
Change to smaller hook.
Rounds 21–24 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each 
st around; join with slip st in first sc. TURN at 
end of Round 24.
Third Texture Pattern Section
Change to larger hook.
Round 25 (wrong side): Ch 1, *hdc in next st, 
slip st in next st; repeat from * around; do not 
join.
Round 26: *Slip st in next st, hdc in next st; 
repeat from * around; do not join.
Round 27: *Hdc in next st, slip st in next st; 
repeat from * around; do not join.
Round 28: Repeat Round 26.
Round 29: *Hdc in next st, slip st in next st; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in first 
hdc, TURN.
Fourth Single Crochet and Texture 
Pattern Sections
Work same as Third Single Crochet and 
Texture Pattern Sections.
FINISHING
Pompom
Following manufacturer instructions, make a 
pompom of any size you prefer. Tie pompom 
to top of hat. 
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: All in One Granny Crochet Balaclava
materials: YARN
• Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
COLORS
• Contrast A Dove (2016) 1 ball (4 Granny squares)
• Contrast B Shadow (2017) 1 ball (4 Granny Squares)
TOOLS
• Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
• Susan Bates® yarn needle.
• Tape measure.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One Size to Fit Adult.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools. 
NOTES
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 round (rnd) in the Motif with 5 colors in total. If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some stitches (sts) and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends, leaving a tail for weaving in. Begin next Motif with Color 1 and repeat 5 rnds for each Motif.
• Granny Square how to: https://www.yarnspirations.com/pages/how-to-granny-square-guide

INSTRUCTIONS
MOTIF
Make 4 each with A and B.
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as double crochet (dc).
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with slip stitch (sl st) to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Whipstitch squares tog as shown in Assembly Diagram. Face Edging. Join black section of A with slip stitch (sl st) to any dc of Motif indicated on Assembly Diagram.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *Work 1 single crochet (sc) in each dc until 2 sts before next corner. (Sc2tog) twice. Rep from * once more. Work 1 sc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Bulky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 78 yds/71 m) Royal Blue (89132) 2 balls
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions: Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. Ch 40. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 3rd to 13th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 14th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Hdc2tog. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 35 hdc. 15th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 28 hdc. 16th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 21 hdc. 17th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 14 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely. Pompon: Wind yarn around 4 fingers 60 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to top of Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to form pompon. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: Red Heart® Hygge Charm™ (7 oz/198 g; 432 yds/395 m)
Sizes S M L
Comet (6319) 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop at front of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice around post of next st. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook

Cluster dcfp2tog = *Yoh and draw up a loop at front of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice around post of next Cluster dcfp. Rep from * once more. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook - Cluster dcfp2tog made Note: Skip any sts or sps between two Clusters when working Cluster dcfp2tog
Scbp = Draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook
Scfp = Draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook
measurements: To fit adult head S (M-L).
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Notes: • Hat is worked in joined rnds from top down to lower edge. • Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. • Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. • Join all rnds with sl st to first st (dc or Cluster dcfp). Ch 4. Join with sl st to 4th ch from hook to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3. 10 (11-12) dc in ring. Join. 11 (12-13) dc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. Cluster around first st. *Ch 1. Cluster around next st. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join. 11 (12-13) Clusters. 3rd rnd: Ch 2. Cluster around first st. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. *Cluster around next Cluster. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join. 11 (12-13) Clusters. 4th rnd: Ch 2. Cluster around first st. 3 dc in next dc. *Cluster around next Cluster. 3 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 11 (12-13) Clusters. 5th rnd: Ch 2. (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) around first st. 1 sc in center dc of next 3-dc group. *(Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) around next Cluster. 1 sc in center dc of next 3-dc group. Rep from * around. Join. 6th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Cluster dcfp2tog over next 2 Cluster dcfp (skipping the ch-1 sp between). *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Cluster dcfp2tog over next 2 Clusters. Rep from * around. Join. 7th rnd: Sl st in next (dc and ch-2 sp). Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Cluster around next Cluster dcfp2tog. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Cluster around next Cluster dcfp2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 8th rnd: Sl st in next (dc and ch-2 sp). Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) around next Cluster. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) around next Cluster. Rep from * around. Join. 9th rnd: Sl st in next dc and ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Cluster around next Cluster. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Cluster around next Cluster. *1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Cluster around next Cluster. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Cluster around next Cluster. Rep from * around. Join. 10th rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 sts and ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Cluster dcfp2tog over next 2 Clusters. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Cluster dcfp2tog over next 2 Clusters. Rep from * around. Join. 11th rnd: Sl st in next dc and ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) around next Cluster dcfp2tog. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) around next Cluster dcfp2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12th to 20th rnds: As 9th to 11th rnds 3 times more. 21st rnd: Sl st in next (dc and ch-2 sp). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Cluster around next Cluster. 3 sc in next ch-1 sp. Cluster around next Cluster. *1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Cluster around next Cluster. 3 sc in next ch-1 sp. Cluster around next Cluster. Rep from * around. Join. 22nd rnd: Sl st in next (Cluster and sc). Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Cluster dcfp2tog over next 2 Clusters. *2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Cluster dcfp2tog over next 2 Clusters. Rep from * around. Join. 23rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 scfp around first st. 1 scfp around each of next 5 sc. 1 scfp around next Cluster dcfp2tog. *1 scfp around each of next 6 sc. 1 scfp around next Cluster dcfp2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 77 (84-91) sts. 24th to 27th rnds: Ch 1. 1 scbp around each st around. Join. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby™ (140 g/5 oz; 331 m/362 yds)
Contrast A Antique White (30008) 1 1 1 ball
Contrast B Soft Red (30424) 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. 6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® Steel Yarn Needle.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit 6 mos (12 mos -18/24 mos).
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Note: Ch 2 at beg of each rnd does not count as hdc.
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: 12 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 11 (3-2) hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 11 (3-2) hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 10 (2-1) hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 52 (60-64) hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4 (5-5)" [10 (12.5-12.5) cm].
First Ear Flap: Proceed in rows as follows:
**1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 13 (15-15) hdc. Turn. Leave rem hdc unworked.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 9 (11-11) hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 7 (9-9) hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 (7-7) hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn.
Size 6 mos only: Fasten off.**
Sizes 12 mos and 18/24 mos only: 7th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Hdc2tog. Fasten off.**
All sizes: Skip next 18 (22-26) hdc. Join A with sl st to next hdc. Work from ** to ** as given for first Ear Flap.
Edging: Join B with sl st to center back hdc. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around edge of Hat, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Outer Ear (make 2).
With A, ch 11.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
10 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 8 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
9th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Inner Ear (make 2).
With B, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Inner Ear to Outer Ear.
Attach Ears to sides of Hat as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 9518 Teal
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook®: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch markers
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Headwarmer measures 5” (12.5 cm) wide x 21” (53.5 cm) long
gauge: 15 sc = 4” (10 cm). In pattern, 10 rows = 4” (10 cm).
instructions:
HEADWARMER
Row 1: Work 17 Fsc (see Special Stitches).
Row 2 (Right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each of the next 16 sts; turn—17 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1 (does not count as a st), sc in each of the next 16 dc, sc in top of beginning ch-3; turn—17 sc.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in each of the next 5 sc, Fptr around next dc 2 rows below, BR (see Special Stitches) over next 3 dc 2 rows below, Fptr around next dc 2 rows below, dc in each of the next 6 sc; turn—12 dc, 5 Fptr.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each of the next 16 sts and in the top of beginning ch-3; turn—17 sc.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in each of the next 5 sc, Fptr around next Fptr 2 rows below, BR over next 3 BR sts 2 rows below, Fptr around next dc 2 rows below, dc in each of the next 6 sc; turn—12 dc, 5 Fptr.
Repeat Rows 5-6 until piece measures 21” (53.5 cm) or desired length, ending on a Row 5. Do not fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Note: First and last rows are joined by slip stitching the outside loops of each set of 2 stitches together so the inside loops form a decorative ridge on the Right side of the headwarmer.
Right sides together, match sts from first and last rows (it may be helpful to use stitch markers), turn headwarmer so working yarn is at top right, drop the loop from the hook and reinsert hook into front loop of first st of Row 1, draw loop through to join sts, *insert hook into front loop of next st of Row 1 and back loop of next st of last row, draw up loop and make a slip st; repeat from * across; turn piece Right side out.
EDGING
Chain 1, skip first stitch, work rev sc (see Special Stitches) evenly along the side, slip st to first st to join; fasten off. Join yarn to second side and repeat. Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® Gumdrop®: 1 ball each of 930 Orange A and 620 Cherry B.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5 mm [US H-8] and 3.75 [US F-5] for size Small (6 mm [US J-10] and 5 mm [US H-8] for size Large).
Yarn needle
One 10 mm orange or blue bead for each hat
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Small hat measures 18” (45.5 cm) in circumference using smaller hooks and gauge. Large hat measures 20” (51 cm) in circumference using larger hooks and gauge.
gauge: With smaller hook for Small, first 3 rounds = 1¾” (4.4 cm) in diameter; with larger hook for Large, first 3 rounds = 2” (5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needle to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HAT
With larger hook for desired size and A, ch 4, join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc – 8 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc – 16 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *skip next sc, shell in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 8 shells.
Round 5: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in same sc, *hdc in next dc, sc in next dc, hdc in next dc**, 2 dc in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 40 sts. 
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc – 40 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *skip next sc, shell in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around; skip last sc; join with a slip st in first sc – 13 shells).
Round 8: Ch 3, 2 dc in first sc, *sc in center dc of next shell, shell in next sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Round 9: Slip st in next dc, ch 1, sc in same dc, *shell in next sc, sc in center dc of next shell; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 13 shells.
Rounds 10-13: Repeat Round 8-9 twice. 
Round 14: Ch 3, *hdc in next dc, sc in next dc, hdc in next dc**, dc in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beg ch-3 – 52 sts. 
Round 15: Sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc – 52 sc. 
Change to smaller hook. 
Rounds 16-17: With smaller hook for desired size, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc. 
Round 18: Ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in first sc, *skip next sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.
Weave in ends.

FLOWER
Note: Use larger hook for desired size. 
With 2 strands of B held together as one, ch 5, join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, [sc, ch 3] 8 times in ring; join with a slip st in first sc – 8 ch-3 spaces. 
Round 2: Working behind sts in Round 1, ch 1, sc in next space between 2 sc, [ch 5, sc between next 2 sc] 7 times, ch 5; join with a slip st in first sc – 8 ch-5 spaces. Fasten off, leaving a 9” (23 cm) sewing length. 
FINISHING
With yarn needle and sewing length, sew Flower to border of Hat through sts of Round 2 of Flower.
With yarn needle and a single strand of B sew bead hole to center of Flower. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver: 1 Skein each 334 Buff A 319 Cherry Red B, and 365 Coffee C.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hat Circumference: 20”.
gauge: 12 sc = 4”; 16 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 62.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc and dc in same st, *skip 2 ch, work (sc, hdc, dc) in next ch; repeat from * across to last 3 ch, skip 2 ch, sc in last ch.
Rounds 2-10: Ch 1, turn, (sc, hdc, dc) in first sc, *skip next dc and hdc, (sc, hdc, dc) in next sc; repeat from * across to last 3 sts, skip next dc and hdc, sc in sc. Do not fasten off.
Joining Row: With right sides together, fold Hat in half crosswise, turn to work along side edges, working through both layers along edges of rows, sc evenly spaced to Row 1. Do not fasten off.
Top Edge
Round 1: With wrong side facing, turn to work opposite foundation ch, ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), *hdc in sc, hdc in ch-2 space; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 40 hdc. 
Rounds 2-4: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc, slip st in top of beginning ch. Do not fasten off.
Joining Row: Flatten Hat and working through both layers, slip st across 20 sts to join top of Hat. 
Fasten off. 
Band
Round 1: With right side facing, join B in seam on lower edge of Hat, ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in first sc to join – 60 sts.
Rounds 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in each sc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 5: With C, ch 2, Fphdc in each hdc around, slip st in beginning ch.
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 7: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each hdc around, slip st into first st.
Round 8: Ch 1, [sc in next 10 sc, ch 2, sc in same sc] around, slip st in first st.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch-2 space around, slip st in first beginning sc – 72 sc.
Round 10: With A, ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft™: 1 skein 9344 Chocolate.
Crochet Hook: 4.25mm (US G-6)
Yarn needle
Heavy weight interfacing or a 15 oz. margarine tub for brim insert
Stitch markers
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Finished Head Circumference: 19 (20, 21”)
gauge: 5 sts = 1”, 18 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Crown
Round 1: Ch 2; work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 48 sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 54 sc.
Round 10: [Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 60 sc.
Round 11: [Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 66 sc.
Round 12: [Sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 72 sc.
Size Medium Only
Round 13: [Sc in next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 78 sc.
Size Large Only
Round 13: [Sc in next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 78 sc.
Round 14: [Sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 84 sc.
All Sizes
Round 13 (14, 15): Sc in each sc around – 72 (78, 84) sc.
Round 14 (15, 16): [Sc in next 11 (12, 13) sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 78 (84, 90) sc.
Round 15 (16, 17): Sc in each sc around; turn.
Round 16 (17, 18): With wrong side facing, [sc in next 12 (13, 14) sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 84 (90, 96) sc.
Round 17 (18, 19): Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off; weave in loose ends.
Round 18 (19, 20): With right side facing, join yarn in slip st of previous row, sc in each st around – 84 (90, 96) sc.
Round 19 (20, 21): Sc in each sc around.
Size Medium Only
Round 21: Sc in each sc around.
This cool look will have a boy wanting to wear a hat for its style, not necessarily to keep warm.
Crocheted in easy care yarn so that if he tosses it in dirt you can toss it in the washer and dryer.

All Sizes
Round 20 (22, 22): [Sc in next 12 (13, 14) sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 78 (84, 90) sc
Round 21 (23, 23): Sc in each sc around.
Round 22 (24, 24): Sc in each sc around.
Round 23 (25, 25): Sc in each sc around.
Round 24 (26, 26): [Sc in next 11 (12, 13) sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 72 (78, 84) sc
Round 25 (27, 27): Sc in each sc around.
Round 26 (28, 28): Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off; weave in loose ends.
brim Top
With right side facing, mark the center front of hat; count 13 (14, 14) sts from the left and right of center and place a marker on each side.
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn in front loop of first marked st on the right side of hat; ch1, sc in front loop of same sc; sc in front loops of next 25 (27, 27) sc; turn – 26 (28, 28) sc
Row 2: Sc in first sc and in each st across; turn.
Row 3: Skip first sc; sc in next sc and in each sc across to last 2 sc; skip next sc;, sc in last sc – 24 (26, 26) sc.
Row 4-6: Repeat Row 2.
Row 7: Repeat Row 3 – 22 (24, 24) sc.
Row 8-9: Repeat Row 2.
Size Medium and Large Only
Row (10, 10): Repeat Row 2.
All Sizes
Row 10-12 (11-13, 11-13): Repeat Row 3 – 16 (18, 18) sc.
Fasten off.
With right side facing, join yarn in Row 1 of brim top; ch1, sc in same st; work 10 (11, 11) sc evenly across right side of brim top; sc in each of 16 (18, 18) sc across brim front; work 11 (12, 12) sc evenly across left side of brim top. Fasten off; weave in loose ends – 38 (42, 42) sc.
brim bottom
Row 1: With wrong side facing, join yarn in back loop of Row 1 of brim top; ch1, sc in back loop of same sc; sc in back loops of next 25 (27, 27) sc – 26 (28, 28) sc.
Rows 2-12 (13, 13): Repeat pattern for brim top. Fasten off.
With right side facing, join yarn in Row 1 of brim bottom; ch1, sc in same sc; work 10 (11, 11) sc evenly across right side of brim bottom; sc in each of next 16 (18, 18) sc across front of brim bottom; work 11 (12, 12) sc evenly across left side of brim bottom. Fasten off; weave in loose ends – 38 (42, 42) sc.
Hat band
Row 1: Ch 6; sc in second ch from hook; sc in each ch across; turn – 5 sc.
Row 2: Sc in each sc across.
Row 3-76 (3-80, 3-84): Repeat Row 2. Rows can be increased or decreased to fit around the base of the hat.
With right side facing, sew hat band side seam. Weave in loose ends.
Finishing
Place hat band on base of the hat and sew around bottom of band; tack front and back of band to hat along the top of band.
Using Brim as a template, cut a piece of heavy-weight interfacing or margarine tub to same dimensions. Place piece between layers of Brim and sew Brim closed. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Hygge™ or Hygge™ 8oz.: 1 ball 8406 Pearl
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm [US K-10½]
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Balaclava measures 17¾ (19½, 20½)" (45 (49.5, 52) cm) in circumference around head.
gauge: 9 dc = 4" (10 cm); 6 dc rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BALACLAVA
Ch 4, and join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring, join with slip st in 3rd of beginning ch-3, turn – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining slip st, 2 dc in each st around, join with slip st in 3rd of beginning ch-3, turn – 24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining slip st, dc in next st, * 2 dc in next st, dc in next st; repeat from * around, join with slip st in 3rd of beginning ch-3, turn – 36 dc.
Place 4 (8, 10) markers evenly spaced around last round.
Round 4: Ch 3, * dc in each dc to marked dc, 2 dc in marked dc, remove marker; repeat from * 3 (7, 9) more times, dc in each remaining dc to end, join with slip st in 3rd of beginning ch-3, turn – 40 (44, 46) dc.
Next 2 (3, 3) rounds: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, join with slip st in 3rd of beginning ch-3, turn.
Fasten off.
Face Opening
With wrong side (right side, right side) facing, skip 25 (27, 28) dc, and join yarn with standing dc in next dc.
Row 1: Dc in each of next 29 (33, 35) sts, turn, leaving remaining sts unworked – 30 (34, 36) dc.
Row 2: Ch 1 loosely (does not count as a st), dc in first st, dc2tog, dc in each st to last 3 sts, dc2tog, dc in last st, turn – 28 (32, 34) dc.
Row 3: Ch 1 loosely, dc in first st and in each st to end, turn.
Repeat the last row 2 (2, 3) times.
Next row (right side, wrong side, right side): Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in first dc, dc in each dc to last dc, 2 dc in last dc, ch 10, join with slip st to 3rd of beginning ch-3 forming a round – 30 (34, 36) dc and 10 ch.
Fasten off.
Rejoin for Neck
With wrong side (right side, wrong side) facing, join yarn with standing dc in center back of piece.
Round 1: Dc in each dc and ch st around, join with slip st in first standing dc, turn – 40 (44, 46) dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, join with slip st in 3rd of beginning ch-3, turn.
Repeat the last round 1 (1, 2) more times.
Last Round: Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
EARS (Make 2)
Leaving a long tail for sewing, ch 9. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end – 8 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sts, sc2tog twice, sc in each of next 2 sts, turn – 6 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn. 
Row 6: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each of next 2 sts, sc2tog – 4 sc.
Row 7: Sc2tog twice – 2 sts.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Face Opening Edging
Round 1 (right side): Join yarn with standing sc in corner of face opening, sc evenly around, join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
Use long yarn tails to sew ears onto top of hood, using photo as a reference.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Light & Lofty®”: 1 Skein 9932 Spice Multi.
Crochet Hook: 10mm [US N-15].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Circumference: 20 (22 ¾)”.
gauge: 7 sts = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 35 (40); join with a slip st in first ch being careful that chain is not twisted.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with a slip st in first sc – 35 (40) sc.
Repeat Rnd 1 until 6 (7 1/2)” from beginning.
Size Small/Medium ONLY-Shape Crown-Rnd 1: Ch 1, [sc in 5 sc, sc2tog] 5 times; join – 30 sc.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, [sc in 4 sc, sc2tog] 5 times; join – 25 sc.
Rnd 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Both Sizes-Next Rnd: Ch 1, [sc in 3 sc, sc2tog] 5 (8) times; join – 20 (32) sc.
Next Rnd: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Next Rnd: Ch 1, [sc in 2 sc, sc2tog] 5 (8) times; join – 15 (24) sc.
Next Rnd: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Next Rnd: Ch 1, [sc in one sc, sc2tog] 5 (8) times; join – 10 (16) sc.
Size Medium/Large ONLY-Next Rnd: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Next Rnd: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 8 times; join – 8 sc.
Both Sizes: Fasten off leaving a 12” tail. Thread yarn in yarn needle and through remaining sts; draw up firmly, fasten securely. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 312 and 316 Soft White B.
Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6] and 3.5mm [US E-4] (for appliqué).
Stitch markers.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Small: 6” wide x 3“ tall. Medium/Large: 7½” wide x 3½” tall.
gauge: With larger hook, 18 sts = 4”; 20 rows sc = 4”. Gauge is not overly important for this project since the hat is designed to sit on top of the head. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Hat Brim (make 2)
With larger hook and A, ch 21 (31).
Row 1: Working in back bumps only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 20 (30) sc.
NOTE: On opposite side of foundation ch, mark placement of crown by placing a marker in 6th (11th) ch from each end of foundation ch.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 5 (10) sts, place marker, hdc in next 3 sts, [dc in next st, 2 dc in next st] twice, hdc in next 3 sts, sc in next st, place marker, sc in last 4 (9) sts, turn – 32 (42) sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 5 (10) sts, hdc in next 12 sts, sc in last 5 (10) sts, turn – 22 (32) sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 5 (10) sts, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next st, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, dc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in last 5 (10) sts, turn – 26 (36) sts.
Row 5: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in first st, sc in next 4 (9) sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st, sc in next 4 (9) sts, hdc in last st, turn – 32 (42) sts. Fasten off size Small, leaving a long sewing length.
Size Medium/Large only
Row 6: Ch 2, hdc in first st, sc in next 9 sts, hdc in last st, turn – 42 sts.
Row 7: Ch 2, hdc in first st, sc in next 9 sts, hdc in st, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 5 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 6 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 5 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next 9 sts, hdc in last st – 46 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long sewing length.
Hat Crown/Gusset
Row 1: With right side facing and larger hook, join A with a slip st in back loop of first marked ch on opposite side of foundation ch, working in back loops of ch sts only, ch 1, sc in same st and in next 8 ch sts, turn leaving remaining sts unworked – 9 sts.
Row 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Fasten off size Small, leaving a long sewing length.
Size Medium/Large only
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Fasten off, leaving a long sewing length.
ASSEMBLY
With yarn needle and sewing length, working in inside loops of sts, whipstitch last row of Crown/Gussett to corresponding marked sts of foundation ch on second Hat Brim. Weave in ends.
APPLIQUÉ
Size Small only
Skull
With smaller hook and B, ch 3.
Row 1: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next st, turn – 3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn – 4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc last sc, turn – 6 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 3 sts, skip next sc, sc in last sc, turn – 4 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
Cross Bones (make 2)
With smaller hook and B, ch 2.
First End: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc, ch 9.
Second End: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
Size Medium/Large only
Skull
With smaller hook and B, ch 3.
Row 1: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next st, turn – 3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn – 5 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] twice, turn – 7 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn – 5 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sts, slip st in last st.
Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
Cross Bones (make 2)
With smaller hook and B, ch 2.
First End: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc, ch 11.
Second End: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
Ear Loop: With larger hook, join A with slip st in corner at base of Row 1 of Crown/Gusset, ch 10 (16) or desired length to fit over ear, skip side edge of Crown/Gusset, slip st in corner on opposite side of Crown/Gusset where last row is joined to other Brim (Ear Loop made). Fasten off. Tie: With larger hook, join A to center of Ear Loop just formed, ch 33 (50) or desired length for Tie. Fasten off. Repeat Ear Loop and Tie on opposite side of Crown/Gusset.
FINISHING
Lay out Cross Bones in an “X” configuration on front of hat as pictured and with yarn needle and sewing length, whipstitch bones in place. With yarn needle and A, satin st 2 eyes and a triangular shaped nose as pictured on Skull. Whipstitch skull onto hat as pictured. Place 2 Brim pieces together with wrong sides facing, With yarn needle and A, matching sts, whipstitch Brim pieces together across short edges. Brim shape is maintained by making a stitch through both parts in 2 different locations on the top edge of the brim, (do not sew entire brim closed). Hold hat together at the top. Tack the 2 layers together as indicated by the letter “A” on the schematic, using a single stitch. Weave in ends. Tie to dog’s head using ties, being careful not to tie the piece too tightly. The chain loop is designed to hold the hat straight on the head and can be used to poke ears through as needed.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Sizes    2/4       6/8 yrs
Contrast A Lemonade (9776)                  1                 1  ball
Contrast B Chartreuse (9771)                  1                 1  ball
Contrast C Kelly Green (9769)                  1                 1  ball
Contrast D Ocean (9759)                  1                 1  ball
Contrast E Fuchsia (9764)                  1                 1  ball
Contrast F Red (9729)               1                 1  ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in indicated space or stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: To fit child's head 2/4 (6/8) yrs.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Beg at top of crown, with A and larger hook, ch 4. Join in ring with sl st in first ch. 1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc in ring) 3 times. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break A.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st in any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in same sp as last sl st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - beg cluster made. Ch 1. Cluster in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. Cluster in next dc. Ch 1. (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. Skip next dc. Cluster in next dc. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 12 clusters. Break B.
3rd rnd: Join C with sl st to first ch-1 sp of last rnd. (Beg cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in same ch-1 sp. *(Ch 1. Cluster in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1.** (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 16 clusters. Break C.
4th rnd: Join D with sl st to first ch-1 sp of last rnd. (Beg cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in same ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1.** (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 6 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 24 clusters. Break D.
Size 2/4 only: 5th rnd: Join E with sl st to first ch-1 sp of last rnd. Beg cluster in same ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. Break E.
Size 6/8 only: 5th rnd: Join E with sl st to first ch-1 sp of last rnd. (Beg cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in same ch-1 sp. *(Ch 1. Cluster in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1.** (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 28 clusters. Break E.
Both sizes: 6th rnd: Join F with sl st to first ch-1 sp of last rnd. Beg cluster in same ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. Break F.
7th to 12th rnds: Rep 6th rnd working each rnd in color sequence as follows: A, B, C, D, E and F, ending 12th rnd with join D with sl st to top of beg cluster.
Cuff: Change to smaller hook.
1st rnd: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next cluster) twice. 2 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next cluster. Rep from * to last 5 (7) sts. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next cluster) 2 (3) time(s). 2 (1) sc in last ch-1 sp. 56 (64) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *1 dcfp around post of next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dcfp around post of last sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
3rd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last dcfp. 1 dcfp around post of last dcfp. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
4th and 5th rnds: As 3rd rnd. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART Mixology Swirl™: 1 ball 9931 Sizzling A
RED HEART Mixology Solids™: 1 ball 572 Orchid B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 10mm [US N-15]
Yarn needle
stitch marker
2½” (6.5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard or optional pompom maker
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 18 (20)” [45.5 (51) cm] circumference at band.
gauge: 10 sc = 6” (15 cm); 2 rows = 1½” (4 cm) with A.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 7 sc in ring—7 sc. Do not join. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—14 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—21 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—28 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: *Sc in next 13 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * once—30 sc.
Rounds 7–9: Sc in each sc around.
Size Large only:
Round 10: Work *2 sc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc; repeat from * around—33 sc.
Both Sizes: 
Rounds 10–12 (11–13): Sc in each sc around.
Round 13 (14): Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Band
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join B with sc in first sc, sc in each sc around—30 (33) sc. Do not join. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around. Do not fasten off.
Brim
Row 1 (right side): Sc in next 17 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—17 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 11 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—11 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, sc in end of row, sc in next unworked st of band, turn—13 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, sc in ends of first 2 rows, slip st in next unworked st of Row 1, turn—15 sc.
Round 5: Skip slip st, sc in next 15 sc, sc in each remaining unworked st of band; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pompom
With B, following pompom maker directions, make 2½” (6.5 cm) pompom or make pompom as follows: Wrap yarn around 2½” (6.5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard (the more wraps, the fuller the pompom). Gently remove wraps from cardboard. Cut a 12” (30.5 cm) length of B and tie it tightly around center of wraps. Do not cut the ends of this center tie. Cut ends of wraps. Fluff and trim pompom. Use ends of center tie to sew pompom to top of hat. Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Worsted™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 194 yds/177 m)
Contrast A Rich Teal (77768) 1 ball or 90 yds/82 m
Contrast B Teal Chalk (77767) 1 ball or 40 yds/37 m
Contrast C Claret (77747) 1 ball or 40 yds/37 m
Contrast D Rose (77745) 1 ball or 40 yds/37 m
Contrast E Blush (77743) 1 ball or 50 yds/45.5 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Beg Cluster = Ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop) twice in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Ch 1 to close stitch.
Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Ch 1 to close stitch.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times - 1 trfp made
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 15 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
CROWN
See Diagram 1 on page 3.
Beg at top of Hat, with E, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 10 hdc in ring. Join. Fasten off. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Join D with sl st to first st. Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off. 20 hdc. 
3rd rnd: Join C with sl st to first st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as join. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. Fasten off. 30 hdc. 
4th rnd: Join E with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
5th rnd: Join A with sl st to first st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 sc. *2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 hdc in last sc. Join. Fasten off. 40 hdc.  
6th rnd: Join B with sl st to first st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. * 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last dc. Join. Fasten off. 50 hdc.  
7th rnd: Join C with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
8th rnd: Join E with sl st to first st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 sc. *2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 hdc in last sc. Join. Fasten off. 60 hdc. 
9th rnd: Join D with sl st to first st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. Fasten off. 70 hdc.
10th rnd: Join A with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
11th rnd: Join B with sl st to first st. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 6 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join. Fasten off. 80 hdc.  
12th rnd: Join C with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
13th rnd: Join D with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
14th rnd: Join E with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
15th rnd: Join D with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as join. *1 dcfp around post of next sc 3 rnds below (Color D - rnd). Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dcfp around post of next sc 3 rnds below (Color D - rnd). Skip last sc. Join. Fasten off.
16th rnd: Join C with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as join. 1 sc in next dcfp. *1 trfp around post of next sc 4 rnds below (Color C - rnd). Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 trfp around post of next sc 4 rnds below (Color C - rnd). Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. Fasten off.
17th rnd: Join B with sl st to first st. Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 25 sts. Hdc2tog) twice. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join. Fasten off. 77 sts.
18th rnd: Join A with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off. 77 sc.
MOTIF  
See Diagram 2 on page 3.
With Color 1, ch 3. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join. Fasten off. 
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any sc. Beg cluster in same sp as sl st. Ch 2. *Cluster in next sc. Ch 2. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off. 8 clusters.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 2  (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. (2 hdc. Ch 3. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1.** 2 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join. Fasten off. 
4th rnd: Join A with sl st to 2nd ch of any corner ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st (hdc and ch) around. Join. Fasten off. 44 sc. (11 sc for each side).

materials: Bernat® Sheepy™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 149 yds/136 m)
Sizes 6/12 18/24 mos Bunny Brown (43003) 1 1 ball
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit baby 6-12 (18-24) mos.
gauge: 7 hdc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ).
Notes:
• Due to thick pile of Bernat® Sheepy™ yarn, you may find it useful to place a safety pin or st marker on RS of work to help keep track.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd/row does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first hdc.
Ch 48 ( 56 ). Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join. 48 (56) hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 3½ (5½)" [9 (14) cm].
Shape Yoke: 1st rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 ( 5 ) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 40 (48) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 (4) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 32 (40) sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 (3) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 (32) sts.
Hood: Beg working in rows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 24 (32) sts. Turn. 24 (32) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. 2 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 26 (34) hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Hood measures 7 ( 8)" [ 18 ( 20.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 ( 6) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. 22 (30) sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 3 (5) hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. 18 (26) sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Using end, sew top Hood seam.
Ears (make 2)
Ch 4.
1st row: 7 dc in 4th ch from hook. Fasten off.
Sew Ears on either side of Hood as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red A and 316 Soft White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
Susan Bates® Easy Pom Pon Maker, 2" (5 cm) diameter
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 14 (16, 18)" (35.5 (40.5, 45.5) cm) in circumference.
gauge: 13 dc and 7 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HAT
With A, create a magic ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 dc in ring; join with slip st in first dc – 12 dc
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 dc in each dc around; join with slip st in first dc – 24 dc 
Round 3: Ch 1, [dc in next st, 2 dc in next st] 12 times; join with slip st in first dc – 36 dc 
Round 4: Ch 1, [dc in 2 each of next sts, 2 dc in next st] 12 times; join B with slip st in first dc. Break A – 48 dc
For 2 largest sizes only:
Next round: Ch 1, [dc in each of next 0 (7, 3) sts, 2 dc in next st] 0 (8, 12) times, join with slip st in first dc – 48 (54, 60) dc.
For all sizes:
Next 5 (5, 6) rounds: Ch 1, dc in each st around; slip st to join - 48 (54, 60) dc.
Earflaps
Row 1: Ch 2 (counts as 1 dc here and throughout), dc2tog over next 2 sts, dc in each of next 4 sts, dc2tog over next 2 sts, dc in next st, turn – 8 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn – 8 sc.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc2tog over next 2 sts, dc in each of next 2 sts, dc2tog over next 2 sts, dc in last st, turn – 6 dc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn – 6 sc.
Row 5: Ch 2, [dc2tog over next 2 sts] twice, dc in last st, turn – 4 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each st across – 4 sc. 
Fasten off.
With earflap facing up, skip 20 (22, 24) sts to the left of last earflap st on brim, and join B with slip st in next st.
Work other Earflap the same way.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Border for Cap Version
Next 2 rounds: Ch 1, sc in each st around.
Fasten off.
Border for Earflap Version
Join B with slip st in center back of hat. 
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each st and 4 sc in each sc-row edge around, join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
Pom Pom
With A and B held together, make a pom pom and sew to top of hat.
Maple Leaf
With A, form an adjustable loop
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as 1 dc), 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in first st – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 2, (picot, hdc) in same st as joining slip st, (hdc, picot, hdc) in next st, (hdc, picot, ch 2, slip st) in next st, (slip st, ch 2, picot, dc) in next st, (dc, picot, dc) in next st, (dc, picot, ch 2, slip st) in next st, (slip st, ch 2, picot, hdc) in next st, (hdc, picot, hdc) in next st, (hdc, picot, ch 2, slip st) in next st, slip st in next st, ch 5, skip 1 ch, sc in each of next 4 ch (stem), slip st in Round 1 to join stem, slip st in beginning ch-2 to join round.
Fasten off.
Position Maple Leaf as desired onto hat and use markers to hold in place.
Assuring picots are defined, use yarn needle to sew in place.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: 1 ball Red Heart® Gemstone 2156 Sapphire
5.5 mm [US I-9] Susan Bates® Crochet Hook
Yarn needle
Susan Bates® Easy-Wrap PomPom Maker
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 18 (20, 22)" [45.5 (51, 56) cm] at brim.
gauge: 10 sts = 4" (10 cm); 9 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 29.
Row 1 (right side): Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 4 ch, (sc, dc) in next st, *skip next ch, (sc, dc) in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—5 slip sts, 12 sc, and 12 dc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first dc, (sc, dc) in next sc, *skip next dc, (sc, dc) in next sc; repeat from * across, sc in each slip st, turn—17 sc and 12 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1, slip st in back loop only of first 5 sc, skip first dc, (sc, dc) in next sc, *skip next dc, (sc, dc) in next sc; repeat from * across to last 4 sts, leave last 4 sts unworked, turn—5 slip sts, 10 sc, and 10 dc.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2—15 sc and 10 dc.
Row 5: Ch 1, slip st in back loop only of first 5 sc, skip first dc, (sc, dc) in next sc, *skip next dc, (sc, dc) in next sc; repeat from * 8 times, sc2tog in last sc worked and in first unworked sc 2 rows below, turn—12 sc, 12 dc, and 5 slip sts.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2—17 sc and 12 dc.
Rows 7–42 (46, 50): Repeat last 4 rows 9 (10, 11) times.
Row 43 (47, 51): With wrong sides held together and working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across. Fasten off, leaving an 18" (45.5 cm) tail.
FINISHING
To close top of hat, working in ends of rows, weave tail from front to back through first row, skip next row, weave from back to front through next row, *skip next row, weave from front to back through next row, skip next row, weave from back to front through next row; repeat from * around, pull gently to close. With beginning tail, make an overhand knot. Cut tails to 6" (15 cm).
Edging Round: With right side facing and working in ends of rows, join yarn with sc in any row, sc in each row around; join with slip st in first sc.
Pompom
Follow manufacturer’s directions to make a 3½" (9 cm) pompom and tie to top of hat. Draw tails to wrong side. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ Metallic (5 oz/142 g; 255 yds/233 m) Black/Gold (0326) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Tapestry needle.
measurements: One size to fit Adult. Approx 6" [15 cm] wide.
gauge: 16 sts and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern (pat).
instructions:
Chain (ch) 49. 
1st row:  1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Repeat (rep) from * to last ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 48 stitches (sts).
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 space (sp). Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beginning (beg) measures 21" [53.5 cm]. 
Fasten off.
Fold Headband in half lengthwise. Sew edges together (tog) to make a long tube. Twist one end of Headband 180 degrees. Sew ends of Headband tog.

pattern_name: Preemie to Toddler Size Crochet Hats
materials: Caron® Kindness™ (7 oz/198 g; 345 yds/315 m)
Robin’s Egg Blue (53007) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: To fit head circumference: Preemie 9½" [24 cm], Newborn 12" [30.5 cm], 6/12 mos 16" [40.5 cm], 18/24 mos 17½" [44.5 cm]
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
Sizes Newborn, 6/12 and 18/24 mos only: 5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 hdc.
