6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
Sizes 6/12 and 18/24 mos only: 7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
Sizes Preemie and 18/24 mos only: Next rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 27 (54) sc.
All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. PM on last rnd. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 3 (3½-4-4½)" [7.5 (9-10-11.5) cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each st around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Rep last rnd 2 (3-4-5) times more. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Worsted™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 194 yds/177 m)
Contrast A  Natural Mix (00229) 1 ball or 85.5yds/78m
Contrast B  Seafoam (77219) 1 ball or 105yds/96m
Contrast C  Rich Raspberry (77783) 1 ball or 31yds/28.5m
Contrast D  Rich Teal (77768) 1 ball or 35yds/32m
Contrast E  Amaranth (77784) 1 ball or 42.5yds/39m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Susan Bates® split stitch marker.
abbreviations: Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
Sc2togspl = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc between ‘legs’ of stitch. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 15 sts and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm] in split sc pat.
instructions:
Note: When working from chart, carry yarn not in use loosely across top of work. Work next row over strand of yarn which is not in use. Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
Ribbing: With A, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg, when slightly stretched, measures 19½" [49.5 cm].** Do not fasten off.
Proceed as follows:
Set-up rnd:  Ch 1. Work 80 sc across longer side of ribbing. Do not join. PM for beg of rnd.
Cont working in spiral as follows: Beg working Chart, noting 2-st rep will be worked 40 times, reading rnds from right to left.

1st rnd: 1 splsc in each sc around. Rep last rnd, and cont working Chart until Rnd 28 of Chart is complete.
Break all colors but B.
Shape crown: 1st rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 6 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. 70 sts.
2nd and alt rnds: 1 splsc in each sc around.
3rd rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sts.
5th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
7th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
9th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
11 rnd:  *1 splsc in next st. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
Break yarn, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. Sew ends of ribbing together.

Pompom:  Wind 4 strands of B, 1 strand each A, C, D and E around 4 fingers 40 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

pattern_name: Chic and Quick Messy Bun Hat
materials: RED HEART® Soft Essentials™: 1 ball Turquoise 7508
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 21 (22)” [53 (56) cm].
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 8 rounds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HAT
Band
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc into 2nd ch from hook and each ch across — 7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, slip st in each sc — 7 slip sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each slip st. Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until band measures 21 (22)” [53 (56) cm].
Crown
Round 1 (Right Side): With right side facing, join yarn in first st with a slip st, ch 1, sc in same st, sc 71 (79) sts evenly spaced along one long edge of Band; slip st in first sc to join – 72 (80) sc.
Rounds 2-4: Dc in each sc around; join with slip st to first dc – 72 (80) dc.
Round 5: *Dc in next 3 sts, skip next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first dc — 54 (60) dc.
Round 6: *Dc in next 2 sts, skip next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first dc — 36 (40) dc.
Round 7: *Dc in next st, skip next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first dc — 18 (20) dc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, seam band. Weave in all loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Yarn: 1 ball 4601 Off White
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Heavy-weight interfacing or stiff cardboard or plastic for brim
stitch markers
yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 18”
gauge: 16 dc = 4”; 9 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CAP
Ch 4, slip st in first st to form ring. 
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 7 dc in ring, slip st to top of beginning ch to join, place marker for beginning of round – 8 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, 2 dc in same space, 3 dc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 24 sts.
Round 3: Ch 3, [(dc and Fpdc) in next st, dc in next 2 sts] 7 times, (dc and Fpdc) in next st, dc in last st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 32 sts; 8 Fpdc.
Round 4: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1 here and throughout), skip next st, [(dc and Fpdc) in next st, ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st, ch 1, skip next st] 7 times, (dc and Fpdc) in next st, ch 1, skip next st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 40 sts.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in ch-1 space, dc in next st, *(dc and Fpdc) in next st, [dc in ch-1 space, dc in next st] twice; repeat from * 6 more times, (dc and Fpdc) in next st, dc in ch-1 space st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 sts.
Round 6: Ch 4, skip next st, dc in next st, *ch 1, skip next st, (dc and Fpdc) in next st, [ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st] twice; repeat from * 6 more times, ch 1, skip next st, (dc and Fpdc) in next st, ch 1, skip next st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 56 sts.
Round 7: Ch 3, *[dc in ch-1 space, dc in next st] twice, (dc and Fpdc) in next st, dc in next ch-1 space, dc in next st; repeat from * 6 more times, [dc in ch-1 space, dc in next st] twice, (dc and Fpdc) in next st, dc in next ch-1 space, slip st in top of beginning ch – 64 sts.
Round 8: Ch 4, skip next st, *[dc in next st, ch 1, skip next st] twice, (dc and Fpdc) in next st, ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * 6 more times, [dc in next st, ch 1, skip next st] twice, (dc and Fpdc) in next st, ch 1, skip next st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 72 sts.
Round 9: Ch 3, *[dc in ch-1 space, dc in next st] 3 times, Fpdc in next Fpdc, dc in next ch-1 space, dc in next st; repeat from * 6 more times, [dc in ch-1 space, dc in next st] 3 times, Fpdc in next Fpdc, dc in next ch-1 space, slip st in top of beginning ch – 72 sts.
Round 10: Ch 4, skip next st, *[dc in next st, ch 1, skip next st] 2 times, dc in next st, Fpdc in next Fpdc, ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * 6 more times, [dc in next st, ch 1, skip next st] 2 times, dc in next st, Fpdc in next Fpdc, ch 1, skip next st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 72 sts.
Rounds 11-15: Repeat Rounds 9-10, end with Round 9.
Round 16: Slip st in each st around. 
Fasten off. 
BRIM
Top Side
Mark 22 sts on front of Hat on Round 16 for Brim.
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn in first marked st, working in front loops only, sc in each next 22 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in back loops in next 4 sts on Hat – 26 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in front loops in next 4 sts on Hat – 30 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in back loop in next st on Hat – 31 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in front loop in next st on Hat – 32 sts.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in back loop in next st on Hat – 33 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in front loop in next st on Hat – 34 sts.
Fasten off.
Bottom Side
Row 1: With wrong side facing, join yarn on wrong side of Row 1 of Brim, sc in back loops of first 22 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in front loops in next 4 sts on Hat – 26 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in back loops in next 4 sts on Hat – 30 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in front loop in next st on Hat – 31 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in back loop in next st on Hat – 32 sts.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in front loop in next st on Hat – 33 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, sc in back loop in next st on Hat – 34 sts.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Using Brim as a template, cut a piece of interfacing or stiff cardboard or plastic to same dimensions. Slip piece in between layers of Brim and sew Brim closed. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Version 1 - Main Color (MC) Aruba Sea (0505) 1 ball or 184 yds/168 m
Version 2 - Main Color (MC) Light Jasmine (0115) 1 ball or 184 yds/168 m
Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit - 1 Kit - Kit includes 12 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (85 m/93 yds each; 1020 m/1116 yds total)
Version 1 - Contrast A Jade 1 ball or 16 yds/14.5 m
Contrast B Royal 1 ball or 4 yds/3.5 m
Contrast C Cherry Red 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Contrast D Saffron 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Contrast E Black 1 ball or 4 yds/3.5 m
Version 2 - Contrast A Lavender 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast B Spring Green 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Contrast C Shocking Pink 1 ball or 16 yds/14.5 m
Contrast D Pumpkin 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast E Soft White 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4” [10 cm]. 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Colors quoted are as shown in photos, these are suggestions only and may be customized as desired. 
• Ch 2 at beg of row/rnd does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Repeats at beg of row/rnd start in first st.

BALACLAVA
With MC, beg at top of crown, ch 3.
1st rnd:  12 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
5th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 hdc.
6th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 hdc.
7th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 hdc.
8th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc.1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 hdc.
9th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 66 hdc.
11th to 14th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.

Divide for Face Opening and beg working back and forth in rows:
15th row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to 25th st to right of join. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 44 hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next st. Turn. 48 hdc.
16th row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last st. Turn. 46 hdc.
17th row: As 16th row. 44 hdc.
18th and 19th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
20th to 22nd rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Fasten off. 50 hdc.

Return to working in rnds:
23rd rnd: (RS). Join MC with sl st to hdc at center back. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Ch 10 (face opening). 1 hdc in next hdc from 22nd row. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join.
Proceed in rnds ( do not turn).
24th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st and ch around. Join. 60 hdc.
25th and 26th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
27th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each hdc around. Join.
28th to 30th rnds:  Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Face Edging: With RS facing, join A with sl st 2 sts to left of bottom right corner of Face Opening.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each st to next corner. 1 sc in corner. Work 9 sc along sides of rows to next corner. 1 sc in next corner. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each st until 1 st before next corner sc. Sc3tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. Fasten off.

Neck Edging:  With A and yarn needle, work Blanket Stitch around last rnd of Balaclava, working between dcfp sts as shown.

APPLIQUÉS
Note:
• This project is customizable, make as many Appliqués as desired.
• Colors quoted are as shown in photos and are suggestions only to be customized as desired; noting that yardage may differ.

Daisy (See diagram on page 4)
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: With RS facing, join B for Version 1 or E for Version 2 with sl st to any sc. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. (1 dc. Sl st) in next st. *(Sl st. 1 dc) in next st. (1 dc. Sl st) in next st. Rep from * 3 times more – 5 petals made. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off, leaving long tail.

Rosette (See diagram on page 4)
With C, ch 15.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 6th ch from hook (counts as dc and ch-2 sp). *Ch 1. Skip next 2 ch. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 5 sc in same ch-2 sp as sl st. Sl st in next ch-1 sp. 6 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Sl st in next ch-1 sp. 7 dc in next ch-2 sp. Sl st in next ch-1 sp. 8 dc in last ch 2 sp. Ch 3. Sl st in same sp as last dc. Fasten off, leaving long tail.
With RS facing, and beg with smallest petal, roll your petals inward to form Rosette. Using yarn needle and long tail, sew base of Rosette closed.

Leaf (See diagram on page 4)
Leaf may be paired with Daisy and/or Rosette Appliques.
With A for Version 1 or B for Version 2, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. (1 hdc. Sl st) in last ch. Fasten off, leaving long tail.

Star (See diagram on page 4)
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: *Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 2 hdc in next ch. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Fasten off, leaving long tail.

Moon (See diagram on page 4)
With B for Version 1 or E for Version 2, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in next ch. 3 dc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 3 dc in next ch. (1 dc. 1 hdc) in next ch. (1 sc. Sl st) in last ch. Fasten off, leaving long tail.

Heart (See diagram on page 4)
Make 1 each in A, C and E.
Ch 3. Sl st in first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. (2 dc. 3 hdc. 1 dc. 3 hdc. 2 dc) in ring. Ch 3. Sl st in ring. Fasten off, leaving long tail.

Lightning
See diagram shown right.
With E for Version 1 or B for Version 2, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd and 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. Ch 3. Turn.
7th row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in last sc. Turn.
8th row: Sl st in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 3 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sc.
10th and 11th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn.
13th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail.

With yarn needle and yarn tails of coordinating shade of yarn, sew Appliqués to Balaclava as desired.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Paints™ (4 oz/113.4 g; 204 yds/186 m) Main Color (MC) Rainbow Bright (P0016) 1 ball
Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast A Iris (39747) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit child 6-10 yrs (Adult).
gauge: 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Note: Chain (ch) 2 at beginning (beg) of round (rnd) does not count as stitch (st). To change color, work to last loops on hook of first color, yarn over hook (yoh) with new color and proceed. Carry color not in use loosely up Wrong Side (WS) of work. With A, chain (ch) 66 (72). Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first chain (ch) to form a ring, taking care not to twist chain. 1st round (rnd): Ch 2. 1 half double crochet (hdc) in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 66 (72) hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join MC with sl st to first hdc. Break A. 3rd rnd: With MC, ch 2. Working into back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep 3rd rnd until Hat from beg measures 4 (6)" [10 (15) cm]. Shape crown: Next rnd: Ch 2. Working into back loops only, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. [Yarn over hook (yoh) and draw up a loop in next hdc] twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - Hdc2together (Hdc2tog) made. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc2tog. Repeat (rep) from * around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 55 (60) stitches (sts). Break MC. Next rnd: With A, ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 44 (48) sts. Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 33 (36) sts. Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 22 (24) sts. Next rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 11 (12) sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely. Pompom: Wind MC around 4 fingers 150 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Patons® Canadiana™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 205 yds/187 m) Dark Grey Mix (10042) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 buttons.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and insert hook from front to back around post of next stitch. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.)
measurements: One size to fit a verage woman’s head.
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Beg at crown, ch 3. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. (See diagram on page 2).
1st rnd: Ch 3. 7 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 8 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dcfp around each dc around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 16 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. 1 dc in sp between last dcfp and next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 24 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in sp between last dcfp and next dcfp. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 32 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 40 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 48 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 56 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 64 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *3 dcfp around dcfp 2 rows below. Miss next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * 15 times more. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
11th rnd: As 9th rnd.
12th rnd: Sl st in next st. Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss next sc. 3 dcfp around dc 2 rows below. Miss next sc. *1 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. 3 dcfp around dc 2 rows below. Miss next sc. Rep from * 14 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
13th rnd: As 9th rnd.
14th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sts. Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss next sc. 3 dcfp around dc 2 rows below. Miss next sc. *1 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. 3 dcfp around dc 2 rows below. Miss next sc. Rep from * 14 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep 13th and 14th rnds until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a 14th rnd. Do not fasten off.
Band: 1st and 2nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc. Do not fasten off.
Brim: Beg working in rows: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 46 sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of last row.
FINISHING
Fold Brim of Hat at corners and sew into place with button on each side as shown in photo.

materials: 1 skein Red Heart® Team Spirit: 948 Green/Gold
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: To Fit Head Circumference 20-21 (22-23)" [51-53 (56-58) cm]
gauge: Rounds 1-4 = 4” (10cm) diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Rounds 7-15: Hdc in each st around. 
Round 16: Hdc in each st around to last st, sc in last st; join with slip st in first st. 
First Earflap
Note Work now progresses in turned rows.
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 12 (14) sts – 12 (14) sts.
Row 18: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 8 (10) sts, sc2tog, leaving remaining sts unworked – 10 (12) sts.
Row 19: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 6 (8) sts, sc2tog – 8 (10) sts.
Row 21: Repeat Row 19.
Row 22: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 4 (6) sts, sc2tog – 6 (8) sts.
Row 23: Repeat Row 19.
Row 24: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 2 (4) sts, sc2tog – 4 (6) sts.
Row 25: Repeat Row 19.
Row 26: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, [sc2tog] 1 (2) times, sc in last st – 3 (4) sts.
Size Small/Medium Only
Fasten off.
Size Medium/Large Only
Row 27: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, sc2tog, sc in last st – 3 sts. Fasten off. 
Second Earflap 
With Right Side facing, skip 12 (14) sts from First Earflap for back of Hat; join same color section as for First Earflap in next st.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 11 (13) sts – 12 (14) sts. 
Repeat Rows 18-26 (27) of First Earflap. Do not fasten off.
Directions are for size Small/Medium. Changes for size Medium/Large are in parentheses.
Notes
1. Hat is worked in a continuous spiral with Right Side facing at all times. Do not join and do not turn unless otherwise indicated. Use a stitch marker in the first stitch of each round to mark progress. Color changes occur with yarn naturally.
2. Earflaps are worked in turned rows in only one color.
3. Edging is worked in joined rounds with Right Side facing at all times using the same single color as Earflaps. Cut yarn as needed to maintain single color.
Special Stitches
hdc3tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 7 loops on hook.
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next st, draw up a loop] 2 times, yarn over and draw through 3 loops on hook.
HAT
Crown
Ch 3; join with slip st to form ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, work 9 (10) hdc in ring – 9 (10) sts.
Round 2: 2 hdc in each st around – 18 (20) sts.
Round 3: [Hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st] 9 (10) times – 27 (30) sts.
Round 4: [Hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 9 (10) times – 36 (40) sts.
Round 5: [Hdc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 9 (10) times – 45 (50) sts.
Round 6: [Hdc in next 4 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 9 (10) times – 54 (60) sts.

Edging
Round 1: Ch 1, turn, 3 sc in first st (corner made), sc in next st, 3 sc in next st (corner made), sc in each row end of earflap to last row, hdc3tog using last row end, corner join of earflap and hat, and first st of hat, sc in next 16 (18) sts across front of hat, hdc3tog using last st of hat, corner join of hat and earflap, and first row end on side of next earflap, sc in each row end of earflap, 3 sc in next st (corner made), sc in next st, 3 sc in next st (corner made), sc in each row end of earflap to last row, hdc3tog using last row end of earflap, corner join of earflap and hat, and first st of hat, sc in next 10 (12) sts across back of hat, hdc3tog using last st of hat, corner join of hat and earflap, and first row end of earflap, sc in side of each row of earflap, join with slip st to beginning sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first st and in each remaining st around; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.  
FINISHING
Weave in all ends.
Braids
Make 24 strands of each color, each 24” (61cm) long, and 2 wrapping strands, each approximately 6” (15cm) long. Each braid strand is made from 4 strands of each color. Pull a braid strand through each of the center 3 sc on bottom of earflaps. Pull one half of strand all the way through sc. Braid each side, leaving approximately 2” (5cm) fringe. Secure each braid with wrapping strand. 
PomPom
Repeatedly wrap yarn around 4 fingers of hand (more wraps make a fluffier pompom). Thread a strand of yarn under center of wraps and tie a knot. Cut through wraps on opposite side from knot. Fluff pompom and trim evenly. Use the ends of the knotted strand to tie pompom to center of crown.

materials: Caron® Colorama Halo™ Perfect Phasing™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m) Graphite Frost (76006) 2 balls or 601 yds/549.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
2 Susan Bates® stitch markers
Safety pin
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Y oslst (Yarn Over Slip Stitch) = Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch pulling loop just made through 2 loops on hook (1 loop rem)
measurements: Approx 27¾" [70.5 cm] around x 20" [51 cm] tall.
gauge: 15 yoslst and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] in 2x2 Ribbing Pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Yarn has gradual changing color from Color A to Color B. Determine for yourself what shade will be A and B. 
• To maintain ombre effect when joining new ball join 2nd ball matching color from previous ball, letting colors change gradually. Excess of yarn can be used later for I-cord. 
• Hood is worked from bottom up in one piece beg in round and then continued flat in rows. When working in rounds, work is turned after each round. 
• It can be easy to miss first and last sts when working yarn over slip stitches (yoslst), so counting your sts every rnd/row may be beneficial. 
COWL 
Beg with Color A (darkest end of ball in this design), loosely ch 104. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, being careful not to twist ch. 
Foundation rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 yoslst in first ch. 1 yoslst in each ch to end of rnd. Join. Turn. 104 sts. 
1st rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 yoslst in each st around. Join. Turn. 
2nd rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 yoslst in each st around. Join. Turn. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. Working under horizontal bar created in row below, 1 yoslst in each st around. Join. Turn. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working under horizontal bar created in row below, 1 yoslst in each st around. Join. Turn. 
HORIZONTAL BAR CREATED IN ROW BELOW 
Rep last 4 rnds until work from beg measures approx 7" [18 cm], ending on a 3rd rnd and placing markers on 52nd and 53rd sts of last rnd. Fasten off. 
HOOD 
With same end of yarn just fastened off, ch 5, leaving a 36" [91.5 cm] long end for seaming Drawstring Casing later. Cont as follows: 
Joining Row: (RS). Working under horizontal bar created in last row across, 1 yoslst in 53rd st (leftmost marked st). 1 yoslst in each st around to next marker. Ch 6. 115 sts. Do not join. 
Work back and forth in rows as follows: 
1st row: (WS). Working in back loops only across row, 1 yoslst in 2nd ch from hook. 1 yoslst in each of next 4 ch. 1 yoslst in each of next 104 sts. 1 yoslst in each of last 5 ch. Turn. 114 sts. 
**2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 yoslst in each st to end of row. Turn. 
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. Working under horizontal bar created in row below, 1 yoslst in each st to end of row. Turn.** 
Proceed in 2x2 Ribbing Pat as follows: 
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 yoslst in each st to end of row. Turn. 
2nd to 4th rows: Rep from ** to **. 
Rep 1st to 4th rows for 2x2 Ribbing, until work from beg of Cowl measures approx 16¼" [41.5 cm], ending on a 4th row. 
Shaping Back of Hood 
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only across row, 1 yoslst in each of first 42 sts. 1 sl st in each of next 13 sts. Skip next st. 1 sl st in each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 sl st in each of next 13 sts. 1 yoslst in each of last 42 sts. Turn. 112 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only across row, 1 yoslst in each of first 42 sts. 1 sl st in each of next 28 sts. 1 yoslst in each of last 42 sts. Turn. 
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. Working under horizontal bar created in row below, 1 yoslst in each st to end of row. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only across row, 1 yoslst in each of first 42 sts. 1 sl st in each of next 12 sts. Skip next st. 1 sl st in each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 sl st in each of next 12 sts. 1 yoslst in each of last 42 sts. Turn. 110 sts. 
6th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only across row, 1 yoslst in each of first 42 sts. 1 sl st in each of next 26 sts. 1 yoslst in each of last 42 sts. Turn. 
7th and 8th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows. 
9th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only across row, 1 yoslst in each of first 42 sts. 1 sl st in each of next 11 sts. Skip next st. 1 sl st in each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 sl st in each of next 11 sts. 1 yoslst in each of last 42 sts. Turn. 108 sts. 
10th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only across row, 1 yoslst in each of first 42 sts. 1 sl st in each of next 24 sts. 1 yoslst in each of last 42 sts. Turn. 
11th and 12th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows. 
13th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only across row, 1 yoslst in each of first 42 sts. 1 sl st in each of next 10 sts. Skip next st. 1 sl st in each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 sl st in each of next 10 sts. 1 yoslst in each of last 42 sts. Turn. 106 sts. 
14th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only across row, 1 yoslst in each of first 42 sts. 1 sl st in each of next 22 sts. 1 yoslst in each of last 42 sts. Turn. 
15th row: As 3rd row. 
Fold in half (RS tog) and work through both thickness along top of Hood to join first 53 sts and last 53 sts, working 1 sl st under each pair of horizontal bars created in last row to fold. Fasten off. Turn Hood right-side out. 
Drawstring 
Ch 173. 
1st row: (RS). Working into horizontal ‘bump’ at back of each ch, 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. 172 sts. 
FINISHING 
Drawstring Casing: Turn first 4 sts and last 4 sts of Hood Portion to WS (inside) and whipstitch into place, leaving bottom edge of Drawstring Casing open. Pin safety pin to one end of Drawstring. Work Drawstring through Casing. Remove safety pin.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Worsted™ (100 g/3.5 oz; 192 m/210 yds)
Contrast A Aran Tweed (84008) or Cognac Heather (77532) 1 ball
Contrast B Cognac Heather (77532) or Aran Tweed (84008) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G/6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head.
gauge: 15 dc and 7½ rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Beg at crown, with A, ch 4. Join with sl st to form a ring. (See Diagram on page 2).
1st rnd: Ch 3. 8 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 9 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dcfp in each dc around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 18 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *With A, 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. With B, 1 dc in sp between last dcfp and next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 27 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *With A, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With B, 1 dc in sp between last dcfp and next st. With A, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With B, 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 36 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *With A, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With B, 1 dc in next dc. With A, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With B, 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 45 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *With A, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With B, 2 dc in next dc. With A, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With B, 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 54 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *With A, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 72 sts.
8th rnd: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Place marker at end of rnd.
9th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. With A, (yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of first dcfp at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of next dcfp at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – beg trfp cluster made. *Miss next dc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. With A, (yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of last dcfp worked at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of next dcfp at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – trfp cluster made. Rep from * around, ending with: miss next dc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. With A, trfp cluster over last dcfp and first dcfp. Miss next dc. With B, 1 sc in last dc. Join with sl st to first sc.
10th rnd: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
11th rnd: Ch 1. With A, trfp cluster over last trfp cluster and next trfp cluster. Miss first dc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. *With A, trfp cluster over last trfp cluster worked and next Trfp cluster. Miss next dc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
Rep 8th to 11th rnds until work from marked rnd measures approx 4" [10 cm], ending on 9th rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 2. With A, dcfp around first sc. *With B, dcbp around next sc. With A, dcfp around next trfp cluster. With B, dcbp around next sc. With A, dcfp around next sc. Rep from * around, ending with B, dcbp around last sc. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 2. With A, dcfp around first dcfp. *With B, dcbp around next dcbp. With A, dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around, ending with B, dcbp around last dcbp. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Smokey Green (32025) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Y oh-sl st = Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Draw 1st loop on hook through 2nd and 3rd loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
With smaller hook, ch 11. 
1st row: 1 yoh-sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 yoh-sl st in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 10 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. *Work 1 yoh-sl st into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 22" [56 cm] when slightly stretched. 
Joining row: Work 1 row of sc through both thicknesses to join last row with foundation row. 
Note: All rnds are joined with sl st to first hdc. Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Change to larger hook. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. Working around straight edge of ribbing, work 56 hdc evenly around. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
Rep 2nd rnd until work from lower edge measures 6½" [16.5 cm].
Shape Crown: 1st rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 sts. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 49 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 42 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 35 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 28 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 21 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 14 hdc. 
7th rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 7 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and secure tightly.

materials: Patons® Highland Bulky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 83 yds/76 m) Main Color (MC) Tidal (13010) 1 ball
Contrast A Sundried Tomato (14003) 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: Scbp = Draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left.
Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook
Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
Sc2togspl over 3 sts = Draw up a loop in next sc between ‘legs’ of stitch. Skip next stitch. Draw up a loop in next sc between ‘legs’ of stitch. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 8 sts and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] in split sc/scbp pat.
instructions:
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
With MC, ch 40. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, taking care to not twist chain.
1st rnd:  1 sc in each ch around. 40 sc. Do not join. Work in continu - ous rnds (see note).
2nd rnd: *1 splsc in next st. 1 scbp. Rep from * around.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 6" [15 cm].
Shape crown: 1st rnd: *Sc2togspl over 3 sts. 1 scbp. 1 splsc in next st. 1 scbp. Rep from * to last 4 sts. Sc2togspl over 3 sts. 1 scbp. 26 sts.
2nd rnd: *1 splsc in next st. 1 scbp. Rep from * around.
3rd rnd: *Sc2togspl over 3 sts. 1 scbp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 splsc in next st. 1 scbp. 14 sts.
4th rnd: *1 splsc in next st. 1 scbp. Rep from * around.
5th rnd:  *Sc2togspl over 3 sts. 1 scbp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 splsc in next st. 1 scbp. 8 sts.
Break yarn, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly and fasten securely.
Pompom:  Wind 2 strands of A around 4 fingers 50 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Bernat® Plush™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 146 yds/133 m)
Contrast A 1 1 ball Almandine (68056) or Charcoal (68031) 55/50 70/64 yds/m
Contrast B 1 1 ball Mustard (68029) or Almandine (68056) 95/86 120/109 yds/m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: To fit Child 18½ (Adult 21) [47 (53.5) cm] head circumference. Approx 10 (13)" [25.5 (33) cm] tall.
gauge: 10 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for Child size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written Child (Adult). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes: 
• Ch 2 does not count as st at beg of rnd. 
• Move marker as work progresses each rnd.
• When working in hdc, do not join rnds unless indicated when color changes.
With B, ch 2. See diagrams on page 3.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd. 5 sc.
2nd rnd: 1 hdc in each sc around. 
3rd rnd: 2 hdc in each hdc around. 10 hdc. 
4th and 5th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around. 
6th rnd: (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 5 times. 15 hdc.
7th and 8th rnds:  1 hdc in each hdc around. 
9th rnd: (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 5 times. 20 hdc.
10th and 11th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. Break B. 
12th rnd:  With A, (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc) 5 times. 25 hdc.
13th and 14th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around. 
15th rnd:  With A, (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 5 times. 30 hdc. 
16th and 17th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around.
18th rnd: (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc) 5 times. 35 hdc. 
19th and 20th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join B with sl st to first hdc. Break A.
21st rnd:  With B, (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc) 5 times. 40 hdc. 
22nd and 23rd rnds:  1 hdc in each hdc around. 
24th rnd: (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc) 5 times. 45 hdc. 
   
Child Version only: 25th rnd:  (1 hdc in each of next 14 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 3 times. 48 hdc. 
Adult Version only: 25th and 26th rnds:  1 hdc in each hdc around. 
27th rnd: (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc) 5 times. 50 hdc. 
28th and 29th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. 
30th rnd: (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc) 4 times. 
2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. 56 hdc.
Both Versions:  With B, 1 sc in next hdc. 1 sl st in next hdc. Join A. Break B. 
Note: Join all following sc rnds with sl st to first sc.
 
Brim: 1st rnd: With A, [2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 (6) sc] 8 times. Join. 56 (64) sc.
2nd rnd: [1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 (4) sc] 8 times. Join. 64 (72) sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. [2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 (8) sc] 8 times. Join. 72 (80) sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 (5) sc] 8 times. Join B with sl st to first sc. Break A. 80 (88) sc.
5th rnd: With B, ch 1. [2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 (10) sc] 8 times. Join. 88 (96) sc.
6th rnd:  Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Baby TLC™: PINK HAT – 1 ball each 5945 Lilac A, 5737 Powder Pink B and 7624 Lime C.
BLUE HAT – 1 ball each 7624 Lime A, 5935 Clear Blue B and 5945 Lilac C.
Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US g-6]
Yarn needle, small (2”) pom-pom maker.
abbreviations: * = Repeat directions following * as many times as indicated
[ ] = Work directions inside brackets as many times as indicated.
measurements: Hat fits 3-6 months. Finished Measurement: 15” circumference.
gauge: Rounds 1–5 = 4½” diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions: Starting at center of crown with A, ch 4, join with slip st to form a ring (or use adjustable ring method). NOTE: To make an adjustable ring, wrap yarn around index finger, forming a ring. Remove ring from finger and hold working yarn behind ring. Insert hook into ring, yarn over and draw a loop through the ring. Work round 1 in ring, then pull tail to cinch ring closed. Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as dc now and throughout), 11 dc in ring –12 dc. Join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3. Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, 2 dc in next st and in each st around – 24 dc. Join as before. Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next st; *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around – 36 dc. Join, changing to B. Round 4: With B, ch 3, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; *dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around – 48 dc. Join. Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st; *dc in next 3 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around – 60 dc. Join, changing to A. Round 6 (wrong side): With A, ch 1, turn; sc in same st as joining, Bobble in next st; *sc in next st, Bobble in next st; repeat from * around – 30 sc and 30 Bobbles. Join with slip st in first sc, changing to B. Round 7 (right side): With B, ch 3, turn; dc in same sc as joining; *skip next Bobble, 2 dc in next sc; repeat from * around – 60 dc. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3. Round 8: Ch 1, sc in same ch as joining, sc in next st and in each st around – 60 sc. Join with slip st in first sc, changing to C. Round 9 (wrong side): With C, repeat Round 6. Changing to B in joining. Round 10 (right side): With B, repeat Round 7. Rounds 11–14: Ch 3, dc in next st and in each st around –60 dc. Join. At end of Round 14, change to A in joining. Round 15: With A, ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in next st and in each st around – 60 hdc. Join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-2, changing to C. Round 16: With C, repeat Round 15. Do not change colors. Fasten off. FINISHING: With C and pom-pom maker, make one 2” diameter pom-pom, leaving yarn tails used to tie pom-pom long. Thread tails through top of hat into inside center, tie tails together. Weave in all ends. Baby will look fashionable in this colorful hat perfect for shopping or visiting grandma. Make a few now and have them ready for the next shower!

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m; Stripes and Paints: 5 oz/141 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit head circumference: 6-12 mos 17" [43 cm], 18-24 mos 18" [45.5 cm]
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.

Cone
With A, ch 52 (60). Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 52 (60) hdc.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdcfp around first st. *1 hdcbp around next st. 1 hdcfp around next st. Rep from * around to last st. 1 hdcbp around last st. Join with sl st to first hdcfp.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th and 8th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Reverse Sc Diagram

Ice Cream
Join B with sl st to first st of 5th rnd through back loop only.
6th rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 52 (60) hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each of first 2 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first st.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcfp around last st. Join with sl st to first st.
9th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around each of first 2 sts. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first st.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around first st. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcbp around last st. Join with sl st to first st.
11th and 12th rnds: As 7th and 8th rnds.
13th rnd: Ch 2. Skip first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first st. 39 (45) sts.
14th rnd: Ch 2. Skip first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Join with sl st to first st. 26 (30) sts.
15th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcbp around last st. Join with sl st to first st.
16th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around first st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcfp around last st. Join with sl st to first st.
17th rnd: Ch 2. Skip first st. *1 dcfp around next st. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Skip next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcfp around last st. Join with sl st to first st. 13 (15) sts.
18th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around first st. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
19th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

Version 2 only: With C, embroider Sprinkles onto Ice Cream as shown in picture.

Version 3 only: With C, wind yarn around 3 fingers approx 40 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center with length of yarn approx 12" [30.5 cm] long. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Attach pompom Cherry to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1805 Bluebell A
1 skein 1401 Pewter B
1 skein 1101 Eggshell C
1 skein 1308 Tan D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch markers, Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 14 (16, 18, 20)” (35.5 (40.5, 45.5, 50.5) cm) in circumference. Hat measures 6 (6.5, 7, 7.5)” (15 (16.5, 18, 19) cm) long.
gauge: 17 dc = 5” [12.5 cm]; 9 rows dc = 5” [12.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HAT
With A, make an Adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 12 dc in ring; slip stitch in first dc to join—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 dc in each dc around; slip stitch in first dc to join—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc] 12 times; slip stitch in first dc to join—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [dc in each of next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 12 times; slip stitch in first dc to join—48 dc.
Rounds 5-10: Ch 1, dc in each dc around; slip stitch in first dc to join—48 dc. Do not fasten off; continue to make Right Ear Flap.
16” Circumference Only
Round 5: Ch 1, [dc in each of next 7 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 6 times; slip stitch in first dc to join—54 dc.
Rounds 6-11: Ch 1, dc in each dc around; slip stitch in first dc to join—54 dc. Do not fasten off; continue to make Right Ear Flap.
18” Circumference Only
Round 5: Ch 1, [dc in each of next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 12 times; slip stitch in first dc to join—60 dc.
Rounds 6-12: Ch 1, dc in each dc around; slip stitch in first dc to join—60 dc. Do not fasten off; continue to make Right Ear Flap.
20” Circumference Only 
Round 5: Ch 1, [dc in each of next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 12 times; slip stitch in first dc to join—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [dc in each of next 9 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 6 times; slip stitch in first dc to join—66 dc.
Rounds 7-13: Ch 1, dc in each dc around; slip stitch in first dc to join—66 dc. Do not fasten off; continue to make Right Ear Flap.
Right Ear Flap
Row 1: Ch 2 (counts as dc now and throughout), dc2tog, dc in each of next 4 dc, dc2tog, dc in next dc; turn—8 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each dc across; turn—8 sc.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc2tog, dc in each of next 2 sc, dc2tog, dc in last sc; turn—6 dc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each dc across; turn—6 sc.
Row 5: Ch 2, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last sc; turn—4 dc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each dc across—4 sc.
Fasten off and weave in ends.
Note: for 14” (16”, 18”, 20”) [(35.5 (40.5, 45.5, 50.5) cm)] circumference
With Right Earflap facing, and Hat seam to the right, place a stitch marker 20 (22, 24, 26) spaces to the left of the last stitch from the Earflap.
Left Ear Flap
Join with A in marked stitch.
Rows 1-6: Repeat Rounds 1-6 for Right Earflap.
Border
Round 1: Join A in center back of Hat between Right and Left Earflaps; ch 1, sc evenly around by working one sc in each stitch and one sc in the end of each sc Row and 3 sc in the end of each dc Row; slip stitch in first sc to join. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Eyes (Make 2)
With B, make an Adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 12 dc in ring; slip stitch in first dc to join—12 dc. Fasten off B.
Round 2: Join C; ch 1, 2 dc in each dc around; slip stitch in first dc to join—24 dc. Fasten off C, leaving a 3” (7.6 cm) tail.
Nose
With D, leave a 3” (7.6 cm) tail; make an Adjustable ring, ch 3 (counts as dc).
Row 1: Work 3 dc into ring, ch 3, slip stitch into ring. Fasten off, leaving a 3” (7.6 cm) tail.
Ears (Make 2)
With A, leave a 3” (7.6 cm) tail; make an Adjustable ring, ch 3 (counts as dc).
Row 1: Work 3 dc into ring, picot, work 3 dc into ring, ch 3, slip stitch into ring. Fasten off, leaving a 3” (7.6 cm) tail.
Row 2: Cut a 6” (15 cm) strand of each color B, C and D, fold in half and knot to picot in Ear. Trim ends evenly.
ASSEMBLY
Braids (Make 2)
Cut three 28” (71 cm) strands of each color B, C, and D. Separate each color. Referring to photograph for placement, evenly attach strands between stitches on last Row of Earflap. Braid together until 4” (10 cm) of fringe remains, knot to fasten, trim ends evenly.
Attach Eyes
Use stitch markers to hold eyes in place, centered mid forehead between Earflaps. Use yarn needle and C to fasten into place.
Attach Nose 
Cut two 4” strands of D, knot one to the top of the first dc on the Nose, knot the second to the top of the 5th dc on the Nose. Using tail ends from all three sides of Nose, fasten to Hat where desired.
Attach Ears
Flatten Hat so that Eyes are facing and centered. Using Round 3 as a guide, place one stitch marker on either side of Hat as desired. Use the 3” tails from each Ear to fasten to Hat where stitch markers are placed.

materials: Patons® Astra™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 161 yds/147 m)
Contrast A Dark Tan (02013) 1 1 ball
Contrast B Medium Tan (02020)  1 1 ball
Contrast A Medium Grey (02728)  1 1 ball
Contrast B Hot Pink (08416)  1 1 ball
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit child 2/4 (6/8) yrs.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Note: Do not break colors. Carry color not in use loosely up WS of work. To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color and draw through rem 2 loops and proceed.
Beg at top of crown, with A, ch 4.
1st rnd: 9 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 10 dc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dcfp around same ch-3 post as last sl st. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dcfp around post of same dc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 20 sts.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last dcfp. 2 dcfp around post of last dcfp. Join B with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.
4th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next dcfp. 1 dcfp around post of same dcfp.** 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join A with sl st to first sc. 40 sts.
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 dcfp around post of next dcfp.** 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join B with sl st to first sc. 50 sts.
6th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next dcfp. 1 dcfp around post of same dcfp.** 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join A with sl st to first sc. 60 sts.
7th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 2 dcfp around post of next dcfp.** 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join B with sl st to first sc. 70 sts.
8th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next dcfp. 1 dcfp around post of same dcfp.** 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join A with sl st to first sc. 80 sts.
9th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dcfp around post of last dcfp. Join B with sl st to first sc.
10th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 2 dcfp around post of next dcfp.** 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join A with sl st to first sc. 90 sts.
11th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next dcfp. 1 dcfp around post of same dcfp.**. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join B with sl st to first sc. 100 sts.
12th rnd: With B, as 9th rnd. Join A with sl st to first sc.
Size 6/8 only: 13th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc) 4 times. 2 dcfp around post of next dcfp.** 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join B with sl st to first sc. 110 sts.
14th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc) 4 times. 1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next dcfp. 1 dcfp around post of same dcfp.** 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join A with sl st to first sc. 120 sts.
Both sizes: Next rnd: As 9th rnd.
Next rnd: With B, as last rnd. Join A with sl st to first sc.
Rep last 2 rnds once more.
Beg shaping: Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc) 3 (4) times. Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next dcfp at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Miss next sc. Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next dcfp at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – dcfp2tog made**. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from* around, ending at **. Join B with sl st to first sc. 80 (100) sts.
Next rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Dcfp2tog over next 3 sts. 1 sc in next sc. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc) 1 (2) time(s). 1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dcfp around post of last st. Join A with sl st to first sc. 60 (80) sts. Break B.
Size 6/8 only: Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dcfp around post of next st. (1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next dcfp) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Dcfp2tog over next 3 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dcfp around post of last dcfp. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sts.
Both Sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dcfp around post of next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 dcfp around post of last hdc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dcfp around post of last dcfp. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Brim: Place marker on 15th (16th) st from center back.
1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st in front loop only of marked st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of next 29 (31) sc. Turn. 30 (32) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 4 times more. 20 (22) sts. Fasten off.
Edging: (RS). Join A with sl st at center back. Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each st around, working 1 reverse sc in side of each row at each end of Brim. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Pompom: Wind A around 4 fingers 80 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to form pompom. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: 1 skein Red Heart Super Saver in Spring Green (672) or Cherry Red (319) and Soft White (316)
Susan Bates Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Fiberfill
Stitch markers
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 14 (17, 19, 22, 25)" [35.5 (43, 46, 56, 63.5) cm]
gauge: 13 dc = 4" [10 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 4.
Round 1: Work 9 dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch does not count as first dc here and throughout), join with slip st in top of beginning ch – 9 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (does not count as first dc here and throughout), dc in same space as join, 2 dc in space between each st, slip st in top of beginning ch – 18 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same space, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 27 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same space, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 36 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same space, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 45 dc.
For Medium, Large, X-Large and XX-Large Only 
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in same space, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 4 dc, 2 dc in next dc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 54 dc.
For Large, X-Large and XX-Large Only 
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in same space, dc in next 4 dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 5 dc, 2 dc in next dc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 63 dc.
For X-Large and XX-Large Only 
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in same space, dc in next 5 dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 6 dc, 2 dc in next dc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 72 dc.
For XX-Large Only 
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in same space, dc in next 6 dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 7 dc, 2 dc in next dc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 81 dc.
Begin Pattern Stitch
Round 1: Ch 3, dc in each st around – 45 (54, 63, 72, 81) dc.
Round 2 (Cross Stitched): Ch 3, [skip next st, dc in next 2 sts, working in front of 2 dc just worked, dc in skipped st – Crossed dc made] around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around
Repeat Rounds 2-3 of Pattern st two more times for a total of 3 Crossed Stitch rounds.
Repeat Round 1 of Pattern st until piece measures 6 (7, 8, 8½, 8½)" [15 (18, 20.5, 21.5, 21.5) cm]. Fasten off.

ANTLERS (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – sc. Place stitch marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed. Stuff lightly with fiberfill as you go.
Round 2: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] around – 9 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each st around.
Repeat Round 3 until Antler measures 4" [10 cm] or desired length. At end of last round, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Antler Branch
With B, ch 2. 
Rounds 1-3: Repeat Rounds 1-3 as for Antler – 9 sc.
Note: Continue to work in back and forth in rows.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, leave remaining sts unworked, turn – 4 sc. 
Row 5: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice – 2 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Referring to photograph as a guide, sew open end of Antler Branch to side edge of Antler.

EARS (make 2)
Outer Ear
With A, ch 12.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 4 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in next ch, 3 sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 5 ch, d in first ch of beginning ch, turn – 20 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in next 6 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 6 sts, dc in top of beginning ch – 22 sts.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in next 6 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in next 5 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 6 sts, dc in top of beginning ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Inner Ear
With B, ch 10.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in next ch, 3 sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 3 ch, d in first ch of beginning ch, turn – 16 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in next 4 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 4 sts, dc in top of beginning ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
Sew Inner Ear in center of Outer Ear. Pinch sides of Outer Ear to center and tack down. Following photo, sew Ears and Antlers on to top of Hat. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball
Contrast B Tangerine (01699) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcbl = Double crochet in back loop
measurements: One size to fit head circumference: 21" [53.5 cm].
gauge: 13 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Hat is worked using Tapestry crochet techniques. To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw loop in next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color.
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of previous row and work color in use around it.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Hat is worked from Top down, ending at the brim. The pattern ‘pinwheels’ in a counter-clockwise direction at top, and then transitions into a clockwise direction on the side.
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch 3.
TOP
With A, Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join. 10 dc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 dc. (5 groups of A and 5 groups of B).
3rd rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in next dc. *With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join. 30 dc.
4th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Join. 40 dc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. With B, 2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Join. 50 dc.
6th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last 5 dc. With B, 2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Join. 60 dc.
7th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *With B, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. With A, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * to last 6 dc. With B, 2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Join. 70 dc.
SIDE
1st rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dcbl in each of next 5 dc. *With B, 1 dcbl in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dcbl in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * to last 8 dc. With B, 1 dcbl in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dcbl in last dc. Join.
2nd rnd: With A, working in both loops, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *With B, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * to last 9 dc. With B, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *With B, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * to last 10 dc. With B, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join.
4th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *With B, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * to last 11 dc. With B, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Join.
5th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *With B, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * to last 12 dc. With B, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of last 5 dc. Join.
6th rnd: With A, ch 3. *With B, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * to last 13 dc. With B, 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of last 6 dc. Join.
BRIM
1st rnd: With B, ch 3. 1 dcbl in same sp as sl st. (1 dcbl in next dc. 2 dcbl in next dc) twice. 1 dcbl in next dc. (With B, 1 dcbl. With A, 1 dcbl) in next dc. *With A, (1 dcbl in next dc. 2 dcbl in next dc) 3 times, 1 dcbl in next dc. With B, (2 dcbl in next dc. 1 dcbl in next  dc) 3 times. (With B, 1 dcbl. With  A, 1 dcbl) in next dc. Rep from * to last 7 sts. (With A, 1 dcbl in next dc. 2 dcbl in next  dc) 3 times. 1 dcbl in next dc. Join. 105 dc.
2nd rnd:  With B, ch 3. Working in both loops,  1 dc in each dc to 1 st before color change. *With A, 1 dc in each dc to 1 st before color change. With B, 1 dc in each dc to 1 st before color change. Keeping cont of pinwheel pat, rep from * around. Join.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Keeping cont of pinwheel pat and beg with B, work each color section to 1 st before color change, inc as follows, using appropriate color: *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join. 140 dc.
4th rnd: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to 1 st before color change. *With A, work 1 dc in each dc to 1 st before color change. With B, work 1 dc in each dc to 1 st before color change. Rep from * around, ending with A. Join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Cherry Red (0319) 1 ball or 73 yds/67 m
Contrast B Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 36.5 yds/33.5 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Hood is approx 5½" [14 cm] at its deepest point x 5" [12.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as dc. First dc of row is worked directly into last dc of previous row.
HOOD
With A, ch 32.
See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 dc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 14 dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 32 dc.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 34 dc.
4th and 5th rows: Ch 2. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 13 dc. (Dc2tog) 4 times. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 30 sts.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 13 sts. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 28 sts.
8th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 26 sts.
9th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 24 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Fold top of Hood, aligning sts of last row. Sew top of Hood closed using long tail.
CAPE
With RS facing, join A with sl st to rem loop of foundation ch at bottom left of Hood. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: Ch 2. 2 dc in first ch. *1 dc in next ch. 2 dc in next ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 45 dc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * end of row. Do not turn. 60 dc.
Cape Edging
Front edging: (RS). Ch 1. Working up right front edge of Hood, Work 24 sc evenly to top of Hood (2 sc in side of each row). Work 24 sc evenly down left side. Join B with sl st to first dc of last row of Cape. 1st rnd: With B, skip first st. *5 dc in next st. Skip next st. Sl st in next st. Skip next st. Rep from * along bottom of Cape, up right front edge and down left front edge. Join with sl st to last st. Fasten off.
TIES (Make 2)
Make Bobble: Holding 2 strands of B tog, ch 4. [Yoh and draw up a long loop in 4th ch from hook (same height as ch-3). Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook] 4 times. Yoh and draw through rem 5 loops on hook. Ch 1. Sl st in 4th ch from hook (same sp as Bobble just worked) to create Bobble end. Ch 20. Fasten off leaving long tail. Using tail, attach each tie to front edge of Hood at 1st row. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Off White (9702) 1 ball
Contrast B Dark Country Blue (9711) 1 ball
Contrast C Harvest Red (9763) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit average adult.
gauge: 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. To join colors, work to last 3 loops on hook at end of rnd. Draw new color through rem loops and proceed with new color.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 hdc. 
4th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc. 
5th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 hdc. 
6th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 hdc. 
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join C with sl st to first hdc. 
8th rnd: With C, ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc) 8 times. Join A with sl st to first sc. 56 hdc. 
9th rnd: With A, as 7th rnd. 
10th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 hdc. 
11th to 14th rnds: As 7th rnd. Join B at end of last rnd.
15th rnd: With B, as 7th rnd. Join C at end of rnd.
16th rnd: With C, as 7th rnd. Join B at end of rnd.
17th to 22nd rnds: With B, as 7th rnd. Fasten off. 
Pompom: Wind C around 4 fingers approx 80 times. Remove from fingers. Tie tightly in center, leaving 2 long ends for attaching to Cap. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew to Cap.

materials: RED HEART® Snuggle Bunny™: 1 ball 9937 Carousel
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.0mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Ribbing Circumference: 13.5” [34.5 cm] (15.5” [39.5 cm]). Ribbing stretches to 14-15” [35.5-38 cm] (16-17” [40.5-43 cm]).
gauge: 8 sc = 4”[10 cm], 10 rows sc = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HAT
Ribbing
Leaving an 8” [20.5 cm] tail at beginning, ch 6.
Row 1 (Right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each sc across; turn—5 sc.
Rows 3-30 (3-34): Repeat Row 2; do not fasten off.
Wrong side facing, sew rib seam together using the beginning tail. Weave in loose ends and turn Hat Right side out.
Crown
Begin Round with yarn still attached from Ribbing.
Round 1 (Right side): 2 sc in first st, sc in each of the next 14 (16) Rows of Ribbing, 2 sc in next Row, sc in remaining 14 (16) Rows—32 (36) sc.
Rounds 2-9 (2-11): Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a 14” [35.5 cm] tail.
Turn Hat to Wrong side. Weave the tail in and out of the sts in the last Round and pull tight to gather the Crown together. Weave in loose ends and turn Hat Right side out.
Ears (Make 2)
Ch 18; being careful not to twist, join with slip st in first ch to make a ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, (sc in each of the next 7 ch, sc2tog in next 2 ch) twice—16 sts.
Round 2: Sc in each st around.
Round 3: (Sc in 6 sts, sc2tog) twice—14 sts.
Round 4: Sc in each st around.
Round 5: (Sc in 5 sts, sc2tog) twice—12 sts.
Round 6: Sc in each st around.
Round 7: (Sc in 4 sts, sc2tog) twice—10 sts.
Round 8: Sc in each st around.
Round 9: (Sc in 3 sts, sc2tog) twice—8 sts.
Round 10: Sc in each st around.
Round 11: (Sc in 2 sts, sc2tog) twice—6 sts.
Round 12: Sc2tog 3 times—3 sts.
Fasten off, pull tail through last 3 sts and pull tight.
Weave in loose ends. Referring to photo for placement, sew the Ears to both sides of the top of the Crown so they flop to the sides.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver® Chunky™: 1 skein each 512 Turqua A and 400 Grey Heather B
