Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Pompom maker
yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 20 (22, 24)" [51 (56, 61) cm]
gauge: 12 hdc = 4" [10 cm] in half double crochet.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 28 (31, 34).
Row 1 (RS): Working in back loops only, hdc in 3rd ch from hook, hdc in each ch to last 8 ch, sc in next 7 ch, slip st in last ch.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in first slip st, sc in next 7 sc, hdc in each hdc across.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, working in back loops only, hdc in each hdc to last 8 sts, sc in next 3 sc, slip st in next st, leave remaining 4 sts unworked.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in first slip st, sc in next 3 sc, hdc in each hdc across.
Row 5: Ch 2, turn, working in back loops only, hdc in each hdc to last 8 sts, sc in next 7 sts, slip st in last st.
Rep Rows 2-5 until piece measures 20 (22, 24)" [51 (56, 61) cm] from beginning, end with Row 5. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Weave tail through row edges along top edge and pull to gather. Sew back seam closed. Weave in ends.
Using pompom maker, make a 4½" [11 cm] pompom with B. Sew pompom to top of Hat.

materials: 1 skein each of 1803 Blue Hawaii A, and 1932 Minty B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Pompom maker (optional)
yarn needle
abbreviations: A and B= Color A and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures about 18" [45.5 cm] circumference to fit 20" [51 cm] head circumference.
gauge: 8 sts = 3" [7.5 cm]; 11 rounds = 4" [10 cm] in half double crochet (hdc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With B, ch 48 loosely; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.

Ribbed Band
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in each ch around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—48 hdc.
Rounds 2–4: Ch 2, Fpdc around next st, *hdc in next st, Fpdc around next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—24 hdc and 24 Fpdc.

Body
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, Fpdc around next st, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next st, *hdc in next 3 sts, Fpdc around next st, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next st; repeat from * to last 2 sts, hdc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—32 hdc and 16 Fpdc.
Fasten off B.
Round 2 (wrong side): With wrong side facing, draw up a loop of A in same st as joining slip st, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, TURN—48 hdc. Work all following rounds with A only.
Round 3 (right side): Ch 2, skip first Fpdc 2 rounds below, Fptr around 2nd Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in next st (of previous round), working in front of last Fptr made, Fptr around skipped (first) Fpdc 2 rounds below, *hdc in next 3 sts, skip next Fpdc 2 rounds below, Fptr around next Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, working in front of last Fptr made, Fptr around skipped Fpdc 2 rounds below; repeat from * to last 2 sts, hdc in last 2 sts, turn; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn—32 hdc and 16 Fptr.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn.
Round 5: Ch 2, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, Fpdc around first Fptr 2 rounds below, *hdc in next 3 sts, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below; repeat from * to last 2 sts, hdc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn.
Rounds 6–17: Repeat Rounds 2–5 three times.
Rounds 18–20: Repeat Rounds 2–4.

Shape Top of Hat
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, Fpdc around first Fptr 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below, *hdc2tog, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below; repeat from * to last 2 sts, hdc2tog; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn—24 hdc and 16 Fpdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—40 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, skip first Fpdc 2 rounds below, Fptr around 2nd Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, working in front of last Fptr made, Fptr around skipped (first) Fpdc 2 rounds below, *hdc2tog, skip next Fpdc 2 rounds below, Fptr around next Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, working in front of last Fptr made, Fptr around skipped Fpdc 2 rounds below; repeat from * to last st, skip last st, turn; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn—16 hdc and 16 Fptr.
Round 4: Ch 2, [hdc2tog] 15 times, skip last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn—16 sts.
Round 5: Ch 1, beginning in same ch as join, sc2tog around; join with slip st in first st, turn—8 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through top of stitches in last round and pull tight to close opening at top of hat. Carefully secure end on wrong/inside of hat.

FINISHING
Pompom (optional)
With B and following pompom maker directions, make a 2" [5 cm] pompom and attach to top of hat.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Roving™ (3.5 oz/ 100 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color Rice Paper (00100) - 1 ball (2/4 yrs), 1 ball (6/8 yrs), 1 ball (Adult)
Contrast A Plum (00071) - 1 ball (2/4 yrs), 1 ball (6/8 yrs), 1 ball (Adult)
Main Color Taupe (00010) - 1 ball (2/4 yrs), 1 ball (6/8 yrs), 1 ball (Adult)
Contrast A Cherry (00436) - 1 ball (2/4 yrs), 1 ball (6/8 yrs), 1 ball (Adult)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit average head sizes: child 2/4 yrs (child 6/8 yrs -Adult).
gauge: 9 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Beg at crown, with MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in ring – beg cluster made. (Ch 1. Cluster) 7 times in ring. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 8 clusters.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. (Beg cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 16 clusters.
Size 6/8 only: 3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. (Beg cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Cluster in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1.** (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 20 clusters.
Size Adult only: 3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Beg cluster in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1 (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. ** Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 6 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 24 clusters.
All sizes: Next rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Beg cluster in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. Rep last rnd until Hat from beg measures 5 (6-7) [12.5 (15-18) cm]. Fasten off.
Band: 1st rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in top of next cluster. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 (40-48) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 14 (18-22) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first st. 30 (38-46) sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Band measures 1½ (2-2) [4 (5-5) cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool DK Superwash™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 125 yds/114 m)
Contrast A Deep Blush (12409) 1 ball
Contrast B Pumpkin (12630) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6  (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit average Woman’s head.
gauge: 16 hdc and 12 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 hdc.
9th rnd: As 7th rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 hdc.
11th rnd: As 7th rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 hdc.
13th to 17th rnds: As 7th rnd. Join B with sl st to first hdc at end of 17th rnd.
18th to 26th rnds: With B, as 7th rnd.
Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Ombre™ (10 oz/283 g; 482 yds/440 m) Sea Coral (3967) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet through back loop
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Ribbing: Ch 21.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 20 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures 19½" [49.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Join ribbing: With WS facing, working through both thicknesses of foundation ch and last row of ribbing, work 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not fasten off.
Turn Ribbing sideways and work 72 sc evenly around long edge of Ribbing. Join with sl st to first sc. Proceed in Shell Pat as follows:
(see diagram on page 2)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 sc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 2 dc in first sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc and 2 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 dc. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds for Shell St Pat until work from first rnd of sc after Ribbing measures approx 6½" [16.5 cm], ending on 2nd rnd.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc and 2 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 dc. Join with sl st to first sc. 50 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next dc. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next dc. 1 dc in first sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next dc. 1 hdc in next sc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc and dc. Skip next dc. 1 hdc in next sc. Skip next dc. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sts. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving long end. Thread end through front loops of rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Fold Ribbing in half to RS. Pompom: Wind yarn around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (14 oz/400 g; 431 yds/394 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: To fit head sizes: Child 2/4 years 19" [48 cm] circumference, Child 6/10 years 20" [51 cm] circumference, Adult 21-22" [53.5-56 cm] circumference.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Note: Hat is worked side to side. Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. Ch 23 (28-32) leaving a 24" [61 cm] long end for seaming later.

1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 15 (19-22) ch. 1 sc in each of last 5 (6-7) ch. Turn. 21 (26-30) sts.

2nd row: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of first 5 (6-7) sc. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked – see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked). Rep from * 15 (19-22) times more. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of last 5 (6-7) sc. Turn.

Rep last 2 rows until Hat (at widest point) measures approx 17 (18-19)" [43 (45.5-48) cm] ending on a 2nd row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Using end from foundation ch, weave yarn through short side of Hat (sc rows) and gather top of Hat tog securely. Sew center back seam. Turn back cuff as shown.

Pompom: Wind yarn around 3 (4-4) fingers approx 70 (80-80) times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape, approx 3 (4-4)" [7.5 (10-10) cm] diameter. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein 365 Coffee.
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8].
Split lock stitch marker
4” x 9” piece of plastic mesh canvas
sheet of paper
yarn needle
abbreviations: Dec (decrease) = draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Cap Circumference = 20½”. Designed by Linda Cyr. One size fits most women.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Unless otherwise directed, work in continuous rnds without joining. Place a marker in first st of first rnd and move up each rnd.
Ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: [Inc in next sc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 3: [Inc in next sc] 12 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 4 (And All Even Rnds): Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 5: [Inc in next sc, sc in next sc] 12 times – 36 sc.
Rnd 7: [Inc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 12 times – 48 sc.
Rnd 9: [Inc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 12 times – 60 sc.
Rnd 11: [Inc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 12 times – 72 sc.
Rnd 13: [Inc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] 12 times – 84 sc.
Rnd 15: [Inc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] 12 times – 96 sc.
Rnds 16, 17, 18: Repeat Rnd 4.
Rnd 19: [Dec, sc in next 6 sc] 12 times – 84 sc.
Rnds 20, 21, 22: Repeat Rnd 4.
Rnd 23: [Dec, sc in next 5 sc] 12 times – 72 sc.
Rnd 24: Hdc in each sc around.
Rnd 25: Slip st in the center (through the fabric) of each hdc around.
Brim-Row 1: Working under the 2 top loops of the slip sts, sc in next 31 slip sts, slip st in next slip st; turn.
Row 2: Ch 2, skip 2 sc, sc in next 28 sc, slip st in next sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, skip 2 sc, sc in next 26 sc, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 4: Ch 2, skip 2, sc in next 24 sc, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 5: Ch 2, skip 2, sc in next 22 sc, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 6: Ch 2, skip 2, sc in next 20 sc, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 7: Ch 2, skip 2, sc in next 18 sc, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 8: Ch 2, skip 2, sc in next 16 sc, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 9: Ch 2, skip 2, sc in next 14 sc, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 10: Ch 2, skip 2, sc in next 12 sc, slip st in next st; turn. Fasten off.
Brim Facing: With right side facing, attach yarn in the hdc above the first sc of Row 1 of brim and repeat Rows 1-10, working first row in hdc of Rnd 24.
FINISHING: Trace around brim onto paper. Use this paper pattern to cut out brim liner from plastic canvas. Place plastic liner between brim pieces, trim if necessary.
Edging: With right side facing, attach yarn to back of cap; ch 1, sc around entire edge, encasing plastic liner between brim and brim facing; slip st in each sc around. Fasten off.
Strap: Ch 43; 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch to last ch; 3 sc in last ch; pivot and work sc in remaining loop of each ch across; slip st in each sc around. Fasten off.
Buttons (Make 2): Ch 3; 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; slip st in each hdc around. Fasten off.
Place strap over front of cap. Sew buttons to ends of strap through all layers. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz /100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Clay (28041) or Hot Pink (28416) 2 3 balls
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit child 2/4 yrs (6/8 yrs) Approx 20½ (23)" [52 (58.5) cm] circumference x 13 (14)" [33 (35.5) cm] deep.
gauge: 7 sts and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook in pat.
instructions: The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). HOOD Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd or row counts as dc throughout. With larger hook, ch  36 (40). Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist chain. Note: Hood is worked with WS facing until divide for Face Opening. 1st rnd: (WS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each ch around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 36 (40) sts. 2nd rnd: Ch 3. Sl st in next dc. *1 dc in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 4th rnd: As 2nd rnd. Rep last 2 rnds 1 (2) time(s) more. Divide for Face Opening: Turn work inside out and beg working in rows as follows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 30 (34) sts. Turn. Leave rem 5 sts unworked. Cont working on 31 (35) sts as follows: 2nd row: Ch 3. *Sl st in in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from divide measures approx 5 (6)" [12.5 (15) cm], ending on a WS row. Shape Top Hood: 1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 8 (9) sts. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each of next 5 (7) sts. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each of next 9 (10) sts. Turn. 27 (31) sts. 2nd row: Ch 3. *Sl st in in first dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 7 (8) sts. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each of next 3 (5) sts. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each of next 8 (9) sts. Turn. 23 (27) sts. 4th row: As 2nd row. 5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 6 (7) sts. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each of next 1 (3) st(s). (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each of next 7 (8) sts. Turn. 19 (23) sts. Size 6/8 only: 6th row: Ch 3. *Sl st in in first dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 7th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 6 sts. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in next st. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. 19 sts. Both sizes: Fasten off. Sew Top Hood seam. Face Opening Edging With larger hook, join yarn with sl st to first unworked st at bottom of Face Opening. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sts. Work 25 (30) sc evenly around Face Opening. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 (35) sts. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. EARS (make 4) With smaller hook, ch 2. 1st row: (RS). 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 10 sc. 3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. 15 sc. Fasten off. Join Ears: With WS of 2 Ears facing each other, join yarn with sl st to first sc. 1st row:  Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. Sew Ears to Hood as seen in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 (1, 2, 2) ball(s) 9940 Light Grey Heather A and 1 ball 9770 Rose Blush B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I–9]
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
Polyester fiberfill
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Snood fits 11 (13½, 16½, 19½)” (28 [33, 42, 49.5] cm) circumference around neck.
gauge: 12 sc = 4” (10 cm); 15 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Notes
1. Neckband and hood are one piece worked back and forth in turned rows. Antlers and ears are worked separately and sewn to hood.
2. Antlers and Rounds 1–3 of antler branches are worked in continuous (spiral) rounds. Do not turn or join at end of rounds unless instructed. Place marker on first stitch and move up as each round is completed.
SNOOD
Neckband
Leaving a long tail for sewing, with A, ch 10 (13, 16, 19).
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—9 (12, 15, 18) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 3–32 (40, 50, 58): Repeat Row 2; do not turn at end of last row.
Hood
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, working in ends of rows, sc in each row across, turn—32 (40, 50, 58) sc.
Rows 2–12 (16, 21, 25): Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 13 (17, 22, 26): Ch 1, sc in first 14 (18, 23, 27) sc, [sc2tog] twice, sc in each remaining st across, turn—30 (38, 48, 56) sc.
Row 14 (18, 23, 27): Ch 1, sc in first 13 (17, 22, 26) sc, [sc2tog] twice, sc in each remaining st across, turn—28 (36, 46, 54) sc.
Row 15 (19, 24, 28): Ch 1, sc in first 12 (16, 21, 25) sc, [sc2tog] twice, sc in each remaining st across, turn—26 (34, 44, 52) sc.
Row 16 (20, 25, 29): Ch 1, sc in first 11 (15, 20, 24) sc, [sc2tog] twice, sc in each remaining st across—24 (32, 42, 50) sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Assembly
Fold last row together to form top of hood. With end tail and working through both thicknesses, whipstitch sts of last row together. With beginning tail, whipstitch first and last rows of neckband together.
Edging
With right side of hood facing and working in ends of rows, join A with sc in Row 1, work 31 (39, 49, 57) sc evenly around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Antler (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place stitch marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed. Stuff lightly with fiberfill as you go.
Round 2: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—9 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each st around.
Repeat Round 3 until antler measures 4” (10 cm) or desired length. At end of last round, join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Antler Branch
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work same as Round 1 of antler—6 sc.
Rounds 2 and 3: Work same as Round 3 of antler—9 sc.
Note: Continue in turned rows.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice—2 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Referring to photograph as a guide, sew open end of antler branch to side edge of antler.
Ear (make 2)
Inner ear
With B, ch 16 (16, 20, 20).
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped 3 ch count as first dc), dc in next 8 (8, 12, 12) ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in next ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in next 1 (2) ch, hdc in next 2 (1) ch, dc in next 9 (9, 13, 13) ch, dc in first ch of beginning ch-3, turn—29 (29, 37, 37) sts.
Sizes Extra-Small and Small only:
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 14 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in each st across to beginning ch-3, sc in top of beginning ch—31 (31) sc. Fasten off.
Sizes Medium and Large only:
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next 15 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, (hdc, dc, hdc) in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in each st across to beginning ch-3, dc in top of beginning ch—39 (39) sts. Fasten off.
Outer Ear
With A, repeat Rows 1 and 2 of Inner Ear. At the end of Row 2, turn, do not fasten off.
Row 3: Holding right side of outer ear to wrong side of inner ear and working through both thicknesses, ch 1, sc in first 15 (15, 19, 19) sts, (hdc, dc, hdc) in next st, sc in each st across to last sc (beginning ch-3), sc in last sc (top of beginning ch)—33 (33, 41, 41) sts.
Joining Row: Fold bottom edge in half, ch 1, working through both thicknesses, work 5 sc evenly spaced across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide, sew antlers and ears to hood. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Skinny Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 795 yds/727 m) Sugared Cube (18043) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Front post double crochet. Yoh and draw up a loop around post of indicated stitch, inserting hook from front to back to front. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice

Dcfp3tog = Front post double crochet 3 Together. (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc3tog = Single crochet 3 together. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Trfp = Front post treble crochet (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of indicated stitch, inserting hook from front to back to front. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
measurements: One size to fit average Adult.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: All rnds are joined with sl st to first st. Ribbing: Ch 12. 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 11 sc. 2nd row: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 21" [53.5 cm] when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off. Join last row and first row tog with 1 row of sc to form ring. Set up pat: 1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). Working along side edge, work 90 dc evenly around. Join. 2 rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of the next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of the next 9 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Proceed in Braided Cable Pat (see diagram on page 3): 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Skip next 3 sts. (1 trfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. Working in front of 3 trfp just made, 1 trfp around post of each of 3 skipped dcfp 2 rows below. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 2nd and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next trfp 2 rows below) 6 times. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. Rep from * around. Join. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. Skip next 3 sts. (1 trfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. Working behind 3 trfp just made, 1 trfp around post of each of 3 skipped dcfp 2 rows below. Rep from * around. 7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. (1 dcfp around post of next trfp 2 rows below) 6 times. Rep from * around. Join. 8th rnd: As 2nd rnd. Rep 1st to 8th rnds until work from beg measures approx 6" [15 cm], ending on an even numbered rnd. Shape Crown: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Dcfp3tog around next 3 sts 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. Dcfp3tog around next 3 sts 2 rows below. (1 dcfp around post of next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. Rep from * around. Join. 70 sts. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around next st 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Dcfp3tog around next 3 sts 2 rows below. 1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below. Dcfp3tog around next 3 sts 2 rows below. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts. 4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc3tog. 1 dcfp around next st 2 rows below. Sc3tog. Dcfp3tog around next 3 sts 2 rows below. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts. Fasten off. Draw end tightly through rem sts. Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 80 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to smooth round shape. Attach pompom to top of Hat.

materials: Bernat® Softee Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
Contrast A True Gray (28044) 1 1 ball
Contrast B Berry Red (28705) 1 1 ball
Contrast A Emerald (28200) 1 1 ball
Contrast B Pumpkin (28630) 1 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 [8 mm] Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Sizes Child 6/8 yrs and Adult.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for Child 6/8 yrs. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written Child 6/8 yrs ( Adult).
Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Notes:
• Hat is worked side to side.
• Work with 2 separate balls of yarn and twist 2 colors around each other, where they meet on WS, to avoid a hole.
• When changing colors, work to last loops on hook of first color, then yoh with new color and proceed.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.

HAT
With B, ch 11 ( 13); then with A, ch 17 ( 20). Total 28 ( 33) ch.
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ( 6) ch. 1 hdc in each of next 10 ( 12) ch, joining B in last st. With B, 1 hdc in each of last 11 ( 13) ch. Turn. 27 ( 32) sts.
2nd row: With B, ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked – see diagram). Rep from * 10 ( 12) times more, joining A in last st. With A, rep from * to last 6 ( 7) sc. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of last 6 ( 7) sc. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 6 ( 7) sc. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked – see diagram). Rep from * 9 ( 11) times more, joining B in last st. With B, rep from * in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until Hat (at widest point) measures approx 18 ( 19½)[ 45.5 ( 49.5) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a WS row. Fasten off, leaving a long yarn end of A.

FINISHING
Using A yarn end, weave through short side of Hat (sc rows) and gather top of Hat tog securely. Sew center back seam, changing to B at color change. Turn back cuff as shown.

Pompom: Wind B around 4 fingers approx. 80 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape, 4" [10 cm] diameter. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Main Color (MC) White (39701) 1 (1-1-1-1-2) ball(s)
5 yds/4.5 m each of Caron® Simply Soft™ in Black (39727), Bone (39703) and Grey Heather (H9509)
Wire brush
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Stitch markers
abbreviations: Sc2tog = (Draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit 0/3 mos (3/6 mos-6/12 mos-2/4 years-6/10 years-Adult)
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Say goodbye to crocheter's block
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 9 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 18 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 27 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 36 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 45 hdc.
Size 3/6 mos only: 6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 50 hdc.
Sizes 6/12 mos, 2/4 yrs, 6/10 yrs and Adult only: 6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 54 hdc.
Sizes 2/4 yrs, 6/10 yrs and Adult only: 7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 60 hdc.
Sizes 6/10 yrs and Adult only: 9th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next (29-9) hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. (62-66) hdc.
All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
Rep last rnd 8 (8-9-9-10-11) times more. Do not fasten off.
First Earflap
**1st row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 10 (10-10-10-12-12) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 (6-6-6-8-8) sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 8 (8-8-8-10-10) sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 (6-6-6-8-8) sts.
5th row: As 3rd row.
Rep last 2 rows to 4 sts.
Next row: (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sts.
Next row: Sc2tog. Fasten off.**
Fold Hat in half, with slightly more sts towards front of Hat than in the back. Place markers for 10 (10-10-10-12-12) hdc of Second Earflap to line up with First Earflap on opposite side.
Second Earflap
With RS facing, join MC with sl st at marker.
Work from ** to ** as given for First Earflap.
Eyes (make 2)
With Black, ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join Bone with sl st to first sc.  
2nd rnd: With Bone, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join MC with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: With MC, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join Grey Heather with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
5th rnd: With Grey Heather, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Nose
With Black, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of last 2 ch. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Sew Eyes and Nose to front of Hat as shown in picture.
Loop strands of MC and tie between eyes. Comb with wire brush to ‘fluu’ and trim.
Braided Tails (make 2)
Cut 12 strands of MC 36" [91 cm] long. Take 6 strands tog and thread through end of Earflap. Knot at top.
Divide 12 strands into 3 groups of 4 strands and braid. Knot to secure braid. Use wire brush to fluff ends!
Ears
Cut 10 strands of MC and 4 strands Heather Grey 12" [30.5 cm] long. Taking 5 strands of MC and 2 strands of Heather Grey tog, loop through sts at top of Hat on either side. Knot and trim to approx 1" [2.5 cm].
Use wire brush to fluff! Rep for opposite Ear.
Note: You can also use the wire brush to lightly comb over the Hat to create a layer of 'fur'!

materials: Bernat® Super Value Stripes™ (5 oz/142 g; 264 yds/241 m) 1 ball
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Tunisian crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit Child 6/8 (Adult) head.
gauge: 13 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Work into horizontal bumps at back of foundation chain for 1st row.
1st row: Forward pass: (Right to left). Insert hook into 2nd ch from hook. Yoh, draw loop through and leave on hook. *Insert hook in next ch. Yoh, draw loop through and leave on hook. Rep from * to end of chain. Do not turn. 72 (76) loops on hook.
Return pass: (Left to right). Yoh and draw through first loop on hook for selvedge st. *Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Rep from * until 1 loop rem on hook. Do not turn. Loop rem on hook becomes first st of next row.

**2nd row: Forward pass: (Right to left – work Tks and Tps ribbing). *(Insert hook from front to back below chain formed by previous reverse row, to right of front vertical thread, but to left of corresponding back thread. Yoh and draw up a loop and leave on hook – Tks made) twice. (Bring yarn to front. Insert hook from right to left behind single vertical thread. Once yarn to back of work and yoh. Draw up a loop and leave on hook - Tps made) twice. Rep from * to last 3 sts. (Tks) 3 times. Do not turn.
2nd row: Return pass: (Left to right). Yoh and draw through first loop on hook for selvedge st. *Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Rep from * until 1 loop remains on hook. Do not turn. Loop remaining on hook becomes first st of next row.** Rep from ** to ** until work from beg measures 5 (6½)" [12.5 (16.5) cm], ending with return pass row.

Shape top:
1st row: Forward pass: (Right to left). (Work established rib pat across 8 sts. Skip next st) 8 times. Work established rib pat across last 9 (4) sts. Do not turn. 65 (68) sts.
Return pass for all rows: (Left to right after working Forward pass of each row). Yoh and draw through first loop on hook for selvedge st. *Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Rep from * until 1 loop remains on hook. Do not turn. Loop remaining on hook becomes first st of next row.

2nd row: Forward pass: (Right to left). (Work established rib pat across 7 sts. Skip next st) 8 times. Work established rib pat across last 1 (4) sts. Do not turn. 57 (60) sts.
3rd row: Forward pass: (Right to left). (Work established rib pat across 6 sts. Skip next st) 8 times. Work established rib pat across last 1 (4) sts. Do not turn. 49 (52) sts.
4th row: (Right to left). (Work established rib pat across 5 sts. Skip next st) 8 times. Work established rib pat across last 1 (4) sts. Do not turn. 41 (44) sts.
5th row: (Right to left). (Work established rib pat across 4 sts. Skip next st) 8 times. Work established rib pat across last 1 (4) sts. Do not turn. 33 (36) sts.
6th row: (Right to left). (Work established rib pat across 3 sts. Skip next st) 8 (9) times. Work established rib pat across last 1 (0) st(s). Do not turn. 25 (27) sts.
7th row: (Right to left). (Work established rib pat across 2 sts. Skip next st) 8 (9) times. Work established rib pat across last 1 (0) st(s). Do not turn. 17 (18) sts.
Return pass: As 1st row: Break yarn, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. Sew back seam.

Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 120 times (or 2 strands tog 60 times). Tie in the middle. Cut through both sides of loops. Shape to a smooth round shape. Attach to top of hat.

materials: 1 skein 3901 Rouge of RED HEART® Super Saver®
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.0mm [US H-8] for size Medium or 6.0mm [US J-10] for size Large
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** - repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Hat Size: 20” (22”) [51 (56) cm] in circumference
gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 4” [10 cm] with smaller size hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Ch 3, slip st in first ch to make a ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 2, work 12 dc in ring; slip st in first dc to join—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 2, 2 dc in each dc around; slip st in first dc to join—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 2, Fpdc around first 2 dc, *2 dc in each of next 2 dc, Fpdc around next 2 dc; repeat from * around, end with 2 dc in each of last 2 dc, slip st in first Fpdc to join—12 Fpdc, 24 dc.
Round 4: Ch 2, *Fpdc around next 2 Fpdc, dc in next 4 dc; repeat from * around, slip st in first Fpdc to join—12 Fpdc, 24 dc.
Round 5: Ch 2, *Fpdc around next 2 Fpdc, 2 dc in each of next 4 dc; repeat from * around, slip st in first Fpdc to join—12 Fpdc, 48 dc.
Round 6: Ch 2, *Fpdc around next 2 Fpdc, dc in next 3 dc, Fpdc around next 2 dc, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * around, slip st in first Fpdc to join—24 Fpdc, 36 dc.
Rounds 7-13: Ch 2, *Fpdc around next 2 Fpdc, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * around, slip st in first Fpdc to join—24 Fpdc, 36 dc.
Round 14: Ch 2, *Fpdc around next 2 Fpdc, Bpdc around next dc, Fpdc around next dc, Bpdc around next dc; repeat from * around, slip st in first Fpdc to join—36 Fpdc, 24 Bpdc.
Rounds 15-17: Ch 2, *Fpdc around next 2 Fpdc, Bpdc around next Bpdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc, Bpdc around next Bpdc; repeat from * around, slip st in first Fpdc to join. At end of Round 17, fasten off and weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 5142 Cherry Red A.
RED HEART® Team Spirit™: 1 skein 940 Red/Blue B.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 4mm [US G-6]
Stitch marker, yarn needle
abbreviations: sc2tog = single crochet two stitches together
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22)” [51 (56)cm] circumference.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4”
instructions:
STRIPED HAT
Rounds 31-45 (33-48): Sc in each sc around.
Size Large Only
Round 49: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc]—72 sc.
Round 50: Sc in each sc around.
All Sizes
Round 46 (51): [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] 12 times—60 sc.
Round 47 (52): Sc in each sc around.
Round 48 (53): [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 12 times—48 sc.

First Sock
Round 49 (54): Sc in first sc, place marker in sc just made, sc in next 23 sc, leave remaining 24 sc unworked.
Round 50 (55): Ch 12, sc in marked sc and in each of next 23 sc. Sc in each ch—36 sc.
Rounds 51, 53, 55 (56, 58, 60): Sc in each sc around.
Round 52 (57): [Sc2tog, sc in next 7 sc] 4 times—32 sc.
Round 54 (59): [Sc2tog, sc in next 6 sc] 4 times—28 sc.
Round 56 (61): [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc] 4 times—24 sc.
Work 26 more sc rounds. Change to smaller hook.
Next round: Slip st in back loop of first sc, ch 3, dc in back loop of each sc around, join with sl st to top of beginning ch-3—24 dc.
Next round: Ch 2, *fpdc in next dc, bpdc in next dc; repeat from * around ending with fpdc and join to top of beginning ch-2.
Repeat last round twice more. Fasten off.

Second Sock
With right side facing, join yarn in first skipped sc.

Directions are for size Small. Changes for size Large are in parentheses.
NOTE
Entire hat is worked in back loops only unless otherwise specified.

SOLID HAT
Round 1 (Right Side): With larger hook and A, ch 2, 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join, move marker as work progresses—6 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in back loop only of each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 4 sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 12 times—48 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 12 times—60 sc.
Round 11: Repeat Round 9.
Round 12: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 12 times—72 sc.
Round 13: Repeat Round 9.

Size Large Only
Round 14: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] 12 times—84 sc.
All Sizes
Rounds 14-30 (15-32): Sc in each sc around. Cut A at end of last round; join B.

Insert solid hat into striped hat.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 3901 Rouge
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle, 1½ yds (1.40 m) of 7⁄8" (2.25 cm) wide white grosgrain ribbon
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 20" (51 cm) circumference at brim.
gauge: 14 hdc = 5" (12.5 cm); 10 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first hdc—8 hdc. Pull gently on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—16 hdc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next st, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—24 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 2 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—32 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 3 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—40 hdc.
Round 6: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 4 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—48 hdc.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 5 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—56 hdc.
Rounds 8–16: Ch 1, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—56 hdc.
Round 17: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next 2 sts, *ch 1, skip next st, dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around, ch 1, skip last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—42 dc and 14 ch-1 spaces.
Round 18: Ch 1, hdc in each st and ch-1 space around; join with slip st in first hdc—56 hdc.
Round 19: Ch 1, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc.
Round 20: Slip st loosely in each st around; join with slip st in first slip st—56 slip sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
With right side facing, weave ribbon through ch-1 spaces of Round 17. Adjust ribbon so beginning and end tails are even and tie in a bow. Trim ends to desired length.

materials: Bernat® Bundle Up™ (4.9 oz/140 g; 267 yds/244 m)
Sizes 6/12 18/24 mos
Contrast A Brook (74012) 1 ball
Contrast B Red Wagon (74024) 1 ball
Contrast C Marshmallow (74001) 1 ball
Contrast D Duckling (74019) 1 ball
Sizes U.S H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit head circumference: 6/12 mos 16" [40.5 cm], 18/24 mos 18" [45.5 cm]
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnds and rows does not count as hdc.
• Hat is worked from top down.
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of first st.
HAT
Beg at top with A and larger hook, ch 3.
1st rnd: 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
Size 6/12 mos only: 6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first hdc. Break A. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: With B, ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. Rep from * around. Join C with sl st to first hdc. Break B. 60 hdc. 
Size 18/24 mos only: 6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 56 hdc. Break A.
8th rnd: With B, ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 hdc. 
9th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 15 hdc. Rep from * around. Join C with sl st to first hdc. Break B. 68 hdc. 
Both sizes: Next rnd: With C, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 5½ (7)" [14 (18) cm], joining B with sl st to first hdc on last rnd. Break C.
Next rnd: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 6 (7½)" [15 (19) cm], joining D with sl st to first hdc on last rnd. Break B.
Next rnd: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Do not fasten off.
Earflaps: Proceed in rows as follows: Place marker on 7th sc from joining sc (center back).
First Earflap: 1st row: (RS). Join D with sl st in marked sc, leaving 6 sc unworked. **Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 11 (13) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 (14) sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 (10) sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 (12) sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 (8) sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 (10) sc. Turn. 
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 (6) sc. Sc2tog. Fasten off.**
Second Earflap: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 24 (28) sc after First Earflap. Join D with sl st in next sc. Work from ** to ** as given for First Earflap.
Edging rnd: (RS). Join D with sl st to center back sc. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around edge of Hat, working 3 sc in each corner of Earflaps. Join. Fasten off.
Left Wing
With B and smaller hook, ch 13.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each chain across. Turn. 12 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 11 sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 10 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 3 dc in last dc. Do not fasten off. Ch 1. Work sc evenly across bottom edge of Wing. Surface sl st evenly up foundation row, across top edge, down 4th row and across bottom sc sts. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.
Right Wing
With B and smaller hook, ch 13. 1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each chain across. Turn. 12 sc. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sts. 3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn. 10 sts. 4th row: Ch 2. 3 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Do not fasten off. Surface sl st evenly across top edge, down foundation row. Ch 1. Work sc evenly across bottom edge of Wing. Join with sl st to base of first dc. Fasten off.
Window
With C and smaller hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 8 sc in ring. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc. Fasten off.
Window Frame
With A and smaller hook, ch 16. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 32 sc in ring. Join. Do not fasten off.
Join Window and Window Frame:
With WS of Window Frame and RS of Window tog, working through both thicknesses, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With Hat joining rnds positioned at Back, sew Window to Front of Hat and Wings above Ear Flaps as shown.
Vertical Lines: With RS facing and larger hook, join B with sl st at top of lower B ring, as shown. Surface sl st evenly up to base of upper B ring. Fasten off. Rep for other side.

materials: Red Heart® Soft® (5 oz/141 g; 256 yds/ 234 m) Biscuit (9274) 1 ball
Sizes U.S I/9 [5.5 mm] and U.S. K/10½ [6.5 mm] crochet hooks or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice

Fpdec (Front post double decrease) = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of same dcfp as last st worked at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next dcfp worked at front of work inserting hook from right to left, Yoh and draw 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook. Skip st centered 'behind' Fpdec, unless otherwise instructed.

FpPuff (Front post puff st) = (Yoh and draw up a loop worked at front of work inserting hook from right to left) 4 times around post of next st - (9 loops on hook). Yoh and draw through all 9 loops on hook. Ch 1 tightly to close. Note: Closing ch-1 is part of FpPuff and does not count as a separate st. Skip st 'behind' FpPuff, unless otherwise instructed.

Trfp2tog (Treble front post 2 together) = *(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Rep from * once more - (3 loops on hook). Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook. Skip st centered 'behind' Fptr2tog, unless otherwise instructed.
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times
measurements: To Fit Head Circumference Small 20-22" [51-56 cm] Medium 22-24" [56-61 cm] Finished Circumference (measured around brim) Small 17½" [44.5 cm] Medium 20" [51 cm] Note: Hat will stretch to fit a range of sizes. Finished Height: Approx 8" [20.5 cm].
gauge: 13¼ sts and 14½ rnds = 4" [10 cm] in sc-dcfp pat
instructions:
Notes: • Take care to skip top of sts 'behind' each post st, unless otherwise instructed. • When instructed to work around st '2 rnds below' work in to the indicated st in the rnd numbered 2 less than the rnd being worked. For example, if you are working 17th rnd, st '2 rnds below' is 15th rnd. • When instructed to work into or around the 'same' st, this means you should work into or around the st that was last worked into or around.
HAT 
With larger hook, make adjustable ring: Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind working yarn. Grip ring and tail between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work sts of first rnd in the ring. After the first rnd of sts is worked, pull gently on tail to tighten ring. 
 
1st rnd: Ch 2 (counts as dc). 6 (7) dc in ring. Join with sl st in top of beg ch-2. 7 (8) dc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1 loosely. 2 dcfp around beg ch-2 (first 1 dcfp). 2 dcfp around each rem dc. Join with sl st in first 1 dcfp. 14 (16) dcfp. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1 loosely. 2 dcfp around each dcfp around. Join with sl st in first dcfp. 28 (32) dcfp. 
4th rnd: Ch 1 loosely. 1 dcfp around each dcfp around. Join with sl st in first dcfp. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same dcfp as join. 1 dcfp around same 1 dcfp. *1 sc in next dcfp 1 dcfp around same dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 28 (32) sc and 28 (32) dcfp. 
6th to 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as join. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. *1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as join. *1 sc in next dcfp. 1 dcfp around same dcfp. Skip next sc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Skip next sc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 sc in same dcfp.** 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around ending last rep at **. Join with sl st in first sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as join. 1 sc in next sc. *1 sc in next dcfp. 1 dcfp around same dcfp. Hold next 2 dcfp tog (skipping sc between them) and work 1 dcfp around them as if they were one st. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 sc in same dcfp.** 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around ending last rep at **. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 35 (40) sc and 21 (24) dcfp. 
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as join. 1 sc in next 2 sc. *1 sc in next dcfp. Fpdec. 1 sc in same dcfp as last leg of Fpdec.** 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around ending last rep at **. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 49 (56) sc and 7 (8) Fpdec. 
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as join. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *Skip next sc. 1 dcfp around Fpdec. 1 sc in same Fpdec. 1 dcfp around same Fpdec. Skip next sc.** 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around ending last rep at **. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 42 (48) sc and 14 (16) dcfp. 
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as join and in each st around. Join with sl st in first sc. 56 (64) sc. 
17th rnd: Ch 1 loosely. Trfp around first dcfp 2 rnds below. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc.** Trfp2tog over next 2 dcfp 2 rnds below. Rep from * ending last rep at. ** Trfp around last dcfp 2 rnds below. Join with sl st in first trfp (first and last trfp tog count as trfp2tog). 49 (56) sc and 7 (8) trfp2tog. 
18th rnd: As 16th rnd. 
19th rnd: Ch 1 loosely. Hold first and last trfp 2 rnds below tog and work 1 dcfp around them as if they were one st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. FpPuff around next sc 2 rnds below. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *1 dcfp around trfp2tog 2 rnds below. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. FpPuff around next sc 2 rnds below. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first dcfp. 42 (48) sc. 7 (8) dcfp, and 7 (8) FpPuff.
20th rnd: As 16th rnd. 
21st rnd: Ch 1 loosely. 1 dcfp around first dcfp 2 rnds below. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc.** 1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rnds below. Rep from * around ending last rep at **. Join with sl st in first dcfp. 49 (56) sc and 7 (8) dcfp. 
22nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dcfp. 1 dcfp around same dcfp. *Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Skip next sc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp **. 1 sc in same dcfp. 1 dcfp around same dcfp. Rep from * around ending last rep at **. Join with sl st in first sc. 42 (48) sc and 14 (16) dcfp. 
23rd rnd: As 16th rnd. 
24th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as join. 1 dcfp around first dcfp 2 rnds below. *(1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around next sc 2 rnds below) twice. 1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rnds below.** 1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rnds below. Rep from * around ending last rep at **. Join with sl st in first sc. 28 (32) sc and 28 (32) dcfp. 
Ribbing 
25th to 27th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as join. 1 dcfp around first 1 dcfp. *1 sc in next sc. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
Change to smaller hook. 
28th rnd: With smaller hook, as 16th rnd. 56 (64) sc. 
29th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit™: 1 skein 948 Green/Gold
OR 972 Orange/Black.
Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm (US I-9)
Yarn needle.
measurements: Finished Circumference 21”.
gauge: 11 dc = 4”; 7 rows = 4” in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 4, join with slip st to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc throughout), work, 11 dc into ring, slip st to first dc to join – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st, 2 dc in each dc around, slip st to first dc to join – 24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from *, slip st to first dc to join – 36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from *, slip st to first dc to join – 48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 5 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from *, slip st to first dc to join – 56 dc.
Rounds 6-14: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st to first dc to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Dazzle™ (3 oz/85 g; 117 yds/107 m)
Blue Sky Shine (07004) 2 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
2 buttons
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head.
gauge: 10 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Band (worked sideways).
Ch 14. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. (Ch 11. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch) twice. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. (1 sc in each of next 11 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. (Ch 11. Skip next 11 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 22" [56 cm], ending on a 2nd row. Do not fasten off.
Turn work sideways. 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 55 sc evenly across long side of Band. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from bottom of Band measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape top: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Skip next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. 51 sc. 
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Skip next sc) 10 times. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 41 sc. 
5th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Skip next sc) 10 times. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 31 sc. 
7th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Skip next sc) 10 times. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 21 sc. 
9th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Skip next sc) 10 times. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 11 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and pull tightly.
Fasten securely. Sew back seam. Pull seam slightly to gather.
Mock Cables for Band: (RS). Twist 1st horizontal bar at foundation row to form loop. Draw 2nd bar through 1st bar without twisting. Rep, drawing next bar through previous bar without twisting until all bars have been worked. Sew last loop to second last loop to secure. Sew buttons as seen in picture.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 505 Aruba Sea A and 928 Earth & Sky B.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 5mm [US H-8].
Stitch markers
yarn needle
one 1½” diameter button
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 18 (20, 22)”
gauge: 12 hdc = 4”; 10 rows = 4” using smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A and smaller hook, ch 54 (60, 66), slip st in first ch to form ring. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in each ch around, slip st in top of beginning ch to join.
Rounds 2-4: Ch 2, hdc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 5-8: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 9: Ch 2, hdc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 10: Ch 2, hdc in next 4 sts, skip next st, [hdc in next 5 sts, skip next st] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 45 (50, 55) sts.
Rounds 11-13: Ch 3, dc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 14: Ch 2, hdc in next 3 sts, skip next st, [hdc in next 4 sts, skip next st] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 36 (40, 44) sts.
Round 15: Ch 2, hdc in next 2 sts, skip next st, [hdc in next 3 sts, skip next st] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 27 (30, 33) sts.
Round 16: Ch 2, hdc in next st, skip next st, [hdc in next 2 sts, skip next st] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 18 (20, 22) sts.
Round 17: Ch 2, skip next st, [hdc in next hdc, skip next hdc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 9 (10, 11) sts.
Round 18: Sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, [sc in next 2 sts, skip next st] around, sc in next 0 (1, 2) sts, slip st in first st to join – 6 (7, 8) sts.
Round 19: Working in a spiral manner, [sc in next sc, skip next sc] around until no sts remain.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Asymmetric Brim
Row 1: With right side facing and larger hook, count 11 sts to left of first st on Round 1, join B and sc in next 29 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, skip 2 sc, sc in next sc and each sc across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across to last st, skip last st.
Rows 4-17: Repeat Rows 2-3.
Row 18: Repeat Row 2. Do not fasten off.
Hat Edging
With wrong side facing, work sc evenly spaced along edge of Brim, hdc in each st along opposite edge of foundation ch to opposite edge of Brim, sc evenly spaced along opposite edge of Brim, sc in each st across Row 18, ch 10 for buttonhole, slip st in first st to join.
Fasten off.
Fold corner of Brim with buttonhole up and mark placement for button. Sew button where marked. Button up Brim.
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Alpaca Blend™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 155 yds/142 m) Birch (01019) or Slate (01005) 2 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcbp2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 60 loosely. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st here and throughout). 1 dc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first dc. 60 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 3 dc. *Dcbp around each of next 3 dc. Dcfp around each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Dcbp around each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 3 dcfp. *Dcbp around each of next 3 dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 dcbp. 1 dcbp around each of last 3 dcbp. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm].
Beg crown decreases:
1st rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 3 dcfp. *Dcbp2tog over next 2 dcbp. Dcbp around next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 dcbp. Dcbp2tog. 1 dcbp around last dcbp. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 50 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 3 dcfp. *Dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Dcbp around each of last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 3 dcfp. *Dcbp2tog. Dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Dcbp2tog. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 40 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 3 dcfp. *Dcbp around next st. Dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Rep from * to last st. Dcbp around last st. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
5th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. Dcfp2tog. *Dcbp around next dcbp. Dcfp around next dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Rep from * to last dcbp. Dcbp around last dcbp. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 30 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 sts. *Dcbp around next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last dcbp. Dcbp around last dcbp. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
7th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp2tog around each of first 2 dcfp. *Dcbp around next dcbp. Dcfp2tog around next 2 dcfp. Rep from * to last dcbp. Dcbp around last dcbp. Join with sl st to first st. 20 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first st. *Dcbp around next st. Dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. Dcbp around last st. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
9th rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 10 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and pull up tightly. Fasten securely.

materials: 1 skein each 1562 Jadeite A and 1955 Parade B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 19 (21, 23)[48 (53.5, 58.5) cm]
gauge: 16 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BAND
With A, ch 8. 
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each ch across – 7 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, slip st in each sc – 7 slip sts. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each slip st. 
Repeat Rows 2-3 until Band is 17 (19, 21)[43 (48, 53.5) cm] from beginning, end with a Row 3. 
Joining Row: With right sides together, fold piece in half, lining up sts of first and last row, ch 1, working through sts of both layers, slip st in each st across to join. Fasten off. Turn right side out.
CROWN
Round 1 (Right Side): With right side facing, join B in first st with a slip st, ch 1, sc in same st, sc 75 (83, 91) sts evenly spaced along one long edge of Band, slip st in first sc to join – 76 (84, 92) sc. 
Round 2: Hdc in each sc around, slip stitch in first hdc. 
Round 3-6: Dc in each hdc around, slip stitch in first dc. 
Round 7: [Hdc in next 3 sts, skip next st] 19 (21, 23) times – 57 (63, 69) sts. 
Round 8: Dc in each st around. 
Round 9: [Hdc in next 2 sts, skip next st] 19 (21, 23) times – 38 (42, 46) sts. 
Round 10: Hdc in each hdc around, slip st in first hdc. 
Round 11: [Hdc in next st, skip next st] around, slip st in first hdc. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 2 balls 332 Hot Pink
Susan Bates® Steel Crochet Hook: 2.55mm [US 0]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** or as indicated
measurements: Beanie measures 18” (45.5 cm) in circumference
gauge: 30 sts and 10 rows dc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With 2 strands of thread held together as one throughout, ch 7; join with a slip st in first ch.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 20 dc in ring; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—21 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *ch 3, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * 5 times, ch 3, dc in last dc; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—7 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *ch 2, dc in next ch-3 space, ch 2**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, dc in last dc; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—14 ch-2 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *(ch 2, dc) in each of next 2 ch-2 spaces, ch 2**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, dc in last dc; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—21 ch-2 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *(ch 2, dc) in each of next 3 ch-2 spaces, ch 2**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, dc in last dc; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—28 ch-2 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *(ch 2, dc) in each of next 4 ch-2 spaces, ch 2**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, dc in last dc; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—35 ch-2 spaces.
Round 7: Ch 3, *2 dc in next dc, skip next ch-2 space, (ch 2, dc) in each of next 3 ch-2 spaces, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, 2 dc in next dc**, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, dc in first st already holding beginning ch-3; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—35 ch-2 spaces.
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in each of next 2 dc, *skip next ch-2 space, (ch 2, dc) in each of next 2 ch-2 spaces, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 5, skip next ch-2 space**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—21 ch-2 spaces; 7 ch-5 spaces.
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in each of next 2 dc, *ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next ch-2 space,
ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 5**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—14 ch-2 spaces; 14 ch-5 spaces.
Round 10: Ch 3, dc in each of next 2 dc, *ch 4, skip next 2 ch-2 spaces, dc in each of next 3 dc, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces, ch 5**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—7 ch-4 spaces; 21 ch-5 spaces.
Round 11: Ch 3, dc in each of next 2 dc, *ch 2, skip next ch-4 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 3 ch-5 spaces, ch 5**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—7 ch-2 spaces; 28 ch-5 spaces.
Round 12: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *dc2tog over next 2 dc, dc in each of next 2 dc, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 4 ch-5 spaces, ch 5**, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—35 ch-5 spaces.
Round 13: Ch 3, dc4tog over next 3 sts, *(ch 5, sc) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces, ch 5, 3 dc in next ch-5 space, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces**, ch 5, dc5tog over next 5 sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; ch 2, dc in top of beginning ch-3 instead of last ch-5 space—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 14: *(Ch 5, sc) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces, ch 5, 3 dc in next ch-5 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, 3 dc in next ch-5 space**, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 2, dc in top of last dc of last round instead of last ch-5 space—35 ch-5 spaces.
Round 15: *(Ch 5, sc) in each of next 3 ch-5 spaces, ch 5, skip next 3 dc, dc in each of next 3 dc, skip next 3 dc **, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 2, dc in top of last dc of last round instead of last ch-5 space—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 16: (Ch 5, sc) in each ch-5 space around to last ch-5 space, ch 2, dc in top of last dc of last round instead of last ch-5 space—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 17: *Ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 5, 3 dc in next ch-5 space**, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 4 ch-5 spaces; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 3 ch-5 spaces, ch 2, dc in top of last dc of last round instead of last ch-5 space—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 18: *Ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 5, 3 dc in next ch-5 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, 3 dc in next ch-5 space**, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 3 ch-5 spaces; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces, ch 2, dc in top of last dc of last round instead of last ch-5 space—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 19: *(Ch 5, sc) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces, ch 5, skip next 3 dc, dc in each of next 3 dc, skip next 3 dc **, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 3 ch-5 spaces; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 2 ch-5 spaces, ch 2, dc in top of last dc of last round instead of last ch-5 space—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 20: Repeat Round 16.
Round 21: *Ch 5, 3 dc in next ch-5 space**, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 5 ch-5 spaces; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 4 ch-5 spaces, ch 2, dc in top of last dc of last round instead of last ch-5 space—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 22: *Ch 5, 3 dc in next ch-5 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, 3 dc in next ch-5 space**, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 4 ch-5 spaces; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 3 ch-5 spaces, ch 2, dc in top of last dc of last round instead of last ch-5 space—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 23: *Ch 5, sc in next ch-5 spaces, ch 5, skip next 3 dc, dc in each of next 3 dc, skip next 3 dc **, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 4 ch-5 spaces; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 3 ch-5 spaces, ch 2, dc in top of last dc of last round instead of last ch-5 space—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 24: Repeat Round 16.
Round 25: Ch 3, dc over post of dc, *(ch 5, sc) in each of next 5 ch-5 spaces, ch 5**, 3 dc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, dc in last ch-2 space; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 26: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *3 dc in next ch-5 space, (ch 5, sc) in each of next 4 ch-5 spaces, ch 5, 3 dc in next ch-5 space**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, dc in last dc; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—35 ch-5 spaces.
Round 27: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *(ch 5, sc) in each of next 5 ch-5 spaces, ch 5**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, dc in last dc; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 28: Slip st in next dc, slip st to center of next ch-5 space, ch 1, sc in same space, *(ch 5, sc) in each ch-5 space around to last ch-5 space, ch 2, dc in top of first sc instead of last ch-5 space—42 ch-5 spaces.
Round 29: Ch 1, sc in same space, *6 dc in next ch-5 space**, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—21 shells.
Round 30: Ch 3, 2 dc in first sc, *skip next shell, 6 dc in next sc; repeat from * around to last sc, 3 sc in first sc already holding beginning ch-3 and 2 dc—21 shells.
Round 31: Slip st in each of next 2 dc, slip st in space before next dc, ch 3, 5 dc in same space between shells, *6 dc in space between next 2 shells; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—21 shells.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® With LoveTM: 1 skein each 1303 Aran A and 1703 Candy Pink B.
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8].
Tape measure, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures 16” in circumference.
gauge: 15 sts = 4”; 12 rounds = 4” in sc and dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Crown
With A, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring – 6 sts.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] – 18 sts.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] – 24 sts.
Round 5: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] – 30 sts.
Round 6: Sc in each st around.
Round 7: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] – 36 sts.
Round 8: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] – 42 sts.
Round 9: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] – 48 sts.
Round 10: Ch 2, dc in each st around, join with slip st to top of ch 2 – 48 sts.
Round 11: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] – 54 sts.
Round 12: Repeat Round 10.
Round 13-14: Repeat Round 6.
Round 15: Repeat Round 10.
Round 16-17: Repeat Round 6.
Fasten off.
Heart Flap (Make 2)
With B, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), work 12 dc in ring – 13 sts.
Round 2: Sc in each st; turn.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st, 2 dc in next 2 sts, hdc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, hdc in next st, 2 dc in next 3 sts; turn – 21 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, skip first st, 2 sc in next 4 sts, sc in next 5 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next 4 sts, slip st 6 sts across the top of the heart – 36 sts.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
