Ear Flaps: Count in 6 sts from the center back on each side of hat. Pin earflaps 1” up from bottom edge of hat. With B, sew across heart along hat edge. 
Border: With B, join yarn at the center back of hat. Ch1, sc in same st, sc in next 5 sts, slip st in the front loops around the right earflap, sc across the front of the hat, slip st in the front loops around the left earflap, sc in the remaining 6 sts of hat. Fasten off.
Flap Tie (Make 2): With B, join yarn at the bottom of the ear flap, chain st for 8-10” Fasten off.
Babies are so dear — keep them comfy and looking irresistible in cute accessories like this crocheted hat with heart earflaps.

materials: RED HEART® Vivid™: 1 ball each 6804 Electric Blue A, 6002 Black B, 6631 Glowing Green C
16mm [US Q] or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Finished Size: 22½” (57.2 cm) in circumference; 9” (23 cm) tall
gauge: 5 sc = 4½” (11.4 cm); 5 rounds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com

Stripe It Beanie
Super bulky yarn and an easy pattern means 
that you can crochet this hat in a jiff! Cool 
idea for a gift hat!

Notes
Join rounds with slip st in indicated st or 
space unless otherwise stated.

BEANIE
With A, ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to form 
ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, 10 sc in ring, join 
in first sc, fasten off—10 sc.
Round 2: With right side facing, join B with sc 
in any st, sc in same st as join, 2 sc in each st 
around, join in first sc, fasten off—20 sc.
Round 3: With right side facing, join C with sc 
in any st, sc in each st around, join in first sc, 
fasten off.
Round 4: With right side facing, join A with sc 
in any st, sc in same st as join, sc in next 3 sts, 
*2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from *
around, join in first sc, fasten off—25 sc.
Round 5: With B, repeat round 3.
Round 6: Repeat round 3.
Round 7: With A, repeat round 3.
Rounds 8–9: Repeat rounds 5–6.
Round 10: With A, repeat round 3.
Round 11: With B, repeat round 3.

FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart ™ Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m) Sandy Shores (0110) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. 7 Star Clusters and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions: Ribbing: With smaller hook ch 13. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm], when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off. Join last row and first row together with 1 row of sc to form tube. Change to larger hook and begin working in rnds as follows around top edge of tube: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 71 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. 71 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 3. Draw up a loop in each of the following spaces: 2nd and 3rd loops from hook, same sc as last sl st and each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook – begin Star Cluster made. Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of the following spaces: Top of previous Star Cluster, under 2 vertical strands of last st of previous Star Cluster, in same space as last loop drawn up of previous Star Cluster and each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook – Star Cluster made. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch 3. 35 Star Clusters. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in first ch-1 space. 1 sc in top of next Star Cluster. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last ch-1 space. Join with sl st to first sc. 71 sc. Rep last 2 rnds until work from beg (including ribbing) measures approximately 6½" [16.5 cm], ending on a 2nd rnd. Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 61 sts. 2nd and alt rnds: Ch 3. Beg Star Cluster. Ch 1. *Star Cluster. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch-3. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 51 sts. 5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 41 sts. 7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 31 sts. 9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sts. 10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc3tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 7 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through remaining sts and fasten securely. Sew Faux Fur Pompom to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball of 4608 Wine
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
1 yard of ½” (1.25 cm) wide elastic (optional)
sewing needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work instructions in parentheses as indicated
measurements: One size fits most. Finished Size: approximately 21” (53.5 cm) circumference.
gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 3” (7.5 cm) wide. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
A jaunty beret is just the right touch to accent 
your winter wardrobe. For a closer fit, elastic 
can be inserted to provide the perfect finish.
Rounds 7-11: Repeat Round 4.
Round 12: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, skip next 
ch-1 space, *dc in next 3 dc, skip next ch-1 
space; repeat from * around: 90 dc.
Round 13: Ch 1, sc in same space and in 
next 6 dc, work Sc2tog, *sc in next 7 dc, work 
Sc2tog; repeat * around, join with slip st to 
first sc: 80 sts.
Rounds 14-21: Ch 1, sc in each st around, join 
with slip st to first sc, at the end of Round 21, 
fasten off.
OPTIONAL FINISHING
Cut ½” (1.25 cm) elastic to length of Beret 
circumference, allowing a ½” (1.25 cm) for 
sewing. Overlap ends of elastic and sew 
together with sewing needle and matching 
thread. Loop elastic around the wrong side of 
Beret between Round 14 and Round 21. Fold 
up Round 21 to Round 13, so the wrong sides 
are together. Thread yarn needle with a length 
of yarn and sew Round 21 and Round 13 
together, securing the elastic inside.
Special Stitch
Sc2tog: (insert hook in next dc, Yo and pull up 
a loop) twice, Yo and pull through 3 loops on 
hook. (1 stitch decrease).
BERET
Ch 5; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc, 
now and throughout), 2 dc in ring, ch 1, (3 dc 
in ring, ch 1) 4 times, join with slip st to first 
dc: 15 dc and 5 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st in next dc, ch 3, 2 dc in same 
space, ch 1, skip next dc, 3 dc in next ch-1 
space, ch 1, *skip next dc, 3 dc in next dc, ch 
1, skip next dc, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1; 
repeat from * around, join with slip st to first 
dc: 30 dc and 10 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in same space, ch 1, (3 
dc, ch 1) twice in next ch-1 space, *(3 dc, ch 
1) in next ch-1 space, (3 dc, ch 1) twice in next
ch-1 space; repeat from * around, join with slip 
st to first dc: 45 dc and 15 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 3, 2 dc in same space, ch 1, (3 
dc, ch 1) in each ch-1 space around to last 
ch-1 space, skip last ch-1 space, join with slip 
st to first dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, 2 dc in same space, ch 1, *(3 
dc, ch 1) in next ch-1 space, (3 dc, ch 1) twice 
in next ch-1 space, (3 dc, ch 1) in next ch-1 
space; repeat from * around, ending last rep 
at **, skip last ch-1 space, join with slip st to 
first dc: 60 dc and 20 ch-1 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 3, 2 dc in same space, ch 1, (3 
dc, ch 1) twice in next ch-1 space, *(3 dc, ch 
1) in next ch-1 space, (3 dc, ch 1) twice in
next ch-1 space; repeat from * around to last
ch-1 space, skip last ch-1 space, join with slip
st to first dc: 90 dc and 30 ch-1 spaces.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein 310 Monet.
Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat circumference is 19½.”
gauge: 11 sts = 4”; 7 rounds = 4” in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 5; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3, 8 dc in ring; join with a slip st in top of ch-3 – 9 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, 2 dc in each dc around; join in top of ch-3 – 18 sts.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, fpdc in next dc, [2 dc in next dc, fpdc in next dc] 8 times; join – 27 sts.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, dc in next dc, fpdc around fpdc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, fpdc around fpdc] 8 times; join – 36 sts.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, dc in next 2 dc, fpdc around fpdc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc, fpdc around fpdc] 8 times; join – 45 sts.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, dc in next 3 dc, fpdc around fpdc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc, fpdc around fpdc] 8 times; join – 54 sts.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in next dc, fpdc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc, fpdc around fpdc, [dc in next 2 dc, fpdc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc, fpdc around fpdc] 8 times; join – 54 sts.
Rounds 8-15: Ch 3, dc in next dc, fpdc around fpdc, [dc in next 2 dc, fpdc around fpdc] 17 times; join.
brim-Round 16: Turn work so wrong side of hat is facing you; ch 3, dc in each st around; join.
Round 17: Ch 3, fpdc in next dc, [dc in next 2 dc, fpdc in next dc] 17 times, dc in last dc; join.
Rounds 18-20: Ch 3, fpdc around fpdc, [dc in next 2 dc, fpdc around fpdc] 17 times, dc in last dc; join.
Round 21: Ch 1, (slip st, ch 4, slip st) in next st, [slip st in next 2 dc, (slip st, ch 4, slip st) in next st] 17 times, slip st in last st; join in first slip st. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Turn hat right side out. Fold brim up. Optional: Tack lightly at 4 points to secure brim to hat.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®
Hat 1: 1 skein each 520 Minty A, 235 Lemon B, and 312 Black C
Hat 2: 1 skein each 235 Lemon A, 726 Coral B, and 312 Black C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US F-5] and 4.5mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Single crochet 2 together: [Pull up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat circumference measures 16 (18)” [41 (46) cm].
gauge: 13 sts = 4" (10 cm); 10 rounds = 4" (20 cm) in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A and larger hook, form an adjustable loop as follows: Make a loop over your fingers, insert hook into the loop and draw up 1 ch.
Round 1: 10 hdc into loop; join with a slip st in first hdc; pull end to tighten loop – 10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1 (does not count as a st here and throughout), 2 hdc in same st as joining, 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st to first hdc – 20 sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next hdc, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next hdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first hdc – 30 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 2 hdc, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 hdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first hdc – 40 sts.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 3 hdc, *2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 3 hdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first hdc – 50 sts.
Baby Size Only
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in each hdc around; join with slip st to first hdc – 50 sts
Rounds 7-12: Ch 1, hdc in next hdc and in each hdc around; join with slip st to first hdc.
Round 13: Ch 1, sc in each st around.
Fasten off.   
Toddler Size Only
Round 6: Ch 1, 2 hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 4 hdc, *2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 4 hdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first hdc – 60 sts.
Rounds 7-13: Ch 1, hdc in next hdc and in each hdc around; join with slip st to first hdc.
Round 14: Ch 1, sc in each st around.
Fasten off.
Eyes (Make 2)
With C and smaller hook, make an adjustable loop over your fingers, insert hook into the loop and draw up 1 ch.
Round 1: 5 hdc into loop; join with a slip st in first hdc; draw up end to tighten loop. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for attaching to hat later.
Beak
With smaller hook and B, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each of next 2 sc, sc2tog, turn – 4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn – 4 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, turn – 2 sts.
Row 5: Sc2tog.   
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for seaming later.
Top Knot (Make 3 or 4)
With smaller hook and A, ch 7.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for seaming later.
FINISHING
Referring to photo for placement, sew eyes and beak to hat using long tails and yarn needle. Thread yarn needle with long tails from top knot and thread through top of hat. Secure on wrong side. Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Contrast A Soft White (0316) 1 1 1 1 ball
Red Heart® Super Saver Fair Isle™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m) Contrast B Fair Isle Jingle (7279) 1 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Finished Hat circumference: S 18" [45.58 cm], M 20" [51 cm], L 22" [56 cm], XL 24" [61 cm]
gauge: 14 hdc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.
Brim
With A, ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 63 (69-77-83) times more.
Next row: Ch 1. With first and last rows tog, working through both thicknesses, sl st in each st to end of row. Do not turn.
Hat
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as a st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
1st rnd: With B working across long side of Brim, ch 1. Work 64 (70-78-84) sc evenly around.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first hdc. *Skip next hdc. 2 sc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. Skip last hdc. Join. 64 (70-78-84) sc.
Rep last 2 rnds 16 (18-20-22) times.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. *Skip next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. Skip last hdc. Join. 32 (35-39-42) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 1 (2-2-1) sc. Skip last 1 (2-2-1) sc. Join. 16 (17-19-21) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc, *Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 1 (2-2-2) sc. Skip last 1 (2-2-2) sc. Join. 8 (8-9-10) sc.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Weave end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Pompom: Wind A around 4 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hood. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: YARN: SUPER BULKY 6
• Bernat® Softee Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m)
• Contrast A Natural (28008) Small Large 2 balls 152 yds/139 m 2 balls 173 yds/158.5
• Contrast B Brass (28807) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
• Contrast C Hot Pink (28416) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
• Contrast D Faded Denim (28114) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
• Contrast A Faded Denim (28114) Small Large 2 balls 152 yds/139 m 2 balls 173 yds/158.5
• Contrast B Hot Pink (28416) 1 ball or 30 yds/27.5 m
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: To fit Adult head sizes: Small (Large). Finished circumference: 20 (2111⁄22)" [51 (54.5) cm].
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for Small size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written S (L ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.

USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.

Note: Hat is worked side to side.

1. Slip Knot: Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then pull through to make slip knot.

2. Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw up a loop.

3. With A, chain (ch) 29 (31) leaving a 24" [61 cm] long end for seaming later. (See Diagram on page 7).

4. Single Crochet (sc): Insert hook in 2nd chain (ch) from hook. Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw up a loop – 2 loops on hook. Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw through 2 loops on hook – 1 single crochet (sc) made.

5. 1st row: [Right Side (RS)]. 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 28 (30) sc.

6. 2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 single crochet in back loop only (scbl) in each sc to end of row. Turn.

7. Repeat (rep) 2nd row until work from beginning (beg) measures 18 (20)" [45.5 (51) cm] ending on a Wrong Side (WS) row. Fasten off.

8. Finishing: Using end from foundation ch, weave yarn through top of Hat and gather together (tog) securely. Sew center back seam. Turn back cuff as shown in photo.

9. Pompom: Wind B around 4 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat as shown in photo.

OR Holding B, C, and D together, use Extra Large size pompom maker tool.

We love seeing your makes! Share your photos using #YARNSPO and tag us @yarnspirations on Instagram or find us on Facebook.

materials: RED HEART® “Light & Lofty®”: 1 Skein 9617 Pheasant Multi.
Crochet Hook: 9mm [US M-13].
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Ear Warmer circumference: 16”.
gauge: 8 sc = 4”; 6 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
EARWARMER
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 2, beginning in 2nd ch from hook, work 10 fsc.
Row 2 And All Even Number Rows: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, turn – 10 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sts, Bobble in next st, sc to end.
Row 5 and 21: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 3 sts, Bobble in next st, sc to end.
Row 7 and 19: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 4 sts, Bobble in next st, sc to end.
Row 9 and 17: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 5 sts, Bobble in next st, sc to end.
Row 11 and 15: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 6 sts, Bobble in next st, sc to end.
Row 13: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 7 sts, Bobble in next st, sc to end.
Row 23: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sts, Bobble in next st, sc to end.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew short ends together. Weave in ends.
Super bulky yarn and an easy pattern are combined for this quick-to-crochet ear warmer. Depend on them all winter long to keep you comfy.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast A Neon Pink (39775) 1 ball or 30 yds/28 m
Contrast E Iris (39747) 1 ball or 80 yds/70 m
Caron® Simply Soft® Brites™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast B Super Duper Yellow (B9612) 1 ball or 30 yds/28 m
Contrast C Limelight (B9607) 1 ball or 30 yds/28 m
Contrast D Blue Mint (B9608) 1 ball or 30 yds/28 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch markers.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit child to adult.
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc.
MOTIFS
Make 1 each in the following color combinations:
Motif 1: E as Color 1, C as Color 2, A as Color 3.
Motif 2: D as Color 1, E as Color 2, C as Color 3.
Motif 3: A as Color 1, B as Color 2, E as Color 3.
Motif 4: C as Color 1, D as Color 2, A as Color 3.
Motif 5: E as Color 1, C as Color 2, B as Color 3.
Motif 6: B as Color 1, A as Color 2, D as Color 3.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc) 3 times in ring. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. [(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1] 3 times. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
Sew sides of 6 Motifs tog to form Ring in this order: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6.
Hat Crown
Note: Join all rnds with sl st in first sc.
With RS facing, join E with sl st to any ch-2 sp at top edge of Ring of Motifs.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around, working 1 sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Join. 78 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 66 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sc. Fasten off. Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely.
Brim
Note: Join all rnds with sl st in first sc.
With RS facing, join E with sl st to any ch-2 sp at bottom edge of Ring of Motifs.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around, working 1 sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Join. 78 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 84 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 90 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 96 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 102 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 108 sc.
7th to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 254 A pumpkin and 672 Spring Green B.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US-I 9].
Yarn needle, stitch markers.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 15 rounds = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Hat-Stem
With B, ch 2; 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join but work in continuous rounds unless otherwise noted. Place marker for end of round and move up each round.
Rounds 1-5: Sc in each sc around – 4 sc.
Round 6: 2 sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in next st – 8 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, ch 1, [sc in next sc, ch 1] 7 times; join in first sc changing to A – 8 sc, 8 ch-1 spaces.
Pumpkin
Round 8: With A, ch 1, 2 sc in same sc as joining, dc in ch-1 space, [2 sc in next sc, dc in next ch-1 space] 7 times; join to first sc – 24 sts.
Round 9: Ch 1, 2 sc in same sc as joining, 2 sc in next sc, Fphdc around post of next dc, [2 sc in each of next 2 sc, Fphdc around post of next dc] 7 times; join – 40 sts.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining and next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, Fphdc around next Fphdc, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, Fphdc around next Fphdc] 7 times; join – 48 sts.
Round 11: Ch 1, 1 (2, 2, 2) sc in same st as joining, sc in next 3 sc, 1 (2, 2, 2) sc in next sc, Fphdc around next Fphdc, [1 (2, 2, 2) sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 1 (2, 2, 2) sc in next sc, Fphdc around next Fphdc] 7 times; join; TURN – 48 (64, 64, 64) sts.
Round 12 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, *ch 1, skip Fphdc **, sc in next 5 (7, 7, 7) sc; repeat from * to last 4 (6, 6, 6) sc, end at **; sc in last 4 (6, 6, 6) sc; join; TURN.
Round 13 (Right Side): Ch 1, 1 (1, 1, 2) sc in same sc as joining, sc in next 4 (6, 6, 5) sc, [2 sc in next sc] 0 (0, 0, 1) time, Fphdc around next Fphdc 2 rows below, * 1 (1, 1, 2) sc in next sc, sc in next 4 (6, 6, 5) sc, [2 sc in next sc] 0 (0, 0, 1) time, Fphdc around next Fphdc 2 rows below; repeat from * around; join; TURN – 48 (64, 64, 80) sts.
Baby (Child, Adult) Only: Repeat Rounds 12 and 13 until 6 (7, 8,)” from beginning, end Round 13; do NOT turn.
Large Adult Only-Round 14: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, * ch 1, skip Fphdc **, sc in next 9 sc; repeat from * to last 8 sc, end at **; sc in last 8 sc; join; TURN.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, sc in next 8 sc, Fphdc around next Fphdc 2 rows below, [sc in next 9 sc, Fphdc around next Fphdc 2 rows below] 7 times; join; TURN.
Repeat Rounds 14 and 15 until 9” from beginning, end Round 15; do NOT turn.
All Sizes-Edging Round: Ch 1, work Reverse sc in each st around. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Curly Leaves (Make 3)
Ch 17; 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 3 sc in each ch across. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Sew around stem as desired.

materials: Red Heart® Heat Wave Prints™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 164 yds/150 m) Ultra Violet (9540) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: HBdc = Yoh and insert hook in next stitch. Yoh and draw through stitch and first loop on hook. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook – herringbone double crochet made.

HB2dctog = (Yoh and insert hook in next stitch. Yoh and draw through stitch and first loop on hook. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – herringbone double crochet 2 together made.
Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Join all rnds with sl st to first st. Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. With A, ch 68. Join with sl st to first ch making sure not to twist ch.

1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each ch around. Join. 68 sts.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdcfp around next st. 1 hdcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join. Rep 2nd rnd 5 times more.

Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 HBdc in each st around. Join. Turn.

Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 6" [15 cm], ending on a WS rnd.

Shape top: 1st rnd: (RS). Ch 2.
*1 HBdc in each of next 15 sts. HBdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sts. Turn.

2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 HBdc in each of next 14 sts. HBdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sts. Turn.

3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 HBdc in each of next 8 sts. HBdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sts. Turn.

4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 HBdc in each of next 7 sts. HBdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sts. Turn.

5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 HBdc in each of next 6 sts. HBdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sts. Turn.

6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 HBdc in each of next 5 sts. HBdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sts. Turn.

7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 HBdc in each of next 4 sts. HBdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts. Turn.

8th rnd: Ch 2. *1 HBdc in each of next 3 sts. HBdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts. Turn.

9th rnd: Ch 2. *1 HBdc in each of next 2 sts. HBdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts. Turn.

10th rnd: Ch 2. *1 HBdc in next st. HBdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.

Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”: 1 ball each 9925 Really Red A; and 4601 Off White B.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hat Circumference: 18”. Instructions are for size 2 years.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 15 rows = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Round 1: With A, ch 2; 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st to first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [inc] 3 times; join – 6 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, inc] 3 times; join – 9 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, inc] 3 times; join – 12 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, inc] 3 times; join – 15 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, inc] 3 times; join – 18 sc.
Rounds 7-21: Continue in this manner, increasing 3 sc every round and working one more sc between increases until there are 63 sc.
Rounds 22-40: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Change to B in last sc of last round. Cut A.
With B, work 5 rounds even in sc. Fasten off.

Ball Adornment
Round 1: With B, ch 2; 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st to first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [inc] 3 times; join – 6 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [inc] 6 times; join – 12 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Round 5: Ch 1, [dec] 6 times; join – 6 sc. Stuff ball with extra B yarn to make it puffy.
Round 6: Ch 1, [dec] 3 times; join – 3 sc. Fasten off.
Attach Ball Adornment to tip of hat. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Hopscotch™: 1 (1, 1, 2) ball(s) 7950 Scooter
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
Pompom maker or 3" (7.5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard
measurements: Hat measures 18½ (20, 22½, 24)” [47 (51, 57, 61) cm] circumference.
gauge: 14 sts = 4" (10 cm); 10 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 27 (31, 34, 37).
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 4 ch, hdc in next 18 (22, 25, 28) ch, slip st in last 3 ch, turn—26 (30, 33, 36) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, slip st in first 3 sts, hdc in next 18 (22, 25, 28) sts, sc in last 5 sts, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first 5 sts, hdc in next 18 (22, 25, 28) sts, slip st in last 3 sts, turn.
Rows 4–45 (49, 55, 59): Repeat last 2 rows 21 (23, 26, 28) times.
Row 46 (50, 56, 60): Repeat Row 2. 
Joining Row: With right sides of first and last rows held together and working in back loops only of Row 1 and both loops of last row, slip st in each st across.
Turn right side out so Joining Row is on inside of Hat.
Gathering Round: Ch 1, working in ends of rows, skip first 4 rows, slip st in next row, [skip next 4 rows, slip st in next row] 8 (9, 10, 11) times, do not join. 
Fasten off, leaving 12" (30.5 cm) tail.
FINISHING
Weave tail through every other slip st, pull gently to close top of Hat. Draw tail to inside and secure. 
Pompom
Following pompom maker directions, make 3" (7.5 cm) pompom or make pompom as follows: Wrap yarn around 3" (7.5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard (the more wraps, the fuller the pompom). Gently remove wraps from cardboard. Cut a 12" (30.5 cm) length and tie it tightly around center of wraps. Do not cut the ends of this center tie. Cut ends of wraps. Fluff and trim pompom. Thread ends of center tie through top of Hat to attach pompom and secure on wrong side.
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Harvest Red (9729) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: To fit teen head approx 20" [51 cm] around.
gauge: 13 half double crochet (hdc) and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beginning of rounds does not count as half double crochet. At end of each round, join with slip stitch to first half double crochet.
Chain (ch) 4. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch to form a ring. 
1st round: Ch 2. 7 half double crochet (hdc) in ring. Join.
2nd round: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. Repeat (rep) from * around. Join. 14 hdc.
3rd round: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 21 hdc.
4th round: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 28 hdc. 
5th round: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 35 hdc. 
6th round: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 hdc. 
7th round: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 49 hdc.
8th round: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 hdc.
9th round: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 63 hdc.
10th round: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 30 hdc. Rep from * once more. 1 hdc in next hdc. Join. 65 hdc. Place marker at end of last round. 
Next round: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
Rep last round until work from marked round measures 6½" [16.5 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver® Chunky™: 1 Skein each 776 Dark Orchid A and 656 Teal B.
Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10].
Stitch markers, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat circumference at lower edge: 22 (25)”.
gauge: 10 dc = 4”; 7 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: With A, ch 55 (64), slip st in first st to join. Place marker for beginning of round. Round 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in each ch around, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 55 (64) hdc. Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch. Round 3: Ch 3, working in front loops only, dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch. Round 4: Ch 3, working through both loops, dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch. Round 5: Repeat Round 3. Round 6: Ch 3, [dc in next 5 (6) dc, skip next dc] 9 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 46 (55) sts. Round 7: Repeat Round 3. Round 8: Repeat Round 4. Round 9: Ch 3, [dc in next 4 (5) dc, skip next dc] 9 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 37 (46) sts. Round 10: Ch 3, [dc in next 3 (4) dc, skip next dc] 9 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 28 (37) sts. Round 11: Ch 3, [dc in next 2 (3) dc, skip next dc] 9 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 19 (28) sts. For large Size Only Round 12: Ch 3, [dc in next (2) dc, skip next dc] 9 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – (19) sts. For Both Sizes Round 12 (13): Ch 2, [hdc in next 2 dc, skip next dc] 6 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 13 sts. Round 13 (14): Ch 2, [hdc in next dc, skip next dc] 6 times – 7 sts. last Round: [Slip st in next st, skip next st] around until no sts remain. Fasten off. FINISHING Brim Row 1: With wrong side facing, count 20 (25) sts from beginning marker, join A in next st, ch 3, dc in next 21 sts, leave remaining sts unworked – 22 dc. Rows 2-5: Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across. Fasten off. Edging With wrong side facing, join B in first st of foundation ch, ch 1, sc in each st to edge of Brim, sc evenly spaced along side edge of Brim, slip st in each hdc on last row of Brim, sc evenly spaced along side edge of Brim, sc in each st to beginning ch, slip st in first st. Fasten off. Turn right side out. Fold each corner of Brim up and sew to Hat. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby Chunky™ (5 oz/140 g; 155 yds/142 m) Main Color (MC) Teddy Brown (96016) 1 ball
Bernat® Pipsqueak™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 101 yds/92 m) Contrast A Vanilla (59008) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: To fit baby head sizes 6-12 (18-24) months.
gauge: Bernat® Softee® Baby Chunky™: 10 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Bernat® Pipsqueak™: 9 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes. Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around, omitting final dc in last rep. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc. 
Size 6-12 mos only: Next rnd: Ch 3. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around, omitting final dc in last rep. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 45 dc. 
Size 18-24 mos only: Next rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc. 
Both sizes: Next rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 45 (48) dc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 6 (7)" [15 (18) cm]. 
Earflaps 
Right Earflap: 1st row: Sl st in each of next 5 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
**2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Turn. 
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Fasten off.**
Left Earflap 
Skip next 15 (18) sts after Right Earflap. Join MC with sl st to next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Work from ** to ** as given for Right Earflap. 
Earflap Edging: With RS facing, join A with sl st at top corner of Earflap. Ch 1 and work 28 sc evenly around sides and bottom of each Earflap. Fasten off. 
Front Flap 
With RS facing, join A with sl st in first skipped st at center front between Earflaps. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 14 (17) sc. Turn. 
1st to 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
5th row: As 1st row. 
Rep 4th and 5th rows twice more. 9 (12) sc rem. Fasten off. 
Fold Front Flap up and tack to body of Hat as shown in photo. 
Ties (make 2). 
Ch 21. 
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of ch. Fasten off. 
Attach ties to bottom of each Earflap as shown in photo.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m) Lippy (68004) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
Locking stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2togbl = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches in back loops only. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.

CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: INTERMEDIATE


For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section (Contrast A, B, C, D and E). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A, B, C, D and E.
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of rnd and work sts around it.
• Change colors by drawing new color through last 2 loops on hook and proceed with new color, keeping color change to WS of work.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 1 at beg of each rnd. Ch 1 does not count as st and is not shown on Chart.


HAT 
Ribbing: With E, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 19” [48 cm] when unstretched, ending on a WS row.
Do not fasten off.
Join last row and first row tog with 1 row of sl st to form tube. Do not fasten off.


Beg working in rnds: 
Set-up rnd:  (RS). Ch 1. Working across side edge of ribbing, work 52 sc evenly around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd.


Work chart as follows:
1st to 14th rnds:  Ch 1. Working in scbl, work Chart to end of chart, reading rnds from right to left and noting 4-st rep will be worked 13 times. Join.


Shape top: 1st rnd: With A, ch 1. *Sc2togbl. 1 scbl in next st. With C, 1 scbl in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Break C. 39 sts.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. *Sc2togbl. 1 scbl in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 26 sts.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. *1 scbl in each of next 11 sts. Sc2togbl. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
4th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 scbl in each of next 4 sts. Sc2togbl. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 scbl in each of next 3 sts. Sc2togbl. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2togbl. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and secure tightly.

pattern_name: TWIST STITCH MESSY BUN CROCHET HAT
materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Robin’s Egg (39780) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from left to right. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.

Dcfp2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2(3) times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit average Woman’s head.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 72 loosely. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st here and throughout). 1 dc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first dc. 72 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dc. *Dcbp around next dc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last dc. Dcbp around last dc. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. *Dcbp around next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. Rep from * to last dcbp. Dcbp around last dcbp. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
Rep last rnd twice more.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. 2 dcfp around next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. (1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp) twice. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. 2 dcfp around next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in last dcbp. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 78 sts.
Proceed in Cable Twist Pat as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next 3 dcfp. Dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Working behind last 3 dcfp worked, dcfp around each of 3 skipped sts - Cr6F made. (1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp) twice. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Cr6F over next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. (1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp) twice. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. Rep 1st to 5th rnds for Cable Twist Pat until Hat measures approx 6" [15 cm], ending on a 4th rnd of pat.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 72 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 4 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Cr6F over next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Cr6F over next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 66 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first 3 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next 3 dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
5th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp3tog. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp3tog. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 54 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. (Dcfp2tog) twice. Dcfp around next dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. (Dcfp2tog) twice. Dcfp around next dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 42 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 6 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
8th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *Skip next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. Skip last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 24 sts.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® 'Light & Lofty®': 5 1/2 Ounces 9334 Café Au Lait
Crochet Hook: 10mm [US N-15]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: Fpdc (front post double crochet) = yarn over, insert hook from front to back to front around the post of stitch indicated and draw up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops] twice
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 7 sts = 4"; 8 rows = 4" in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 4; join with a sl st to form a ring. 
Rnd 1: Ch 3, 11 (13) dc into ring; join with a sl st in top of ch-3 – 12 (14) sts. 
 
Rnd 2: Ch 3, FPdc around joining st, [dc in next dc, FPdc around same dc] 11 (13) times; join with a sl st in top of ch-3 – 24 (28) sts. 
 
Rnd 3: Ch 3, FPdc around joining st, FPdc around next FPdc, [Fpdc around next 2 sts, dc between next 2 sts] 11 (13) times; join – 36 (40) sts. 
 
Rnd 4: Ch 3, skip joining st, FPdc around each st around; join. 
 
Rnds 5-15: Rep Rnd 4. Fasten off. 
 
Weave in ends. Turn up brim to either side – this hat is reversible.

materials: Bernat® Softee® BabyTM (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m)
White (02000) 1 ball
or Pink (02001), Pale Blue (02002), Lemon (02003), Mint (02004)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit Preemie (6/12 mos-18 mos).
gauge: 18 dc and 10 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ).
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 (3-2) dc. Rep from * to last 11 (3-2) dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of last 10 (2-1) dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 52 (60-64) dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 31/2 ( 41/2-41/2)" [ 9 ( 11. 5-11. 5) cm].
Size 18 mos only: Next rnd: Ch 3. *1 dc in each of next 14 dc. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next dc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – dc2tog made. Rep from * 3 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 dc.
All sizes: Edging: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 5. Miss next 3 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around, omitting sc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to first sc.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1308 Tan A, 1012 Black B, and 1401 Pewter C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22)” [51 (56) cm] at brim.
gauge: 10 sc = 4” (10 cm); Rounds 1–4 = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With larger hook and A, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), 7 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—8 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next st, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 2 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—32 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 3 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—40 hdc.
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 4 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 hdc.
Size Large only:
Round 7: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 5 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—56 hdc.
Both sizes:
Rounds 7–16 (8–17): Ch 1, hdc in same st as join and in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—48 (56) sts. 
Note For a slouchier appearance, repeat last round as many times as desired. 
Fasten off.
Round 17 (18): With right side facing and smaller hook, join B with sc in first st, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 18 (19): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st around; change to C; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 19 (20): Ch 1, sc in first dc, *skip next 2 dc, Fptr around next sc 2 rounds below, ch 1, working in front of Fptr just made, Fptr around sc 2 rounds below first skipped dc, skip next 3 dc from last sc made, sc in next 5 dc; repeat from * around to last 7 dc, skip next 2 dc, Fptr around next sc 2 rounds below, ch 1, working in front of Fptr just made, Fptr around sc 2 rounds below first skipped dc, skip next 3 dc from last sc made, sc in last 4 dc; join with slip st in first sc—30 (35) sc, 12 (14) Fptr, and 6 (7) ch-1 spaces.
Round 20 (21): Ch 3, dc in each st and ch-1 space around; change to B; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 (56) dc.
Round 21 (22): Ch 1, sc in first 5 dc, *skip next 2 dc, Fptr around next sc 2 rounds below, ch 1, working in front of Fptr just made, Fptr around sc 2 rounds below first skipped dc, skip next 3 dc from last sc made, sc in next 5 dc; repeat from * around to last 3 dc, skip next 2 dc, Fptr around next sc 2 rounds below, ch 1, working in front of Fptr just made, Fptr around sc 2 rounds below first skipped dc; join with slip st in first sc—30 (35) sc, 12 (14) Fptr, and 6 (7) ch-1 spaces.
Round 22 (23): Ch 1, sc in each st and ch-1 space around; join with slip st in first sc—48 (56) sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Heads Up™: 1 ball each of 12 Black A and 779 Bright Pink B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8mm [US L-11]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures about 22” (56 cm) circumference
gauge: Rounds 1–5 = 4¼” (11 cm) diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in front loop of first sc—8 sc.
Note: Work first stitch of each round in same stitch as joining slip stitch unless otherwise instructed.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st first sc—24 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—32 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next st, small-shell in next st, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last 3 sts, skip next st, small-shell in next st, skip last st; join with slip st in first sc—10 small-shells and 10 sc.
Round 7: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in same st as joining (first small-shell made), sc in center dc of next small-shell, *small-shell in next sc, sc in center dc of next small-shell; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 8: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in next dc (center dc of first small-shell), large-shell in next sc, *sc in center dc of next small-shell, large-shell in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—10 large-shells and 10 sc.
Fasten off A.
Round 9: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in center dc of first large-shell, ch 1, sc in same dc, large-shell in next sc, *sc in center dc of next large-shell, large-shell in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off B.
Round 10: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in center dc of first large-shell, ch 1, sc in same dc, large-shell in next sc, *sc in center dc of next large-shell, large-shell in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.
Rounds 11 and 12: Repeat Rounds 9 and 10.
Round 13: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in center dc of first large-shell, ch 1, sc in same dc, sc in next dc, *hdc in next dc, dc in next sc, hdc in next dc, sc in next 3 dc; repeat from * around to last 4 sts, hdc in next dc, dc in next sc, hdc in next dc, sc in last dc; join with slip st in first sc—60 sts.
Rounds 14 and 15: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 16: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in same st as joining then skip this st, *ch 3, skip next sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around to last sc, ch 3, skip last sc; join with slip st in same st as joining—30 ch-3 spaces.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m)
Peach Blush Parfait (01011)  2 braids
Faerie Cakes (01023)  2 braids
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Colorwork Pat.
instructions:
Notes:
Before working with Caron® x Pantone™ multi-shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls for each braid.
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone™ color # (see label).
• Designate each different shade of the 5 separate yarn balls as Contrast A, B, C, D and E as noted in Materials section (or as desired).
• Due to finite amount of yarn in each shade, pattern gauge must be matched to ensure successful results
• When working from chart and joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color when not in use loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to avoid stranding.

With E ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 21" [53.5 cm] when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off.
Join last row and first row tog with 1 row of sc to form tube. Break E.
Beg working in rnds:
Foundation rnd: (RS). Join B with sl st at seam. Ch 1. Working along side edge of ribbing, work 64 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd.
1st to 18th rnds: Ch 1. Work Chart to end of chart, noting 4-st rep will be worked 16 times. Join with sl st to first sc at end of each rnd.
When Chart is complete break D and cont with C.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and secure tightly.

materials: Red Heart® Boutique Unforgettable™: 1 ball 3955 Winery.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [J-10 US]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures approximately 18” (45.5 cm) circumference at brim
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; 8 rounds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Starting at the top, this beanie is crocheted in the round using post stitches for a ribbed effect. Choose any shade of this beautiful yarn for a hat you’ll love giving, or wearing yourself!
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, 2 dc in each st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—24 dc.
Round 3 and all odd-numbered rows through Round 31: Ch 3, work BPdc in each st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Round 4: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—36 hdc.
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next 2 st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—48 hdc.
Round 8: Ch 2, hdc in next 2 st, 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next 3 st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—60 hdc.
Round 10: Ch 2, hdc in next 3 st, 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next 4 st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—72 hdc.
Round 12: Ch 2, hdc in next 4 st, 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next 5 st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—84 hdc.
Round 14: Ch 2, hdc in next 5 st, 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next 6 st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—96 hdc.
Round 16: Ch 2, hdc in next 6 st, 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next 7 st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—108 hdc.
Rounds 18, 20, and 22: Ch 2, hdc in each st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2.
Round 24: Ch 2, hdc2tog in next st, *hdc in next st, hdc2tog in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—72 st.
Round 26: Repeat Round 3.
Special Stitches
BPdc (back post double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from back to front and then to back again around post of next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice.
BPhdc (back post half double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from back to front and then to back again around post of next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
BPdc2tog (back post double crochet decrease) = [Yarn over, insert hook from back to front and then to back again around post of next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
hdc2tog (half double crochet decrease) = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
reverse sc (reverse single crochet) = Work single crochet in opposite direction from which you would usually work (left to right if you are right-handed and right to left if you are left-handed). This stitch is also known as crab stitch.
Notes
1. Hat is worked in continuous rounds from top down with right side facing at all times. Do not turn rounds.
2. Repeat Round 3 for all odd-numbered Rounds 5-31; instructions are written for all even-numbered rounds and Round 33.
HAT
Ch 5, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), work 11 dc into ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—12 dc. 
Red Heart® Boutique Unforgettable™, Art. E793 available in 3.5oz (100 g), 280 yd (256 m) balls
Designed by Ann Regis
Round 28: Ch 3, BPdc in next 6 st, BPdc2tog in next st, *BPdc in next 7 st, BPdc2tog in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—63 dc.
Rounds 30 and 32: Repeat Round 3.
Round 33: Ch 2, BPhdc in each st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2.
Round 34: Ch 1, reverse sc in each st; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop of next stitch
measurements: Women 19½"-20½" [49.5-52 cm] circumference; Men 21-22" [51 cm] circumference
gauge: 14 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Rib Pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to both sizes.
Note: Balaclava is worked from side to side. 
Ch 57 (59) loosely. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 56 (58) sc.
**2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (sc and sl st). 
Rep last 2 rows 5 times more, then 2nd row once.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 scbl in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 6 times. Turn. 56 (58) sc.**  
 
Rep from ** to ** once more.
Shape face opening: Upper Section: 1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each of next 26 (28) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
***2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (sc and sl st). 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 4 times more.***
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 scbl in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 3 (4) times. Turn. 27 (29) sc. 
Next row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep from *** to *** once more. 
Fasten off.
Lower Section: With WS facing, working across rem sts of Main Body, join yarn with sl st to back loop of next sc. 
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Working through back loops only, Sc2tog. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last 2 sts. Working through back loops only, Sc2tog.
3rd row: As 1st row. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row 11 (13) times more.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. 2 scbl in last sc. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. 2 scbl in first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Joining row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. 2 scbl in last sc of Lower Section. Working across Upper Section: 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 scbl in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 4 (5) times. Turn. 56 (58) sc.
Rep from ** to ** as given above twice more. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Sew back seam. Weave yarn through last sl st of each row along top edge. Gather tightly and fasten securely.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Stripes™: 1 (1, 1, 2) skein(s) 4145 Candy Stripe
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle, Susan Bates
Easy Wrap Pompom Maker or 3½" (9 cm) piece of heavy cardboard
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 18 (20, 22, 24)" [45.5 (51, 56, 61) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 16 sts = 4½" (11.5 cm); 10 rows = 3½" (9 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Brim:
Ch 6.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Rows 2–64 (70, 78, 84): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 65 (71, 79, 85): With first and last rows held together, ch 1, working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across. Do not turn.
Body:
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing and working in ends of rows, ch 1, 2 sc in first row, *skip next row, 2 sc in next row; repeat from * around to last row, skip last row; join with slip st in first sc—64 (70, 78, 84) sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—64 (70, 78, 84) hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first hdc, *skip next hdc, 2 sc in next hdc; repeat from * around to last hdc, skip last hdc; join with slip st in first sc—64 (70, 78, 84) sc.
Rounds 4-16 (18, 20, 22): Repeat last 2 rounds 16 (18, 20, 22) times.
Round 17 (19, 21, 23): Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last st, skip last st; join with slip st in first sc—32 (35, 39, 42) sc.
Round 18 (20, 22, 24): Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last 1 (2, 2, 1) st(s), skip last 1 (2, 2, 1) st(s); join with slip st in first sc—16 (17, 19, 21) sc.
Round 19 (21, 23, 25): Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last 1 (2, 2, 2) st(s), skip last 1 (2, 2, 2) st(s); join with slip st in first sc—8 (8, 9, 10) sc. Fasten off, leaving a 12" (30.5 cm) tail.
FINISHING:
Weave tail through every other st of last round, working through last st as needed. Pull gently to close and secure tail.
Pompom:
Following pompom maker directions, make 3½" (9 cm) pompom or make pompom as follows: Wrap yarn around 3½" (9 cm) piece of heavy cardboard (the more wraps, the fuller the pompom). Gently remove wraps from cardboard. Cut a 12" (30.5 cm) length of yarn and tie it tightly around center of wraps. Do not cut the ends of this center tie. Cut ends of wraps. Fluff and trim pompom. Use ends of center tie to attach pompom to top of hat.
Weave in ends.

Solid Version (not shown)
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.

5th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 hdc.

Striped Version 1
Stripe Pat 1: With A – 8 rnds. With B – 7 rnds. With C – 7 rnds. Proceed in Stripe Pat I, work as given for Solid Version. 
Striped Version 2
Stripe Pat 2: With A – 3 rnds. With B – 1 rnd. With A – 5 rnds. With C – 1 rnd. With A – 5 rnds. With B – 1 rnd. With A – 5 rnds. With C – 1 rnd.
Proceed in Stripe Pat 2, work as given for Solid Version. 
Striped Version 3
Stripe Pat 3: With A – 1 rnd. With B – 1 rnd. With C – 1 rnd. These 3 rnds form Stripe Pat 3. Proceed in Stripe Pat 3, work as given for Solid Version, working 2 extra rnds to end on 3rd rnd of Stripe Pat 3.
Striped Version 4
Stripe Pat 4: With A – 16 rnds. With B – 2 rnds. With A – 1 rnd. With C – 2 rnds. With A – 1 rnd.

Striped Version 5

instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beginning (beg) of rounds (rnds) do not count as half double crochet (hdc). At end of each round (rnd), join with slip stitch (sl st) to first hdc.
Chain (ch) 4. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 7 half double crochet (hdc) in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. Repeat (rep) from * around. Join. 14 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 21 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 28 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 35 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 49 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 hdc.
9th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 63 hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 30 hdc. Rep from * once more. 1 hdc in next hdc. Join. 65 hdc. Place marker at end of last rnd.

abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Sc2tog = draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head.
gauge: 13 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
HAT
Notes: 
•   To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed with new color.
•   Carry colour when not in use loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to prevent stranding.
Version A
With MC and smaller hook, ch 66. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 66 hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. d cfp around next st. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Rep last rnd twice more. 
Next rnd: Ch 2. *(1 hdc in next hdc. dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in next hdc) 10 times. 2 hdc in next hdc. dcfp around next st. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * once more. Join with sl st to first hdc. 68 sts.
Change to larger hook and proceed in pat as follows:
1st rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: *With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. With a, 1 long sc in next st 1 row below. Miss next sc (behind long sc just worked). 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
3rd rnd: With a, ch 1. 1 sc in in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: *With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. With a, 1 sc in next sc. With MC, 1 long sc in next sc 1 row below. Miss next sc (behind long sc just worked). 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last 4 rnds, substituting B for a. 
Rep last 4 rnds, substituting C for a. 
Rep last 4 rnds, substituting D for a. 
Rep last 4 rnds, substituting C for a. 
Rep last 4 rnds, substituting B for a. 
Rep last 4 rnds. 
**Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. (With B, sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. sc2tog) 4 times. 60 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *With B, ch 1.  sc2tog. (With B, 1 sc in next sc. With MC, 1 long sc in next sc 1 row below. Miss next sc (behind long sc just worked). 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. With B, 1 sc in next sc. With MC, 1 long sc in next sc 1 row below. Miss next sc (behind long sc just worked). 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * 3 times more. 52 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (With MC, sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. sc2tog) 4 times. 44 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *With B, sc2tog. With MC, 1 sc in next sc. With B, 1 long sc 1 row below. Miss next sc (behind long sc just worked). 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With MC, 1 sc in next sc. With B, 1 long sc 1 row below. Miss next sc (behind long sc just worked). 1 sc in next sc. With B, draw up a loop in next sc 1 row below. Miss next sc. Draw up a loop in next sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – st2tog made. Rep from * 3 times more. 36 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (With C, sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. sc2tog) 4 times. 28 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (With C, sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. sc2tog) 4 times. 20 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (With C, sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. sc2tog) 4 times. 12 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. With C, (sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.**
Version B
With B and smaller hook, ch 68. Join with sl st to first chain to form a ring, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 68 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. d cfp around next st. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around.
Change to larger hook and proceed in pat as follows:
1st rnd: With B, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: *With B, 1 sc in first sc. With a, 1 long sc in next st 1 row below. Miss next sc (behind long sc just worked). 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: With a, 1 sc in in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: *With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With a, 1 sc in next sc. With B, 1 long sc in next sc 1 row below. Miss next sc (behind long sc just worked). Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last 4 rnds of pat until work from beg measures approx 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a 4th row of pat.
Shape top: Cont changing colors as before, work from ** to ** as given for Version A.

around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.

to top of ch 3. Break D. 16 groups 
of 3 dc.

between any 2 groups of 3 dc. Ch 3.

6th rnd:  Join C with sl st in sp 
between any 2 groups of 3 dc. Ch 3. 
2 dc in same sp. *3 dc in sp between 
next 2 groups of 3 dc. Rep from * 
around to last group of 3 dc. 3 dc 
in center dc of next 3 dc group. Join 
with sl st to top of ch 3. Break C. 21 
groups of 3 dc.
7th rnd:  Join B with sl st in sp 
between any 2 groups of 3 dc. Ch 3. 
2 dc in same sp. *3 dc in sp between 
next 2 groups of 3 dc. Rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
Break B. 
8th rnd: With A, as 7th rnd.
9th rnd: With E, as 7th rnd.
10th rnd: With D, as 7th rnd.
11th rnd: With A, as 7th rnd.
12th rnd: With C, as 7th rnd.

14th rnd: With A, as 7th rnd.
15th rnd: With E, as 7th rnd.
Brim: Note: Brim rnds alternate RS 
and WS.
1st rnd: (RS). Join D with sl st in any 
dc (center back of Hat). Ch 1. Work 
1 sc in each dc around. 63 sc. Join 
with A with sl st to first sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in 
each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc 
in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 
Rep from * around. Join C with sl st 
to first sc. Turn. 84 sc.
3rd rnd: (RS). With C, ch 1. 1 sc in 
each sc around. Join B with sl st to 
first sc. Turn.
4th rnd: (WS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in 
each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc 
in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 
Rep from * around. Join A with sl st 
to first sc. Turn. 126 sc.
5th rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in 
each sc around. Join with sl st to 
first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic Crochet Thread size 10™: 2 balls of 451 Parakeet
Susan Bates® Steel Crochet Hook: 2.55mm [US 0]
Yarn needle
measurements: Hat Measures 18” (45.5 cm) in circumference
gauge: 23 sts and 10 rows dc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: With 2 strands of thread held together as one throughout, ch 6; join with a slip st in first ch. Round 1: Ch 1, 16 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc—16 sc. Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), skip next sc, *dc in next sc, ch 3, skip next sc; repeat from* around, join with a slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-6—8 ch-3 spaces. Round 3: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, 5 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-3 space around, join with a slip st in first sc—8 shells. Round 4: Ch 1, BPsc in first sc, *ch 8, skip next shell, skip next sc**, BPsc of next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—8 ch-8 spaces. Round 5: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, 6 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-8 space around, join with a slip st in first sc—8 shells. Round 6: Repeat Round 4. Round 7: Slip st in each of next 3 ch, ch 1, (sc, ch 4, sc, ch 4) in each ch-8 loop around; join with a slip st in first sc—16 ch-4 spaces. Round 8: Slip st in next ch-4 space, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 5 dc in same ch-4 space, *ch 2, 2 dc in next ch-4 space, ch 2**, 6 dc in next ch-4 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—16 ch-2 spaces. Round 9: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, dc in each of next 4 dc, *ch 3, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc**, dcd in each of next 5 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—16 ch-3 spaces. Round 10: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, dc in each of next 3 dc, *ch 4, skip next ch-3 space, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, ch 4, skip next dc**, dc in each of next 4 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—16 ch-4 spaces. Round 11: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, dc in each of next 2 dc, *ch 4, skip next ch-4 space, dc in each of next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, ch 4, skip next dc**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—16 ch-4 spaces.
