Round 12: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, dc in next dc, *ch 5, skip next ch-4 space, dc in each of next 5 dc, ch 4, skip next dc**, dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—16 ch-5 spaces. Round 13: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *5 dc in next ch-5 space, dc in each of next 5 dc, 5 dc in next ch-5 space**, dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—136 dc. Rounds 14-30: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Round 31: Ch 3, dc in next dc (counts as dc2tog), *dc in each of next 2 dc, dc2tog over next 2 sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—102 sts. Round 32: Ch 3 (counts as FPdc), dc in each of next 2 dc, *FPdc around the post of next dc2tog, dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Round 33: Ch 3 (counts as FPdc), dc in each of next 2 dc, *FPdc around the post of next FPdc, dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Sizes 3-4 5-6 7-9 10-12 pounds Soft Blue (39712) 1 1 1 1 ball
Note: 1 ball will make approx 15 (10-9-6) Hats.
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker.
measurements: Preemie 3-4 lbs (Preemie 5-6 lbs – Newborn 7-9 lbs -3 months 10-12 lbs). To fit head circumference: 81/2 (11-121/2 -14) [21.5 (28-32-35.5) cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.
Note: Chain (Ch) 2 at beginning (beg) of round (rnd) does not count as stitch (st).
Beginning (Beg) at crown, chain (ch) 3. 
1st round (rnd): 8 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Repeat (Rep) from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
Size 3-4 lbs only: 4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
Sizes 5-6, 7-9 and 10-12 lbs only: 4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
Size 5-6 lbs only: 5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
Sizes 7-9 and 10-12 lbs only: 5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
Size 10-12 lbs only: 6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 (36-40-50) hdc.
Rep last rnd until Hat measures approx 31/2 (4-41/2-5) [9 (10-11.5-12.5) cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) White (0311) 1 ball or 85 yds/78 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Susan Bates® stitch markers
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw a loop through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] circumference x 5½" [14 cm] high.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Ribbing: Ch 8. See diagram on page 2. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 35 times more. 36 rows total. Do not fasten off. Join ribbing: Holding WS tog and working through both thicknesses of foundation ch and last row of ribbing, work 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not fasten off. Turn Ribbing sideways to work along straight top edge of Ribbing. Hat Body See diagram on page 2. 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 36 sc around straight top edge of Ribbing. (1 sc into side of each row of ribbing). Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc. 3rd to 6th rnds: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 1 dc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of beg ch 3. Shape top: 7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. Dc2tog. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 54 sts. 8th rnd: Ch 3. Dc2tog. *1 dc in next dc. Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 sts. 9th rnd: Ch 2. Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice – beg dc2tog made. *Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of first st. 18 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten to secure. Ties: Lay Hat flat with seam of Ribbing at center back and place markers at each side edge of Ribbing. Join yarn with sl st at marker. Ch 25. Fasten off. Rep for second Tie.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Medium: 1 ball each 4012 Ink A, 4001 Frosting B, and 4255 Orangie C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
stitch marker
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat stretches to fit 13-15” (15-17”, 17-19”) [33-38 (38-43, 43-48.5) cm] head circumference.
gauge: 12 hdc = 4” (10 cm); 7 rows = 3” (7.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), 7 hdc in ring—8 hdc. 
Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 hdc in each st around—16 hdc.
Round 3: *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * 7 times—24 hdc. 
Round 4: *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from * 7 times—32 hdc. 
Round 5: *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts; repeat from * 7 times—40 hdc. 
Size Small only:
Round 6: Hdc in each st around.
Size Medium only:
Round 6: *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 19 sts; repeat from * once—42 hdc. 
Size Large only:
Round 6: *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 9 sts; repeat from * 3 times—44 hdc.
All sizes:
Rounds 7–12 (7–13, 7–14): Hdc in each st around—40 (42, 44) hdc.
Round 13 (14, 15): Hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc. 
Fasten off. 
First Earflap
Flatten hat and place marker on 3rd st from either side edge.  
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join A with slip st in marked st, ch 2, hdc in next 7 (7, 8) sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 (8, 9) hdc. 
Row 2: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in each remaining st across, working last st in top of beginning ch, turn—7 (7, 8) hdc.
Row 3–6 (3–6, 3–7): Repeat Row 2—3 hdc. 
Fasten off. 
2nd Earflap
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, skip next 12 (13, 13) unworked sts, join A with slip st in next st, ch 2, hdc in next 7 (7, 8) sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 (8, 9) hdc. 
Rows 2–6 (2–6, 2–7): Repeat Rows 2–6 (2–6, 2–7) of First Earflap. 
Note For size Large only, do not turn at end of Row 7.
Edging Round (right side): Ch 1, sc in each st and row end around, working additional sts as needed in outer corners so piece lays flat; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Face
With B, ch 16.
Row 1 (wrong side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first hdc) and in each ch across—15 hdc. 
Rows 2–7: Ch 2, hdc in each st across. 
Row 8: Skip first 3 sts, 5 tr in next st, slip st in next st, skip next 3 sts, 5 tr in next st, slip st in last st; do not turn—10 tr and 2 slip sts.
Edging Round (right side): Work same as Edging Round of Earflaps. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Eye (make 2)
With A, ch 2, 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
FINISHING
Sew eyes to face.
With C and straight stitches, embroider triangular beak between eyes. 
Sew face to hat.
Weave in ends.

materials: 1 skein each 311 White A, 387 Soft Navy B and 319 Cherry Red C
1 skein each 311 White A, 312 Black B and 321 Gold C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
Susan Bates® Easy Wrap Pom-Pom Maker or piece of heavy cardboard
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22)" [51 (56) cm] circumference.
gauge: 12 sts and 12 rows ribbing = 4" (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Notes
1. Ribbing is worked first. Hat is worked in turned rows then back seam is sewn.
2. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Carry old color loosely up side of piece until next needed.

Special Stitches
dc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc2tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

Directions are for size to fit Teens. Changes for size to fit Adult are in parentheses.

CROCHET HAT
Ribbing
With A, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across – 5 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in back loops of each st across.
Rows 3-59 (65): Repeat Row 2.
Do not fasten off.

Body
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, rotate to work into row ends, work 60 (66) sc evenly along row ends of ribbing – 60 (66) sts. 
Row 2: Sc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, changing to B in last st.
Row 4-9: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), turn, skip first st, dc in each remaining st across.
Row 10: Ch 3, turn, skip first st, dc in each remaining st across, changing to C in last st.
Rows 11-12: Ch 3, turn, skip first st, dc in each remaining st across.
Row 13: Ch 3, turn, skip first st, dc in next 3 sts, dc2tog, [dc in next 4 dc, dc2tog] 9 (10) times – 50 (55) sts.
Row 14: Ch 3, turn, skip first st, dc in next 2 dc, dc2tog, [dc in next 3 dc, dc2tog] 9 (10) times – 40 (44) sts.
Row 15: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 10 (11) times – 30 (33) sts.
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] 10 (11) times – 20 (22) sts.
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] 10 (11) times – 10 (11) sts.
Row 18: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] 5 times, (sc in last st) – 5 (6) sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

FINISHING
Weave yarn tail through sts of Row 18 and pull to close tightly. Fasten securely. With Right Sides facing, align row ends and sew back seam. Weave in ends. With A, B, and C held together, follow our tutorial on using the Susan Bates Easy Wrap Pom-Pom Maker or follow these directions: Wrap yarn around 3½” [9 cm] piece of heavy cardboard (the more wraps, the fuller the pompom). Gently remove wraps from cardboard. Cut a 12” (30.5 cm) length of yarn and tie it tightly around center of wraps. Do not cut the ends of this center tie. Cut ends of wraps. Fluff and trim pompom to even strands. Use ends of center tie to attach pompom to top of hat.

materials: RED HEART® Heads Up™: 1 ball each of 100 Ivory A and 275 Bright Coral B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10½]
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures about 22” (56 cm) circumference
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = 4” (10 cm) diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Notes: Work first stitch of each round in same stitch as joining slip stitch unless otherwise instructed.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st first sc—24 sc. Fasten off A.
Round 4: With right side facing, join B with beg-dc in 13th sc of previous round, dc in same st, dc in next 2 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in beg-dc—32 dc. Fasten off B.
Round 5: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in 17th dc of previous round, ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc. Fasten off A.
Round 6: With right side facing, join B with beg-dc in 21st sc of previous round, dc in same st, dc in next 4 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 4 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in beg-dc—48 dc. Fasten off B.
Round 7: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in 25th dc of previous round, ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc. Fasten off A.
Round 8: With right side facing, join B with beg-dc in 29th sc of previous round, dc in each st around; join with slip st in beg-dc. Fasten off B.
Round 9: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in 29th dc of previous round, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.
Rounds 10 and 11: Repeat Rounds 8 and 9.
Round 12: Repeat Round 8.
Round 13: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A with beg-dc in same st as joining, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last st, ch 1, skip next st; join with slip st in first sc—28 ch-1 spaces and 28 sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, skipping the sc sts, work 2 sc in each ch-1 space around; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc. Fasten off A.

Special Stitch
beg-dc (beginning double crochet) = Beginning with empty hook and leaving a long beginning tail to weave in later, [yarn over] twice, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Note: If preferred, a traditional beginning double crochet can be worked as follows: Join yarn with slip st in indicated stitch, ch 3.

Notes
1. To make a smaller hat, use a hook one size smaller. To make a larger hat, use a hook one size larger.
2. Hat is worked in joined rounds, beginning at top of hat. Join but do not turn rounds.
3. Hat stripes are worked in the following color sequence: 3 rounds with A, 1 round with B, [1 round with A, 1 round with B] 4 times, 3 rounds with A.
4. To change color, fasten off old color and join new color in indicated stitch as instructed. The new color is joined in different stitches to help hide the joins.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Soft®: 1 ball each of 9925 Really Red A and 9440 Light Grey Heather B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.0 mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 18” (12.7 cm) in circumference.
gauge: Rounds 1-4 = 3.25” (8.3 cm) across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 4, join to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 8 scs in ring; join, ch 1 – 8 sc.
Round 2: Sc v-st in each sc around; join, slip st in next sc v-st, ch 1 – 8 sc v-sts.
Round 3: Sc v-st in same sc v-st, ch 1, *sc v-st in next sc v-st, ch 1; repeat from * around; join, slip st in next sc v-st, ch 1 – 8 sc v-sts.
Round 4: Sc v-st in same sc v-st, ch 3, * sc v-st in next sc v-st, ch 3; repeat from * around; join, slip st in next sc v-st, ch 1 – 8 sc v-sts.
Round 5: Sc v-st in same sc v-st, ch 1, sc v-st in next ch-3 space, ch 1, *sc v-st in next sc v-st, ch 1, sc v-st in next ch-3 space, ch 1; repeat from * around; join, slip st in next sc v-st, ch 1 – 16 sc v-sts.
Round 6: Repeat Round 3 – 16 sc v-st.
Round 7: Sc v-st in same sc v-st, ch 2, *sc v-st in next sc v-st, ch 2; repeat from * around; join, slip st in next sc v-st, ch 1 – 16 sc v-sts.
Rounds 8-15: Repeat Round 4 – 16 sc v-sts.
Rounds 16-24: Repeat Round 7 – 16 sc v-sts.
Fasten off. Weave in all ends on inside of piece.
With B, repeat instructions for Beanie through Round 23. Weave in beginning yarn end; complete Round 24 to join to first Beanie as follows:
Joining Round 24: With Right Sides facing, (sc, ch 1, drop loop, draw loop under to over through opposite sc v-st – join made, ch 1, sc) in same sc v-st, ch 2, *(sc, join to opposite sc v-st, sc) in next sc v-st, ch 2; repeat from * around; join – 16 joins.
Fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in final yarn end. Turn one side into the other, turning up edge to form a cuff.
NOTE: Make 2 beanies, one in each of the two colors. Beanies are joined together on Round 24 of second beanie. Stitches are worked into the ch-2 space of the sc v-stitch where indicated. Always join last stitch of round to first with a slip stitch.
SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS:
Single crochet v-stitch (sc v-st): (sc, ch 2, sc) in indicated stitch.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Unforgettable®: 1 ball 9942 Cappuccino
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [I-9 US]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures approximately 20 (22)” [51 (56) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 16 sc = 4” (10cm); 24 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Leaving long beginning tail, ch 41.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 34 ch; leave last 5 ch unworked, turn—35 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first 30 sts, working in both loops, sc in last 5 sts, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, FPdc around next 3 sts 2 rows below, sc in next st, working in back loops only, sc in next 30 sc, working in remaining ch from Row 1, sc in next 5 ch, turn—40 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first 35 sts, working in both loops, sc in last 5 sts, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in next st, skip next st, FPdc around next 2 FPdc 2 rows below; working in front of 2 FPdc just made, FPdc around skipped st 2 rows below, sc in next st, working in back loops only, sc in next 30 sts; leave last 5 sts unworked, turn—35 sts.
Row 6: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first 30 sts, working in both loops, sc in last 5 sts, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first st, FPdc around next 3 FPdc 2 rows below, sc in next st, working in back loops only, sc in next 30 sts, working in back loops only, sc in last 5 sts 2 rows below, turn—40 sts.
Row 8: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first 35 sts, working in both loops, sc in last 5 sts, turn.
Rows 9–88 (100): Repeat Rows 5–8 twenty (twenty-three) times.
Row 89 (101) (right side - joining row): Ch 1, holding Rows 1 and 88 (100) with wrong sides together and working through both thicknesses and in opposite side of foundation ch, slip st through first st of last row and first ch; drop loop from hook, insert hook behind post of first FPdc of Row 87 (99), place dropped loop on hook and pull loop behind st, skip first FPdc of Row 1, FPdc around second FPdc of Row 1, drop loop from hook, insert hook behind post of next FPdc of Row 87 (99), place dropped loop on hook and pull loop behind st, FPdc around next FPdc on Row 1, drop loop from hook, insert hook behind post of next FPdc of Row 87 (99), place dropped loop on hook and pull loop behind st, FPdc around skipped FPdc of Row 1; working through both thicknesses and in opposite side of foundation ch, *slip st through next st of last row and next ch; repeat from * across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave beginning tail through ends of rows, pull tightly and secure end. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Swirl Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 252 yds/230 m) Toasted Almond (22013) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) and U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdchl = *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below stitch in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram).
Popcorn = Work 3 dc in next stitch. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back in first dc. Pull loop through. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
measurements: One size to fit Adult
gauge: 9 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Ribbing: With smaller hook, ch 9.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing, when slightly stretched, measures 22" [56 cm]. Do not fasten off.
Ch 1. Join last row and 1st row tog, working 1 row of sc through both thicknesses. Do not fasten off.
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. 
Change to larger hook and proceed as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 2. Work 55 hdc evenly along side edge of ribbing. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdchl in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Popcorn in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
5th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *Popcorn. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
7th rnd: As 4th rnd.
Rep 2nd to 7th rnds for pat until work from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a 3rd or 6th rnd.
Beg crown decs: 1st rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 44 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdchl in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in first st. Popcorn in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 33 sts.
5th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Popcorn in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 22 sts.
8th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts, draw up tightly. Fasten securely.

materials: 2 balls 4001 Frosting A
1 ball 4724 Pinkie B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8] and 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
2 (3, 3, 4) ¾-inch buttons
Sewing needle and thread to match buttons
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Onesie measures 16 (18, 20, 22)" [40.5 (45.5, 51, 56) cm] chest. Hat measures 14 (16)" [35.5 (40.5) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 7 V-sts = 4" (10 cm); 14 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: With larger hook and A, ch 10 (14, 14, 18). Row 1 (right side): V-st in 2nd ch from hook, *skip next ch, V-st in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—5 (7, 7, 9) V-sts. Row 2 (buttonhole row): Ch 1, V-st in first V-st, *ch 1, skip next V-st, V-st in next V-st; repeat from * to end, turn—3 (4, 4, 5) V-sts and 2 (3, 3, 4) ch-1 buttonholes. Row 3: Ch 1, (sc, V-st) in first V-st, V-st in each V-st and ch-1 buttonhole across to last V-st, (V-st, sc) in last V-st, turn—5 (7, 7, 9) V-sts and 2 sc. Row 4: Ch 1, V-st in first sc, V-st in each V-st across, V-st in last sc, turn—7 (9, 9, 11) V-sts. Row 5: Ch 1, V-st in each V-st across, turn. Row 6: Repeat Row 5. Rows 7–14: Repeat Rows 3–6 twice—11 (13, 13, 15) V-sts. Rows 15 and 16: Repeat Rows 5 and 6. Rows 17 and 18: Repeat Rows 3 and 4—13 (15, 15, 17) V-sts. Sizes 18 months and 24 months only: Rows 19 and 20: Repeat Rows 3 and 4—17 (19) V-sts. Row 21: Repeat Row 5. All sizes: Body Repeat Row 5 of Leg Openings 17 (19, 21, 23) times. Armholes Row 1: Slip st in first V-st, ch 1, V-st in each V-st across to last V-st; leave last V-st unworked, turn—11 (13, 15, 17) V-sts. Row 2: Repeat Row 5 of leg openings. Row 3: Ch 1, beg V-st2tog in first 2 V-sts, V-st in each V-st across to last 2 V-sts, end V-st2tog, turn—9 (11, 13, 15) V-sts. Rows 4–9 (11, 13, 15): Repeat Row 5 of leg openings. First Shoulder and Neck Row 1: Ch 1, V-st in first 3 V-sts, slip st in next V-st; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—3 V-sts. Row 2: Ch 1, beg V-st2tog, V-st in last V-st, turn—2 V-sts. Row 3: Repeat Row 5 of leg openings. Row 4: Ch 1, beg V-st2tog, turn—1 V-st. Row 5: Ch 1, working in each sc of V-st, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off. 2nd Shoulder and Neck Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side of back facing, join A with sc in first V-st of Row 1 of armhole, ch 1, sc in same st (first V-st made), V-st in next 2 V-sts, slip st in next V-st; leave remaining st unworked, turn—3 V-sts. Rows 2–5: Repeat Rows 2–5 of first shoulder and neck; change to B at end of row 5. Do not fasten off. Contrast Band Row 1: Ch 1, working in ends of rows, sc evenly spaced across neck edge. Fasten off. FRONT Leg Openings With A, ch 6 (10, 10, 14). Row 1 (right side): Repeat Row 1 of back leg openings—3 (5, 5, 7) V-sts. Row 2: Repeat Row 5 of back leg openings. Rows 3–5: Repeat Rows 3–5 of back leg openings—5 (7, 7, 9) V-sts. Rows 6–11: Repeat Rows 3 and 4 of back leg openings 3 times—11 (13, 13, 15) V-sts. Row 12: Repeat Row 5 of back leg openings. Rows 13 and 14: Repeat Rows 3 and 4 of back leg openings—13 (15, 15, 17) V-sts. Sizes 18 months and 24 months only: Rows 15–17: Repeat Rows 3–5 of back leg openings—17 (19) V-sts. All sizes: Body Work same as back body. Armholes Rows 1–3: Repeat Rows 1–3 of back armholes. Rows 4–6 (8, 10, 12): Repeat Row 5 of leg openings. First Shoulder and Neck Row 1: Ch 1, V-st in first 3 V-sts, slip st in next V-st; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—3 V-sts. Row 2: Ch 1, slip st in first V-st, V-st in each V-st across—2 V-sts. Fasten off. 2nd Shoulder and Neck Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side of front facing, join A with sc in first V-st of Row 1 of armhole, ch 1, sc in same st (first V-st made), V-st in next 2 V-sts, slip st in next V-st; leave remaining st unworked, turn—3 V-sts. Row 2: Repeat Row 2 of first shoulder and neck; change to B. Do not fasten off. Contrast Band Work same as contrast band of back. ASSEMBLY Sew side seams from last row of leg opening to armhole. With right side facing, overlap Row 5 of back shoulder to Row 1 of front shoulder and sew in place. First Sleeve Round 1 (right side): With front facing, join A with sc in first V-st of Row 1 of left armhole, ch 1, sc in same st (first V-st made); working in ends of rows, work 7 (9, 11, 13) V-sts evenly around armhole; join with slip st in first sc, turn—8 (10, 12, 14) V-sts. Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 1, V-st in each V-st around; join with slip st in first sc, turn. Round 4: Ch 1, *beg V-st2tog, V-st in next 1 (2, 3, 4) V-st(s); repeat from * once, end V-st2tog, turn—5 (7, 9, 11) V-sts. Round 5: Ch 1, V-st in each V-st around; join with slip st in first sc, turn. Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first V-st, hdc in next 1 (1, 2, 2) V-st(s), dc in next 1 (3, 3, 5) V-st(s), hdc in next 1 (1, 2, 2) V-st(s), sc in last V-st; join with slip st in first sc; change to B, turn—5 (7, 9, 11) sts. Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—5 (7, 9, 11) sc. Fasten off. 2nd Sleeve Round 1 (right side): With back facing, join A with sc in first V-st of Row 1 of right armhole, ch 1, sc in same st (first V-st made); working in ends of rows, work 7 (9, 11, 13) V-sts evenly around armhole; join with slip st in first sc, turn—8 (10, 12, 14) V-sts. Rounds 2–7: Repeat Rounds 2–7 of first sleeve. Flower (make 4) With A and smaller hook, ch 2. Round 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st to first sc. Round 2: *Ch 3, sm petal in each sc around; change to A, do not join—5 small petals. Round 3: Ch 3 (does not count as a st or ch-3 space), (sc, ch 3) in first ch-3 space of each small petal; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—5 ch-3 spaces. Round 4: Slip st in next sc, lg petal in each ch-3 space around, do not join—5 large petals. Round 5: Holding ch-3 to wrong side, (slip st, ch 3) in first slip st of each large petal around, do not join—5 ch-3 spaces. Round 6: (Slip st, ch 5) in each ch-3 space around, do not join—5 ch-5 spaces. Round 7: (Slip st, ch 3, petal cl, ch 3, slip st) in each ch-5 space; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. FINISHING ONESIE Edging Round 1: With right side of front facing and working in opposite side of foundation ch, join B with sc in first ch, sc in same ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 2 sc in last ch; working in ends of rows, sc evenly spaced across front and back of left leg openings; working on opposite side of foundation ch of back, 2 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 2 sc in last ch; working in ends of rows, sc evenly spaced across front and back of right leg openings; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Referring to photograph as a guide, sew 3 flowers to lower back above leg openings. Weave in ends. HAT With larger hook and A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Work 4 V-sts in ring, do not join—4 V-sts. Place marker. Round 2: Work 2 V-sts in each V-st—8 V-sts. Round 3: *Cl in next V-st, 2 V-sts in next V-st; repeat from * around—12 V-sts. Round 4: *Cl in next 2 V-sts, 2 V-st in next V-st; repeat from * around—16 V-sts. Round 5: *Cl in next 3 V-sts, 2 V-st in next V-st; repeat from * around—20 V-sts. Round 6: *Cl in next 4 V-sts, 2 V-st in next V-st; repeat from * around—24 V-sts. Size 18-24 months only: Round 7: *V-st in next 5 V-sts, 2 V-st in next V-st; repeat from * around—28 V-sts. Both sizes: Rounds 7–14 (8–15): V-st in each V-st around; change to B at end of last round. Rounds 15 and 16 (16 and 17): Sc in each sc and ch-1 space around; change to A, turn—72 (84) sc. Round 17 (18): Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. FINISHING HAT Sew 1 flower to hat. Weave in ends.

materials: 1 skein each 0400 Grey Heather A
387 Soft Navy B
3945 Blue Suede C
381 Light Blue D
311 White E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch marker
pompom maker
yarn needle
abbreviations: dc2tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all loops on hook
dc3tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 3 times, yarn over, draw through all loops on hook

Fpdc: (front post double crochet) Yarn over, insert hook from front to back then to front, going around post of indicated st, draw up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Skip st behind the Fpdc.
Shell: Work 5 dc in same stitch or space.
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 20 (22)" [51 cm (56) cm]
gauge: 11 dc = 4" [10 cm]; 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 54 (60), taking care not to twist sts, slip st in first ch to form a ring. Place marker for beginning of round. Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each chain around, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 to join – 54 (60) dc. 
Rounds 2-4: Ch 3, Fpdc in next st, *dc in next st, Fpdc; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Do not cut A. There was a typo here of an extra dc after the Fpdc.
Round 5: Change to B, ch 1, sc in same st, *skip 2 sts, Shell in next st, skip 2 sts, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last 5 sts, skip 2 sts, Shell in next st, skip 2 sts, slip st in first sc – 9 (10) Shells with a sc in between each Shell. Cut B.
Round 6: Change to A, ch 3, dc in st below first sc on Round 4, *ch 2, sc in 3rd dc of Shell, ch 2, 2 dc in st on Round 4 below next sc; repeat from * around to last Shell, ch 2, sc in 3rd dc of Shell, ch 2, slip st in top of beginning ch-3. 2 dc will be worked in st in row below sc between Shells to cover sc completely. This allows the contrasting colored Shell to "pop" out of main color.
Round 7: Ch 2, dc in next st (counts as dc2tog), *dc in each of next 2 ch, dc in next sc, dc in each of next 2 ch, dc2tog; repeat from * to last 5 sts, dc in each of next 2 ch, dc in next sc, dc in each of next 2 ch, slip st in first dc – 54 (60) dc. You will be working dc2tog over the 2 dc of previous row. This will return your st count to 54 (60 sts).
Round 8: Change to C and repeat Round 5. Cut C.
Round 9: Change to A, ch 3, dc in corresponding st in round below first sc, *ch 2, sc in 3rd dc of Shell, ch 2, 2 dc in corresponding st in round below next sc; repeat from * around to last Shell, ch 2, sc in 3rd dc of Shell, ch 2, slip st in top of beginning ch-3. This is the same as Round 6, working the 2 dc in the st in the row below previous row to cover the sc of the previous row.
Round 10: Repeat Round 7.
Round 11: Change to D and repeat Round 5. Cut D.
Rounds 12-13: Change to A and repeat Rounds 9-10.
Round 14: Change to E and repeat Round 5. Cut E.
Round 15-16: Change to A and repeat Rounds 9-10.
Round 17: Ch 2, dc2tog over next 2 sts (counts as first dc3tog here and throughout), dc in next 3 sts, *dc3tog over next 3 sts, dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * 7 (8) more times, slip st in first dc2tog – 36 (40) sts.
Round 18: Ch 2, dc2tog over next 2 sts, *dc in next st, dc3tog over next 3 sts; repeat from * to last st, dc in last st, slip st in first dc2tog – 18 (20) sts.
Round 19: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), (dc3tog) 6 times, dc in each st to end of round if necessary, slip st in first dc3tog.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Using long tail, weave end through top of last row and pull to close. Secure end. Weave in ends. 
With White, make a 4" [10 cm] diameter pompom. Sew pompom on top of Hat.
ABBREVIATIONS
A, B, C = Color A, B, C; ch = chain; cm = centimeters; dc = double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); tog = together; * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.

materials: Patons® Canadiana™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 205 yds/187 m)
Main Color (MC) Med Grey Mix (10044) 1 ball
Contrast A Tangy (10628) 1 ball
Contrast B Black (10040) 1 ball
Contrast C Fool’s Gold (10610) 1 ball
Contrast D Lime Juice (10712) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 stitch markers.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 4 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through 8 loops on hook. Yoh with MC and draw through rem 2 loops on hook. Push bobble to RS of work.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: To fit child 18 mos/2 yrs (4 yrs).
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Beg at top of crown, with MC, ch 4. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 hdc in each of next 3 (2) hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 (2) hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 (2) hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 (64) hdc.
Note: When working bobbles, cut 24" [61 cm] lengths of contrast color for each bobble, leaving approx 3" [7.5 cm] ends at beg and end of each bobble which will be secured to WS of work during finishing. To change color before bobble, work to last loops on hook of previous hdc, draw color of bobble through last loops and proceed.
Size 18 mos/2 yrs only: 7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in next hdc. *With B, bobble in next hdc. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With D, bobble in next hdc.** With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With A, bobble in next hdc. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With C, bobble in next hdc. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last 10 hdc, then rep from * to **. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
8th and 9th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *With A, bobble in next hdc. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With C, bobble in next hdc.** With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With D, bobble in next hdc. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last 7 hdc, then rep from * to **. Join MC with sl st to first hdc.
11th and 12th rnds: As 8th and 9th rnds.
Rep 7th to 11th rnds once more. Fasten off.
Size 4 yrs only: 7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in next hdc. *With B, bobble in next hdc. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. With D, bobble in next hdc. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. With A, bobble in next hdc. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. With C, bobble in next hdc.** With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to last 30 hdc, then rep from * to **. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
8th and 9th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *With A, bobble in next hdc. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. With C, bobble in next hdc.** With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. With D, bobble in next hdc. With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. With B, bobble in next hdc.** With MC, 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to last 26 hdc, then rep from * to **. With MC, 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
11th and 12th rnds: As 8th and 9th rnds.
Rep 7th to 12th rnds once more, then rep 7th and 8th rnds once. Fasten off.
Both sizes: Earflaps: Place markers on 7th hdc on each side of center back (joining hdc), leaving 12 hdc unworked at center back.
First Earflap: 1st row: (RS). Join MC with sl st in marked hdc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 14 (15) sts. Turn. 15 (16) sc.
2nd to 8th rows: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 13 (14) sts.
10th and 11th rows: As 2nd row.
12th to 14th rows: As 9th row. 7 (8) sts at end of 14th row. Fasten off.
Second Earflap: 1st row: (RS). Miss next 18 (20) hdc of Hat. Join MC with sl st in next hdc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 14 (15) sts to marker. Turn. 15 (16) sc.
2nd to 14th rows: Work as for First Earflap.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m)
Main Color (MC) Coconut Cream (01001)  1 braid
Contrast A Spicy Blooms (01014)  1 braid
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Beg TrCl = (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of first dcfp at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of next dcfp at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.

TrCl = (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of last dcfp worked at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of next dcfp at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: One size to fit average Woman.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes: 
• Before working with Caron x Pantone multi-shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls.
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone color # (see label)
• Designate each different shade of the 5 separate yarn balls as Contrast A, B, C, D and E as noted in Materials section (or as desired).
• Due to finite amount of yarn in each shade, pattern gauge must be matched to ensure successful results
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as dc.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed in new color. 
Stripe Pat: Work 2 rnds of dc with A, B, C, D, E.
These 10 rnds form Stripe Pat.
Work Dcfp and TrCl with MC.
Beg at crown, with MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
See diagram on page 3. 
1st rnd: Ch 3. Work 7 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 8 dc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dcfp around each dc around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 16 sts. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *With MC, 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. With A, 1 dc in sp between last dcfp and next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 24 sts. 
4th rnd: Ch 2. *With MC, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With A, 1 dc in sp between last dcfp and next st. With MC, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With A, 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 32 sts. Join B. Break A.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *With MC, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With B, 1 dc in next dc. With MC, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With B, 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 40 sts. 
6th rnd: Ch 2. *With MC, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With B, 2 dc in next dc. With MC, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With B, 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 48 sts. Join C. Break B. 
7th rnd: Ch 2. *With MC, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. With C, 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 64 sts. 
8th rnd: With C, ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join D with sl st to top of ch 3. Place marker at end of rnd. 
9th rnd: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. With MC, Beg TrCl. *Skip next dc. With D, 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. With MC, TrCl. Rep from * around, ending with: Skip next dc. With D, 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. With MC, TrCl over last dcfp and first dcfp. Skip next dc. With D, 1 sc in last dc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
10th rnd: With D, ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join E with sl st to top of ch 3. Break D. 
11th rnd: Ch 1. With MC, TrCl over last TrCl and next TrCl. Skip first dc. With E, 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. *With MC, TrCl over last trfp cluster worked and next TrCl. Skip next dc. With E, 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 
9 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete. 
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 8th to 11th rnds until work from marked rnd measures approx 4" [10 cm], ending on 9th rnd. 
Next rnd: Ch 2. With MC, dcfp around first sc. *With corresponding color, dcbp around next sc. With MC, dcfp around next trfp cluster. With corresponding color, dcbp around next sc. With MC, dcfp around next sc. Rep from * around, ending with corresponding color, dcbp around last sc. Join with sl st to first st. 
Next rnd: Ch 2. With MC, dcfp around first dcfp. *With corresponding color, dcbp around next dcbp. With MC, dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around, ending with corresponding color, dcbp around last dcbp. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Black (7120) 1 O’Go
Contrast C Cherry (7190) 1 O’Go
Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast B Burgundy (0376) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = (Draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit adult head circumference 22" [56 cm].
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of rnd and work sts around it.
• Change colors by drawing new color through last 2 loops on hook and proceed with new color, keeping color change to WS of work.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Ribbing: With B and smaller hook, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 22" [56 cm], when slightly stretched.
Do not fasten off. Join last row of sc with rem loop of foundation ch with 1 row of sl st.  Do not fasten off.
Change to larger hook and proceed as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working along side edge, work 64 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *With C, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
3rd to 5th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around.
7th to 9th rnds: As 6th rnd.
Rep 2nd to 9th rnds once more.
Beg crown decs: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *With C, 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *With C, 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. With B, 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *With C, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *With B, 1 sc. Sc2tog. With A, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. With A, 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *With C, Sc2tog. With B, 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. With B only, *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.
Pompom: With A, B and C held tog wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 60 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: Caron® Big Donut™ O’Go™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 502 yds/459 m) Raspberry Glazed (29006) 1 O’Go
Sizes U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
Sc2togspl = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc between ‘legs’ of stitch. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 15 sts and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm] in split sc pat with smaller hook.
instructions:
Note: When working from chart, carry yarn not in use loosely across top of work. Work next row over strand of yarn which is not in use. Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
Ribbing: With A and larger hook, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg, when slightly stretched, measures 19½" [49.5 cm].** Do not fasten off.
Change to smaller hook and proceed as follows:
Set-up rnd: Ch 1. Work 80 sc across longer side of ribbing. Do not join. PM for beg of rnd.
Cont working in spiral as follows: Beg working Chart, noting 2-st rep will be worked 40 times, reading rnds from right to left.
1st rnd: 1 splsc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd, and cont working Chart until Rnd 28 of Chart is complete.
Break all colors but B.
Shape crown: 1st rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 6 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 70 sts.
2nd and alt rnds: 1 splsc in each sc around.
3rd rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sts.
5th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
7th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
9th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
11 rnd: *1 splsc in next st. Sc2togspl. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
Break yarn, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. Sew ends of ribbing together.
Pompom: Wind 4 strands of B, 1 strand each A, C, D and E around 4 fingers 40 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1401 Pewter A, 1704 Bubblegum B, 1101 Eggshell C, and 1012 Black D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [H-8 US]
Yarn needle
stitch marker
small amount of fiberfill
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 18½” (47 cm) circumference at brim. Hat will stretch to fit a range of sizes.
gauge: 9 dc = 2½” (6.5 cm) in pattern; 6 rows = 2½” (6.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ribbing
With A, ch 12.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—11 sc.
Rows 2–66: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn. Do not turn at end of Row 66.
Crown
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, working across ends of rows, sc in each row, turn—66 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc, turn.
Rows 4–7: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 twice.
Row 8: Repeat Row 2.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first 9 dc, sc2tog, [sc in next 9 dc, sc2tog] 5 times, turn—60 sc.
Row 10: Repeat Row 2.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first 8 dc, sc2tog, [sc in next 8 dc, sc2tog] 5 times, turn—54 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sc, sc2tog, [sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] 5 times, turn—48 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc, sc2tog, [sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 5 times, turn—42 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, sc2tog, [sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 5 times, turn—36 sc.
Row 15: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, sc2tog, [sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 5 times, turn—30 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, sc2tog, [sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 5 times, turn—24 sc.
Row 17: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, sc2tog, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 5 times, turn—18 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] 5 times, turn—12 sc.
Row 19: Ch 1, [sc2tog] times—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Trunk
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times; join with slip st in first sc—9 sc.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc.
Rounds 4–7: Sc in each sc.
Round 8: Work 2 sc in next sc, sc in each remaining sc—10 sc.
Rounds 9 and 10: Sc in each sc.
Rounds 11–14: Repeat Rounds 8 and 9 twice—12 sc.
Round 15: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] 2 times—14 sc.
Round 16: Sc in each sc.
Round 17: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] 2 times—16 sc.
Round 18: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 4 times—20 sc.
Round 19: Work 2 sc in next 6 sc, sc in remaining sc—26 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Note: First 12 sts of Round 19 is top of trunk.
Tongue
With B, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Mouth
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc—10 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
White of Eye (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
Round 1 (wrong side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in next sc, 2 hdc in next sc, 2 dc in next sc, 2 hdc in next sc, 2 sc in next 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc—12 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Iris
With D, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Ear (make 4 - 2 each in A and B)
Ch 12.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—11 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc, turn—22 sc.
Rows 3–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—20 sc.
Rows 7–10: Repeat Rows 5 and 6 twice—16 sc.
Rows 11–13: Repeat Row 6 three times—10 sc.
Fasten off.
Round 14: With right sides facing, hold 2 ears (1 each of A and B) together, working through both thicknesses and across opposite side of foundation ch, join A with sc in first ch of Row 1, 2 sc in same ch as join, sc in each ch to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; sc evenly across ends of rows of first side to Row 13; 3 sc in first st of Row 13, sc in each st to last st, 3 sc in last st; sc evenly across ends of rows of 2nd side; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Weave tail through stitches of last row of hat and pull gently but firmly to close. Sew edges of rows together to seam back of hat.
Stuff trunk with fiberfill so that trunk turns upward. Using photograph as a guide, position top of trunk on front of hat and sew trunk in place.
Sew tongue into curve of mouth. Sew straight edge of mouth (across ends of rows) under trunk.
Sew iris to white of eye. With tail of C, sew 1 small straight stitch on iris. Sew eyes on crown on either side of trunk.
Top knot fringe: Cut 2 or 3 lengths of A, each 6-8” (15-20.5 cm) long. Thread through top of crown and tie in place. Brush to fluff and trim to desired length.
Using photograph as a guide, position and sew ears to sides of crown.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® With Love: 1 skein each of 1101 Eggshell A and 1704 Bubblegum B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
1 yd (1 m) of ribbon, yarn needle, scissors
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 18 (20)'' (45.5 [51 cm]) in circumference
gauge: 14 sts and 7 rows in dc = 4” (10 cm)
instructions:
TRIM
Round 1: With right side facing, join B with a slip st in ch-2 space near back seam, ch 1, 3 sc in same space, sc in each of next 3 dc, skip 2 dc, sc in each of next 3 dc**, 3 sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—63 (72) sc. Fasten off B.
FINISHING
Weave ribbon evenly through holes made by ch-2 spaces 2-3 rows above the trim. Tie ribbon in a bow near front of hat. Trim ends evenly.
HAT 
With A, ch 4; join with a slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 13 (15) dc in ring; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—14 (16) dc.
Round 2: Slip st between first 2 sts, ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), dc in same space, skip next 2 dc, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in space before next dc, skip next 2 dc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first ch-1 space—7 (8) ch-1 spaces; 2 dc between ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in each ch-1 space around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—7 (8) ch-2 spaces; 4 dc between ch-2 spaces.
Round 4: Slip st in next dc, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, dc in next dc, *skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, skip last 2 dc; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—7 (8) ch-2 spaces; 6 dc between ch-2 spaces.
Round 5: Slip st in next dc, ch 3, dc in next dc, *(2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, dc in each of next 2 dc, skip next 2 dc**, dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—7 (8) ch-2 spaces; 8 dc between ch-2 spaces.
Round 6-11 (13): Slip st in next dc, ch 3, dc in each of next 2 dc, *(dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-2 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, skip next 2 dc**, dc in each of next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—7 (8) ch-2 spaces; 8 dc between ch-2 spaces. Fasten off A.

materials: Patons® Canadiana™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 205 yds/187 m)
Sizes 4/6
Boy’s Version
Main Color (MC) Dark Grey Mix (10042) 1 ball
Contrast A Black (10040) 1 ball
Contrast B Lime Juice (10712) 1 ball
Contrast C Pale Grey Mix (10046) 1 ball
Girl’s Version
Main Color (MC) Medium Teal (10744) 1 ball
Contrast A Medium Amethyst (10344) 1 ball
Contrast B Winter White (10006) 1 ball
Contrast C Lime Juice (10712) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Sc3tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook
measurements: To fit child 4/6 (8/10)
gauge: 16 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Fair Isle Pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
•  To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed with new color.
• Carry color when not in use loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to avoid stranding (see photo below of WS of work).
Ribbing
With MC, ch 18. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 17 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
GAuGE
16 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Fair Isle Pat. Proceed in pat as follows:
Rep last row until work from beg measures 17½ (18½)" [44.5 (47) cm], when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off.
Join last row and 1st row tog with 1 row of sc to form tube.
Beg working in rnds: Foundation rnd: ch 1. Working along side edge of ribbing, work 72 (80) sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
1st to 8th rnds: Ch 1. Work Chart to end of chart, noting 8-st rep will be worked 9 (10) times. Join with sl st to first sc at end of each rnd.
Rep last 8 rnds of Chart once more.
Shape top: 1st rnd: With MC, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. *With B, 1 sc in next sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 63 (70) sts.
2nd rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in next st. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 6 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Join B with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. *With MC, sc2tog. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. With MC, sc2tog. Join A with sl st to first sc. 54 (60) sts.
4th rnd: With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 45 (50) sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 (40) sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc3tog. Rep from * around to last 0 (1) st. (1 sc in last st) 0 (1) time. Join with sl st to first sc leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem 12 (14) sts.

materials: AUSTRALIAN SUPERFINE MERINO BY CLECKHEATON 8 PLY 65g/2.3oz balls
2 balls in color 42 Lavender
G-6 (4mm) crochet hook or size needed to give correct gauge
Pom pom maker or piece of cardboard (optional)
Yarn needle for sewing in ends
measurements: Medium Large To Fit Head ins 22 23 cm 56 58
gauge: 17dc and 10.5 rows to 4 (10cm) over dc fabric.
instructions:
1. Do not turn work. With right side facing, insert hook in front loop only of next stitch to the right, draw yarn through, yarn over hook and draw through both loops on hook.
2. Repeat across row or round.
3. Repeat step 1 across round, working from left to right.

FINISHING
DO NOT PRESS. If desired, using large pom pom maker or two circles of cardboard 4 (10cm) in diameter with a 1½ (4cm) diameter hole in center, make a loose pom pom and attach securely to crown.

BEANIE (beg at crown)
Make 2ch.
1st round – Skip first ch, (2sc, 2hdc, 16dc) in last ch, do not join with a sl st as beanie is worked in a spiral … 20 sts.
2nd round – (2dc in next st, 1dc in next st) 10 times … 30dc.
3rd round – (2dc in next dc, 1dc in each of next 2dc) 10 times … 40dc.
4th round – (2dc in next dc, 1dc in each of next 3dc) 10 times … 50dc.
5th round – (2dc in next dc, 1dc in each of next 4dc) 10 times … 60dc.
6th round – (2dc in next dc, 1dc in each of next 5dc) 10 times … 70dc.
7th round – (2dc in next dc, 1dc in each of next 6dc) 10 times … 80dc.
8th round – (2dc in next dc, 1dc in each of next 17dc) 0 (4) times, 1dc in each of next 75 (3) dc, 1hdc in each of next 2dc, 1sc in each of next 2dc, sl st in next dc … 80 (84) sts.
Rem of Beanie is worked in joined rounds.
9th round – 3ch, 1dc in each st to end, sl st in 3rd ch at beg.
Rep last round until Beanie measures 7 (7 ½) [18 (19) cm] from beg.
1st round (worked left to right) – 1ch, Crab st in front lp only of each dc to end, sl st in back lp of first Crab st.
2nd round (worked right to left) – 3ch, 1dc in rem back lp of each dc (working behind Crab sts) to end, sl st in 3rd ch at beg.

POM POMS
1. Cut out two circles of cardboard for your pom pom. Cut a hole in the center of both circles (the diameter of the hole should be ¼ the diameter of the circle).
2. Put the two circles together and wind yarn round and round the cardboard.
3. If you are making a standard pom pom, keep winding until the center hole is completely filled up. If you prefer a floppy pom pom, cover the cardboard but do not fill the center hole.
4. Place the point of a pair of scissors between the two circles of cardboard and cut around the yarn, keeping the scissors between the circles all the time.
5. Using a strand of yarn, wrap it round between the two circles of cardboard, knot firmly and take away the cardboard.
6. Trim the pom pom.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m) Main Color (MC) Teal Heather (53203) 1 ball
Contrast A Grass (53223) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Hat: One size to fit average woman's head. Scarf: Approx 8" x 78" [20.5 x 198 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
COLOR BURST BEANIE | CROCHET
 Say goodbye to crocheter's block
 INSTRUCTIONS
 Notes
 • Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
 • To join new color, work to last loops on 
hook of first color. Yoh with new color, 
draw through loops and proceed with 
new color. Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
 BEANIE
 With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form 
a ring. 
 1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join.
 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
 16 hdc. 
 3rd rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next 
hdc) 8 times. Join. 24 hdc. 
 4th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in 
each of next 2 hdc) 8 times. Join. 32 hdc. 
 5th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in 
each of next 3 hdc) 8 times. Join. 40 hdc. 
 6th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in 
each of next 4 hdc) 8 times. Join. 48 hdc.  
 7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.  
 8th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in 
each of next 5 hdc) 8 times. Join. 56 hdc.  
 Break A. Join MC. 
 9th rnd: With MC, as 7th rnd. 
 10th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in 
each of next 6 hdc) 8 times. Join. 64 hdc. 
 11th to 22nd rnds: As 7th rnd. 
 23rd to 25th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st 
around. Join. Fasten off.
 SCARF
 With A, ch 30. 
 1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook 
 (counts as 2 hdc). *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 hdc in 
 next ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 hdc in last ch. 
 Turn. 29 sts. 
 2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as 1 hdc and ch-1 sp). 
 Skip next hdc. *1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 
 Skip next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in 
 last hdc. Turn. 
 3rd row:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. 
 Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. Rep 
 from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 
 Last 2 rows form pat.
 Cont in pat until Scarf measures 10" [25.5 cm], 
 ending on a WS row. Join MC. Break A. With 
 MC, cont in pat until Scarf measures 68"  
 [173 cm], ending on a WS row. Join A. Break MC. 
 With A, cont in pat until Scarf measures 78" 
 [198 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
 Fringe: Cut lengths of A 16" [40.5 cm] long. 
 Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into 
 fringe across ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Red Heart ™ Super Saver™ O’Go™(Solids: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m; Prints: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Main Color (MC) Navy (7180) 1 O’Go
Contrast A, B, C, D and E Rainbow (7192) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with O’Go, locate the end of the yarn.
• Carefully cut plastic tie where ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull to remove tie. 
• Colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. 
• Each color is ready to use. Each rnd of Motif will be worked with a different color of O’Go. 
• Ch 3 at beg of ends counts as dc.
MOTIFS
Make 1 each in the following color combinations:
Motif 1: E as Color 1, C as Color 2, A as Color 3.
Motif 2: D as Color 1, E as Color 2, C as Color 3.
Motif 3: A as Color 1, B as Color 2, E as Color 3.
Motif 4: C as Color 1, D as Color 2, A as Color 3.
Motif 5: E as Color 1, C as Color 2, B as Color 3.
Motif 6: B as Color 1, A as Color 2, D as Color 3.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 2.
CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: EASY
1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc) 3 times in ring. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. [(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1] 3 times. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
Sew sides of 6 Motifs tog to form Ring in this order: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6.
Hat Crown
Note: Join all rnds with sl st in first sc.
With RS facing, join MC with sl st to any ch-2 sp at top edge of Ring of Motifs. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around, working 1 sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Join. 78 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.  
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 66 sc.  
4th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.  
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.  
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.  
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.  
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.  
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.  
10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.  
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.  
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.  
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sc. Fasten off.
Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely.
Brim
Note: Join all rnds with sl st in first sc. 
With RS facing, join MC with sl st to any ch-2 sp at bottom edge of Ring of Motifs. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around, working 1 sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Join. 78 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 84 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 90 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 96 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 102 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 108 sc.
7th to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Ocean (9759) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook).
measurements: Hat: One size to fit Adult. Cowl: Approx 20" [51 cm] around face x 23" [58.5 cm] around neck x 8" [20.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 13 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 does not count as st. 
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
COWL
Ribbing: Ch 8. 
**1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.**
Rep last row until Ribbing, without stretching, measures 20" [51 cm]. Do not fasten off. 
Set-up rnd: Turn work sideways. Ch 2. Work 64 hdc evenly across long side of ribbing. Join. PM for beg of rnd. 

Proceed in pat as follows:
1st and 2nd rnds: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around each st around. Join. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. (1 dc in each of next 15 sts. 2 dc in next st) 4 times. Join. 68 dc.
4th and 5th rnds: As 1st and 2nd rnds. 
6th rnd: Ch 2. (1 dc in each of next 16 sts. 2 dc in next st) 4 times. Join. 72 dc.
7th and 8th rnds: As 1st and 2nd rnds. 
9th rnd: Ch 2. (1 dc in each of next 17 sts. 2 dc in next st) 4 times. Join. 76 dc.
10th and 11th rnds: As 1st and 2nd rnds. Fasten off. 
Bottom Ribbing: Rep from ** to ** as given for Ribbing. Rep last row until Bottom Ribbing, without stretching, measures 23" [58.5 cm]. Fasten off. Sew Bottom Ribbing to last rnd of Cowl. 
HAT
Ribbing: Ch 8. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Ribbing, when slightly stretched, measures 19½" [49.5 cm]. Do not fasten off. 
Set-up rnd: Turn work sideways. Ch 2. Work 64 hdc evenly across long side of ribbing. Join. PM for beg of rnd. 
Proceed in Ridged Pat as follows:
1st and 2nd rnds: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around each st around. Join. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join. 68 dc.
Rep last 3 rnds for Ridged Pat until work from beg measures approx 6" [15 cm], ending on a 2nd rnd of pat.
Shape crown: 1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 3 sts. *Skip next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last st. Skip last st. Join. 48 sts.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around each st around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 2 sts. *Skip next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last st. Skip last st. Join. 32 sts.
5th and 6th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *Skip next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to last st. Skip last st. Join. 16 sts.
8th and 9th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds. Fasten off at end of 9th rnd.
Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. 
FINISHING
Sew sides of Ribbing for Cowl and Hat. Sew Hat to Cowl at center back, overlapping ribbing of Cowl on top of Hat ribbing for 4" [10 cm].

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 1 ball each 8012 Black A, and 8251 Neon Orange B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
1 piece of black craft felt, black sewing thread, sewing needle, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures about 20” (51 cm) circumference and will stretch to fit a range of sizes.
gauge: 11 sts = 4” (10cm); 7 rows = 4” (10cm) in double crochet and Front post double crochet pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
PUMPKIN
Round 1 (right side): Leaving a long tail to weave in later, draw up a loop of B in same st as joining slip st of previous round, ch 3, Fpdc around first Fpdc, [dc in next dc, dc in top of next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc] 7 times, dc in same st as joining slip st of previous round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, Fpdc around first Fpdc, [dc in next 2 dc, dc in top of next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc] 7 times, dc in next dc, dc in same st as joining slip st of previous round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—32 sts.
Round 3: Ch 3, Fpdc around first Fpdc, [dc in next 3 dc, dc in top of next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc] 7 times, dc in next 2 dc, dc in same st as joining slip st of previous round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—40 sts.
Round 4: Ch 3, Fpdc around first Fpdc, [dc in next 4 dc, dc in top of next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc] 7 times, dc in next 3 dc, dc in same st as joining slip st of previous round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 sts.
Round 5: Ch 3, Fpdc around first Fpdc, [dc in next 5 dc, dc in top of next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc] 7 times, dc in next 4 dc, dc in same st as joining slip st of previous round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—56 sts.
Rounds 6-10: Ch 3, Fpdc around first Fpdc, [dc in next 6 dc, Fpdc around next Fpdc] 7 times, dc in next 5 dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—56 sts.
STEM
With A, leaving a 10” (25.5 cm) tail, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), (hdc, 5 dc, hdc) in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—8 sts.
Rounds 2–6: Ch 2, Fphdc around next st, Fpdc around each of next 5 sts, Fphdc around last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 7: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), Fpdc around the beginning ch-2.
Round 11: Ch 2, Fphdc around first Fpdc, [hdc in next dc, dc in next 4 dc, hdc in next dc, Fpdc around next Fpdc] 7 times, hdc in next dc, dc in next 4 dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 12: Ch 2, Fphdc around first Fphdc, [hdc in next hdc, dc in next 4 dc, hdc in next hdc, Fphdc around next Fphdc] 7 times, hdc in next hdc, dc in next 4 dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Fasten off.
FIRST VINE
With A, ch 12.
Row 1: Work 3 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (2 skipped chains count as first hdc), 4 hdc in each remaining ch across—40 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing Vine to Hat.
SECOND VINE 
With A, ch 15.
Row 1: Work 3 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (2 skipped chains count as first hdc), 4 hdc in each remaining ch across—52 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing Vine to Hat.
FINISHING
Thread yarn tail at beginning of the Stem into yarn needle. Sew the tail down through all the beginning chains of the Stem. Pull tail slightly to increase curve of Stem and weave in tail on inside of Hat. Use tails of Vines to sew Vines onto Hat at base of Stem. Weave in all remaining ends. Cut out a Jack-‘o-Lantern face of your liking from the black craft felt. Position it on the Hat and pin in place. Hand stitch the face onto Hat.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™ 1 Kit
Contrast A Saffron 1 ball or 28 yds/25m
Contrast B Lavender 1 ball or 28 yds/25m
Contrast C Jade 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Contrast D Spring Green 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Contrast E Soft White 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in indicated space. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Note
• Ch-3 at beg of rnds counts as dc throughout.
Stripe Pat
• Work 1 rnd each in A, B, C, D and E throughout.
With A and larger hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 3. 
1st rnd: Ch 3. [1 dc. Ch 1. (2 dc. ch 1) 5 times] all in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.  6 clusters of 2-dc and 6 ch-1 sps. 
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 12 clusters of 2-dc and 12 ch-1 sps. 
3rd rnd: Join C with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off. 12 clusters of 3-dc and 12 ch-1 sps.
4th rnd: Join D with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 2-dc and 24 ch-1 sps. 
5th rnd: Join E with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. * 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 2-dc and 24 ch-1 sps.
6th rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. * 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 3-dc and 24 ch-1 sps.
7th rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *(2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from *around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 2-dc, 12 clusters of 3-dc and 36 ch-1 sps.
8th to 11th rnds: Keeping Stripe Pat, join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. *2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 36 clusters of 2-dc and 36 ch-1 sps.
12th rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Dc2tog, drawing up first loop in same sp as last dc and 2nd loop in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in same sp as last st. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp.
