Dc2tog, drawing up first loop in same sp as last dc and 2nd loop in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in same sp as last st. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 3-dc and 24 ch-1 sps. 
13th rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 2-dc and 24 ch-1 sps.
Change to smaller hook for final edging.
14th rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc. 
15th and 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Heads Up™: 1 ball each of 901 True Red A and 100 Ivory B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures about 22” (56 cm) circumference
gauge: One parallelogram = 2½” x 5½” (6.5 x 14 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
First Parallelogram
With B, ch 8.
Row 1 (right side): Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn.
Rows 4–11: Repeat last 2 rows 4 more times.
Row 12: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off B.

Second Parallelogram
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in first st of last row of previous parallelogram, ch 1, beginning in same st as joining, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn.
Rows 2–12: Work same as Rows 2–12 of first parallelogram. Fasten off A.

Third Parallelogram
With B, work same as second parallelogram. Fasten off B.

Fourth Parallelogram
With A, work same as second parallelogram. Fasten off A, leaving a long tail for sewing. With long tail, sew last and first rows together to form a ring. Take care to sew through both loops of the stitches of the last row and the remaining two loops of the foundation chain.

Top of Hat
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in end of last row of last parallelogram, ch 1, sc in the end of each row around; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Note: Work first stitch of each round in same stitch as joining slip stitch unless otherwise instructed.
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.
Round 4: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in the 32nd sc of Round 3, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Note: This new joining location is now at the center back of hat.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc. Fasten off B.
Round 6: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in first sc of previous round, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.

Rounds 7 and 8: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc. Fasten off A.
Round 10: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in the first sc of previous round, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 11: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc. Fasten off B.
Round 12: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in the 2nd sc of previous round, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, [sc in next st, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. Fasten off A, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull to tighten. Weave in end securely on wrong side of hat.

Lower Edging
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in end of row of parallelogram directly below back seam (joining of last 12 rounds), ch 1, sc in end of each row around; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Round 2: Skip same st as joining, *ch 2, skip next st, slip st in next st; repeat from * around to last st, ch 2, skip last st; join with slip st in joining slip st of previous round. Fasten off A.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Kids™: 1 skein each 2652 Lime A; 2230 Yellow B and 2735 Pixie Pink C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color a, B, C
measurements: Approx 15.5 (17)” circumference. Hats fit: 6–12 months (18–24 months).
gauge: CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain your gauge.
instructions:
You’ll have to resist plucking up baby when she’s adorned in this colorful tot topper. This adorable hat is a picture-perfect gift!
3-dc group] 4 times; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-2—18 groups of 3 dc and 2 ch-1 spaces.
Size 12–24 Months Only 
Round 5 Slip st in next 2 sc, (slip st, ch 2, 2 dc) in space before next 3-dc group; *[3 dc in space (or in ch-1 space) before next 3-dc group] twice, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in space before next 3-dc group**, 3 dc in space before next 3-dc group; repeat from * 3 more times, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-2—20 groups of 3 dc and 4 ch-1 spaces.
All Sizes
Rounds 6–8 (6–9) Slip st in next 2 dc, (slip st, ch 2, 2 dc) in space before next 3-dc group; *3 dc in space (or in ch-1 space) before each 3-dc group; repeat from * around; join with slip in 2nd ch of beginning ch-2—18 (20) groups of 3 dc.
Round 9 (10) Sc in each dc around—54 (60) sc. Do not join, but work in a spiral. Place marker in first st and move up to first st in each round as work progresses.
Rounds 10–13 (11–15) Sc in each sc around.
Round 14 (16) Slip st in each sc around; join with slip st in first slip st.
Fasten off.
FLOWER 
With B, ch 3.
Round 1 (right side) Work 7 dc in 3rd ch from hook (2 skipped chs count as dc); join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3—8 dc. 
Round 2 Ch 6, slip st around 2 skipped chs at beginning of Round 1; *ch 6, slip st around post of next dc; repeat from * around; ch 6—9 ch-6 loops. Fasten off. Insert tail down through center of flower and secure end of ch-6.
Round 3 With right side facing, join C with slip st in any dc on Round 1, ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in same dc as joining, 3 dc in each dc around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3—24 dc.
Note: Work Rounds 4–6 from outer edge in a spiral toward center.
Round 4 *Ch 6, skip next st, slip st in next st; repeat from * around to last dc; ch 6, skip last dc, slip st around beginning ch-3—12 ch-6 spaces.
Round 5 Working in Round 3, *ch 6, skip next dc, slip st around post of next dc; repeat from * around to last dc; ch 6, skip last dc and beginning ch-3, slip st around post of next dc.
Round 6 Working in Round 3, *ch 6, skip next dc where slip st in Round 5 was worked, slip st around post of next dc; repeat from * around; ch 6, skip beginning ch-3; join with slip st in first slip st.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all ends. Lightly block all pieces. Sew flower to edge of hat.

materials: Red Heart® Heatwave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
Hat is worked back and forth in turned rows lengthwise. First and last rows are joined to form Hat. Directions are for size Small. Changes for sizes Medium, Large, and Extra Large are in parentheses.
HAT
Ch 27 (31-34-37).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 4 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 18 (22-25-28) ch. Sl st in each of last 3 ch. Turn. 26 (30-33-36) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, sl st in each of first 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 18 (22-25-28) sts. 1 sc in each of last 5 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 18 (22-25-28) sts. Sl st in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 21 (23-26-28) times more.
Next row: As 2nd row.
Next row: (Joining row). With RS of first and last rows tog and working in through back loops only, sl st in each st across.
Gathering rnd: Ch 1. Working in ends of rows, skip first 4 rows. Sl st in next row. (Skip next 4 rows. sl st in next row) 8 (9-10-11) times. Do not join. Fasten off, leaving 12" [30.5 cm] tail.
FINISHING
Weave tail through every other sl st, pull gently to close top of Hat. Draw tail to inside and secure.
Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Bone (39703) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from left to right. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.

Dcfp2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2(3) times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit average Adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 72 loosely. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st here and throughout). 1 dc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first dc. 72 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dc. *Dcbp around next dc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last dc. Dcbp around last dc. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. *Dcbp around next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. Rep from * to last dcbp. Dcbp around last dcbp. Join with sl st to first dcfp. Rep last rnd 3 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. 2 dcfp around next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. (1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp) twice. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. 2 dcfp around next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in last dcbp. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 78 sts.
Proceed in Cable Twist Pat as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next 3 dcfp. Dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Working behind last 3 dcfp worked, dcfp around each of 3 skipped sts - Cr6F made. (1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp) twice. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Cr6F over next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. (1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp) twice. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. Rep 1st to 5th rnds for Cable Twist Pat until Hat measures approx 6" [15 cm], ending on a 4th rnd of pat.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 72 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 4 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Cr6F over next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Cr6F over next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 66 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first 3 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next 3 dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
5th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp3tog. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp3tog. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 54 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. (Dcfp2tog) twice. Dcfp around next dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. (Dcfp2tog) twice. Dcfp around next dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 42 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 6 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
8th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *Skip next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. Skip last hdc. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 24 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *Dcfp3tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Dcfp3tog. Join with sl st to first dcfp. 12 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp. Break yarn leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
FINISHING
Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 150 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® “Fiesta®”: 1 skein 6332 Harvest
OR
RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein 389 Hunter Green.
Crochet Hooks: 5mm [US H-8] and 5.5mm [US I-9].
Stitch markers, yarn needle, 3 jingle bells.
abbreviations: inc (increase) = work 2 sc in next sc.
dec (decrease) = [draw up a loop in next sc] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Hat Circumference: 18 (20, 24)”
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 16 rounds = 4” in sc rounds with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ribbing
With smaller hook, ch 16.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 15 sc.
Row 2: Working in back loop only, ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until 14 (16, 18)” from beginning. Bring opposite end up to form a circle; join by slip stitch through both layers. Change to larger hook and work in rounds across row ends.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 48 (57, 66) sc evenly around; DO NOT JOIN but work in continuous rounds. Mark end of round. Move marker up each round.
Round 2: [Sc in next 7 (18, 10) sc, inc] 6 (3, 6) times – 54 (60, 72) sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Repeat Round 3 until 7 (8, 9)” from lower edge.
Increase for Points
Round 1: [Inc, sc in next 16 (18, 22) sc, inc] 3 times – 60 (66, 78) sc.
Round 2 and All Even Rounds: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next 18 (20, 24) sc, inc] 3 times – 66 (72, 84) sc.
Round 5: [Inc, sc in next 20 (22, 26) sc, inc] 3 times – 72 (78, 90) sc.
Round 7: [Inc, sc in next 22 (24, 28) sc, inc] 3 times – 78 (84, 96) sc.
Round 9: [Inc, sc in next 24 (26, 30) sc, inc] 3 times – 84 (90, 102) sc.
Round 11: [Inc, sc in next 26 (28, 32) sc, inc] 3 times – 90 (96, 108) sc.
Rounds 12 and 13: Repeat Round 2.
Divide for points
First Point
Round 1: Sc in first 30 (32, 36) sc; bring the first of these sc around to create a ring and work in continuous rounds as before on only these sts.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: [Sc in next 3 (6, 4) sc, dec] 6 (4, 6) times – 24 (28, 30) sc.
Rounds 4-8: Repeat Round 2.
Round 9: [Sc in next 2 (5, 3) sc, dec] 6 (4, 6) times – 18 (24, 24) sc.
Rounds10-14: Repeat Round 2.
Round 15: [Sc in next 1 (2, 2) sc, dec] 6 times – 12 (18, 18) sc.
Rounds 16-20: Repeat Round 2.
Round 21: [Sc in next sc, dec] 4 (6, 6) times – 8 (12, 12) sc.
Rounds 22-26: Repeat Round 2.
Round 27: [Sc in next 0 (1, 1) sc, dec] 4 times – 4 (8, 8) sc.
Women’s and Men’s Sizes Only-Rounds 28-32: Repeat Round 2.
Round 33: [Dec] 4 times – 4 sc.
All Sizes: Fasten off leaving a long 12” tail for sewing ends and attaching jingle bells.
2nd Point
Sc in next 30 (32, 36) sts of last long row; bring the first of these sc around to create a ring and work in continuous rounds as before. Complete as for First Point.
3rd Point
Sc across last 30 (32, 36) sts and complete as for first 2 points.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Sew jingle bells at tips of points. Turn ribbing up for cuff.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Neon Pink (39775) 1 ball
Contrast B Chartreuse (39771) 1 ball
Contrast C Robin’s Egg (39780) 1 ball
Contrast D Royal Blue (39767) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif measures 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
Note: All rnds are joined with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5 unless otherwise indicated.
MOTIFS
Make 2 Motifs using A as Color 1, B as Color 2, C as Color 3 and D as Color 4.
Make 2 Motifs using B as Color 1, C as Color 2, D as Color 3 and A as Color 4.
Make 2 Motifs using C as Color 1, D as Color 2, A as Color 3 and B as Color 4.
Make 2 Motifs using D as Color 1, A as Color 2, B as Color 3 and C as Color 4.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc in ring. Ch 3) 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join. Fasten off. 12 dc, 3 ch-1 sps.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 24 dc, 4 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 36 dc, 8 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps.
4th rnd: Join Color 4 in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-2 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 48 dc, 12 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps.
5th rnd: With Color 1, as 4th rnd. 60 dc, 16 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps.
6th rnd: With Color 2, as 4th rnd. 72 dc, 20 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps. Fasten off.
Whipstitch squares tog as shown in assembly diagram.
WHIPSTITCH Face Edging
Join D with sl st to any dc of Motif indicated on assembly diagram.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *Work 1 sc in each dc until 2 sts before next corner. (Sc2tog) twice. Rep from * once more. Work 1 sc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: As 1st rnd. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® "Designer Sport™": 1 Ball each 3215 Lemon Zest CA and 3101 Ivory CB.
Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Circumference: 15".
gauge: 15 sts = 4"; 12 rnds = 4" in hdc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CAP: With CB, ch 4; join with a sl st in first ch to form a ring.

Rnd 1: Ch 1, 12 hdc in ring; join with a sl st in first hdc – 12 hdc; turn.

Rnd 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each hdc around changing to CA in last st; join; turn – 24 hdc.

Rnd 3: With CA, ch 1, [hdc in next 2 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 8 times; join; turn – 32 hdc.

Rnd 4: Ch 1, [hdc in next 3 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 8 times changing to CB in last hdc; join; turn – 40 hdc.

Rnd 5: With CB, ch 1, [hdc in next 4 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 8 times; join – 48 hdc.

Rnd 6: Ch 1, [hdc in next 5 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 8 times changing to CA in last hdc; join – 56 hdc.

Rnds 7 and 8: With CA, ch 1, hdc in each hdc around; join; turn.

Rnds 9 and 10: Rep Rnds 7 and 8 with CB.

Rnds 11-15: Rep Rnd 7 with CA. Fasten off.

First Earflap-Row 1: With right side facing, join CA in 7th hdc from back joining; ch 1, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 10 hdc; turn – 11 hdc.

Row 2: Ch 1, hdc in each hdc across; turn.

Row 3: Ch 1, dec, hdc in next 7 hdc, dec; turn – 9 hdc.

Row 4: Rep Row 2.

Rnd 5: Ch 1, dec, hdc in next 5 hdc, dec; turn – 7 hdc.

Row 6: Ch 1, dec, hdc in next 3 hdc, dec; turn – 5 hdc.

Row 7: Ch 1, dec, hdc in next hdc, dec – 3 hdc. Fasten off.

Second Earflap: With right side facing, skip next 20 sts on last long row and join CA in next st. Work as for first earflap.

Edging and Ties: With right side facing, join CB at back of hat at the joining; ch 1, sc in same st and in each st to earflap, work sc across earflap to center st at tip of flap; ch 20, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across for tie; sc in same center st, sc across remainder of earflap, across front of hat; work other earflap and tie in the same manner; sc to end; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Off White (9702) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Ribbing: Ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, from beg measures 19½" [49.5 cm].** Do not fasten off.
Set-up rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1) 36 times across longer side of ribbing. Join. PM for beg of rnd. Proceed in pat as follows:
See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next sc) 4 times. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Rep from *, ending last rep with: (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip last ch-1 sp). Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 5. Skip next (ch-1 sp, 1 dc) twice. From front, sl st in next ch-1 sp 2 rows below. Ch 5. Skip next (1 dc, ch-1 sp) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * ending last rep with: 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip last ch-1 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(Working behind ch-5 sp, ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc 2 rows below) 4 times. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Rep from * ending last rep with: (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip last ch-1 sp). Join.
Rep last 2 rnds until work from beg measures 8½" [21.5 cm], ending on a 3rd rnd.
Shape crown: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next dc) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next (ch-1 sp, sc, ch-1 sp). 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending last rep with: Ch 1. Skip next (ch-1 sp, sc, ch-1 sp). Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Ch 1. Skip next (ch-1 sp, sc, ch-1 sp). 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending last rep with: Ch 1. Skip next (ch-1 sp, sc, ch-1 sp). Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Ch 1. Skip next (ch-1 sp, sc, ch-1 sp). 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around ending last rep with: Ch 1. Skip next (ch-1 sp, sc, ch-1 sp). Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next (ch-1 sp, sc, ch-1 sp). 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending last rep with: Ch 1. Skip next (ch-1 sp, sc, ch-1 sp). Join. Fasten off leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Pompom: Wind yarn around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat. Sew short ends of ribbing tog.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool BulkyTM (3.5 oz/100 g; 78 yds/71 m) Emerald (89708) 2 balls
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit average woman's head.
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions: Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout. Hat (See Diagram I on page 2). With larger hook, ch 4. 1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc. 2nd rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc. 3rd rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc. 4th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 54 dc. 5th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in last st from previous rnd keeping ch 3 at back of work. *Miss next st. 1 dc in next st. Working in front of dc just worked, 1 dc in missed st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 7th rnd: Working in both loops, as 5th rnd. 8th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 9th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *(Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – dc2tog made. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Dc2tog. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 45 sts. 10th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc2tog made. Rep from * around. 36 sts. Fasten off. Brim (See Diagram II on page 2). With smaller hook, join yarn with sl st to 8th st of 10th rnd of Hat. 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 28 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 4th to 7th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 20 sc at end of 7th row. 8th row: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc across. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball
Contrast A Hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Contrast B Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop in ch-1 sp. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Dcbl = Double crochet in back loop only
measurements: One size to fit head circumference: 21" [53.5 cm].
gauge: 13 dc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = 4" [10 cm] square.
instructions:
Notes:
• Hat is created by working Motifs and joining them to create side of Hat (Motif Ring).
• Top is worked separately and then joined to Motif Ring.
• Brim is worked around bottom edge of Motif Ring.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch 3, unless otherwise stated.

TOP
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join. 10 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 dc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail to sew Top to side edge of Motif Ring.

MOTIF RING
Motif (make 6)
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc. Ch 1). (1 dc. Ch 1) 11 times in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 4. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop in same sp as sl st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – beg cluster made. Ch 1. *Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join MC with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as sl st. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp (corner made). *3 dc in each of next 2 ch-1 sps. (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more. Join. Fasten off.
Sew sides of 6 Motifs tog to form ring.
Top Edging: Join MC with sl st to any dc at top of any Motif. Ch 1. Work 70 sc evenly around, working 1 sc in each dc along edge of Motifs. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Bottom Edging: Work as given for Top Edging. Do not fasten off.

BRIM
1st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbl in same sp as last sl st. *1 dcbl in next sc. 2 dcbl in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dcbl in last sc. Join. 105 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join. 140 dc.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Using yarn tail, attach Top of Hat to top edge of Motif Ring, whipstitching through back loops. Weave in ends.

WHIP STITCH

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Ball 512 Turqua
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch markers
yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 20 (22, 24)”
gauge: 12 dc = 4”; 6 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 60 (66, 72), slip st in first ch to form ring. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each ch around, slip st in top of beginning ch to join.
Rounds 2-3: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc] around, slip st in top of beginning dc – 80 (88, 96) sts.
Rounds 5-7: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 8: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in next st, skip next st, [hdc in next 3 dc, skip next dc], slip st in top of beginning ch – 60 (66, 72) sts.
Round 9: Ch 2, hdc in next st, skip next hdc, [hdc in next 2 hdc, skip next hdc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 40 (44, 48) sts.
Round 10: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 11: Ch 2, hdc in next 2 hdc, skip next hdc, [hdc in next 3 hdc, skip next hdc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 30 (33, 36) sts.
Round 12: Ch 1 (counts as sc), skip next hdc, [sc in next hdc, skip next hdc] around, sc in last 0 (1, 0) st, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 15 (17, 18) sts.
Round 13: Working in a spiral manner, [sc in next sc, skip next sc] around until no sts remain. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Brim
Row 1: With wrong side facing, count 25 sts to left of first st on Round 1, join yarn with a slip st and ch 2, hdc in next 18 hdc.
Rows 2-4: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each hdc across.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each hdc across.  Fasten off.
Turn Brim to right side and sew in place. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Moon & Stars™”: 2 Balls 3001
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: *or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished Circumference: 15”.
gauge: 13 sts = 4”; 8 rows = 4” in alternating sc & dc rows. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join – 12 sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st, 2 sc in next st, * sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 18 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, * sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 24 sts.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, * sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 30 sts.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, * sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 36 sts.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, * sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 42 sts.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st, * sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 48 sts.
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in each st around; join.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Rounds 11-14: Repeat Rounds 9-10.
Rounds 15-20: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Fasten off, weave in ends.
EAR (Make 2)
Ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join – 12 sts.
Rounds 3-5: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, * sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 18 sts.
Rounds 7-13: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Round 14: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, * sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 24 sts.
Rounds 15-28: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Flatten and shape Ears, folding both sides to center. Stitch into place on Hat. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 4601 Off White A and 9770 Rose Blush B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
Stitch markers
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 14 (16, 18, 20)” [35.5 (40.5, 45.5, 51) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 6 rows = 3¼” (8.5 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 12 dc in ring; join with slip st in first dc—12 dc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 dc in each st around; join with slip st in first dc—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 1, dc in first st, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 1, dc in first 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—48 dc.
Size Small only:
Rounds 5–11: Ch 1, dc in each st around; join with slip st in first dc.
Size Medium only:
Round 5: Ch 1, dc in first 5 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 5 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—56 dc.
Rounds 6–12: Ch 1, dc in each st around; join with slip st in first dc.
Sizes Large and X-Large only:
Round 5: Ch 1, dc in first 3 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 3 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 1, dc in first 14 (4) sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 14 (4) sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—64 (72) dc.
Rounds 7–12 (13): Ch 1, dc in each st around; join with slip st in first dc.
All Sizes:
Right Earflap
Row 1: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), skip next st, dc in next 5 sts, skip next st, dc in next st; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—7 dc.
Row 2: Ch 2, skip next st, dc in next 3 sts, skip next st, dc in last st, turn—5 dc.
Row 3: Ch 2, skip next st, dc in next st, skip next st, dc in last st—3 dc. Fasten off.
With right side of right earflap facing and back seam to the right, count to the left from earflap and place marker on 21st (25th, 29th, 33rd) st.
Left Earflap
With right side facing, join A with slip st in marked st and work same as right earflap.
Edging
Round 1: Join B with sc in center st at back of hat between earflaps, ch 1, sc in each st around working 3 sc in end of each row of earflap; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Flower
With B, make an adjustable loop, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Work 12 hdc in loop; join with slip st in first hdc—12 hdc.
Round 2: [Slip st, ch 2, dc, ch 2, slip st] in every st around (petal made); join with slip st in first slip st—12 petals.
Ear (make 2)
Outer Ear
Leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail, with A, ch 17.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc) and in next 12 ch, 6 dc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, dc in next 13 ch, ch 2 (counts as last dc), slip st in last ch¬—34 dc. Fasten off leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail.
Inner Ear
With B, work same as outer ear.
Joining Row: Leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail, hold wrong sides of outer and inner ears together; working through both thicknesses, join A with sc in first dc, sc evenly around working last sc in top of last ch-2. Fasten off leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail.
FINISHING
With B, sew flower in place where desired.
Braids (make 2)
Cut 6 strands of A and 3 strands of B, each measuring 28” (71 cm). Group into 3 hanks of 3 strands each by color. Thread each hank though last row of earflap and fold over so strands are doubled. Braid doubled hanks until 4” (10 cm) of strands remain, tie an overhand knot tightly, and trim ends evenly.
Ears Flatten hat and place stitch markers on each side edge at round 3 for each ear. Place A tails of first ear at marked st. With a crochet hook, pull tails to wrong side through Rounds 3 and 4 and knot together to form a slightly cupped ear. With a crochet hook, pull B tails to wrong side 3 stitches behind where A tails are fastened and knot together. Repeat to fasten 2nd ear.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m)
Contrast A: Peony Pink (53417) - 1 ball
Contrast B: Oatmeal (53010) - 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
measurements: To fit 4/6 (8/10) year old.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
• Hat is worked side to side.
Ch 33 (41). See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. *With A, 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. With B, 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 32 (40) sts.
2nd row: With B, ch 2. With B, 1 dc in each of first 4 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *With B, 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last 8 sts. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *With B, 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. With A, 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: With A, ch 2. With A, 1 dc in each of first 4 dc. With B, 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *With A, 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. With B, 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last 8 sts. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *With A, 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. With B, 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
6th row: As 2nd row.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows for Check Pat until work from beg measures 18 (20)" [45.5 (51) cm], ending on a 4th or 6th row of pat. Fasten off, leaving a long yarn end.
Thread yarn end through sides of sc rows at top of Hat and cinch closed.
Sew back seam.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Pagoda (COL0014) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit average Woman.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Beg at top of crown, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 3 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 18 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. *2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 2 dc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 33 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. *Skip next dc. Dcfp around post of next dc, then dcfp around post of skipped dc – Cr Dcfp made. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 49 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
7th rnd: Ch 3. *(Cr Dcfp) twice. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * to last 8 dc. [Cr Dcfp. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made)] 4 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 63 sts.
8th rnd: As 6th rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 3. *(Cr Dcfp) 3 times. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * to last 2 dc. Cr Dcfp. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 73 sts.
10th rnd: As 6th rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 3. *Cr Dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Rep 10th and 11th rnds for pat until work from beg measures approx 7" [18 cm], ending on an 11th rnd.
Edging: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 69 sc. Turn.
2nd rnd:  (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
3rd rnd:  (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.
Brim:  1st rnd:  With RS facing, skip first 17 sc. Join yarn with sl st in front loop only of next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of next 34 sc. Turn and work into rem back loops of 35 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 70 sc.
Note: Work sc in rem rnds into both loops of each st.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. Join with sl st to first st. 62 sts.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. Join with sl st to first st. 54 sts.
4th rnd:  Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. Join with sl st to first st. 46 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. 42 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 15 sts. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 15 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. 38 sts.
Join Brim: Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each of next 19 sts. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g, 315 yds/288 m)
Caron® Simply Soft® Brites (6 oz/170.1 g, 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Berry Blue (9609)
Contrast B Pistachio (0003)
Contrast C Mango (9605)
Contrast A Strawberry (0015)
Contrast B Pistachio (0003)
Contrast C Lemonade (9776)
Size U.S. 8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit baby's (kids's) head: 12/18 mos 15½" [39.5 cm], 2/4 yrs 18" [45.5 cm]
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work.
HAT
Cuﬀ  : With A, ch 55 (65).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 54 (64) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Join B.
3rd and 4th rows: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Join C at end of last row.
5th and 6th rows: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Join A at end of last row.
7th and 8th rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Join B at end of last row.
9th to 14th rows: As 3rd to 8th rows.
15th to 17th rows: As 3rd to 5th rows.
18th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. [2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 (7) sc] 5 (7) times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 (3) sc. Turn. 60 (72) sc.

Top of Hat
19th row: (RS). With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 20 (24) sc. Join B. 1 sc in each of next 20 (24) sc. Join A. 1 sc in each of last 20 (24) sc. Turn.
20th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 20 (24) sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 20 (24) sc. With C, 1 sc in each of last 20 (24) sc. Turn.
Rep 19th and 20th rows until hat from beg measures 8 (9)" [20.5 (23) cm], ending on a WS row.

First Point
Note: First point is worked over the 20 (24) C-colored sc only.
21st row: (RS). With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 20 (24) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 20 (24) sc.
**22nd and 23rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
24th row: (decrease row): Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 18 (22) sts.
25th to 27th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
28th row: As 24th row. 16 (20) sc.
29th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
30th row: As 24th row. 14 (18) sc.
31st to 40th (44th) rows: As 29 and 30 rows 5 (7) times more. 4 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. **

Second Point
With RS facing, join B with sl st in first unworked B-colored sc following First Point. 
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 19 (23) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 20 (24) sc. Rep from ** to ** as given for First Point.

Third Point
With RS facing, join B with sl st in first unworked A-colored sc following second point.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 19 (23) sc. Turn. 20 (24) sc.
Rep from ** to ** as given for First Point.

FINISHING
Thread end of yarn of each point through rem sts of last row. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. Sew sides of points tog. Sew sides of hat tog. 
Tassels: (Make 3). Wrap 1 strand of each color tog around a 3½" [9 cm] piece of cardboard 6 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 1½" [4 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. Attach Tassels to top of each point.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m)
Bunny Brown (86028) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: To fit baby 6/12 (18/24) mos.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
• Hat is worked from top down.
• Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch 2.
Ch 3.
1st rnd: 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 8 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Join. 40 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 4 hdc. Join. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Size 18/24 mos only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 5 hdc. Join. 56 hdc.
Both sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 11 (13) hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 11 (13) hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 52 (60) hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until Hat from top measures approx 5½ (6½)" [14 (16.5) cm].
Ribbing: 1st rnd: Ch 2. *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join. Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Ears (make 2).
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 4 times more. Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long end for sewing Ear to Hat.
FINISHING
Sew Ears to top of Hat as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 316 Soft White A, 373 Petal Pink B, 406 Medium Thyme C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
1” (25 mm) button
For detachable flower option: 1” (25 mm) barrette or hair clip, small piece of felt, hot glue gun
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures: 14 (16, 18, 20)” [35.5 (40.5, 45.5, 51) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 12 hdc = 4” (10 cm); 8 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Work 10 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first hdc—10 hdc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to close ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—20 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, hdc in first st, 2 hdc in next st, [hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st] 9 times; join with slip st in first hdc—30 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 1, hdc in first 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, [hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 9 times; join with slip st in first hdc—40 hdc.
Size Small only:
Round 5: Ch 1, hdc in first 19 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 19 sts, 2 hdc in next st; join with slip st in first hdc—42 hdc.
Size Medium only:
Round 5: Ch 1, hdc in first 4 sts, 2 hdc in next st, [hdc in next 4 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 7 times; join with slip st in first hdc—48 hdc.
Sizes Large and Extra Large only:
Round 5: Ch 1, hdc in first 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st, [hdc in first 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 9 times; join with slip st in first hdc—50 hdc.
Round 6: Ch 1, hdc in first 11 (4) sts, 2 (2) hdc in next st [hdc in next 11 (4) sts, 2 (2) hdc in next st] 3 (9) times, hdc in last 2 (0) sts; join with slip st in first hdc—54 (60) hdc.
All sizes:
Round 6 (6, 7, 7): Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, skip next st, [2 hdc in next st, skip next st] 20 (23, 26, 29) times; join with slip st in first hdc—21 (24, 27, 30) 2-hdc groups.
Rounds 7 (7, 8, 8)–13 (14, 15, 16): Slip st in first st, slip st in space before next 2-hdc group, ch 1, 2 hdc in same space, [2 hdc in space before next 2-hdc group] 20 (23, 26, 29) times; join with slip st in first hdc.
Rounds 14 (15, 16, 17)–15 (16, 18, 19): Ch 1, sc in each hdc around; join with slip st in first sc—42 (48, 54, 60) sc. Fasten off.
FLOWERS
Rounded Flower
With B, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Work 10 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first hdc—10 hdc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring when instructed.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, ch 3, skip next st, [sc in next st, ch 3, skip next st] 4 times; join with slip st in first hdc—5 ch-3 sps.
Round 3: (Slip st, ch 1, 3 dc, ch 1, slip st) (petal made) in each ch-3 space—5 petals. Fasten off.
Pointed Flower
With C, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of Rounded Flower.
Round 3: (Slip st, ch 1, 2 dc, picot, 2 dc, ch 1, slip st) (petal made) in each ch-3 space—5 petals. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Place rounded flower on top of pointed flower and place button on top of rounded flower. Position this flower group on hat and sew through all thicknesses.
Detachable Flower Option: Sew both flowers and the button together. Cut a rounded piece of felt to fit center of flower. Glue felt to underside of flower; glue felt to top of barrette or clip.

materials: RED HEART® Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™: 2 balls of 5254 Sunset
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Susan Bates® Yarn needle
stitch markers
Susan Bates® Easy Pompon Maker
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 21” [53.5cm] in head circumference, 8” [20.5 cm] in length from crown to bottom edge.
gauge: 14 extended single crochet = 4" (10 cm); 12 rows = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Make an adjustable loop
Round 1 (RS): Ch 1, 8 extended sc in loop, slip st to first extended sc, pull loop closed. Turn- 8 sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 extended sc in each st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn- 16 sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, *2 extended sc in next st, extended sc in next st, repeat from * around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn- 24 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, *2 extended sc in next st, extended sc in next 2 sts, repeat from * around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn- 32 sts.
Round 5: Ch 1, *2 extended sc in next st, extended sc in next 3 sts, repeat from * around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn- 40 sts.
Round 6: Ch 1, extended sc in each st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 7: Ch 1, *2 extended sc in next st, extended sc in next 4 sts, repeat from * around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn- 48 sts.
Round 8: Ch 1, *[2 extended sc in next st, extended sc in next 2 sts] 4 times*, bpdc around next 2 sts, extended sc in next 5 sts, bpdc around next 4 sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, bpdc around next 4 sts, extended sc in next 5 sts, bpdc around next 2 sts; repeat from * to *, slip st to first extended sc. Turn- 56 sts.
Round 9: Ch 1, *[2 extended sc in next st, extended sc in next 3 sts] 4 times*, cable twist over next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 5 sts, fwd cable over next 4 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, bwd cable over next 4 post sts, extended sc in next 5 sts, cable twist over next 2 post sts; repeat from * to *, slip st to first extended sc. Turn- 64 sts.
Round 10: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 4 sts, skip the next st, *bpdc around next post st, (bpdc, extended sc) in next post st, (extended sc, bpdc) in next post st, bpdc around next post st*, skip next 2 sts; repeat from * to *, skip next st, extended sc in next 4 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 11: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 3 sts, skip next st, fpdc around next post st, (fpdc, extended sc) in next post st, extended sc in next 2 sts, bwd cable over next 4 sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, (extended sc, fpdc) in next post st, fpdc around next post st, skip next st, extended sc in next 3 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 12: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, bpdc around next post 2 sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, bpdc around next post st, (bpdc, extended sc) in next post st, extended sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, bpdc around next post st, (bpdc, extended sc) in next post st, (extended sc, bpdc) in next post st, bpdc around next post st, skip next st, extended sc in next 2 sts, (extended sc, bpdc) in next post st, bpdc around next post st, skip next st, extended sc in next 2 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 13: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc next 2 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 3 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 3 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 14: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 3 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 3 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 15: Repeat Round 13
Round 16: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 3 sts, (extended sc, bpdc) in the next post st, bpdc around the next post st, skip next 2 sts, bpdc around next post st, (bpdc, extended sc) in next post st, extended sc in next 3 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in each remaining st across around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 17: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc next 2 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in each of the next 4 sts, bwd cable over next 4 post sts, extended sc in next 4 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 18: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 4 sts, bpdc around next 4 post sts, extended sc in next 4 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc next 2 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 19: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, (extended sc, fpdc) in next post st, fpdc around next post st, skip next st, extended sc in next 3 sts, bwd cable over next 4 post sts, extended sc in next 3 sts, skip the next st, fpdc around next post st, (fpdc, extended sc) in next post st, extended sc in next 2 sts, fpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 20: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 3 sts, [(extended sc, bpdc) in next post st, bpdc around next post st, skip next st, extended sc next st, skip next st, bpdc around next post st, (bpdc, extended sc) in next post st] twice, extended sc in next 3 sts, bpdc around next 2 post sts, extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 21: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, cable twist over next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 4 sts, extended sc in next post st, fwd cable around the previous and next 3 post sts (skip extended sc in middle of post sts), extended sc in next 2 sts, bwd cable around next 4 post sts (skip extended sc in middle of post sts), extended sc in previous post st (used in bwd cable) extended sc in next 4 sts, cable twist over next 2 post sts, extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 22: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, bpdc around next 2 sts, extended sc in next 5 sts, bpdc around next 4 sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, bpdc around next 4 sts, extended sc in next 5 sts, bpdc around next 2 sts; extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Round 23: Ch 1, extended sc in next 20 sts, cable twist over next 2 post sts, extended sc in next 5 sts, fwd cable over next 4 post sts, extended sc in next 2 sts, bwd cable over next 4 post sts, extended sc in next 5 sts, cable twist over next 2 post sts; extended sc in each remaining st around, slip st to first extended sc. Turn.
Rounds 24 - 27: Repeat Rounds 10 - 13. Do not turn at the end of Round 27.
Round 28 (RS): Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st to first sc, fasten off. Place a stitch marker in 6th st to mark beginning of Right Earflap. Place a stitch marker in 48th st to mark beginning of Left Earflap.
Right Earflap
Join yarn with slip st in marked st for right earflap.
Rows 1 - 5: Ch 1, sc in next 12 sts. Turn -12 sts.
Rows 6 - 15: Ch 1, skip the first sc, sc in each remaining sc across. Turn- 2 sc.
Fasten off.
Left Earflap
Join yarn with slip st in marked st for left earflap. Repeat directions for Right Earflap.
FINISHING
Edging
Round 1: Ch 1, sc evenly around edge of hat, slip st to first sc. Do not turn.
Rnd 2: Slip st in each sc around. Fasten off. Weave in Ends. (Tip: Do not work your slip sts too tight or you will affect the fit of the hat.)
Braids & Poms
Cut (30) pieces of yarn, 48” ( 122 cm) long (15 per braid). Weave 15 strands of yarn thru the bottom edge of one earflap. Divide strands of yarn into 3 sections (10 strands each) and braid. Knot ends to secure.
Make 2 large yarn pompoms and attach one to each braid, if desired.
Note from Marly: I would like to thank Jennifer Pionk for her contribution to the Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™ collection. Jennifer’s sense of style and design aesthetic are a perfect match for this wonderful yarn and pattern collection. I think you will agree that the Entwined Chic hat is the perfect combination of fun, fashionable and chic crochet. Learn more about Jennifer Pink and her designs by visiting her website, ACrochetedSimplicity.com

materials: RED HEART® Heads Up™: 1 ball 565 Grape A and 1 ball 689 Bright Green B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures about 22” (56 cm) circumference.
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = 4” (10 cm) diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in front loop of first sc—8 sc.
Notes
1. Work all stitches in front loops only throughout.
2. Work first stitch of each round in same stitch as joining slip stitch unless otherwise instructed.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st first sc—24 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—32 sc. Fasten off A.
Round 5: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in 2nd sc of Round 4, ch 1, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc. Fasten off B.
Round 7: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in last sc of previous round, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 8 and 9: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.
Round 10: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in the first sc of previous round, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 11: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off B.
Rounds 12–16: Repeat Rounds 7–11.
Round 17: Repeat Round 7.
Round 18: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 12 times; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc.
Round 19: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.
Rounds 20 and 21: Repeat Rounds 10 and 11.
Round 22: Repeat Round 7.
Rounds 23–25: Repeat Round 8 three times. Fasten off A.
Round 26: Repeat Round 10.
Round 27: With B, sc in first st, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last st, ch 1, skip last st; working through both loops, join with slip st in first sc—30 sc and 30 ch-1 spaces.
Fasten off B.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Notes
1. To make a smaller hat, use a hook one size smaller. To make a larger hat, use a hook one size larger.
2. Hat is worked in joined rounds, beginning at top of hat. Join but do not turn rounds. The join serves as back seam of hat.
3. Following Round 1, all stitches are worked in front loops only. This includes the joining slip stitches at the end of each round.
4. Stripes are worked in the following color sequence: 4 rounds with A, 2 rounds with B, [3 rounds with A, 2 rounds with B] 3 times, 4 rounds with A, 2 rounds with B.
5. To change color, fasten off old color and draw up a loop of new color in indicated stitch. The new color is joined in different stitches to help keep back seam straight.

materials: Bernat® Baby BlanketTM (3.5 oz/100 g; 72 yds/65 m)
Main Color (MC): Sand Baby (03010) 100 yds/90 m or 2 balls 138 yds/125 m or 3 balls
Contrast A: Baby Pink (03200) 6 yds/5 m or 1 ball
measurements: To fit sizes 12/18 mos (2/4 yrs) Approx 13 (15)” [33 (38) cm] around x 11 (13)” [28 (33) cm] deep.
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus (  ). When only one number is given, it applies to both sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.
Note: Snood begins at face edge. 
With MC, ch 34 (38). Join in ring with sl st to first ch, being careful to not twist chain. 
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 34 (38) hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 18 (22) hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 sc in each of last 4 hdc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 18 (22) dc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg down longer side measures 11 (13)” [28 (33) cm]. Fasten off. 
EARS
Outer Ear (make 2)
With MC, ch 3. 
1st rnd: 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off. 
Inner Ear (make 2)
With A, ch 3. 
1st rnd: 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off. 
With WS of Outer and Inner Ears tog and with Inner Ear facing, join MC with sl st to any sc. 
1st rnd: Working through both thicknesses, ch 1 and work sc evenly around outer edge of Ears. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off. 
Sew Ears in position as shown in photo.

materials: 1 skein each 1957 Lemon Drop A, and 1401 Pewter B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
Extra hooks in neighboring sizes (see notes)
Susan Bates® Easy Pom Pon Maker, 2" (5 cm) diameter
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 21" (53.5 cm) in circumference and 8" (20.5 cm) in depth.
gauge: 13 sts (including ch sts) = 4" (10 cm); 13 rows = 4" (10 cm) in Moss Stitch.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: redheart.com
©2017 Coats & Clark Page 1 of 2
RED HEART® With Love®: 
1 skein each 1957 Lemon Drop 
A, and 1401 Pewter B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 
6 mm [US J-10] 
Extra hooks in neighboring 
sizes (see notes)
Susan Bates® Easy Pom Pon 
Maker, 2" (5 cm) diameter
Yarn needle
GAUGE: 13 sts (including ch 
sts) = 4" (10 cm); 13 rows =  
4" (10 cm) in Moss Stitch. 
CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use 
any size hook to obtain the 
gauge given.
RED HEART® With 
Love®, Art. E400, 
available in solid 
color 7 oz (198 g), 370 yd 
(338 m); multicolor 5 oz (141 
g), 230 yd (211 m), skeins
What you will need:
continued...
Planned Pooling 
Argyle Hat
Start you pooling adventure with a small 
project like this fresh argyle hat. Then go on 
to create larger garments and throws.
Hat measures 21" (53.5 cm) in 
circumference and 8" (20.5 cm) 
in depth.
NOTES
1. It is highly recommended that you
watch Marly Bird’s tutorial videos
on planned color pooling before 
beginning this project.
2. You may have to tighten or loosen 
some stitches as you go in order to 
keep the color pooling intact. Keep a 
variety of hook sizes on hand to help 
resize your stitches.
3. Different dye lots of the same
colorway may change the number
of stitches obtained in any given
color. Count the number of stitches
YOU get to work through one full
sequence, as well as in each color
section, and maintain that throughout
the pattern.
4. Hat is worked flat and then seamed
using whip stitch.
MOSS STITCH
Ch an even number of sts.
Row 1: Skip 3 ch, sc in next ch, * ch 
1, skip 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; 
repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and 
throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 
1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to 
end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, 
turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and 
throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 
1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to 
end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, 
turn.
Repeat Row 3 only for Moss st.
SPECIAL STITCH
Sc2tog = Single crochet 2 together: 
[Pull up a loop in next st] twice, yo and 
draw through all 3 loops on hook. 
SPECIAL TECHNIQUE
Crab Stitch: Sc in last st of previous row 
or rouned, * sc in next st to the RIGHT 
of last st worked; repeat from * to end 
of row or round (reversing normal 
direction of work).
HAT
With A, ch through 3 full color 
sequences, with the last loop on hook 
being the first loop of a new color just 
after a color change in the yarn. 
Row 1 (right side): Skip 3 ch (counts 
as a st), sc in the 4th ch from hook, * 
ch 1, sc around the foundation ch 
(instead of going into a ch st); repeat 
from * until 1 full color sequences has 
been completed. Count the number 
of sc made in each individual color in 
the colorway and note it down. Work 2 
more full color sequences, maintaining 
the same number of sc made in each 
individual color. Leave remaining ch sts 
unworked. Undo one st repeat (sc, ch 1), 
turn.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as 
a st now and throughout), sc in next 
ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; 
repeat from * to end finishing with a sc 
in last ch-3 space, turn.
Note: As you work this row and all 
remaining rows, you MUST get the 
correct number of sc in each color in 
order to maintain the planned color 
pooling. Change hook sizes, or actual st 
used, to get the correct color in place. 
If you use the same number of sts per 
color that you counted on Row 1, it will 
work out. 
RHC0316-016681M | LAST UPDATED: AUGUST 1, 2019
CROCHET  
SKILL LEVEL
EASY
SHOP KIT
PLANNED POOLING ARGYLE HAT  | CROCHET    1 of 2
Find more ideas & inspiration: redheart.com
©2017 Coats & Clark Page 2 of 2
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a 
st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 
space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; 
repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc 
in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row 
will shift to the left or right by 1 st from 
the previous right side row depending 
on the colorway and if you are right or 
left handed. It doesn’t matter which 
direction the stitch shifts as long as it is 
off-set by 1.
Row 4 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as 
a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 
space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; 
repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc 
in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row 
will shift to the left or right by 1 st from 
the previous wrong side row depending 
on the colorway and if you are right or 
left handed. It doesn’t matter which 
direction the stitch shifts as long as it is 
off-set by 1.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until Hat measures 
7" (18 cm), ending on a Row 4 (wrong 
side row). 
Shape Crown
Row 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a 
st now and throughout), sc in each ch 
space to end, turn.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as 
a st now and throughout), sc in space 
between first 2 sc, * sc2tog over next 
2 spaces between scs; repeat from * to 
end, ending with either a sc or sc2tog 
depending on the number of sts 
remaining, turn.
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a 
st now and throughout), sc in space 
between first 2 sc, * sc2tog over next 
2 spaces between scs; repeat from * to 
end, ending with either a sc or sc2tog 
depending on the number of sts 
remaining, turn.
Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHIING
Squish or stretch the sts on foundation 
chain of Trim to match the width of the 
rest of the piece. You can slide the sts 
around along the foundation chain, as 
with an adjustable ring. Unravel unused 
foundation ch sts and weave in yarn tail 
to secure foundation.
Seaming
With wrong side facing, thread long 
yarn tail through remaining sts on the 
last row of the crown and pull tight like 
a drawstring. Then, use whip st to sew 
the side seam of the hat to the bottom. 
Edging
Turn hat upside down. With right side 
facing and working across foundation 
edge, join B with a slip st foundation ch 
st under last sc of Row 1.
Round 1 (right side): * Ch 1, sc in next 
space to the right (working in Crab st 
and reversing direction) between sc of 
Row 1; repeat from * around, join with 
slip st in beginning ch-1.
Fasten off. 
PomPom
With B, make pompom and attach 
securely to crown of hat.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Chunky™”: 2 balls 7252 Fire
Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10½]
Yarn needle
pompom maker
abbreviations: [ ] or { } = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 22” in circumference.
gauge: 13 sc = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CLOCHE
Ch 4, join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring, join with slip st to first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [sc, ch 1] in each sc around, join with slip st to first sc (6 sc).
Round 3: Ch 2 (counts as sc and ch-1), sc in same space, *[ch 1, sc] 2 times in each space around; repeat from * around, ch 1, join, slip st in next ch-space (12 sc).
Round 4: Ch 2 (counts as sc and ch-1), [sc in next ch-space, ch 1] around, join, slip st in next ch-space.
Round 5: Repeat Round 3 (24 sc).
Rounds 6-8: Repeat Round 4.
Round 9: Ch 2 (counts as sc and ch-1), sc in same space, *[ch 1, sc] in next 5 spaces, [ch 1, sc] 2 times in next space; repeat from * around, end ch 1, join, slip st in next ch-space (28 sc).
Rounds 10-13: Repeat Round 4.
Round 16: Ch 2 (counts as sc and ch-1), sc in same space, *[ch 1, sc] in next 6 spaces, [ch 1, sc] 2 times in next space; repeat from * around, end ch 1, join, slip st in next ch-space (32 sc).
Rounds 17-18: Repeat Round 4.
Round 19: Ch 2 (counts as sc and ch-1), sc in same space, *[ch 1, sc] in next 7 spaces, [ch 1, sc] 2 times in next space; repeat from * around, end ch 1, join, slip st in next ch-space (36 sc).
Rounds 20-24: Repeat Round 4.
Round 25: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each space and sc around, join (72 sc).
Rounds 26-27: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each sc around, join. Fasten off.
Make 2 pompoms and sew to side of hat as shown. Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Kroy Sock FX™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 166 yds/152 m) Copper Colors (57510) 2 balls
Sizes U.S C/2 (2.75) and U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 Susan Bates® Split-Lock stitch count markers
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Stem: With larger hook, ch 7. 
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 
Sl st in each ch to end of chain. Do not turn. 6 sl sts. 
From this point, Beret is worked in a continuous spiral.  Do not join at end of rnds.  Move marker each rnd to mark first st.
Beret: 1st rnd: 6 sc in same sp as last sl st. 6 sc
2nd rnd:  Working behind stem, 2 sc in first sc, placing marker on first of these 2 sts for beg of rnd. 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc. 
4th rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc. 
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
7th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc. 
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around.  48 sc.
9th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 54 sc. 
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around.  60 sc.
11th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 66 sc. 
12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around.  72 sc.
Cont as established, alternating placement of increases and inc 6 sts each rnd to 204 sc. 
Next 4 rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
Dec as follows:
1st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Rep from * around. 198 sc.
2nd rnd:  *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 31 sc. Rep from * around. 
192 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Rep from * around. 
186 sc.
4th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 29 sc. Rep from * around. 
180 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * around. 
174 sc.
6th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. Rep from * around. 
168 sc.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. 
162 sc.
8th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. Rep from * around. 
156 sc.
9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. 
150 sc.
10th rnd:  *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Rep from * around. 
144 sc.
11th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 138 sc.
