12th rnd:  *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Rep from * around. 
132 sc.
13th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. 126 sc.
14th rnd:  *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. Rep from * around. 
120 sc.
15th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 114 sc.
Place second marker at end of last rnd.
Change to smaller hook.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
Rep last rnd until work from 2nd marker measures 1" [2.5 cm]. 
Join last rnd with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (Solids: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m; Prints: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Version 1: Dayglow (3934) 1 ball or 192 yds/176 m
Version 2: Retro Stripe (4971) 1 ball or 192 yds/176 m
Version 3: Pretty ‘n Pink (0722) 1 ball or 192 yds/176 m
Size U.S. I/9 [5.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4” [10 cm]. 14 sts and 9 rows = 4” [10 cm] in Waffle Pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc, unless otherwise stated.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
• Side Band of Hat is worked flat in rows, then joined to Top. 
• Brim is worked around bottom edge of Side Band.
CROWN
Ch 3. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 7 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 28 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 35 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 49 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 63 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off. 70 sc.
SIDE BAND
Ch 15.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 13 dc.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 3. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * 3 times more. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. *1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * 3 times more. Turn.
Last 2 rows form Waffle Pat. 
Cont in Waffle Pat until 39 rows in total have been worked. Do not fasten off.
With WS facing outside, align foundation ch and last row tog.
Joining row: Ch 3. Sl st into 1st foundation ch. *(1 dcfp around next dc. Sl st in next foundation ch) twice. 1 dc in next dc. Sl st around front post of next dc of 1st row. Rep from * 3 times more. 
Turn work RS out.
Ch 1. Work 70 sc evenly around edge of Side Band. Join. Do not fasten off.
Join Crown and Side Band: With WS facing each other, line up seams of Crown and Side Band. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sl st through both thicknesses of 70 sts of Crown and Side Band. Join. Fasten off.
BRIM
Beg at seam on Side Band, join yarn with sl st. Ch 1. Work 70 sc evenly around edge of Side Band. Join.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 105 sc.
2nd to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 105 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, loosely sl st around. Join and fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Heads Up™: 1 ball each of 401 Steel A and 531 Maroon B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
yarn needle
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures about 22” (56 cm) circumference
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = 4” (10 cm) diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 1 (right side): Work 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in front loop of first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st first sc—24 sc. Fasten off A.
Round 4: With right side facing, join B with beg-dc in 13th sc of previous round, dc in same st, dc in next 2 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in beg-dc—32 dc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc. Fasten off B.
Round 6: With right side facing, join A with beg-dc in 17th sc of previous round, dc in same st, dc in next 4 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 4 sts] 7 times; join with slip st in beg-dc—48 dc. Fasten off A.
Round 7: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in 21st dc of previous round, ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc. Fasten off B.
Round 8: With right side facing, join A with beg-dc in 25th sc of previous round, dc in each st around; join with slip st in beg-dc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.
Round 10: With right side facing, join B with beg-dc in 29th sc of previous round, dc in each st around; join with slip st in beg-dc.
Round 11: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off B.
Round 12: With right side facing, join A with beg-dc in 15th sc of previous round, dc in each st around; join with slip st in beg-dc. Fasten off A.
Round 13: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in same st as joining, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last st, ch 1, skip last st; join with slip st in first sc—28 ch-1 spaces and 28 sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch-1 space around; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc. Fasten off B.
Place markers for back and front of hat: Mark joining st of Round 15 for back of hat. Mark 29th st from back of hat marker for center front of hat.
Visor
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in 12th st before center front marker, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st (marked center st), sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts, turn—28 sc. Remove marker from center front st.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first st, slip st in next st, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, dc in next 3 sts, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog, turn; leave last 2 sts unworked—24 sts (not counting the slip st).
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first st, slip st in next st, sc2tog, sc in next 16 sts, sc2tog, slip st in next st; leave last st unworked—18 sts. Fasten off.
Edging Round (right side): With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in marked st at back of hat, remove marker, ch 1, sc in each st to visor, sc evenly spaced across entire edge of visor, sc in each st to end of round; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece Finer™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 385 yds/352 m) Main Color (MC) Unicorn (76027) 1 ball
Contrast A Light Sky (51005) 1 ball
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1.5 yds (1.4 m) each of worsted weight black and white yarn.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Hdcbtw = Work 1 hdc in space between next 2 hdc.
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 sps. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit 18 mos-2 yrs.
gauge: 10 hdc and 9.5 rnds = 4" [10 cm] in Hat Body Pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc. HAT Beg at top of Hat with MC, ch 3. 1st rnd: 6 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch-2 on this and all rnds. 6 hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdcbtw in sp before first hdc. *2 hdbtw in next sp. Rep from * around. Join. 12 hdc. 3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdcbtw in sp before first hdc. *1 hdcbtw in next sp. 2 hdcbtw in next sp. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdcbtw in last sp. Join. 18 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcbtw in sp before first hdc. *2 hdcbtw in next sp. (1 hdcbtw in next sp) twice. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdcbtw in last sp. Join. 24 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdcbtw in sp before first hdc. *(1 hdcbtw in next sp) twice. 2 hdcbtw in next sp. Rep from * around, ending with: (1 hdcbtw in next sp) twice. Join. 32 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcbtw in sp before first hdc. *2 hdcbtw in next sp. (1 hdcbtw in next sp) 3 times. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdcbtw in last sp. Join. 40 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdcbtw in sp before first hdc. *(1 hdcbtw in next sp) 4 times. 2 hdcbtw in next sp. Rep from * 6 times more. (1 hdcbtw in next sp) twice. 2 hdcbtw in next sp. 1 hdcbtw in last sp. Join. 49 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcbtw in sp before first hdc. *1 hdcbtw in next sp. Rep from * around. Join. Rep 8th rnd until work from beg measures 7" [18 cm]. First Earflap: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdcbtw in sp before first hdc. (1 hdcbtw in next sp) 12 times. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. **2nd to 4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdcbtw between first 2 hdc. (1 hdcbtw in next sp) 11 times. 1 hdc in top of ch 2. Turn. 13 hdc.
5th to 8th rows: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sps. *1 hdcbtw in next sp. Rep from * to last 2 sps. Hdc2tog over next sp and top of ch 2. Turn. 5 hdc at end of 8th row.
9th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sps. 1 hdcbtw in next sp. Hdc2tog over next sp and top of ch 2. Fasten off.**
Second Earflap: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 13 unworked sps (center front). Join MC with sl st in next sp. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp. *1 hdcbtw in next sp. Rep from * 11 times more. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. Rep from ** to ** as given for First Earflap.
Edging: (RS). Join A with sl st at base of First Earlap (back of Hat). Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edges of Earflaps and Hat. Join. Fasten off. SPIKE STRIP: With A, ch 53. Spike 1: 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Fasten off.
Spikes 2 to 9: 1st row: Skip next 2 ch. Join A with sl st in next ch. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Turn.
2nd to 6th rows: Work as given for Spike 1.
Spike Strip Edging: (RS). Join MC with sl st in base of Spike 1. Ch 1. Work 13 sc evenly around sides of Spike 1. (Ch 1. Work 13 sc evenly around sides of next Spike) 8 times. Fasten off.
SNOUT: With A, ch 5. 1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 10 sc.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc around, working 3 sc in center sc at each end of rnd. Join. 26 sc at end of 5th rnd. Fasten off.
Note: Do not join end of rnds when making Horns and Tusk. Work in continuous spiral. Move marker up each rnd to keep count.
HORNS (make 2): With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first ch. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. PM on last sc. 10 sc.
2nd to 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 6th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 8 sc.
7th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 6 sc.
8th rnd: (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) twice. 4 sc.
9th rnd: (Sc2tog) twice. Fasten off. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
TUSK: With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first ch. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. PM on last sc. 10 sc.
2nd to 5th rnds: Work as for 6th to 9th rnds of Horn.
Sew Spike Strip, Snout, Horns and Tusk in position (see photo). With black yarn, embroider eyes with satin stitch on Hat as shown adding final sts of white yarn as highlight.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 718 Shocking Pink A, 886 Blue B, 316 Soft White C, and 324 Bright Yellow D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch markers, yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures: 20” (51 cm) in circumference at brim; Length: 7½” (19 cm)
gauge: 17 dc = 5” [12.5 cm]; 9 rows dc = 5” [12.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HAT
With A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 12 dc in ring; join with slip st in first dc—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 dc in each dc around; join with slip st in first dc—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc] 12 times; join with slip st in first dc—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [dc in each of next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 12 times; join with slip st in first dc—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [dc in each of next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 12 times; join with slip st in first dc—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [dc in each of next 9 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 6 times; join with slip st in first dc—66 dc.
Rounds 7–13: Ch 1, dc in each dc around; join with slip st in first dc. Do not fasten off.
Right Earflap
Row 1: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc2tog, dc in each of next 4 dc, dc2tog, dc in next dc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, turn—8 sc.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc2tog, dc in each of next 2 sc, dc2tog, dc in last sc, turn—6 dc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, turn—6 sc.
Row 5: Ch 2, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last sc, turn—4 dc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each dc across—4 sc. Fasten off.
With right earflap facing and back seam to the right, place st marker 26 spaces to the left of the last st from right earflap.
Left Earflap
Join A with slip st in marked st.
Row 1–6: Work same as rounds 1–6 of right earflap.
Border
Round 1: Join A with slip st in center back between earflaps, ch 1, sc evenly around, working sc in each st and in end of each sc row and 3 sc in the end of each dc row; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Eye (make 2)
With B, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 12 dc in ring; join with slip st in first dc—12 dc. Fasten off.
Round 2: Join C with slip st in any dc, ch 1, 2 dc in same dc as join and in each dc around; join with slip st in first dc—24 dc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Nose
With D, leaving a long tail, make an adjustable ring, ch 3.
Row 1: Work 3 dc in ring, ch 3, slip st in ring. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Ear (make 2)
With A, leaving a long tail, make an adjustable ring, ch 3.
Row 1: Work 3 dc in ring, picot, 3 dc in ring, ch 3, slip st in ring. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Cut a 6” (15 cm) strand each of B, C and D. Hold strands together and fold in half to form a loop. Insert crochet hook from right side through picot. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Trim ends evenly.
ASSEMBLY
Refer to photograph as a guide for placement of all pieces.
Braid (make 2)
Cut three 28” (71 cm) strands each of B, C, and D. Separate each color. Thread strands between stitches on last row of earflap. Fold in half and braid doubled strands together until 4” (10 cm) of fringe remains, knot to fasten, trim ends evenly.
Eyes
Center eyes on forehead and with C, sew in place.
Nose
Cut two 4” (10 cm) strands of D, knot one to the top of the first dc on nose, knot 2nd to the top of the 5th dc on nose. Position nose between eyes. Thread tails through eyes and hat to wrong side and tie securely.
Ears
Flatten hat so eyes are facing and centered. Place stitch marker on each side of round 3 where desired. Thread tails from ear to wrong side of hat at stitch marker and tie securely.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds) (00073 Sunshine) 2 balls
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit average lady’s head.
gauge: 16 dc and 8 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 counts as dc at beg of rnd. Ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in next sc. *2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 30 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 40 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 50 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 dc.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 70 dc.
9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 80 dc.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 85 dc.
11th to 14th rnds: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
15th rnd: Ch 3. Miss next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in first of last 2 missed dc – Crossed dc made. *Crossed dc over next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
16th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 27 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 sc in last st. Join with sl st in first sc. 88 sc.
17th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. *3 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 3 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 1. Miss last sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
18th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last 6 sts. 3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 1. Miss last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
19th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. Miss last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
20th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Ch 1. Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Ch 1. Miss last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m) Wine Time (68006) 1 O’Go
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
Locking stitch marker.
abbreviations: Splsc = Split single crochet = Work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
Splsc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc between ‘legs’ of stitch. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 10 splsc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plas-tic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet. 
• Pull tie to remove. 

CROCHET FAIR ISLE HAT   
• Colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cut -ting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.
• Designate each color A, B, C, D, E as indicated in Materials.
• Start crocheting!
• All rnds are joined with a sl st to first sc/splsc.

Ribbing: With E and smaller hook, ch 10.
1st row:  1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sts.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg measures 22" [56 cm] when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off.
Join last row and first row tog with 1 row of sl st to form tube. Do not fasten off.

Beg working in rnds: 
Set-up rnd:  (RS). Ch 1. Working along side edge of ribbing, work 52 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd. Break E. Join D.

Work chart as follows:
1st to 13th rnds: Ch 1. Working in splsc, work Chart to end of chart, reading rnds from right to left and noting 4-st rep will be worked 13 times. Join.

Shape top: 
1st rnd:  With A, ch 1. *1 splsc in each of next 24 sts. Splsc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 splsc in each of next 3 sts. Splsc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. Splsc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 splsc in next st. Splsc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. *Splsc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 10 sts.

Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and secure tightly. 

Pompom: With 1 strand each of A, B, C, D, and E held tog, wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 15 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew pompom to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Unforgettable Waves™: 2 balls 3970 Prairie
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: dc2tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next ch-1 space of V-st, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all loops on hook
V-Stitch: (Dc, ch 1, dc) all in the same st.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat circumference: 20” [51 cm]. One size fits most.
gauge: 16 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 20 rows = 4” [10 cm] in slip stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Brim
Ch 9.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 8 sts.
Rows 2-100: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, slip st in each st across.
Joining Row: Ch 1, turn, with wrong sides facing and right sides rows together, fold band in half to line up sts of first and last rows, working through both layers, sc in each st across to join ends.
Turn Brim right side out.

Body
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1 here and throughout), dc in same st, [skip 3 rows, V-st in next row] around, slip st in 3rd ch of beg ch-4 – 25 V-sts.
Rounds 2-14: Ch 4, dc in ch-1 space, [V-st in ch-1 space of next V-st] around, slip st in 3rd ch of beg ch-4.

Shape Crown
Round 15: Ch 3, [dc2tog in ch-1 space of next 2 V-sts] 12 times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

FINISHING
Weave long tail through sts of last row and pull to close top of crown. Secure end.
Weave in ends.

materials: Stitch Nation by Debbie Stoller™ “Washable Ewe™”: 1 Ball 3582 Lilac.
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8].
Yarn needle, stitch marker.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 21” circumference x 9” tall and will stretch to fit.
gauge: 5 rounds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size Hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 8 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—9 dc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), Fpdc around beginning ch, [hdc in next dc, Fpdc around same dc] 8 times; do not join—9 hdc and 9 post sts. Place marker in first hdc for beginning of round. Move marker up as work progresses.
Round 3: [Hdc in next hdc, Fpdc around same hdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc] 9 times—9 hdc and 18 post sts.
Round 4: [Hdc in next hdc, Fpdc around same hdc, Fpdc around each of next 2 Fpdc] 9 times—9 hdc and 27 post sts.
Round 5: [Hdc in next hdc, Fpdc around same hdc, Fpdc around each of next 3 Fpdc] 9 times—9 hdc and 36 post sts.
Round 6: [Hdc in next hdc, Fpdc around same hdc, Fpdc around each of next 4 Fpdc] 9 times—9 hdc and 45 post sts.
Round 7: [Skip next hdc, 2 hdc in next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc, Fpdc around each of next 4 Fpdc] 9 times—18 hdc and 45 post sts.
Round 8: [Skip next hdc, hdc in next hdc, 2 hdc in next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc, Fpdc around each of next 4 Fpdc] 9 times—27 hdc and 45 post-sts. Note: Piece should measure about 6” in diameter at this point.
Rounds 9–11: [Skip next hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc, hdc in next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc, Fpdc around each of next 4 Fpdc] 9 times – 27 hdc and nine 5-post-st groups.
Round 12: [Skip next hdc, hdc in next 4 sts, Fpdc2tog working over first 2 Fpdc of the 5-post-st group, Fpdc around each of next 3 Fpdc] 9 times—36 hdc and nine 4-post-st groups.
Notes: In the following rounds, post sts are worked around the sts of each post-st group. Always begin each Split-Fpdc2tog by working the first leg around the first leg of the Fpdc2tog in the previous round (the last hdc was worked into this FPdc2tog), skip the 2nd leg of the Fpdc2tog, then work the 2nd leg around the following Fpdc.
Round 13: [Skip next hdc, hdc in next 5 sts, Split-Fpdc2tog working around the first leg of the Fpdc2tog and then around the next Fpdc, Fpdc around each of next 2 Fpdc] 9 times—45 hdc and nine 3-post-st groups.
Round 14: [Skip next hdc, hdc in next 6 sts, Split-Fpdc2tog working around the first leg of the Fpdc2tog and then around the next Fpdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc] 9 times—54 hdc and nine 2-post-st groups.
Round 15: [Skip next hdc, hdc in next 7 sts, Split-Fpdc2tog working around the first leg of the Fpdc2tog and then around the next Fpdc] 9 times—63 hdc and 9 post sts.
Round 16: [Skip next hdc, hdc in next 7 sts, Fpdc around next Fpdc2tog (working around both legs of the Fpdc2tog)] 9 times.
Rounds 17 and 18: [Hdc in next 7 sts, Fpdc around next Fpdc] 9 times.
Round 19: [Hdc in next 6 hdc, skip next hdc, 2 Fpdc around next Fpdc] 9 times—54 hdc and 18 post sts.
Round 20: [Hdc in next 5 hdc, skip next hdc, 2 Fpdc around next Fpdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc] 9 times—45 hdc and 27 post sts.
Round 21: [Hdc in next 4 hdc, skip next hdc, 2 Fpdc around next Fpdc, Fpdc around each of next 2 Fpdc] 9 times—36 hdc and 36 post sts.
Round 22: [Hdc in next 3 hdc, skip next hdc, 2 Fpdc around next Fpdc, Fpdc around each of next 3 Fpdc] 9 times—27 hdc and 45 post sts.
Round 23: [Hdc in next 2 hdc, skip next hdc, 2 Fpdc around next Fpdc, Fpdc around each of next 4 Fpdc] 9 times—18 hdc and 54 post sts.
Round 24: [Hdc in next hdc, skip next hdc, 2 Fpdc around next Fpdc, Fpdc around each of next 5 Fpdc] 9 times—9 hdc and 63 post sts.
Round 25: [Skip next hdc, 2 Fpdc around next Fpdc, Fpdc around each of next 6 Fpdc] 9 times—72 post sts.
Round 26: Fpdc around each Fpdc around.
Round 27: Fpdc around each of next 69 Fpdc, Fphdc around next Fpdc, Fpsc around next Fpdc, slip st in next Fpdc, turn.
Round 28 (Wrong Side): Sc in each st around by inserting hook through unused top loops of both Round 26 and Round 27 at the same time. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: Stitch Club Chunky Crochet Beanie + Tutorial
materials: Patons ® Norse™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 211 yds /193 m) Tawny Coral (91008) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 11 sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in scbl pat.
instructions:
Note: Hat is worked sideways
Ch 42.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 41 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Leave last sc unworked. 40 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Sl st in back loop only of first sc. 1 scbl in next sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. 39 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. Leave last st unworked. 38 sts. Turn.
5th row: Sl st in back loop only of first sc. 1 scbl in next sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. 37 sts. Turn.
6th to 9th rows: As 4th and 5th rows twice more. 33 sts.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row, working into skipped sts and sl sts of previous rows. 41 sc. Turn.
11th to 13th rows: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 13th rows 3 times more. Break yarn leaving a long end. Thread yarn through side of sts at top of Hat and cinch to close.
FINISHING
With yarn end, sew foundation ch and last row tog. Thread yarn through side of sts at top of Hat and cinch to close.

materials: Red Heart™ Super Saver™ O’Go™ (Solids: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m; Prints: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Version 1 - Jeweltone (7195) 1 O’Go
Version 2 - Gold (7160) 1 O’Go
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in indicated space. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with O’Go, locate the end of the yarn.
• Carefully cut plastic tie where ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull to remove tie.
• Ch-3 at beg of rnds counts as dc throughout.

Version 1
With desired color and larger hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 3. [1 dc. Ch 1. (2 dc. ch 1) 5 times] all in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 6 clusters of 2-dc and 6 ch-1 sps.
2nd rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 12 clusters of 2-dc and 12 ch-1 sps.
3rd rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off. 12 clusters of 3-dc and 12 ch-1 sps.
4th rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 2-dc and 24 ch-1 sps.
5th rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 2-dc and 24 ch-1 sps.
6th rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 3-dc and 24 ch-1 sps.
7th rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *(2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 2-dc, 12 clusters of 3-dc and 36 ch-1 sps.
8th to 11th rnds: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. *2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 36 clusters of 2-dc and 36 ch-1 sps.
12th rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Dc2tog, drawing up first loop in same sp as last dc and 2nd loop in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in same sp as last st. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Dc2tog, drawing up first loop in same sp as last dc and 2nd loop in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in same sp as last st. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 3-dc and 24 ch-1 sps.
13th rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 24 clusters of 2-dc and 24 ch-1 sps.
Change to smaller hook for final edging.
14th rnd: Join next color with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
15th and 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Version 2
Work as given for Version 1 noting the following:
Notes:
• Do not fasten off at end of each rnd.
• At beg of each rnd, sl st into each dc to next ch-1 sp. Sl st in ch-1 sp. Proceed as written for rnd.
• Disregard all references to color changes.

materials: Red Heart ® Hygge™ (5 oz/141 g; 132 yds/121 m) Contrast A Sterling (8340) 1 ball
Red Heart® Hygge Fur™ (7 oz/200 g; 260 yds/238 m) Contrast B Cotton Tail (0108) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) and U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Stitch marker
abbreviations: Beglnkdc = Insert hook down through horizontal bar in center of previous stitch, yoh and draw up a loop. Insert hook into ring, yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops on hook – Beginning Linked Dc made.

Lnkdc = Insert hook down through horizontal bar in center of previous stitch, yoh and draw up a loop. Insert hook in next stitch, yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh, and draw through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops on hook. See diagram shown right.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: Red Heart ® Hygge™: 11 sc and 13 rows = 4” [10 cm] with larger hook. Red Heart® Hygge Fur™: 11 sc and 13 rows = 4” [10 cm] with smaller hook and 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
Note: Rnds are worked as a spiral. First lnkdc of each rnd is worked into last lnkdc of previous rnd.

BODY OF HAT
With A and larger hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. Set-up: (2 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. Place marker in dc. 8 beglnkdc) in ring. 1 lnkdc in each st to marker. 12 sts. 1st rnd: *1 lnkdc in next st. 2 lnkdc in next st. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
2nd rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 2 sts. 2 lnkdc in next st. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
3rd rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 3 sts. 2 lnkdc in next st. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
4th rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 4 sts. 2 lnkdc in next st. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
5th rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 5 sts. 2 lnkdc in next st. Rep from * around. 42 sts.
6th rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 6 sts. 2 lnkdc in next st. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
7th rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 7 sts. 2 lnkdc in next st. Rep from * around. 54 sts.
8th rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 8 sts. 2 lnkdc in next st. Rep from * around. 60 sts.
9th to 12th rnds: 1 lnkdc in each st around. 
13th rnd: 1 lnkdc in each st to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Sl st in last st of rnd, and first 4 sts of following rnd. 

RIGHT EARFLAP
**1st row: (RS). Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 12 sts.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
9th and 10th rows: As 7th and 8th rows. 10 sts.
11th to 13th rows: As 7th row. 4 sts. Fasten off.**

RIGHT EARFLAP LINING
With WS of Hat facing and using 2 strands of yarn held tog and smaller hook, join B with sl st to first unworked front loop on far right of Right Earflap. Work from ** to ** as given for Right Earflap.

FRONT FLAP
With RS of Hat facing, join A to first unworked st beside Right Earflap.
***1st row: (RS). Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of next 24 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 24 sc. Turn.
11th and 12th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 20 sts at end of 12th row.
Fasten off.***

FRONT FLAP LINING
With WS of Hat facing and using 2 strands of yarn held tog and smaller hook, join B with sl st to first unworked front loop on far right of Front Flap. Work from *** to *** as given for Front Flap.

LEFT EARFLAP
With RS of Hat facing, join A to first unworked st beside Front Flap. Work from ** to ** as given for Right Earflap.

LEFT EARFLAP LINING
With WS of Hat facing and using 2 strands of yarn held tog and smaller hook, join B with sl st to first unworked front loop on far right of Left Earflap. Work from ** to ** as given for Right Earflap.

EDGING
With RS of Hat facing and using 2 strands of yarn held tog and smaller hook, join B with sl st to center back of Hat. Work 1 row of sc evenly around outer edge of Hat as shown in photo, working through both thicknesses of Flap and Lining sections. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red A and 316 Soft White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J–10]
Yarn needle, 2 stitch markers
Susan Bates® Easy–Wrap Pom Pon Maker
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 16 (18)" (40.5 [45.5] cm) circumference at brim. Beard measures 10" at widest x 2½" long (25.5 x 6.5 cm).
gauge: 12 sts = 4" (10 cm); 14 rows = 4" (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 48 (54); taking care not to twist, join with slip st in first ch.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in each ch around. Do not join. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed—48 (54) sc.
Rounds 2–6: Sc in each sc around.
Size Large only:
Round 7: [Sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—48 sc.
Rounds 8–13: Sc in each sc around.
Both sizes:
Round 7 (14): [Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—42 sc.
Rounds 8 (15)–13 (20): Sc in each sc around.
Round 14 (21): [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 15 (22)–20 (27): Sc in each sc around.
Round 21 (28): [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc.
Rounds 22 (29)–27 (34): Sc in each sc around.
Round 28 (35): [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Rounds 29 (36)–34 (41): Sc in each sc around.
Round 35 (42): [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 36 (43)–41 (48): Sc in each sc around.
Round 42 (49): [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Rounds 43 (50)–45 (52): Sc in each sc around; join with slip st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Brim
Round 1 (wrong side): With right side facing and working in opposite side of foundation ch, join B with sc in any ch, sc in each ch around; join with slip st in first sc, turn—48 (54) sc.
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Round 4: Ch 1, working in back loops only; join with slip st in first sc, turn. Brim should now turn up.
Rounds 5 and 6: Repeat Round 2 twice.
Round 7: Ch 1, working in back loops only, (sc, ch 5, sc) in each sc; join with slip st in first sc, turn—96 (108) sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, holding each ch-5 group to front of work and working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Rounds 9–12: Repeat Rounds 7 and 8 twice—384 (432) sc. Fasten off.
BEARD
With B, ch 25.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch to last ch, 2 sc in last ch, turn—26 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, (sc, ch 3, sc) in first sc, [ch 3, sc] 10 times, [ch 3, sc2tog] twice, [ch 3, sc] 10 times, [ch 3, sc] twice in last sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 10 sc, [sc2tog] twice, sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2.
Row 7: Ch 1, working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 9 sc, ch 4, skip next 6 sc, sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—22 sc and 1 ch-4 space.
Row 8: Ch 1, working in back loops only, (sc, ch 3, sc) in first sc, [ch 3, sc] 9 times, sc in next sc, 4 sc in ch-4 space, sc in next sc, [ch 3, sc] 9 times, (sc, ch 3, sc) in last sc, turn—28 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, holding each ch-3 group to front of work and working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 10 sc, working in both loops, sc in next 6 sc, working in back loops only, sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in last sc—30 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold last round at top of hat in half and stitch edges together.
With B and pompom maker, make a 2½" (6.5 cm) pom pom and sew to top end of hat.
Place hat on wearer’s head and adjust beard to fit. Stitching across ends of rows, sew beard to wrong side of brim.
Optional: Cut two 8" (20.5 cm) lengths of B, attach securely to each end of Row 7 or 8 of beard. Tie beard to Round 2 of hat brim.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each 9600 White A, 9620 Baby Green B, 9702 Strawberry C, 9700 Baby Pink D, and 9200 Baby Yellow E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75mm [US F-5] and 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
stitch marker
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 18” (45.5 cm) circumference at brim.
gauge: 14 sts = 3” (7.5 cm); 10 rows = 2” (5 cm) in single crochet.
instructions:
Beginning at crown, with larger hook and A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc and 6 ch-2 spaces.
Round 6: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—36 sc.
Round 7: *Sc in next sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—30 sc and 6 ch-2 spaces.
Round 8: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—48 sc.
Round 9: *Sc in next sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—42 sc and 6 ch-2 spaces.
Round 10: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—60 sc.
Round 11: *Sc in next sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—54 sc and 6 ch-2 spaces.
Round 12: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—72 sc.
Round 13: *Sc in next sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 10 sc; repeat from * 4 times, ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 5 sc—60 sc and 6 ch-2 spaces.
Round 14: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next 10 sc; repeat from * 4 times, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next 5 sc—72 sc.
Rounds 15–26: Repeat Rounds 13 and 14 six times; change to B at end of Round 26.
Rounds 27–32: Sc in each sc around; change to A at end of Round 32.
Round 33: *Sc in next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—78 sc.
Round 34: *Sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—84 sc.
Round 35: Sc in each sc around.
Round 36: *Slip st in next sc, ch 2, skip next sc; repeat from * around to last sc, slip st in last sc; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
Flower (make 10 - 5 each with C and D)
With smaller hook, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: Slip st in next sc, ch 1, 2 hdc in same sc (petal made), *ch 1, slip st in next sc, ch 1, 2 hdc in same sc (petal made); repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in first slip st—6 petals. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
To make center of flower, with E, embroider satin stitches over Round 1 of each flower. Evenly space flowers around hat on B-colored band, alternating colors. With end tails, sew in place around center with back stitches to puff it up slightly. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Stellar™: 2 balls of 9935 Nova.
OR RED HEART® Stellar™ 8 oz: 1 ball 9935 Nova
Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm [US K-10½]
Yarn needle
stitch marker
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st.
measurements: Hat measures 26 (30)” (71 [76] cm) in circumference.
gauge: 8 sts and 16 rows in sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 4; join with a slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring, do not join — 8 sc. Work in a spiral, marking be of each round moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 16 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 24 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in each of next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 32 sc
Round 5: *Sc in each of next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 40 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in each of next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 48 sts.
Round 7: *Sc in each of next 11 (5) sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 52 (56) sc.
Size L Only
Round 8: *Sc in each of next 13 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 60 sc.
Both Sizes
Rounds 8-21 (9-21): Sc in each st around – 52 (60) sc.
Brim
Round 22: Ch 2 (counts as dc), dc in each st around; join with a slip st in top of beg ch-2 – 52 (60) dc.
Round 23: Repeat Row 22.
Round 24: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc – 52 (60) sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Roll up brim.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 368 Paddy Green A, 1 skein each 312 Black B, 321 Gold C, and 672 Spring Green D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [H-8 US] and 5.5mm [I-9 US]
Yarn needle, straight pins
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 6½ (7)” [16.5 (18 cm) high x 20 (22”) [51 (56 cm)] circumference.
gauge: 12 sc = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet with larger hook and 2 strands held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Crown
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held together, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—16 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—24 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—32 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—40 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—48 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—56 sc.
Small size only:
Round 8: [Sc in next 13 sts, 2 sc in next st] 4 times—60 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each st around.
Round 10: [Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st] 4 times—68 sc.
Round 11-17: Repeat Round 9 seven times.
Round 18: [Sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog] 4 times—60 sc.
Rounds 19–26: Repeat Round 9 eight times.
Large Size only:
Round 8: [Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—64 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each st around.
Round 10: [Sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—72 sc.
Round 11-17: Repeat Round 9 seven times.
Round 18: [Sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog] 8 times—64 sc.
Rounds 19–28: Repeat Round 9 eight times.
Brim
Small Size only:
Rounds 27 and 28: Repeat Rounds 10 and 9—68 sc.
Round 29: [Sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st] 4 times—76 sc.
Round 30: Repeat Round 9.
Round 31: [Dc in next 8 sts, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 9 sts, 2 dc in next st] 4 times—84 dc.
Round 32: Repeat Round 9. Fasten off.
Large Size Only:
Rounds 29 and 30: Repeat Rounds 10 and 9—72 sc.
Round 31: [Sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—80 sc.
Round 32: Repeat Round 9.
Round 33: [Dc in next 9 sts, 2 dc in next st] 8 times—88 dc.
Round 34: Repeat Round 9. Fasten off.
Directions are for a small. Changes for large size are in parentheses.
Special Stitch
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Notes
1. Crown and brim are worked in continuous rounds (spiral) with right side facing at all times. Do not join until instructed. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
2. Crown and brim are worked with 2 strands of yarn held together; hat band, buckle, and three leaf clovers are made with 1 strand each and sewn to hat.
Hat Band
With larger hook and B, ch 9 (11).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—8 (10) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until hat band fits tightly around the hat just above the brim. Fasten off.
Buckle
With smaller hook and C, ch 30; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), 2 dc in same st as join, *dc in next 6 ch, 3 dc in next ch, dc in next 7 ch*, 3 dc in next ch; repeat from * to * once; join with slip st to top of beginning ch-3—38 dc. Fasten off.
Three Leaf Clovers (make 2)
Leaf (make 3)
With smaller hook and D, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3, (tr, dc, hdc, 3 sc, hdc, dc, tr, ch 3, slip st) in ring. Fasten off.
Select one leaf as center leaf. Sew remaining leaves to center leaf through 3 sc, joining through 2 sc on each outer leaf.
Stem
With smaller hook, join D with slip st to bottom of the center leaf.
Row 1: Ch 11, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With right side facing, sew ends of hat band together. Sew buckle to front of hat band. Using photograph as a guide, cross ends of stems of three leaf clovers, pin clovers to right side of hat band, and sew in place. Position hat band over crown close to brim and sew in place. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (Solids: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Sizes Small Large
Contrast A Gold (7160) 1 1 O’Go
Contrast B Black (7120) 1 1 O’Go
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
First fdc (foundation double crochet) = Ch 3. Yoh and draw up a loop in 3rd ch from hook. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook – chain made. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Fdc = Yoh and draw up a loop in 'chain' of previous stitch. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook – chain made. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Fits head circumference: Small 20" [51 cm], Large 22" [56 cm]
gauge: 12 dc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
HAT
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
1st rnd: With A, first fdc. Work 53 ( 59) fdc. Join. 54 ( 60) sts. With beg length of yarn, sew side edge of 1st rnd.
2nd and 3rd rnds:  Ch 2. Dcfp around first st. Dcbp around next st. *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Break A. Join with B.
4th rnd: With B, ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
6th and 7th rnds:  Ch 2. Working in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
8th rnd:  Ch 2, Working in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 dc in in each st around. Join.
9th to 16th rnds:  As 5th to 8th rnds twice.
17th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 7 ( 3) sts. Dc2tog. *1 dc in each of next 7 ( 3) sts. Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sts.
18th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 2 sts. Dc2tog. *1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sts.
19th rnd:  Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. Ddc2tog. *1 dc in next st. Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
20th rnd: Ch 2. *Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
FINISHING
Weave end through last rnd. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. 
Pompom:
With A, wind yarn around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hood. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 672 Spring Green A, 3945 Blue Suede B, 254 Pumpkin C, and 512 Turqua D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [US H-8] and 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
Stitch markers
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures 14 (16, 18)” (35.5 [40.5, 45.5] cm) in circumference at brim.
gauge: 10 dc = 3” (7.5 cm); 8 rows = 4” (10 cm) in pattern with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With larger hook and A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Work 12 dc in ring; join with slip st in first dc—12 dc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1 (does not count as a st here and throughout), 2 dc in each st around; change to B; join with slip st in first dc—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 1, hdc in first st, 2 hdc in next st, [hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st] 11 times; change to A; join with slip st in first hdc—36 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 1, dc in first 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st] 11 times; join with slip st in first dc—48 dc.
Size Small only:
Round 5: Ch 1, dc in each st around; change to C; join with slip st in first dc.
Sizes Medium and Large only:
Round 5: Ch 1, dc in first 7 (3) sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 7 (3) sts, 2 dc in next st] 5 (11) times; change to C; join with slip st in first dc—54 (60) dc.
All sizes:
Round 6: Ch 1, hdc in each st around; change to A; join with slip st in first hdc.
Rounds 7 and 8: Ch 1, dc in each st around; change to D; join with slip st in first dc.
Round 9: Repeat Round 6.
Size Small only:
Rounds 10 and 11: Ch 1, dc in each st around; join with slip st in first dc. Do not fasten off.
Directions are for size Small. Changes for sizes Medium and Large are in parentheses.
Hat measures 14 (16, 18)” (35.5 [40.5, 45.5] cm) in circumference at brim.
Special Stitch
dc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Special Techniques
Adjustable-ring method: Wrap yarn in a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail firmly between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work stitches of first round in the ring, working over both strands (the tail and the ring). After the first round of stitches is worked, pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Join with sc: Place a slip knot on hook, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook.
Notes
1. Hat is worked in joined rounds with right facing at all times. Earflaps are worked back and forth in rows.
2. Dino spines are made separately in continuous rounds (spirals) and sewn to back of hat. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
3. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Cut old color.
Sizes Medium and Large only:
Round 10: Ch 1, dc in each st around; join with slip st in first dc.
Round 11: Ch 1, dc in each st around; change to B; join with slip st in first dc.
Round 12: Repeat Round 6.
Round 13: Ch 1, dc in each st around; join with slip st in first dc.
Do not fasten off.
Size Large only:
Round 14: Repeat Round 13. Do not fasten off.
Right Earflap
Row 1: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc2tog, dc in next 4 sts, dc2tog, dc in next st; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc2tog, dc in next 2 sts, dc2tog, dc in last st, turn—6 dc.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2.
Row 5: Ch 2, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last st—4 sc.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off.
Left Earflap
With right side of Round 11 (13, 14) facing, join A with sc in 20th (22nd, 24th) stitch to the left of the right earflap.
Work same as Rows 1–6 of right earflap.
Border
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join B with sc in any st at center back of hat, sc in each st around, working sc in end of each sc row and 3 sc in end of each dc row of ear flaps; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Dino Spines
Size Small only: make 4 – 1 each with A, B, C, and D
Sizes Medium and Large only: make 5 – 2 with A, 1 each with B, C, and D
With smaller hook, make an adjustable loop, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring—6 sc. Do not join. Work in continuous rounds. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times—9 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times—12 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 3 times—15 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 3 times—18 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each st around.
Round 7: Sc in next 17 sts, slip st in next st; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Braids
Cut six 28” (71 cm) lengths of each color. Separate each 6-strand group into 2 hanks of 3 strands each.
Thread one hank of each color through last row of earflap and fold over so strands are doubled. Braid doubled hanks until 4” (10 cm) of strands remain, tie an overhand knot tightly, and trim ends evenly. Repeat with remaining hanks for other earflap.
Dino Spines
Fold hat in half so earflaps and edges are evenly aligned. Using photograph as a guide and beginning at top of hat, place stitch markers on center back at fold for placement of each dino spine.
Weave in ends of dino spines. Flatten each spine and with A, sew in place, working through the back loops only of rounds of contrasting color.
Weave in remaining ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee Baby™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 724 yds/662 m)
Main Color (MC) Bing Cherry (85002) 1 1 1 ball
Contrast A Dinosaur (85006) 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
4 yds [3.75 m] yellow yarn for ‘seed’ embroidery.
measurements: To fit baby 6 (12-18/24) months.
gauge: 16 hdc and 13 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes.

Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of each rnd does not count as hdc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.

HAT
With MC, ch 3.
1st rnd: 12 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 24 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join hdc. 36 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join. 48 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 11 (3-2) hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 11 (3-2) hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 11 (3-1) hdc. Join. 52 (60-64) hdc.

6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4½ (5-5)" [11.5 (12.5-12.5) cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Turn.
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join. Turn.
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

Leaf Clusters (make 2)
With A, ch 15.
First Leaf: 1st rnd: **1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 6 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in first ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 6 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc.** Do not fasten off, proceed as follows.
Second Leaf: Ch 15. 1st rnd: Work from ** to ** as given for First Leaf. Fasten off.
Stem: With A, ch 7. Join in rnd with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Do not join. Work rem rnds in spiral.
2nd to 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog) twice. Join. Break yarn leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts (top of Stem).

FINISHING
Join Leaf Clusters and Stem: Sew centers of Leaf Clusters tog to form 4 leaf shape. Sew Stem securely in center. Pin Leaf Clusters/Stem to top of Hat with leaves evenly placed around. Using backstitch and A, sew center of each leaf to Hat leaving sides of leaves open.
Seeds: With yellow yarn, embroider 3 rounds of straight stitches approx. 1" [2.5 cm] apart (see photo).

materials: Bernat® Softee® Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Blue Waves (69025) 1 ball
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Yarn needle
2 stitch markers
measurements: One size to fit head circumference 6/12 mos 16" [40.5 cm]
gauge: 20 sc and 22 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Hat is worked from top down.
• Crown of Hat is worked in a continuous spiral. Do not join rnds of top unless otherwise stated. Move marker up each rnd to maintain rnd count.
• Join rnds of Side and Brim with sl st to first st.
Beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here.
Crown: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 7 sc in ring. 7 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 21 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 28 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 35 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 49 sc.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc.
9th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 63 sc.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 70 sc.
11th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 77 sc.
12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 84 sc.
Working in back loop only, join with sl st to first st. PM.
Side: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Rep last rnd until work from marker measures 21/2" [6.5 cm].
Brim: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 112 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join. 140 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join. 168 sc.
8th and 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join. 196 sc.
11th and 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™ Blend”: 2 balls 1740 Rose.
Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6] and 5mm [US H-8].
Split-lock stitch marker
yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Cap fits most women. Finished Circumference = 20¾”.
gauge: 15 sts = 4”; 17 rounds = 4” in sc with larger hook.
instructions:
CAP
Round 1: With larger hook, ch 2, 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, pm in last st of round. Move marker up at end of each round – 6 sc.
Round 2: Sc in front and back loop of each sc around – 12 sc.
Continue alternating front and back loop throughout. Increase by working 1 sc in front and back loop of one st as follows.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Continue in this manner to increase 6 sc every round with one more sc between increases until there are 78 sc. Then work even in continuous rounds until work measures 7½” from center; join with a slip st in next sc; TURN.
Brim
With smaller hook, ch 1, work even in continuous rounds of sc in both loops (NOT alternating front and back loops as before) for 7 rounds; join in next sc. Fasten off leaving a long tail. Roll sc brim to the outside and sew in place.
Band
With larger hook, ch 75.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 74 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2, * skip next sc, (dc, ch 1, dc) all in next sc, skip next sc; repeat from * to last sc; dc in last sc; turn.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 2, * (dc, ch 1, dc) all in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last st; dc in top of ch-2; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across; do NOT turn – 74 sc.
Row 6: With right side still facing, ch 1, * sc in next sc to the RIGHT; repeat from * across; bring opposite end of band up and with right sides facing, slip st ends of band together; ch 1, ** sc in next sc to the RIGHT; repeat from ** around opposite edge. Fasten off.
Flower
Ch 30, (dc, ch 3, slip st, [ch 3, dc, ch 3, slip st] twice) all in 4th ch from hook, * (slip st, ch 3, dc, ch 3, slip st) all in next ch; repeat from * across. Fasten off. Starting with the first 3 petals, spiral the petals around in layers and stitch in place from the back. Sew flower on band to cover seam.
Slide band over hat and tack in place.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Spring Green (0672) - 1 ball or 165 yds/151 m
Contrast B Black (0312) - 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Size U.S I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Tape measure.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 12 half double crochet (hdc) and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.
Note:
Join all rounds (rnds) with slip stitch (sl st) to first stitch (st).

Slip Knot
Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then draw through to make slip knot.

Chain
Yarn over hook (Yoh), draw through loop – 1 chain made.

HAT
With A, chain (ch) 3.
1st round (rnd): 10 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first hdc in this rnd and all subsequent rnds. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
7th to 14th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
15th rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 hdc.
16th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 hdc.
17th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 90 hdc.
18th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 100 hdc.
19th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 110 hdc.
20th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 120 hdc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. Slip stitch (sl st) in each hdc around. Join.
Fasten off.

EYES (make 2 alike)
With A, chain (ch) 3.
1st rnd: 10 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
Fasten off.

EYEBALLS (make 2 alike)
With B, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
Fasten off.

Sew Eyeballs to Eyes as shown in photo.
Sew Eyes to top of hat as shown in photo.
With B, embroider Mouth with outline stitch on Hat as shown in photo.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 97 yds/87 m) Version 1 Blush Pink (27034) 1 ball or 39 yds/35 m
Version 2 Velveteal (27008) 1 ball or 39 yds/35 m
Size U.S. Q (15 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop
measurements: One Size to fit Adult.
gauge: 5 sc and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note
• Join with sl st to first sc at end of each rnd.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 30 sc.
7th and 8th rnds: As 5th rnd twice.
9th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 scbl in first sc. *1 scbl in each of next 2 sc. 2 scbl in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 2 sc. Join. 40 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 50 sc.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Accent™: 1 Skein each 361 Putty A, 575 Hyacinth B, and 501 Paradise C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 20” (51 cm) in circumference
instructions:
With A, ch 62.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc and dc in same st, *skip 2 ch, work (sc, hdc, dc) in next ch; repeat from * across to last 3 ch, skip 2 ch, sc in last ch.
Rounds 2-10: *Ch 1, turn, (sc, hdc, dc) in first sc, skip next dc and hdc, (sc, hdc, dc) in next sc; repeat from * across to last 3 sts, skip next dc and hdc, sc in sc. Do not fasten off.
Joining Row: With right sides together, fold Hat in half crosswise, turn to work alongside edges, working through both layers along edges of rows, sc evenly spaced to Row 1. Do not fasten off.
Top Edge
Round 1: With wrong side facing, turn to work opposite foundation ch, ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), *hdc in sc, hdc in ch-2 space; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 40 hdc.
Rounds 2-4: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc, slip st in top of beginning ch. Do not fasten off.
Joining Row: Flatten Hat and working through both layers, slip st across 20 sts to join top of Hat.
Fasten off.
Band
Round 1: With right side facing, join B in seam on lower edge of Hat, ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in first sc to join – 60 sts.
Rounds 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in each sc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 5-6: With C, ch 2, hdc in each hdc around, slip st in beginning ch.
Rounds 7-8: Ch 1, sc in each hdc around, slip st into first st. Fasten off.
Round 9: With A, ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Pacific Teal (77203) 1 1 1 ball
Contrast A Cloverleaf (77222) 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in indicated space. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit average head sizes: Child 2/4 yrs (Child 6/8 yrs -Adult).
gauge: 9 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Beg at crown, with MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in ring – beg cluster made. (Ch 1. Cluster) 7 times in ring. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 8 clusters.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. (Beg cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 16 clusters.
Size 6/8 only: 3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. (Beg cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Cluster in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1.** (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 20 clusters.
Size Adult only: 3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp.
Beg cluster in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1 (Cluster. Ch 1. Cluster) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. ** Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 6 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster. 24 clusters.
All sizes: Next rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Beg cluster in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg cluster.
Rep last rnd until Hat from beg measures 5 (6-7)" [12.5 (15-18) cm]. Fasten off.
Band: 1st rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in top of next cluster. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 (40-48) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 14 (18-22) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first st. 30 (38-46) sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Band measures 1½ (2-2)" [4 (5-5) cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver Stripes™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Retro Stripe (4971) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc3tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Ch 2 at beg of row/rnd does not count as st.  All rnds are joined with sl st to first st.  Repeats at beg of row/rnd start in the first st.
Beg at top of crown, ch 3.
1st rnd: 12 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
5th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 hdc.
6th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 hdc.
7th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 hdc.
8th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 hdc.
9th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 66 hdc.
11th to 14th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Break yarn.
Divide for Face Opening and beg working back and forth in rows: 15th row:  (RS). Join yarn with sl st to 25th st to right of join. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same st as last sl st. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 44 hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next st. Turn. 48 hdc.
16th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last st. Turn. 46 hdc.
17th row: As 16th row. 44 hdc.
18th and 19th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
20th to 22nd rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. Fasten off. 50 hdc.
23rd rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to hdc at center back of Balaclava. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Ch 10 (face opening). 1 hdc in next hdc from 22nd row. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join.
Proceed in rnds (do not turn).
24th rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st and ch around. Join. 60 hdc.
25th and 26th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
27th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each hdc around. Join.
28th to 30th rnds: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.
Face Edging: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st 2 sts to left of bottom right corner of Face Opening. 1st rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each st to next corner. 1 sc in corner. Work 9 sc along sides of rows to next corner. 1 sc in corner. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Join. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each st until 1 st before next corner sc. Sc3tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. Fasten off.

LEAF (make 2 alike)

1 half double crochet (hdc) in next ch.

Fold Stem in half and sew together along length of Stem.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 1 ball each 8699 Olive A, and 8251 Neon Orange B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures about 20” (51 cm) circumference and will stretch to fit a range of sizes.
gauge: 11 sts = 4” (10cm); 7 rows = 4” (10cm) in double crochet and Front post double crochet pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 1 (right side): Leaving a long tail to weave in later, draw up a loop of B in same st as joining slip st of previous round, ch 3, Fpdc around first Fpdc, [dc in next dc, dc in top of next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc] 7 times, dc in same st as joining slip st of previous round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, Fpdc around first Fpdc, [dc in next 2 dc, dc in top of next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc] 7 times, dc in next dc, dc in same st as joining slip st of previous round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—32 sts.
