The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes.
Notes
Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc. When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed. Carry color when not in use loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to avoid stranding.
With A, ch 56 (64-72). Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 (64-72) sc.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Join B at end of 5th rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 2. (With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. With C, 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc) 7 (8-9) times. Join B with sl st to first hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. (With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. With C, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 7 (8-9) times. Join C with sl st to first hdc.
8th and 9th rnds: Ch 2. (With C, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 7 (8-9) times. Join B at end of 9th rnd with sl st to first hdc.
10th rnd: As 7th rnd.
Rep 7th to 10th rnds 2 (3-4) times more, then 7th to 9th rnds once.
Crown shaping:
1st rnd: Ch 2. *With B, 1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. With C, 1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 6 (7-8) times more. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 42 (48-54) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. (With B, 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. With C, 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts) 7 (8-9) times. Join C with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *With C, 1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. With A, 1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * 6 (7-8) times more. Join C with sl st to first hdc. 28 (32-36) sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. (With C, 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts) 7 (8-9) times. Join B with sl st to first hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *With B, hdc2tog. With C, hdc2tog. Rep from * 6 (7-8) times more. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 14 (16-18) sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. (With B, 1 hdc next st. With C, 1 hdc in next st) 7 (8-9) times. Join A with sl st to first hdc.
7th rnd: With A, ch 2. (Hdc2tog) 7 (8-9) times. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Edging: Working in rem loops of foundation ch, join A with sl st to any loop. Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each loop around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m)
2 Color Stripes
Version 1 (Russia)
Contrast A Cherry Red (53436) 1 ball
Contrast B Royal Blue (00610) 1 ball
Version 2 (Spain)
Contrast A Cherry Red (53436) 1 ball
Contrast B Bright Yellow (00608) 1 ball
3 Color Stripes
Version 3 (USA/UK/France)
Contrast A Cherry Red (53436) 1 ball
Contrast B White (07391) 1 ball
Contrast C Royal Blue (00610) 1 ball
Version 4 (Brazil)
Contrast A Kelly (00609) 1 ball
Contrast B Bright Yellow (00608) 1 ball
Contrast C Royal Blue (00610) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit an average Adult’s head.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 inches [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for 2 Color Stripe Pattern. If changes are necessary for 3 Color Stripe Pattern the instructions will be written thus ( ). Instructions for each Version are shown in the same color throughout the pattern.
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color and draw through rem 2 loops and proceed.

2 Color Stripe Pat
With A, work 2 rnds.
With B, work 2 rnds.
These 4 rnds form Stripe Pat.

3 Color Stripe Pat
With A, work 2 rnds.
With B, work 2 rnds.
With C, work 2 rnds.
These 6 rnds form Stripe Pat.

Beg at top of crown, with A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 3 dc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 18 dc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. *2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in last sc. Join A (C) with sl st to top of ch 3. 32 dc.
5th rnd: With A (C), ch 2 (does not count as st). * Skip next dc. Dcfp around post of next dc, then dcfp around post of skipped dc – Cr Dcfp made. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of first dc. 48 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join B (A) with sl st to top of ch 3.
7th rnd: With B (A), rep 5th rnd. 72 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join A (B) with sl st to top of ch 3.
9th rnd: With A (B), ch 3. *Cr Dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join B (C) with sl st to top of ch 3.

First 10 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete.

Keep cont of Stripe Pat, rep 9th and 10th rnds, until work from beg measures approx 8” [20.5 cm], ending on a 9th rnd. Do not fasten off.

Solid Band: 1st rnd: With A, **ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. (1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 66 sts rem.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of 4th rnd.**

Striped Band: Cont in Stripe Pat, work from ** to ** as given for Solid Band.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m) Aran (77008) 1 ball
Size U.S. J/10 (5.75-6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcfl = Half double crochet in front loop only
Hdcf2l = Half double crochet in front loop only. Yoh and draw up a loop in horizontal bar created by hdc at front of work and front loop in next st. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Hdcf2lCluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop in horizontal bar created by hdc at front of work and front loop) twice in next st. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
Scf2l = Draw up a loop in horizontal bar created by hdc at front of work and front loop in next st. Yoh and draw through
measurements: To fit average lady’s head
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. 
Hat
Ch 38. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 36 hdc. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdcf2l in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 hdcf2lCluster in next st. 1 scf2l in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 2. *1 hdcfl in next st. 1 hdcf2l in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdcf2l in each st to end of row. Turn. 
6th row: As 5th row. 
Rep 3rd-6th rows until work from beg measures approx 21” [53.5 cm], ending on a 5th row. 
Fasten off. 
Sew Foundation chain and last row tog, reversing seam approx 4" [10 cm] for turn back. 
Weave yarn around one end and gather top tog. Pull tightly. 
Fasten securely. 
Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 140 times. 
Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. 
Attach Pompom to top of hat.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (5 oz/142 g; 260 yds/238 m) Buff Fleck (4334) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. H/8 [5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Spike St = Insert hook in stitch 2 rows below current row and draw up a long loop. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook.
measurements: To fit head circumference 20 (22½)" [51 (57) cm]
gauge: 14 sts and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 hdc in ring. Join. 10 hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in next st. 1 dcfp around same st. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in each of first 2 sts. 1 dcfp around last st worked into. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts. 4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in each st to next dcfp. 1 hdc in next dcfp. 1 dcfp around same dcfp. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts. 5th to 13th (15th) rnds: Ch 1. *1 hdc in each of first 4 sts. 1 dcfp around last st worked into. Rep from * around. Join. 130 (150). All sizes: Work shaping as follows: 1st rnd: Ch 1. (Hdc2tog) 6 (7) times. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join. 70 (80) sts. 2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. *Skip next st. 1 hdc in each st to next dcfp. 1 hdc in next dcfp. 1 dcfp around same dcfp. Rep from * around. Join. 4th to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Work Brim as follows: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 24 (26) sts. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. 2nd row: Ch 1. *1 spike sc in next st. Skip next sc. 1 spike sc in each st to last 2 sts. Skip next st. Spike sc in last st. Turn. 22 (24) sts. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 4th to 7th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows twice. 18 (20) sts. 8th row: As 2nd row. 16 (18) sts. FINISHING: Fold Brim up to 13th (15th) rnd, centering brim between dcfp sts. Working in ends of rows and each st across, sew brim to front of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® Heads Up™: 1 ball each 100 Ivory A, 275 Bright Coral B, 701 Candy Pink C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8mm [US L-11]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, Color B, and Color C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22”) (51 (56) cm) circumference
gauge: 10 sts = 4” (10 cm); 3 rounds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 1 (right side): With A ch 3, work 11 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first hdc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in same st as joining (increase made), 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next st, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in each of next 2 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 hdc.
20” Circumference Only
Rounds 5–7: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off A.
Round 8: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off B.
Round 9: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off A.
Round 10: With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off C.
Round 11: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off A.
Round 12: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off B.
Round 13: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Do not fasten off A.
Round 14: Ch 1, TURN, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Rounds 15: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off B.
Round 16: Ch 1, TURN, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart ™ Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Red Hot (0419) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from left to right. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.

Dcfp2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2(3) times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first dc or dcfp.
Ch 72 loosely. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st here and throughout). 1 dc in each ch around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dc. *Dcbp around next dc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last dc. Dcbp around last dc. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. *Dcbp around next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. Rep from * to last dcbp. Dcbp around last dcbp. Join. Rep last rnd twice more.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. 2 dcfp around next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. (1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp) twice. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 hdc in next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. 2 dcfp around next dcbp. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in last dcbp. Join. 78 sts.
Proceed in Cable Twist Pat as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Skip next 3 dcfp. Dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. Working behind last 3 dcfp worked, dcfp around each of 3 skipped sts - Cr6F made. (1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp) twice. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Cr6F over next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. (1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp) twice. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join.
Rep 1st to 5th rnds for Cable Twist Pat until Hat measures approx 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a 4th rnd of pat.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 2 dcfp. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join. 72 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around each of first 4 dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Cr6F over next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 4 dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Cr6F over next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join. 66 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp3tog. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp3tog. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around each of next 6 dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join. 54 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. (Dcfp2tog) twice. Dcfp around next dcfp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. (Dcfp2tog) twice. Dcfp around next dcfp. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join. 42 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *Skip next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Skip next hdc. Dcfp around next dcfp. Dcfp2tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. Skip last hdc. Join. 24 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *Dcfp3tog. Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Dcfp3tog. Join. 12 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 2. Dcfp around first dcfp. *Dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join. Break yarn leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
FINISHING Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 120 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Stripes™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m) Bright Stripe (4970) 1 ball or 197 yds/180 m
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Size: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. 7 Star Clusters and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions: Ribbing: With smaller hook ch 13. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm], when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off. Join last row and first row tog with 1 row of sc to form tube. Change to larger hook and beg working in rnds as follows around top edge of tube: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 71 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. 71 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 3. Draw up a loop in each of the following sps: 2nd and 3rd loops from hook, same sc as last sl st and each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook – beg Star Cluster made. Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of the following sps: Top of previous Star Cluster, under 2 vertical strands of last st of previous Star Cluster, in same sp as last loop drawn up of previous Star Cluster and each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook – Star Cluster made. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch 3. 35 Star Clusters. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in first ch-1 sp. 1 sc in top of next Star Cluster. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 71 sc. Rep last 2 rnds until work from beg (including ribbing) measures approx 6½" [16.5 cm], ending on a 2nd rnd. Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 61 sts. 2nd and alt rnds: Ch 3. Beg Star Cluster. Ch 1. *Star Cluster. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch-3. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 51 sts. 5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 41 sts. 7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 31 sts. 9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sts. 10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc3tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 7 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely. Pompom: Wind yarn around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Dark Sage (39707) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker.
measurements: Approximately 7" [18 cm] in diameter.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Beginning (Beg) at top of crown, chain (ch) 2.
1st round (rnd): 6 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first sc. 6 stitches (sts).
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same space (sp) as last sl st. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Repeat (Rep) from * around, ending with ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
4th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sts.
5th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sts.
7th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sts.
9th rnd: As 7th rnd.
10th rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sts.
11th rnd: As 7th rnd.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 7" [18 cm].
Edging: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc) 4 times. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 76 sc. Turn.
Note: Turn at each end of all Edging rnds to form Ridge Pat.
2nd rnd: [Wrong side (WS)]. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
3rd rnd: [Right side (RS)]. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds for Ridge Pat 4 times more. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Bundle Up™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 478 yds/437 m)
Main Color (MC) Marshmallow (74001) 1 ball
Contrast A Ballet Slipper (74005) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit baby 3-6 mos.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
With MC, ch 33 loosely. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 32 sc.
**2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 7 sc. 1 sl st in each of last 7 sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 7 sl st. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (sc and sl st). 
Rep last 2 rows 4 times more. 
Next row: As 2nd row. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 7 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc: (1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 5 times. Turn. 32 sc.**  
Rep from ** to ** once more.
Shape Upper Face Opening: 
1st row: Ch 1. Sl st in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
***2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (sc and sl st). 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows twice more.***
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 4 times. Turn. 15 sc. 
Next row: Ch 1. Sl st in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep from *** to *** once more. 
Fasten off.
Shape Lower Face Opening: 
With WS facing, working across rem sts of Main Body, skip next 7 sts. Join yarn with sl st to back loop of next sc. 
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sl st in each of last 7 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sl st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sl st in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sl st to end of row. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sl st in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows 3 times more.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sl st to last sl st. 2 scbl in last sc. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sl st in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Joining row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sl st to last 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc of Lower Part. Ch 7. 
Working across Upper Part: 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 4 times. Turn. 32 sc.
Rep from ** to ** as given above twice more. Do not fasten off. 
FINISHING
Pick up rem loop. Working through both thicknesses, crochet back seam. Weave yarn through last sl st of each row along top edge. Gather tightly and fasten securely.
EARS (Make 2 Outer Ears with MC and 2 Inner Ears with A).
Ch 9. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows 10 times more.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
Rep last row until there are 4 sts. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. Fasten off. 
With WS of inner Ear and outer Ear tog, join MC with sl st at bottom corner of Ears. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work in sc evenly around edge of Ears. Do not fasten off. Fold Ears at foundation chains, having inner Ear inside and crochet over Hat in position (as shown). 
Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Fuchsia (69023) 1 ball or 190 yds/173 m
Size U.S. E/4 [3.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Susan Bates® split ring stitch marker.
38” [96.5 cm] of plastic hat brim wire.
Crimp bead.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 20 sc and 22 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Project is worked as a spiral. Do not join rnds. Move marker up each rnd to maintain rnd count.
Beg using magic ring method, demonstrated here:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in in ring. PM on last st of rnd. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 32 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
8th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc.
9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 64 sc.
10th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 72 sc.
12th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. 80 sc.
13th and 14th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
15th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. 88 sc.
16th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
17th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 96 sc.
18th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
19th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 104 sc.
20th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
21st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. 112 sc.
22nd to 34th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
35th rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
36th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. 120 sc.
Note: Switch to hdc for next rnds.
37th rnd: *2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 132 hdc.
38th rnd: *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. 144 hdc.
39th rnd: *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. Rep from * around. 156 hdc.
40th rnd: *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * around. 168 hdc.
41st rnd: *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Rep from * around. 180 hdc.
Add hat brim wire: Next rnd: Holding plastic brim wire along top of 41st rnd and crocheting around, work 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Trim plastic brim wire and secure with crimp bead.

materials: RED HEART® Hygge™: 1 ball 8568 Slate Blue
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 9mm [US M-13]
Yarn needle, pompom maker or 2" (5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard.
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22)" circumference at brim x 16" long [51 (56) x 40.5 cm], excluding pompom.
gauge: 8 sc = 4" (10 cm); 7 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Notes
1. Hat is worked vertically with short rows to create the curve at the top of the piece.
2. Work in back loops only as instructed for more stretch at the brim.
3. When instructed to work into a stitch "2 rows below", work into the row numbered 2 less than the current row. For example, if you are working Row 4, a stitch "2 rows below" is Row 4 – 2 = Row 2.
HAT
Leaving a long tail for sewing, ch 33. 
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—32 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in back loops of first 5 sts, sc in next 24 sts; leave last 3 sts unworked, turn—29 sc. 
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 24 sts, sc in back loops of last 5 sts, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in back loops of first 5 sts, sc in next 24 sts, sc in next 3 sts 2 rows below, turn—32 sc. 
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 27 sts, sc in back loops of last 5 sts, turn.
Rows 6–33 (6–37): Repeat last Rows 2–5 seven (eight) times.
Rows 34–36 (38-40): Repeat Rows 2–4. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With first and last rows held together, sew through both thicknesses to seam. Secure last stitch but do not cut. Weave tail through short row ends at top of hat and pull gently to close. Secure and pull tail to wrong side.
Following pompom maker directions, make 2" (5 cm) pompom or make pompom as follows: Wrap yarn around 2" (5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard (the more wraps, the fuller the pompom). Gently remove wraps from cardboard. Cut a 12" (30.5 cm) strand and tie it tightly around center of wraps. Do not cut the ends of this center tie. Cut ends of wraps. Fluff and trim pompom. Use ends of center tie to tie pompom to top of hat.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Velvety™:  1 ball each 9803 Lake A and 9407 Kitty B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10½]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 18 (21)” (45.5 [53.5] cm) circumference at the brim and 7 (8)” (18 [20.5] cm) in length.
gauge: 9 hdc = 4” (10 cm); 10 rounds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc here and throughout), work 7 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—8 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in first st, 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 hdc.
Change to B.
Round 3: Ch 2, 2 hdc in next st, * hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, * hdc in each of next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch 2—32 hdc.
Change to A.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, * hdc in each of next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—40 hdc.
Round 6 (for size Large only): Ch 2, hdc in each of next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st, * hdc in each of next 4 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 hdc.
Continue changing colors in established stripe sequence for remainder of hat.
Next round: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Repeat the last round until hat measures 7 (8)” (18 [20.5] cm) from center crown to bottom edge.
Fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ Tweeds (5 oz/141 g; 240 yds/219 m)
Gray Heather Tweeds (23002) 1 for each size, 2 3 balls
Scarf: Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Hat: Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: Scarf: Approx 8 x 70" [20.5 x 178 cm]. Hat: To fit head circumference 18 (20-22)" [45.5 (51-56) cm].
gauge: Scarf: 13 scbl and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat with U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook. Hat: 14 scbl and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat with U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook.
instructions:
HAT
Note: Hat is worked from side to side. 
With U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook, ch 30 (34-38) loosely. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last 2 ch. Turn. Leave rem chs unworked. 27 (31-35) sc and 2 chs.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of each of first 2 sc. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last 2 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
4th row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop in each of first 2 sc. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
5th to 10th rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows 3 times more.
11th row: As 2nd row.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last 2 sl st. Working in back loops only, (1 sl st in each of next 2 sl sts) 5 times. 1 sl st in each of next 2 ch. Turn. 29 (33-37) sts. 
**13th to 22nd rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 5 times. 
23rd row: As 2nd row.
24th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to last 2 sl st. Working in back loops only, (1 sl st in each of next 2 sl sts) 6 times. Turn. 35 sts.**
Rep 13th to 24th rows until work from beg measures (without stretching) approx 18 (20-22)" [45.5 (51-56) cm], ending on 23rd row. Fasten off, leaving a long end.

FINISHING
Sew back seam. 
Brim
Join yarn with sl st at back seam 1 st from bottom edge of hat. Run 63 (70-77) surface chains 1 st from bottom edge of Hat.

1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in top loop of each surface ch around. 63 (70-77) sc. Do not join in rnd. Work in continuous spiral rnds. 

2nd rnd: 1 sl st in each st around. Rep last rnd 6 times more. Fasten off.
Pompom: Wind yarn around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat. 
SCARF
Note: Scarf is worked lengthwise.
With U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook, ch 228.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 227 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Scarf measures 8" [20.5 cm]. Fasten off.

pattern_name: Give a Hoot Crochet Owl Hat
materials: RED HEART® With Love™: 1 skein each 1942 Plum Jam A, 1703 Candy Pink B, 1530 Violet C, 1101 Eggshell D.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5].
Two 18mm round flat-back acrylic crystals, one 18mm marquise flat-back acrylic crystal, glue, stitch marker, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, B, C, and D
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures 22" circumference.
gauge: 10 sts = 4” over single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With 2 strands of A held together, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join, work in continuous rounds—5 sc. Place marker in last stitch to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—10 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—15 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—20 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—25 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—30 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—35 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—40 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—45 sc.
Round 11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—50 sc.
Round 13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: [Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—55 sc.
Rounds 15–25: Sc in each sc around.
Do not fasten off.

EARFLAPS
Row 1: Ch 1, turn, skip next st, sc in next 8 sc; leave remaining sts unworked—8 sc.
Rows 2–8: Ch 1, turn, skip next st, sc in each remaining st across—1 sc at the end of Row 8. Fasten off.
Sc in end of each row down side of earflap, sc in next 31 sc of last round of hat.
Repeat Rows 1-8 for second earflap.
Sc in end of each row down side of second earflap, sc in each remaining sc of last round of hat. Change to one strand each of B and C held together. Do not fasten off.

EDGING
Round 1: With one strand each of B and C held together, sc evenly around lower edge of hat and earflaps, working 3 sc in point of each earflap.
Round 2: Slip st in each sc around.
Fasten off.

EYES (make 2)
With 2 strands of A held together, ch 3.
Round 1: Work 11 dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc. Change to 2 strands of D held together.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

BEAK
With 2 strands of C held together, ch 5.
Round 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next 2 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, hdc in next 2 ch; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
Sew eyes to front of hat. Sew beak centered below eyes. Glue one round acrylic crystal to center of each eye. Glue marquise acrylic crystal to center of beak. Weave in all ends.

Top Tassels (make 3)
Cut 8 strands each of B and C, 14” long. Hold all strands together and fold in half. Insert crochet hook in top of hat and draw fold through to form a loop. Thread the ends of the strands through the loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach 2 more tassels to top of hat, nestling the tassels around Round 2 of the hat. Trim tassels to about 4”.

Earflap Tassels (make 2)
Cut 12 strands each of B and C, 24” long. Hold all strands together and use crochet hook to draw strands through tip of earflap, line up the ends of the strands. Hold all strands together and tie an overhand knot. Trim ends to 3½”.

materials: Bernat® Baby Marly™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 221 yds/202 m) Buttercream (33004) or Apple Blossom (33001)  1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit baby head sizes 6/12 (18/24) months.
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Note: Hat is worked sideways.
Ch 25 (27).
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to last 5 ch. 2 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st in each of last 3 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, sl st in each of first 3 sts. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Working in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, (see diagram), 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). Working in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to last 5 sts. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Working in front loops only, sl st in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures 16 (17)" [40.5 (43) cm]. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Weave end through last sl st of each row along top edge and gather tightly. Sew back seam.
Tassel: (make 2). Cut a piece of cardboard 3" [7.5 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 20 times. Break yarn, leaving a long end and thread end through a needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops ¾" [1.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew Tassel to each side of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® “Classic™”: 1 skein 991 Desert
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: One size to fit most children.
gauge: Rnd 1-4 = 5½” across, 12 sts = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 5, join to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 3, 11 dc in ring; join -- 12 sts.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, 2 dc in each st around; join -- 24 sts.
Rnd 3: Ch 3, * 2 dc in next st, dc in next st; repeat from * around; join -- 36 sts.
Rnd 4: Ch 3, dc in next st, * 2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join – 48 sts.
Rnds 5-13: Ch 3, dc in each st around; join.
Rnds 14-16: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 250 yds/228 m; Heathers: 5 oz/141/7 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Main Color (MC) Off White (39702) 1 ball
Contrast A Grey Heather (H9509) 1 ball
Contrast B Pumpkin (39765) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: To fit child 6-10 years (Adult)
gauge: 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions: The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Note: Chain (ch) 2 at beginning (beg) of round (rnd) does not count as stitch (st). To change color, work to last loops on hook of first color, yarn over hook (yoh) with new color and proceed. Carry color not in use loosely up Wrong Side (WS) of work. With MC, chain (ch) 64 (72). Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch to form a ring. 1st round (rnd): Ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in each ch around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 64 (72) sc. 2nd rnd: With A, ch 2. Working into back loops only, 1 half double crochet (hdc) in each sc around. Join MC with sl st to first hdc. 3rd rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each stitch (st) around. Join with sl st to first sc. Repeat (Rep) 2nd and 3rd rnds 4 (5) times more, then 2nd rnd once. Shape crown: 1st rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 (7) hdc. (Insert hook in next hdc and draw up a loop) twice. Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw through all loops on hook - sc2together (sc2tog) made. *1 sc in each of 6 (7) hdc. Sc2tog. Repeat (rep) from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 56 (64) stitches (sts). 2nd rnd: With A, ch 2. Working into back loops only, 1 hdc in each st around. Join MC with sl st to first hdc. 3rd rnd: With MC, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 (6) hdc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 48 (56) sts. 4th rnd: As 2nd rnd. 5th rnd: With MC, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 (5) hdc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 40 (48) sts. 6th rnd: As 2nd rnd. 7th rnd: With MC, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 (4) hdc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 32 (40) sts. 8th rnd: As 2nd rnd. 9th rnd: With MC, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 (3) hdc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 24 (32) sts. 10th rnd: With A, ch 2. *Working into back loops only, 1 hdc in each of next 1 (2) st(s). (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - Hdc2together (Hdc2tog) made. Rep from * around. Join MC with sl st to first hdc. 16 (24) sts. Size 6-10 yrs only: 11th rnd With MC, ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts. Adult size only: 11th rnd: With MC, ch 1. *1 sc in next hdc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 16 sts. 12th rnd: With A, ch 2. *Working into back loops only, Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sts. Both sizes: Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely. Pompom: Wind B around 4 fingers 150 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Bernat® Plush™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 146 yds/133 m) Vivid Pink (68057) or Mustard (68029) 1 ball or 134 yds/123 m
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 8 single crochet (sc) and 9 rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Join all rounds (rnds) with slip stitch (sl st) to first sc.
Chain (ch) 2.
See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd:  (Right side [RS]). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 5 times. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 5 times. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 36 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 5 times. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 42 sc.
9th and 10th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 48 sc.
12th to 22nd rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
23rd rnd:  Working in back loops only, loosely sl st in each sc around.
Fasten off and weave in ends.
Fold last 4 rnds up to form rolled brim.

materials: Caron® Coconut Cake™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m)
Contrast A Marshmallow (84003) 1 ball or 40 yds/36.5 m
Contrast B Tutti-Frutti (84002) 1 ball or 64 yds/58.5 m
Contrast C Sugar Teal (84005) 1 ball or 68 yds/62.5 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 15 hdc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 2 does not count as hdc.
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Break A. Join B. 75 hdc.
9th rnd: With B, ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
10th to 18th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. At end of 18th rnd, break B. Join C.
19th rnd: With C, ch 2. Working in back loops only, *1 hdc in each of next 14 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 hdc.
20th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 90 hdc.
21st rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 100 hdc.
22nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 110 hdc.
23rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 120 hdc.
24th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 130 hdc.
25th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 12 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Break C. Join A. 140 hdc.
26th rnd: With A, ch 1. Sl st in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Jumbo Speckle™ (10 oz/283 g; 482 yds/440 m) Light Blue Speckle (0014) 1 1 1 ball
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit head circumference 18 (20-22)" [45.5 (51-56) cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Join rnds with sl st to top of first dcfp.
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.

CROCHET WAFFLE STITCH HAT
With A, ch 56 (64-72). Join in rnd, taking care to not twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 (64-72) hdc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first hdc. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 dcfp around next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 dcbp around each of last 3 hdc. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of last 3 sts. Join.
Rep 3rd and 4th rnds for Waffle Pat until work from beg measures approx 5 (6-6.5)" [12.5 (15-16.5) cm], ending on a 4th rnd.

Shape top
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 hdc in next st. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in next st. Hdc2tog. Join. 42 (48-54) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of last 2 sts. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join. 28 (32-36) sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcbp around last st. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last st. Skip last st. Join. 14 (16-18) sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st and in each st around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) 7 (8-9) times. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.

Pompom: Wind yarn around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Main Color (MC) Chartreuse (9771) 1 ball
Contrast A Kelly Green (9769) 1 ball
Contrast B White (9701) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Approx 3 yds (2.8 m) of Caron® Simply Soft® in Black (9727) for eyes and nostrils.
abbreviations: Dtr = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in indicated stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times.
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit child 2/4 (6/8-10/12) yrs old.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
Note: Hat is worked from the top down.
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
Cont as established, inc 8 sc every alt rnd until there are 56 (64-72) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 7 (8-9)" [18 (20.5-23) cm].
Beg working in rows: First Earflap:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 (16-18) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until Earflap measures 2 (2½-3)" [5 (6-7.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 4 (5-6). Sc2tog. Rep from * once more. 11 (13-15) sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 (3-4) sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 (3-4) sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 (9-11) sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 0 (1-2) st(s). Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 0 (1-2) st(s). Sc2tog. Turn. 3 (5-7) sts.
Join Spikes: With WS tog, ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc, having 3 sc at top of each spike. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Attach Muzzle to front of Hat as shown in picture, having Teeth between Muzzle and Hat edge. Sew Eyes above Muzzle. With Black yarn, embroider nostrils. Sew Spikes down center back of Hat.
Size 6/8 only: Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 3 sts.
Size 10/12 only: Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Sc3tog. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
All sizes: Fasten off.
With RS facing, skip next 8 (8-11) unworked sc. Join MC with sl st to next st. Ch 1. Work from ** to ** as given for First Earflap.
Muzzle
With A, ch 21 (25-26).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
20 (24-25) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 2 (2½-3)" [5 (6-7.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Next 3 rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 14 (18-19) sts at end of 3rd row. Do not turn. Edging rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around edges of Muzzle. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Teeth
With B, ch 22 (26-26).
1st row: (RS). 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. Skip next ch. 4 dc in next ch. Skip next ch. Sl st in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Skip next ch. Sl st in last ch. Fasten off.
Eyes
With Black yarn, ch 2. 1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join B with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
Fasten off.
Spikes (make 2)
With A, *Ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dtr in next ch – Spike made. Rep from * until length measures same as back of Hat. Do not fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Vivid™: 1 ball 6224 Laser Yellow
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 9 mm [US M-13]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Finished size: 20 (22)” in circumference.
gauge: 7 sts and 4 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 2 sc in each ch around; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in same st, dc in next st, *2 dc in next st, dc in next st, repeat from * twice; join with slip st in first dc—12 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st, 2 dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of ch-3—24 dc. 
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st, *ch 1, skip next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3—24 dc; 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 3, skip first st, dc in next st, *ch 1, skip next ch-1 space**, dc in next 2 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of ch-3—24 dc; 12 ch-1 spaces. 
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in same st, dc in each dc and ch 1 space around; join with a slip st in top of ch-3—36 dc.
Size S Only
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch-1 space around; join with a slip st in first sc—36 sc. 
Fasten off.
Size L Only
Round 7: Ch 1, *sc in each of next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—42 sc. Fasten off.
LEFT EARFLAP
Row 1: With right side facing, skip 4 (5) sts to the right of join, join yarn in next st to the right, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 5 sts, turn—6 sc.
Rows 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn—4 sts.
Row 5: Rep Row 2.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn—2 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc2tog over next 2 sts, turn—1 st.
Fasten off, leaving a 10” (25cm) length for braid.
RIGHT EARFLAP
Row 1: With right side facing, skip 10 (11) sts to the left of last st in Row 1 of Left Earflap (back neck), join yarn in next st, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 5 sts, turn—6 sc.
Rows 2-7: Rep Rows 2-7 of Left Earflap. 
Fasten off, leaving a 10” length for braid.
BORDER
Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn in any st on edge of hat, ch 1, sc in evenly around, increasing 6 sts evenly around edge of hat: join with a slip st in first sc.
FINISHING
Cut two 20” (51 cm) lengths of yarn. Lace one yarn length halfway through the tip of the ear flap leaving 10” (25 cm) on each side of flap. 
With the 10” (25 cm) tail, braid three pieces of yarn together. Tie in an overhand knot at the end and trim ends even. Repeat on other Earflap.
Make a 3” pom-pom and tie to the top of the hat.
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Tea Cakes™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 204 yds/186 m) Oolong (20008) 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop from back to front to back around post of next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop from front to back to front around post of next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
V Puff-st = *(Yoh and draw up a loop) twice in indicated space. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook.* Ch 1. Rep from * to * once more in same space.
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
Beg at crown with smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. V Puff-st in same sp as last sl st. Skip next sc. *V Puff-st in next sc. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first V-st. 6 V-sts.
4th rnd: Sl st in ch-1 sp of first V Puff-st. Ch 2. V-st in same sp. *V Puff-st in sp between 2 V Puff-sts. V Puff-st in ch-1 sp of next V-st. Rep from * around, ending with V Puff-st in sp between last V Puff-st and first V Puff-st. Join with sl st to first V Puff-st. 12 V Puff-sts.
5th rnd: Sl st in ch-1 sp of first V Puff-st. Ch 2. V Puff-st in same sp. *V Puff-st in ch-1 sp of next V Puff-st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first V-st. 12 V Puff-sts.
6th rnd: Sl st in ch-1 sp of first V Puff-st. Ch 2. V Puff-st in same sp. *V Puff-st in sp between 2 V Puff-sts. (V Puff-st in ch-1 sp of next V Puff-st) 4 times. Rep from * around, ending with (V Puff-st in ch-1 sp of next V Puff-st) 3 times. Join with sl st to first V Puff-st. 15 V Puff-sts.
7th rnd: Sl st in ch-1 sp of first V Puff-st. Ch 2. V Puff-st in same sp. *V Puff-st in ch-1 sp of next V Puff-st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first V Puff-st. 15 V Puff-sts.
Rep last rnd until Hat from beg measures 7" [18 cm].
Ribbing: Next rnd: Ch 2. Work 38 hdc evenly around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around post of next hdc. 1 dcbp around post of next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around post of next dcfp. 1 dcbp around post of next dcbp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 100 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® “Holiday”: 1 Ball each 140 White/Silver A and 9090 Red/Red B.
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8].
Yarn needle, pompom maker.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 20 (22)”.
gauge: 12 dc = 4”; 8 rounds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Brim
With A, ch 11. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 10 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each ch across.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 18 (20)” from beginning.
Fasten off.
Sew ends together to form a loop for Brim.
Crown
Round 1: With right side facing, join A with a slip st along one long side of Brim, work sc 60 (66) sts evenly spaced around, slip st to first st to join. Cut A.
Round 2: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each st around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join.  
Rounds 3-6: Repeat Round 2. 
Round 7: Ch 3, [dc2tog, dc in next 8 (9) dc] 5 times, dc2tog, dc in next 7 (8) dc, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 54 (60) sts. 
Round 8: Repeat Round 2. 
Round 9: Ch 3, [dc in next 4 (5) dc, dc2tog, dc in next 3 dc] 5 times, dc in next 4 (5) dc, dc2tog, dc in next 2 dc, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 48 (54) sts.
Round 10: Repeat Round 2.
Round 11: Ch 3, [dc2tog, dc in next 6 (7) dc] 5 times, dc2tog, dc in next 5 (6) dc, join, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 42 (48) sts.
Round 12: Repeat Round 2.
Round 13: Ch 3, [dc in next 3 (4) dc, dc2tog, dc in next 2 dc] 5 times, dc in next 3 (4) dc, dc2tog, dc in next dc, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 36 (42) sts.
Round 14: Repeat Round 2. 
Round 15: Ch 3, [dc2tog, dc in next 4 (5) dc] 5 times, dc2tog, dc in next 3 (4) dc, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 30 (36) sts.
Round 16: Repeat Round 2. 
Round 17: Ch 3, [dc in next 2 (3) dc, dc2tog, dc in next dc] 5 times, dc in next 2 (3) dc, dc2tog, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 24 (30) sts.
Round 18: Repeat Round 2.
For Size Large Only-Round 19: Ch 3, [dc2tog, dc in next 3 dc] 5 times, dc2tog, dc in next 2 dc, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 24 sts. 
Round 20: Repeat Round 2. 
For Both Sizes-Next Round: Ch 3, [dc2tog, dc in next 2 dc] 5 times, dc2tog, dc in next dc, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 18 sts.
Next Round: Repeat Round 2. 
Next Round: Ch 3, [dc2tog, dc in next dc] 5 times, dc2tog, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 12 sts. 
Next Round: Repeat Round 2. 
Next Round: Ch 3, [dc2tog] 5 times, dc in next dc, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 7 sts. 
Fasten off. 
Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through remaining sts and pull to close. Knot to secure. 
FINISHING
With B, make pompom.
Sew to tip of hat.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m) Eucalyptus (28247) 1 ball
Bernat® Faux Fur Pompom™ White Rabbit (01005) 1 Pompom
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head.
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Ch 36. Join with sl st to first sc to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd to 9th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc2tog. *1 hdc in each of 4 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
11th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
12th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 18 hdc.
13th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 12 hdc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely.
Finishing
Attach Pompom to top of Hat.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Kelly Green (9769) 1 ball
Contrast B White (9701) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn for eye embroidery
Small amount of stuffing for eyes
Yarn needle
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: One size to fit Child 4 to 8 yrs
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
BERET
Beg at Crown, with A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 10 hdc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 hdc.
9th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 90 hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join hdc. 100 hdc.
11th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 110 hdc.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Dec rnds: 1st rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 100 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 90 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 80 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 70 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st around. Join. Fasten off.
EYES (make 2)
Eyelid: With smaller hook and A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
Eyeball: With smaller hook and B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail to sew Eyeball to Eyelid.
FINISHING
With black worsted weight yarn, embroider Pupil with Satin st as shown in photo.
Using long tail from Eyeball, sew Eyeball to Eyelid, stuffing gently before finishing seam.
Attach Eyes to top of Beret as shown in photo.
SATIN STITCH

materials: Red Heart® Soft Baby Steps® (Solids: 5 oz/141 g; 256 yds/234 m; Prints: 4 oz/113 g; 204 yds/187 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Tape measure.
measurements: Approximately (approx) 11¼" [28.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: 13 stitches (sts) and 9.5 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern (pat).
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools. 
NOTE
• Ch 3 at beginning (beg) of rounds (rnds) counts as double crochet (dc).
Chain (Ch) 2.
1st round (rnd): 6 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 double crochet (dc) in first sc. (3 dc in next sc) 5 times. Join with sl st in top of ch-3. 18 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 36 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. Skip first sc. 1 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st in top of ch-3.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st in top of ch-3.
6th to 11th rnds: As 4th and 5th rnds 3 times more.
12th rnd: As 4th rnd.
13th rnd: Ch 2. 1 double crochet front post (dcfp) around post of first sc. *1 double crochet back post (dcbp) around post of next sc. 1 dcfp around post of next sc. Repeat (Rep) from * to last sc. 1 dcbp around post of last sc. Join with sl st to top of ch-2.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 4600 White A and 9925 Really Red B
RED HEART® Buttercup®: 1 ball 4270 White C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [US H-8], 5.5mm [US I-9] and 8mm [US L-11]
Yarn needle, stitch markers, velcro hook and loop fastener tape, white sewing thread and sewing needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 18 (20)" [44 (51) cm] circumference. Beard measures 8" [20.5 cm] at widest point x 5½" [14 cm] long.
gauge: 16 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet using 5.5mm [US I-9] and A. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ribbed Band
With 5mm [US H-8] hook and A, ch 7. 
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 6 sts.
Row 2: Working in back loops only, ch 1, turn, sc in each st across – 6 sts. 
Repeat Row 2 until 55 (68) rows have been worked.
Last Row: With right sides together, fold band in half to line up sts of first and last rows, ch 1, turn, working through used loops of foundation ch and front loops of last row, sc in each st across to join. Do not fasten off. 
Hat Crown
Round 1: Turn Ribbed Band right side out and ready to work along one long edge, change to 5.5mm [US I-9] hook and begin working in round, ch 1, sc 56 (68) sts evenly spaced around, slip st in first sc to join – 56 (68) sts. Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, join B in any st with slip st, ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around, slip st in first sc to join – 56 (68) sts. Place stitch marker in first st to mark beginning of round.
Rounds 3-17: Working through both loops in continuous rounds, sc in each st around.
Round 18: *Sc2tog, sc in next 26 (32) sts; repeat from * once more – 54 (66) sts.
Shape Crown
For Small Hat Only
Rounds 19: Repeat Round 17.
Round 20: *Sc2tog, sc in next 7 sts; repeat from * around – 48 sts.  
Round 21: Sc in each st around.
Round 22: *Sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts; repeat from * around – 42 sts.
Rounds 23-24: Sc in each st around for 2 rounds.
Round 25: *Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Rounds 26-28: Sc in each st around for 3 rounds.
Round 29: *Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Rounds 30-32: Sc in each st around for 3 rounds.
Round 33: *Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Rounds 34-35: Sc in each st around for 2 rounds.
Round 36: *Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Round 37: Sc in each st around.
Round 38: *Sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from * around – 12 sts.
Rounds 39-41: Sc in each st around for 3 rounds.
Round 42: *Sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from *around – 8 sts.
Round 43: Sc in each st around.
Round 44: *Sc2tog; repeat from * around. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
Using yarn needle, weave end through sts and pull tightly to close hole. Secure end. 
For Large Hat Only
Rounds 19-21: Sc in each st around for 3 rounds.
Round 22: *Sc2tog, sc in next 9 sts; repeat from * around – 60 sts.
Rounds 23-25: Sc in each st around for 3 rounds.
Round 26: *Sc2tog, sc in next 8 sts; repeat from * around – 54 sts.
Rounds 27-30: Sc in each st around for 4 rounds.
Round 31: *Sc2tog, sc in next 7 sts; repeat from * around – 48 sts.
Rounds 32-37: Sc in each st around for 6 rounds.
Round 38: *Sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts; repeat from * around – 42 sts.
Rounds 39-42: Sc in each st around for 4 rounds.
Round 43: *Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Rounds 44-46: Sc in each st around for 3 rounds.
Round 47: *Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Rounds 48-50: Sc in each st around for 3 rounds.
Round 51: *Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Rounds 52-53: Sc in each st around for 2 rounds.
Round 54: *Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Rounds 55-56: Sc in each st around for 2 rounds.
Round 57: *Sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from *around – 12 sts.
Rounds 58-59: Sc in each st around for 2 rounds.
Round 60: *Sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from *around – 8 sts.
Round 61: Sc in each st around. 
Round 62: *Sc2tog; repeat from * around.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
Using yarn needle, weave end through sts and pull tightly to close hole. Secure end. 
POMPOM  
With A, cut 18" [46 cm] length of yarn and set aside. Hold hand as if to shake hands, with fingers together and extended. 
Wrap yarn around extended fingers for 120 wraps.
While wraps are still on fingers, fold 18" [46 cm] length of yarn in half and slip under all the wraps. With folded yarn in place, slip wrapped yarn off fingers. Tie yarn length tightly around wraps in a secure knot. 
Hold yarn wraps tightly in fist with tie ends dangling from bottom of fist and the looped wraps extending over top of closed fist. Carefully cut loops open to form pompom. Grasp by tie and shake to fluff out. Trim wrap ends evenly. 
Using tie ends, attach to top of Hat.
BEARD
Beginning at bottom edge, with 8mm [USL-11] hook and C, ch 3.
Row 1: Ch 2 (does NOT count as a hdc here and throughtout), 3 hdc in 2nd ch from hook – 3 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in last st – 5 sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, turn, [hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st] 2 times, hdc in last st – 7 sts. 
Row 4: Ch 2, turn, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in last 2 sts – 9 sts.
Row 5: Ch 2, turn, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, [hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st] 2 times, hdc in last 2 sts – 12 sts. 
Row 6: Ch 2, turn, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in last 2 sts – 16 sts. 
Row 7: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across.
Shape Moustache and Mouth Opening 
Row 8: Ch 2, turn, dc in 6 sts, ch 4, skip next 4 sts, dc in last 6 sts.
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends. 
With sewing thread and needle, sew a 1" [5 cm] piece of hook side of hook and loop fastener on right side on either side edge of Row 8. Sew corresponding loop pieces on wrong side along inside edge of Hat, adjusting placement so Beard fits face comfortably.

materials: RED HEART® Snuggle Bunny™: 1 ball each 9802 Bluebird A and 9010 Cottontail B.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 11.5 mm [US P-16].
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc;
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures 16” (40.6 cm) in diameter
gauge: 6 dc = 4” (10 cm); 8 rows = 5” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 26.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each remaining ch across – 25 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, changing to B in last st.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 4 sts, 3-dc Cl in next st, [sc in next 3 sts, 3-dc Cl in next st] 4 times, sc in next 4 sts. 
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sts, 3-dc Cl in next st, [sc in next 3 sts, 3-dc Cl in next st] 5 times, sc in last 2 sts. 
Row 6: Repeat Row 4, changing to A in last st. 
Row 7: Repeat Row 4. 
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog] 5 times – 20 sts. 
Row 9: Repeat Row 4. 
Row 10: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 5 times – 15 sts. 
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, sc2tog] 5 times – 10 sts. 
Row 12: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] 5 times – 5 sts. 
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.

materials: Bernat® Fabwoolous™ (6 oz/170 g; 360 yds/280 m) Cream (25001) 1 ball
Size U.S. 8 (5 mm) knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: C2F = Knit into front loop of 2nd stitch on left-hand needle, then knit 1st stitch, slipping both stitches off needle together.
C2L = Purl through back loop of 2nd stitch on left-hand needle (behind first stitch), then knit first stitch, slipping both stitches off needle together.
C2R = Knit into front loop of 2nd stitch on left-hand needle, then purl first stitch, slipping both stitches off needle together.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 18 sts and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm] in stocking st.
instructions:
Cast on 114 sts.
1st row:  (RS). K2. *P2. K2. Rep from * to end of row.
2nd row:  P2. *K2. P2. Rep from * to end of row.
3rd row:  K1. *C2L. C2R. Rep from * to last st. K1.
4th row:  P1. K1. *P2. K2. Rep from * to last 4 sts. P2. K1. P1.
5th row:  K1. P1. *C2F. P2. Rep from * to last 4 sts. C2F. P1. K1.
6th row:  As 4th row.
7th row:  K1. *C2R. C2L. Rep from * to last st. K1.
8th row:  As 2nd row.
Rep these 8 rows once more.
Next row:  (Fold ridge). Purl.
Proceed as follows, reversing rows from RS to WS as follows:
1st row: (RS). K2. *P2. K2. Rep from * to end of row.
2nd row: P2. *K2. P2. Rep from * to end of row.
3rd and 4th rows: As 1st and 2nd rows once more.
5th row: K1. *C2L. C2R. Rep from * to last st. K1.
6th row: P1. K1. *P2. K2. Rep from * to last 4 sts. P2. K1. P1.
