7th row: K1. P1. *C2F. P2. Rep from * to last 4 sts. C2F. P1. K1.
8th row: As 6th row.
9th row: K1. *C2R. C2L. Rep from * to last st. K1.
10th row: As 2nd row.
11th and 12th rows:  As 1st and 2nd rows.
These 12 rows form pat.
Cont in pat until work from fold ridge measures approx 5½" [14 cm], ending with 10th row of pat.
Shape top: 1st row:  (RS). K2. P2. K2. *P2tog. K2. (P2. K2) twice. Rep from * to end of row. 105 sts.
2nd and alt rows: Knit all knit sts and purl all purl sts as they appear.
3rd row: K2. P2. K2. *P1. K2. P2tog. K2. P2. K2. Rep from * to end of row. 96 sts.
5th row: K2. P2tog. K2. *(P1. K2) twice. P2tog. K2. Rep from * to end of row. 86 sts.
7th row: K2. P1. K2. *P1. K2tog. (P1. K2) twice. Rep from * to end of row. 77 sts.
9th row: K2. P1. K2tog. *P1. K1. P1. K2tog. P1. K2. Rep from * to end of row. 67 sts.
11th row: K2tog. P1. K1. *(P1. K1) twice. P1. K2tog. Rep from * to end of row. 57 sts.
13th row: K1. *K2tog. Rep from * to end of row. 29 sts.
Break yarn, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. Sew center back seam, reversing seam for cuff turnback.
Pompom:  Wind yarn around 4 fingers 60 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to top of Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to form pompom. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: Patons® Metallic™ (3 oz/85 g; 252 yds/230 m)
Pewter (95044) 1 1 2 ball(s)
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Hat:  One size to fit average woman’s head. Scarf: Approx 7" x 30" [18 x 76 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
HAT  
Hat ribbing: With smaller hook, ch 13.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures 22" [56 cm]. Do not fasten off. 

Join last row and 1st row tog, working 1 row of sc through both thicknesses.
Change to larger hook and proceed in rnds as follows:
Notes: 
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. 
• Ch 4 at beg of rnd counts as dc and ch 1. 
(See Chart I on page 3.)
1st rnd:  Ch 1. Working along straight edge of ribbing, work 80 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next 3 sc. 9 dc in next sc. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 7 sc. Skip next 3 sc. 9 dc in next sc. Skip last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 4. 1 dc in first sc. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. *(1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
4th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 8 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *9 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd:  Sl st back into last sc worked. Ch 4. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. *(1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
Last 2 rnds form Shell Pat.
Cont in pat until Hat from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a 5th rnd of pat.
Next rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp.
Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sc.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sts.
2nd and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely. 

SCARF
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beg of row counts as hdc.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. 
(See Chart Il on page 3).
With larger hook, ch 34.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Skip next 3 ch. 9 dc in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next sc. Rep from * to end of row, ending with: Ch 2. 2 dc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 4 dc in first dc. *1 sc in next sc. 9 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to end of row, ending with: 5 dc in last dc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 2. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next 4 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from *, ending with: 1 sc in last dc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *9 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
These 2nd to 5th rows form Shell Pat.
Cont in pat until work from beg measures 6" [15 cm], ending on a 2nd row of pat.
Change to smaller hook and proceed as follows: divide for loop: 
front section: 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 dc. *2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next (dc, ch-1 sp, dc). Rep from * to end of row, ending with: 1 sc in each of last 2 dc. 33 sc. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 17 sts.
3rd row:  Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 1 dc in each st to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
**4th row: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around each st to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each st to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
Rep 4th and 5th rows until work from dividing row measures 4" [10 cm], ending on a 4th row.** 
Fasten off.
Back section: With WS facing, join yarn with sl st to first rem loop of 3rd row.
1st row: Ch 2. Working in rem loops only,  1 dc in each st to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
Work from ** to ** as given for Front section do not fasten off at end of last row.
Join sections: Align Front and Back sections.
1st row: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses,  1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 17 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 33 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next 3 sc. 9 dc in next sc. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Work in Shell Pat until Scarf from beg measures 30" [76 cm], ending on a 2nd row of Shell Pat. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Solids: 50 g/1.75 oz or Ombres and Prints 42.5 g/1.5 oz)
TODDLER VERSION 23743 (Summer Splash) 1 ball
KIDS VERSION Contrast A (00056 Yellow) 1 ball
Contrast B (13628 Hot Orange) 1 ball
Contrast C (13712 Hot Green) 1 ball
Contrast D (13740 Hot Pink) 1 ball
ADULT VERSION 23741 (Playtime) 2 balls
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit Toddler 1-3 yrs (Child 5-8 yrs-Adult).
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
STRIPE VERSION
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join B with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join C with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: With C, ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join D with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: With D, ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. Join A with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. Join B with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
Last 4 rnds form Stripe Pat.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, inc 6 sts on every row, as before to 48 (54-60) sts, then every following alt row to 60 (66-72) sts.
Cont in Stripe Pat, work 9 (10-12) rows even.
Next rnd: With appropriate color, working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
PLAIN VERSION
Work as given for Stripe Version, omitting reference to color changing.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby Chunky™ (5 oz/140 g; 155 yds/142 m)
Nighty Night (96017) 1 ball(s) for sizes 6-12 mos or 2 ball(s) for sizes 18-24 mos
Creamsicle (96013) 1 ball(s) for sizes 6-12 mos or 2 ball(s) for sizes 18-24 mos
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: To fit baby head sizes 6-12 (18-24) months
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 30 (32). 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to last 4 ch. Sl st in each of last 4 ch. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 4 sts. 1 scbl in each st to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to last 4 sts. Sl st in each of last 4 sts. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work measures 16 (17)" [40.5 (43) cm]. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Weave end through last sl st of each row along top edge and gather tightly. Sew back seam. 
Pompoms (make 2)
Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 100 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to smooth round shape. Attach pompom to each side of Hat as shown in photo.

materials: Red Heart® Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 186 yds/170 m) Mai Tai (5327) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ribbed Brim
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  
1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 
7 sc. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back 
loops only, 1 sc in each st to end 
of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg 
measures approx 20" [51 cm] 
when lightly stretched.
Body
Turn work to work across 
long edge.
1st row:  (WS). Ch 1. Work 83 sc 
evenly along edge of ribbing. Turn. 
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 
Draw up a loop in same sp as last st 
worked. Draw up a loop in each of 
next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 
4 loops on hook  –Trinity St made. 
*Ch 1. Trinity St. Rep from * to 
end of row.  1 sc in same sp as last 
Trinity St. Turn.  83 sts. 
Rep 2nd row until work measures 
approx 8" [20.5 cm] from beg. 
Shape Crown
1st row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 
*Trinity St. Rep from * to end of 
row. 1 sc in same sp as last Trinity 
st. Turn. 43 sts.
Rep 1st row 3 times more. 8 sts. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.   
Draw yarn through front loop only 
of rem sts at Crown and gather. 
Pull tight and secure.  Sew back 
seam of Hat.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square ™ (8.8 oz /250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Cyber Leaf (2021) or Frigid (2004) 1 ball or 91 yds/84 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Peel & Stick Fabric Fuse. It is highly recommended to not use iron-on fusing for this project.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit average adult baseball cap.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• To achieve the look shown in photos, work Triangle Motifs and Brim using only the first 4 colors as ‘self-striping’ yarn, allowing colors to change as they appear.
• Make sure to cut off and set aside the longest color length (either Black or Soft White) to use for joining and edges.
Triangle Motif (Make 3)
See Diagram on page 3.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc and ch-2 sp). (3 dc. Ch 2) twice in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc and ch-2 sp). 2 dc in ring. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc to next ch-2 sp. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * once more. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5.
3rd to 5th rnds: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc. Ch-2 sp). 2 dc in ring. *1 dc in each dc to next ch-2 sp. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * once more. 1 dc in each dc to first ch-2 sp. 1 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5.
Fasten off at end of 5th rnd.
Join Motifs
FLAT SLIP STITCH JOIN
Notes:  
• Hold working yarn (Black or Soft White) underneath work to create a flat seam. 
• Keep a loose, even tension on the yarn while joining to keep Motifs flat and even. Too tight tension will cause them to bunch up. 
Place 2 Motifs beside each other, RS up. 
Join yarn (Black or Soft White) with sl st to left Motif in ch-1 corner sp. Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corner ch-1 on this same left Motif. Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corner ch-1 sp of right Motif. (3 loops now on hook). Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.  *Insert hook from front to back into back loop of next st on left Motif. Insert hook from front to back into back loop of corresponding st of right Motif. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Rep from * to end of Motif. 
Join 3 Motifs along side edges to create Cap top.
BOTTOM EDGE
1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn (Black or Soft White) with sl st to any ch-2 sp along bottom edge. Ch 3 (counts as dc). Work 1 dc into each dc, ch-2 sp and into center of join between each Motif. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Do not fasten off.
Place joined Motifs of Cap onto Hat to determine if another rnd of sts is needed to align with bottom edge of Hat when slightly stretched. If needed, work 1 more rnd of either sc, hdc or dc into each dc around to achieve proper depth. Fasten off. Weave in ends on WS.
BRIM
See Diagram on page 3.
Note: Instructions are written to fit an average Baseball cap brim length of approx 3" [7.5 cm] long and 8" [20.5 cm] wide.  
Ch 16.
1st row: (RS). 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 3 dc). *1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 2 dc in next ch. Rep from * to last 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 3 dc in last ch. Turn. 
20 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc (counts as 3 dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 3 dc in last dc. Turn. 26 dc.
3rd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc (counts as 3 dc). 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. (1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc) twice. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc) twice. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 3 dc in last dc. Turn. 36 dc.
4th row: Sl st in each of first 9 dc. Dc2tog over next 2 dc. (2 dc in next dc) twice. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. (2 dc in next dc) twice. Dc2tog. Sl st in next dc. Turn. 20 sts.
5th row: Sl st in first dc2tog and each of next 2 dc. Hdc2tog. 2 hdc in next dc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 dc. 2 hdc in next dc. Hdc2tog. Sl st in next st. 15 sts. Fasten off.
Edging: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn (Black or Soft White) with sc to first dc of 3rd row at right ‘corner’ of Brim. Work 1 sc in each st to last dc of 3rd row (left ‘corner’ of Brim). Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing Brim to Cap.

FINISHING
CAP
Place lengths of Peel and Stick adhesive from top of crown down sides of purchased Cap. Take off only the back layer of the tape using Cap seams as guides and pressing firmly into place. Once tape is positioned, place joined crocheted piece onto Cap, centering 1 Motif at front. Working from top down, carefully peel top layer of tape off and press crocheted piece into place, stretching slightly. Once crocheted piece is properly in position and adhered, it’s a good idea to further secure it by placing lengths of Peel and Stick along bottom edge.
BRIM
Before attaching Brim, it’s helpful to place a st marker at center of Brim piece and also mark center of purchased Cap brim. Place lengths of Peel and Stick around Cap brim as close to edge as possible. Peel off top layer of tape and attach crocheted Brim piece, ensuring center markers are aligned.
After Brim is attached, sew edge of Brim to cap piece with whipstitch using length of yarn (Black or Soft White).

materials: Red Heart® Team Spirit™: 1 skein 972 Orange/Black OR 935 Navy/White
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle, optional pompom maker
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Beanie circumference at bottom edge: 20 (22)” [51 (56) cm]
gauge: 13 dc = 4” [10 cm]; 8 rows = 4” [10 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Brim
Ch 7 (9).    
Row 1: Sc in 2nd chain from hook and in each ch across – 6 (8) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, slip stitch in each sc across. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each slip stitch across 
Repeat Rows 2-3 until piece measures 20 (22)” [51 (56) cm], end with a Row 3. Do not fasten off.
Joining Row: With right sides together, fold piece in half to match sts from first and last row, working through both layers, slip st sts from first and last row together. Do not fasten off.
Body
With right side facing, turn joined Brim to work along long edge, ch 1, sc 66 (72) sts evenly spaced along long edge, slip st in first st to join – 66 (72) sc. 
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each sc around, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 66 (72) dc.
Repeat Round 1 until piece measures 5½ (6”) [14 (15) cm] from lower edge of Brim. 
Shape Crown
For Small Size Only
Round 1: Ch 3, dc in next 9 dc, skip next st, [dc in next 10 dc, skip next st] 5 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 60 sts. 
For Large Size Only
Round 1: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, skip next st, [dc in next 5 dc, skip next st] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 60 sts. 
For All Sizes
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, skip next st, [dc in next 4 dc, skip next st] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 sts. 
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, skip next st, [dc in next 3 dc, skip next st] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 36 sts. 
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, skip next st, [dc in next 2 dc, skip next st] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 24 sts. 
Round 5: Ch 3, skip next st, [dc in next dc, skip next st] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 12 sts. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through sts of last round and pull to gather. Fasten securely. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
If desired, make a pompom and sew on top of hat.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (100 g/3.5 oz; 99 m/108 yds)
Size 9 mm (U.S. M or 13) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s head.
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
BaND
With MC, ch 36.  Join with sl st to first sc to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc around. Break MC. Join A with sl st to first hdc.
4th rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Break A. Join B with sl st to first hdc.
5th to 8th rnds: With B, as 4th rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – hdc2tog made.
*1 hdc in each of 4 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
11th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 18 hdc.
12th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 12 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely.
Brim: 1st row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to 15th foundation ch from beg of rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st and each of next 2 ch. (2 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch) 4 times. Turn. 19 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. Miss first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. Fasten off at end of 3rd row.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1502 Iced Aqua
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle, stitch marker
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 21” (53.5 cm) circumference at brim.
gauge: 7 sts = 3” (7.5 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: HAT Ch 3; join with slip st to first ch to form a ring. Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), 6 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—7 hdc. Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), Fpdc around first hdc, [dc in next hdc, Fpdc around same hdc] 6 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—7 dc and 7 Fpdc. Place marker on first dc and work in continuous rounds. Do not join until instructed. Round 3: Ch 2, Fpdc around first dc, Fpdc around first Fpdc, [hdc in next dc, Fpdc around same dc, Fpdc around next Fpdc] 6 times—7 hdc and 14 Fpdc. Round 4: [Hdc in next hdc, Fpdc around same hdc, Fpdc around next 2 Fpdc] 7 times—7 hdc and 21 Fpdc. Round 5: [Hdc in next hdc, Fpdc around same hdc, Fpdc around next 3 Fpdc] 7 times—7 hdc and 28 Fpdc. Round 6: [Hdc in next hdc, hdc in next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc, Fpdc around next 3 Fpdc] 7 times—14 hdc and 28 Fpdc. Round 7: [Hdc in next 2 hdc, hdc in next Fpdc, Fpdc around same Fpdc, Fpdc around next 3 Fpdc] 7 times—21 hdc and 28 Fpdc. Rounds 8 and 9: [Hdc in next 3 hdc, Fpdc around next 4 Fpdc] 7 times. Round 10: [Hdc in next 3 hdc, hdc in next Fpdc, Fpdc2tog, Fpdc around next 2 Fpdc] 7 times—28 hdc, 14 Fpdc, and 7 Fpdc2tog. Note In next 3 rounds, work first “leg” of Fpdc2tog around 2nd “leg” of Fpdc2tog in previous round. Round 11: Hdc in last Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in next 4 hdc, Fpdc2tog, Fpdc around next Fpdc, [hdc in same Fpdc, hdc in next 4 hdc, Fpdc2tog, Fpdc around next Fpdc] 6 times—35 hdc, 7 Fpdc, and 7 Fpdc2tog. Round 12: Hdc in last Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in first 5 hdc, Fpdc2tog, [hdc in same Fpdc, hdc in next 5 hdc, Fpdc2tog] 6 times—42 hdc and 7 Fpdc2tog. Round 13: [Hdc in next 6 hdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc2tog] 7 times—42 hdc and 7 Fpdc. Round 14: Hdc in last Fpdc2tog 2 rounds below, hdc in next 5 hdc, skip next hdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc, [hdc in same Fpdc, hdc in next 5 hdc, skip next hdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc] 6 times—42 hdc and 7 Fpdc. Round 15: Hdc in last Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in next 5 hdc, skip next hdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc, [hdc in same Fpdc, hdc in next 5 hdc, skip next hdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc] 6 times—42 hdc and 7 Fpdc. Round 16: Repeat Round 13. Round 17: Hdc in last Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in next 5 hdc, skip next hdc, FpPuff around next Fpdc, [hdc in same Fpdc, hdc in next 5 hdc, skip next hdc, FpPuff around next Fpdc] 6 times —42 hdc and 7 FpPuff. Rounds 18 and 19: Hdc in each st around—49 hdc. Round 20: Ch 1, reverse sc in each hdc; join with slip st in first reverse sc. Fasten off. FINISHING If necessary, sew opening at top of hat closed with beginning tail. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn®”: 2 balls 4614 Black MC, 1 ball each 4600 White A and 5142 Cherry Red B.
Crochet Hooks: 5mm [US H-8] and 5.5mm [US I-9].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat fits 21½ (22½, 23½)” circumference head.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 23 rows = 5” in sc with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With larger hook and MC, ch 88 (92, 96).
Row 1 (RS): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn – 87 (91, 95) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until 20 (25, 30) rows have been completed from beginning.
Shape Top-Next Row: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [dec] 43 (45, 47) times; turn – 44 (46, 48) sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Next Row: Ch 1, [dec] 22 (23, 24) times; turn – 22 (23, 24) sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in first 0 (1, 0) sc, [dec] 11 (11, 12) times; turn – 11 (12, 12) sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off, leaving a long length for sewing.
Border
Row 1: With right side facing and smaller hook, join B in first st on lower edge; ch 1, sc in each st across foundation ch edge of Hat; turn – 87 (91, 95) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off B.
Row 3: Join MC in first sc; ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 4-9: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of last row.
Lining
With smaller hook and B, ch 88 (92, 96).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn – 87 (91, 95) sc.
Rows 2-9: Ch 1 sc in each sc across; turn. Do NOT fasten off.
Join Lining: Hold Lining and Border together with wrong sides facing, aligning sts in Row 9. With right side of Border facing, smaller hook and B, sc in each sc across working through the double thickness of Row 9; turn.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.

Embroidery
Starting in center st and working outward, cross st Rows 3-9 of Border following Chart A. Starting in center st and working outward, cross st Rows 3-20 of Hat following Chart B.
Finishing
Fold Lining to wrong side of Hat and sew foundation chain edge of Lining to corresponding row on inside of Hat Border with B. With yarn needle, weave sewing length at top of Hat through last row of sts; draw up firmly, fasten securely. Sew back seam of Hat. Sew edges of Lining separately on inside. With B, make a loose 6” pompom and attach securely to center top of Hat.

materials: 1 skein 1308 Tan RED HEART® With Love®
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10½]
Pompom maker (optional)
yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures about 20" [51 cm] circumference to fit 22" [56 cm] head circumference.
gauge: 7 sts = 3" [7.5 cm]; 12 rounds = 4" [10 cm] in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 48 loosely; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.

Ribbed Band
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in each ch around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—48 hdc.
Rounds 2–4: Ch 2, Fpdc around next st, *hdc in next st, Fpdc around next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—24 hdc and 24 Fpdc.

Body
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, Fpdc around next st, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next st, *hdc in next 3 sts, Fpdc around next st, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next st; repeat from * to last 2 sts, hdc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, TURN—32 hdc and 16 Fpdc. 
Round 2 (wrong side): Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn—48 hdc.

Notes
1. In following rounds, you will be instructed to work around or skip a stitch "2 rounds below". A stitch "2 rounds below" is in the round numbered 2 less than the round currently being worked. For example, if you are working Round 3, a stitch "2 rounds below" is in Round 1.
2. Always skip the stitch "behind" a post stitch. The stitch "behind" a post stitch is in the round you would usually have worked into.
3. When instructed to work in next stitch, but not "2 rounds below", work into the next stitch of the previous round (that you would usually work into).
4. Refer to the stitch diagram to clarify the post stitch pattern.

Round 3: Ch 2, skip first Fpdc 2 rounds below, Fptr around 2nd Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in next st (of previous round), working in front of last Fptr made, Fptr around skipped (first) Fpdc 2 rounds below, *hdc in next 3 sts, skip next Fpdc 2 rounds below, Fptr around next Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, working in front of last Fptr made, Fptr around skipped Fpdc 2 rounds below; repeat from * to last 2 sts, hdc in last 2 sts, turn; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn—32 hdc and 16 Fptr.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning  ch-2, turn.
Round 5: Ch 2, Fpdc around first Fptr 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below, *hdc in next 3 sts, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below; repeat from * to last 2 sts, hdc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning  ch-2, turn.
Rounds 6–17: Repeat Rounds 2–5 three times.
Rounds 18–20: Repeat Rounds 2–4.

Shape Top of Hat
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, Fpdc around first Fptr 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below, *hdc2tog, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, Fpdc around next Fptr 2 rounds below; repeat from * to last 2 sts, hdc2tog; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn—24 hdc and 16 Fpdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—40 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, skip first Fpdc 2 rounds below, Fptr around 2nd Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, working in front of last Fptr made, Fptr around skipped (first) Fpdc 2 rounds below, *hdc2tog, skip next Fpdc 2 rounds below, Fptr around next Fpdc 2 rounds below, hdc in next st, working in front of last Fptr made, Fptr around skipped Fpdc 2 rounds below; repeat from * to last st, skip last st, turn; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn—16 hdc and 16 Fptr.
Round 4: Ch 2, [hdc2tog] 15 times, skip last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn—16 sts.
Round 5: Ch 1, beginning in same ch as join, sc2tog around; join with slip st in first st—8 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through top of stitches in last round and pull tight to close opening at top of hat. Carefully secure end on wrong/inside of hat.

FINISHING
Pompom (optional)
Following pompom maker directions, make a 2" [5 cm] pompom and attach to top of hat. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Heads Up™: 1 ball each 565 Grape A, 872 Royal B, 698 Jade C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, Color B, and Color C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 20 (22)” (51 (56 cm)) circumference
gauge: 10 sts = 4” (10 cm); 3 rounds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FINISHING
Weave in ends. 

HAT
Round 1 (right side): With A ch 3, work 11 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first hdc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in same st as joining (increase made), 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next st, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in each of next 2 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 hdc.
20” Circumference Only
Fasten off A.
Round 5: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 6–10: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Fasten off B.
Round 11: With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 12 and 13: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 14: Ch 1, TURN, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Rounds 15 and 16: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 947 Marrakesh A and 360 Cafe Latte B.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Fptr = Front post treble crochet (Yo) twice, insert hook from the front side of the work to back and to front again around the post of the indicated stitch on a previous row; yo and pull up a loop (4 loops on hook), (yo and draw through two loops) twice, yo and draw through two loops (1 loop on hook).
A, B, C = Color A, B, C.
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat circumference is 23” (58 cm). One size fits most.
gauge: 11 sc = 4” (10 cm); 12 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Shape Crown
Round 11: With right side facing and working across opposite edge of foundation ch, ch 2, hdc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 63 hdc.
Round 12 (Wrong Side): Ch 2, turn, hdc in front loop of each hdc around, slip stitch in top of beginning ch.
Round 13 (Right Side): Ch 2, turn, *hdc in next 6 hdc, skip next hdc, repeat from * around, slip stitch in top of beginning ch – 56 hdc.
Round 14: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 hdc, skip next hdc; repeat from * around, slip st to first sc – 42 sc.
Rounds 15-16: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st to first sc.

FEDORA
With B, ch 64.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in each hdc across – 63 hdc.
Row 3: With A, ch 2, turn, hdc in next 2 hdc, *Fptr in next hdc 2 rows below, hdc in each of next 2 hdc; repeat from * across.
Row 4: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across.
Row 5: With B, repeat Row 3.
Row 6: Repeat Row 4.
Row 7: With A, repeat Row 3.
Row 8: Repeat Row 4.
Row 9: With B, repeat Row 3.
Row 10: Repeat Row 4.

Do not fasten off.
With wrong sides together, fold piece in half crosswise. Working through both layers, slip st side edges together to Row 1.
Do not fasten off.

Round 17: With right sides together, flatten last row in half and working through both layers, slip st evenly across to close. Fasten off.

Crown Band
Round 1: With right side facing and A, ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in first sc – 63 sc.
Rounds 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st to first sc.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in each sc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.

Shape Brim
Round 6: With B, ch 2, hdc in front loop of each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 7: Ch 2, hdc in next 5 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc, *hdc in next 6 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 70 hdc.
Round 8: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 9: Ch 1, *sc in next 6 hdc, 2 sc in next hdc, repeat * around, slip st to first sc – 77 sc.
Round 10: With A, ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc.

Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m) Version 1 or Version 2 Frozen Berry (01022) 2 braids
Sizes U.S. J/10 (6 mm) and U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• Before working with Caron® x Pantone™ multi-shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls for each braid.
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone™ color # (see ball band)
• Designate each yarn ball Contrast, A, B, C, D and E as noted in Materials section (or as desired).
• Due to finite amount of yarn in each shade, pattern gauge must be matched to ensure successful results
• Do not break contrast color, carry color not in use loosely up side of work.
• Ribbing and Body of Hat are worked sideways.

Ribbing: With A and larger hook, ch 20.
1st row: (RS). 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 19 sts.
2nd and 3rd rows: With B, ch 1. Sl st in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th and 5th rows: With A, ch 1. Sl st in each st to end of row. Turn.
Last 4 rows form Stripe Pat. Cont in Stripe Pat until work when slightly stretched measures approx 21" [53.5 cm], ending with 2 rows of B. Fasten off.

Body of Hat: With C and smaller hook, ch 18.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS - see diagram) in each st to end of row. Turn.

(Diagram shows WS of work facing)
3rd and 4th rows: With D, as 2nd row.
5th and 6th rows: With C, as 2nd row. Last 4 rows form Body Stripe Pat. Cont in Body Stripe Pat until work from beg, when slightly stretched, measures 21" [53.5 cm]. Fasten off.

Sew side of Ribbing to Body of Hat. Sew back seam, reversing 3½" [9 cm] for turn-back cuff on Ribbing.

Crown: 1st rnd: (RS). With smaller hook, join E with sl st at Hat seam. Ch 1. Work 57 sc evenly around top edge of Hat. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 49 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 41 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 33 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 25 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Brites™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Mango (9605) 1 ball
Contrast B Blue Mint (9608) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® Steel Yarn Needle
Susan Bates® Split-Lock Stitch Count Marker
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Join = Join with sl st to first st.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit child 2/4 (6/8) yrs.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Beg at top of crown, with A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Join. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 3 dc in each sc around. Join.
18 dc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. *2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around.
Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. *2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 2 dc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 33 dc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 3. *Miss next dc. Dcfp around post of next dc. Dcfp around post of missed dc – Cr Dcfp made. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * around. Join. 49 sts.
6th rnd:  Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join.
2/4 SIZE ONLY:  7th rnd:  With B, ch 3. (Cr Dcfp) 3 times. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). * [(Cr Dcfp) twice. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made)] Rep from * to last 6 dc. (Cr Dcfp) 3 time(s). 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Join. 59 sts.
6/8 SIZE ONLY: 7th rnd:  With B, ch 3. *(Cr Dcfp) 2 times. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made). Rep from * to last 8 dc. [(Cr Dcfp)1 time. 1 dc in sp between last dc and next dc (inc made)] 4 times. Join. 63 sts.
BOTH SIZES: 8th, 10th and 12th rnds: As 6th rnd.
9th and 11th rnds:  With A, ch 3. *Cr Dcfp. Rep from * around. Join  Rep 8th to 12th rnds for pat until work from beg measures approx 7" [18 cm], ending with 2 rnds of B. Break B.
Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (1 sc in each of next 19 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 57 ( 61) sc.
Next 3 rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Pompom: Wind A around 4 fingers 80 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to form pompom. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby Chunky ™ (5 oz/140 g; 155 yds/142 m)
Main Color (MC) Cozy Gray (96005) 1 ball for sizes 6/12 mos, 18/24 mos, 4 yrs, 6/8 yrs
Contrast A Nighty Night (96017) 1 ball for sizes 6/12 mos, 18/24 mos, 4 yrs, 6/8 yrs
Contrast B Cream Puff (96006) 1 ball for sizes 6/12 mos, 18/24 mos, 4 yrs, 6/8 yrs
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit head circumference: 6/12 mos 17" [43 cm], 18/24 mos 18" [45.5 cm], 4 yrs 19" [48 cm], 6/8 yrs 19½" [49.5 cm]
gauge: 9 hdc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as hdc. To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.

With larger hook and MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc. 
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc. 
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 7 (7-3-3) hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 7 (7-3-3) hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 7 (7-3-3) hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 (36-40-40) sts. 
Sizes 18/24 mos and 6/8 yrs only: 6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 17 (19) hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 17 (19) hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 17 (19) hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 38 (42) sts. 
All sizes: Break MC. Next rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep last rnd 2 (2-3-3) times more. Break A.
With MC, rep last rnd until work from beg measures 6½ (7-7½-8)" [16.5 (18-19-20.5) cm]. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Eyes (make 2)
With smaller hook and B, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. With A, embroider French Knot in center of Eye.

Nose
With smaller hook and A, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Inner Ear (make 2)
With smaller hook and A, ch 2. 1st row: (RS). 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. 10 sc.  Break A. Join MC. Turn. 3rd row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in next sc. (1 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Fasten off.

Outer Ear (make 2)
With smaller hook and MC, make as given for Inner Ear, omitting all reference to color changes.

Join Ears: With WS of Inner Ear and Outer Ear facing each other, and RS of Inner Ear facing, join MC with sl st to first sc. 1st row: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Fasten off.

Finishing
Sew Eyes, Nose and Ears to Hat as seen in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each 9505 Aqua A, 9200 Baby Yellow B, 9620 Baby Green C, and 9600 White D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch marker, yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
dtr = double triple or treble crochet
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hat Circumference: 14 (16)” [35.5 (40.5) cm]
gauge: 10 sts = 3” [7.5 cm]; 5 rows = 3” [7.5 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CROWN HAT
With A, ch 3, slip st in first ch to form a ring,
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 11 dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 12 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, [2 dc in next dc] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 24 sts.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next st, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 sts.
For Size 12 Months Only
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 2 dc, 2 sc in next dc, [sc in next 3 dc, 2 sc in next dc] 11 times, slip st in first sc – 60 sts.
For All Sizes
Rounds 5-10 (6-11): Ch 3, dc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 (60) sts. Cut A.
Shape Crown
Work will be turned on this round so wrong side of Crown is on right side of Hat when folded up.
Round 11 (12): Change to B, ch 3, turn, working in front loops only, dc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 (60) sts. Cut B.
Shape Points
Round 12 (13): Change to D, ch 3, dc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 (60) sts.
Fold Crown to right side of Hat along Round 10 (11).
FINISHING
Edging
Round 1: Join B in any unused loop of Round 10 (11), work in reverse single crochet around, slip st in first st to join – 48 (60) sts.
Fasten off.
Jewel Appliques
Make 8
With C, ch 4, [yo twice, insert hook in 4th ch from hook, yo and pull through 2 loops on hook, yo, pull through 2 loops on hook] 4 times, yo and pull through all 5 loops on hook. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew a Jewel in center of each Point. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Black (39727) 1 ball
Contrast B White (39701) 1 ball
Contrast C Iris (39747) or Red (39729) 1 ball or Pagoda (COL0014)
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
1 stitch marker
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit child 6-10 yrs (Woman-Man)
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Note: To change colors, work to last loops on hook, yoh with new color through rem loops and proceed.
Ribbing: With smaller hook and A, ch 10. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg (when slightly stretched) measures 18 (19-20)" [45.5 (48-51) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Join last row and first row tog with 1 row of sc to form tube.
Work 62 (68 -74) sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker on last st. Turn.
Change to larger hook.
Note: Houndstooth Pat is worked in rnds. Turn at end of each rnd to keep pat correct.
1st rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Join B with sl st to first sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (RS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Join A with sl st to first sc. Turn.
3rd rnd: (WS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Join A with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds for Houndstooth Pat until work from marker measures approx 3 (3-4)" [7.5 (7.5-10) cm], ending on a WS rnd and joining C at end of rnd.
Break A and B.
1st rnd: With C, ch 2 (does not count as hdc here and throughout). 1 hdc in each of next 5 (3-1) st(s). *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 (6-7) sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Join with sl st to first hdc. 54 (60-66) sts.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in next 2 (2-5) sts. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 (3-9) sts. Rep from * to last 4 (3-6) sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of last 2 (1-4) st(s). Join with sl st to first hdc. 45 (48-60) sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 (2-4) sts. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 (36-50) sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 1 (1-3) st(s). Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 (24-40) sts.
Size Woman only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Sizes 6-10 yrs and Woman only: Next rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 12 sts. Break yarn, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Size Man only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 15 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Join with sl st to first hdc. 8 sts. Break yarn, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
FINISHING
Pompom (optional): Wind C around 4 fingers approx 150 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to top of Hat.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Bitty Stripes™ (10 oz/283 g; 515 yds/471 m) Crayon Box (0108) 1 ball or 210 yds/191 m
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 14 hdc and 11 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Brim
Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 75 times more.
Joining row: Ch 1. With first and last rows tog, working through both thicknesses, sl st in each st to end of row. Do not turn.
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as a st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
1st rnd: Working across long side of Brim, ch 1. Work 76 sc evenly around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first hdc. *Skip next hdc. 2 sc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. Skip last hdc. Join. 76 sc.
4th to 19th rnds: Rep last 2 rnds 8 times more.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Skip last sc. Join. 38 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Skip last sc. Join. 19 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Skip last 2 sc. Join. 9 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Weave end through rem sts. Pull tightly and fasten securely.
Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: RED HEART® “Holiday”: 1 ball each 9040 Red/Silver or 6040 Green/Silver A and 1040 White/Silver B.
Crochet hook: 5mm [I-9] crochet hook.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Head Circumference: 14 (16, 18, 20)”. Directions are for Child M; changes for Child L, Adult S/M and Adult M/L are in parentheses.
gauge: 12 dc = 4”; 8 rounds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:

Note: Ch 3 counts as dc throughout.
Texture Stripe Stitch: Ch 1, sc in same st, *tr in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around, omitting last sc.

HAT
Round 1: With A ch 4, 11 dc in 4th ch from hook, join with slip st to top of ch – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st, [2 dc] in each st around, join with a slip st in first st – 24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in first st – 36 dc.
Work for 0 (1, 0, 1) round.

Child Sizes Only
Next Round: Ch 3, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 5 (2) sts; repeat from * around, omitting last dc, join with a slip st to first st – 42 (48) sts.
Work in dc for 5 (6) rounds.
Change to B and work in Texture Stripe Stitch.
Change to A and work 1 round in dc.
Fasten off.

Adult Size S/M Only
Next Round: Ch 3, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around, omitting last dc, join with a slip st to first st – 42 sts.
Next Round: Ch 3, dc in same st, dc in next 2 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc; repeat from * around to last 4 sts, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc, join with a slip st to first st – 54 sts.

Adult Size M/L Only
Next Round: Ch 3, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around, omitting last dc, join with a slip st to first st – 48 sts.
Next Round: Ch 3, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around, omitting last 2 dc – 60 sts.

Both Adult Sizes
Work in dc for 6 rounds.
[Change to B and work in Texture Stripe Stitch.
Change to A and work 1 round in dc] twice.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Classic™”: 1 Skein each 645 Honey Gold A and 513 Parakeet B.
Crochet Hooks: 3.75mm [US F-5] and 4mm [US G-6].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat fits most women. Hat Circumference: 20”.
gauge: 17 sts = 4”; 13 rows = 4” in pattern with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BAND: With smaller hook and A, ch 6.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 5 sc.
Rows 2-80: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off leaving an 8” end. Sew top of last row to beginning ch to form a circle, being sure that rows are not twisted.
Lower Edging: With right side facing and larger hook, join A at seam; ch 1, sc in each row end around; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
CROWN-Rnd 1 (Right Side): With right side facing and larger hook, join A at opposite side of seam; ch 1, sc in each row end around; join in first sc – 80 sc.
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 2, skip first st, * Fphdc in next 9 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, Fphdc in next 7 sts **, hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from * to last st, end at **; hdc in last st; join with a slip st in top of ch-2.
Rounds 4 and 5: Ch 2, hdc in next st, * Fphdc in next 7 sts, hdc in next 4 sts, Fphdc in next 5 sts **, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from * to last 2 sts, end at **; hdc in last 2 sts; join.
Rounds 6 and 7: Ch 2, hdc in next 2 sts, * Fphdc in next 5 sts, hdc in next 6 sts, Fphdc in next 3 sts **, hdc in next 6 sts; repeat from * to last 3 sts, end at **; hdc in last 3 sts; join.
Rounds 8 and 9: Ch 2, hdc in next 3 sts, * Fphdc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 8 sts, Fphdc in next st **, hdc in next 8 sts; repeat from * to last 4 sts, end at **; hdc in last 4 sts; join.
Rounds 10 and 11: Ch 2, hdc in next 4 sts, * Fphdc in next st **, hdc in next 19 sts; repeat from * to last 14 sts, end at **; hdc in last 14 sts; join.
Shape Top-Rnd 12: Ch 2, hdc in next 7 sts, hdc2tog, [hdc in next 8 sts, hdc2tog] 7 times; join – 72 sts.
Rnd 13: Ch 2, hdc in next 6 sts, hdc2tog, [hdc in next 7 sts, hdc2tog] 7 times; join – 64 sts.
Rnd 14: Ch 2, hdc in next 5 sts, hdc2tog, [hdc in next 6 sts, hdc2tog] 7 times; join – 56 sts.
Rnd 15: Ch 2, hdc in next 4 sts, hdc2tog, [hdc in next 5 sts, hdc2tog] 7 times; join – 48 sts.
Rnd 16: Ch 2, hdc in next 3 sts, hdc2tog, [hdc in next 4 sts, hdc2tog] 7 times; join – 40 sts.
Rnd 17: Ch 2, hdc in next 2 sts, hdc2tog, [hdc in next 3 sts, hdc2tog] 7 times; join – 32 sts.
Rnd 18: Ch 2, hdc in next st, hdc2tog, [hdc in next 2 sts, hdc2tog] 7 times; join – 24 sts.
Rnd 19: Ch 2, hdc2tog, [hdc in next st, hdc2tog] 7 times; join – 16 sts. Fasten off. Weave yarn end through.
VISOR-Row 1: With right side facing, larger hook and a double strand of A, skip 25 sc from seam of Band, join in next sc; ch 1, work Fpsc across next 30 sc; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st to last 2 sc; sc2tog; turn – 28 sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Row 3 – 24 sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Edging: With right side facing and smaller hook, join B at back; ch 1, work sc around Band and Visor; join to first sc. Fasten off.
FLOWER: With smaller hook and B, ch 5; join with a slip st to form a ring, ch 1.
Rnd 1:  10 sc in ring, join to 1st sc, ch 1.
Rnd 2:  2 sc in each st around, join to 1st sc, ch 4.
Rnd 3:  Dc in same st, ch 2 (2dc, ch 2 in next sc) around, sl st in 3rd ch of ch 4.  Fasten off.
Attach to left side of hat.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Pretty’n Pink (0722) 1 ball or 98 yds/89 m
Contrast B Gold (0321) 1 ball or 98 yds/89 m
Contrast A Tea Leaf (0624) 1 ball or 98 yds/89 m
Contrast B Medium Thyme (0406) 1 ball or 98 yds/89 m
Contrast A Minty (0520) 1 ball or 98 yds/89 m
Contrast B Pale Plum (0579) 1 ball or 98 yds/89 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 13 hdc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Hdc Rib Pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Hat is worked side to side with center back seam.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
With A, ch 47, leaving a 24" [61 cm] long end for seaming later.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 39 ch. Sl st in each of last 5 ch. Turn. 45 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of first 5 sl sts. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked – see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked). Rep from * 39 times more. Working in back loops only, sl st in each of last 5 sl sts. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Hdc Rib Pat until Hat (at widest point) measures approx 9" [23 cm] ending on a WS row. Break A. Join B.
With B, beg on a RS row, cont in Hdc Rib Pat until Hat (at widest point) measures approx 18" [45.5 cm] ending on a WS row. Fasten off, leaving a long end to sew center back seam.
Note: Work equal number of rows with A and B.
FINISHING
Using yarn end from last row, sew center back seam. Weave yarn through short side of Hat (sl st rows) and gather top of Hat tog securely. Turn back cuff as shown.
